description:
I keep coming back here for the delicious fresh fruit margaritas and yummy food. This place is nice for groups and also offers reservations, which I like. 

Ambiance is nice for a dinner or evening out. When its crowded (which is everytime I've been here) its way too loud to hear anyone without yelling. However, the food is delicious and decently priced. If you share a pitcher of margaritas, you won't break the bank either. Love the complimentary chips and salsa they give you in the beginning as well. 

Overall, it's a great place to bring friends, but maybe not the best idea for a date (since you won't be able to hear them!). Up to you ;)
author: Sara S.

description:
Man, this was a huge disappointment. 

Came here b/c heard ambiance was good for dates. Food and service were anything but

House chips - stale
House salsa - tastes like diced up hunts tomatoes - no flavor 
Queso - Would say its velveeta if i didnt know better
Salad - chicken is rubbery. No other flavor.

0/10 don't recommend
author: Anuj A.

description:
Expect to pay $20/person for entrees, $25/person with appetizers, $30/person if you drink. 

From the minute we sat down, they had plenty of chips and salsa on the table, and these were refilled regularly. That was a nice touch!

Between eight people we split one guacamole and one chile queso, which cost $8.75 each. We also ordered a margarita pitcher $41, which was equivalent to 6 servings. 

I ordered a virgin watermelon margarita $4. I appreciated that the virgin margarita was cheaper than the regular margarita. In general, I probably should stop ordering virgin versions of drinks and stick to water for my health.

For my entree I got the Camaron Al Mojo appetizer  $11.79 and a side of vegetables $2.99. The appetizer came with about a dozen shrimp absolutely soaked in butter and garlic. It was super flavorful. 

The vegetables were cactus, which I don't like. I definitely wouldn't order them again, and I wish I'd asked what the vegetable was. 

Next time, I would like to try the fish or beef tacos.
author: Julia C.

description: After a fairly long and tiring flight into the SFO from Boston, I was starving. When my friends, who live in the area, brought me here, I was pretty excited since they usually have good taste. We shared some Guac which wasn't bad and had a decent kick to it. I also got the Fish Tacos, which weren't bad, but nothing too impressive. The service and environment were weird and not my favorite. It was on the loud side so I felt like I had to scream to talk to my friends, whom I hadn't seen in a year. It took us FOREVER to get a hold of our waiter when we were in a rush to leave because we had to pick up another friend from the airport that evening as well. Chances are I would never choose to come back here when I'm back in the area. I've had better.
author: Sam T.

description: My new favorite place in the Mission! Perfect for an early dinner or first date with drinks. The bar side has great ambiance with red lights and leather booths. Highly recommend the chilaquiles. Generous portions and delicious salsa. It's a must-visit if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Sarah N.

description:
I've been to Velvet Cantina a few times now with some friends. There is plenty of seating for a big group. The bartenders are super friendly and quick to make you a drink but service can be kind of slow overall after you order your drink.

I've had the house margarita, one of the daily fruit margaritas, and the "perfect" margarita they have on the menu. All of them are pretty decent, I will not say one of the best margaritas I have had because that would be a lie but pretty decent overall. 

The queso was good with a nice consistency but it came lukewarm which is a no-no. For food I've had the tacos valentina and the carnitas. The carnitas were pretty good and they were actually nice and crispy like I am used to and they give generous portions.

Overall, not a bad spot but not one of my favorites.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Not my favorite dinner experience. There are two rooms, one is quiet where you'd probably rather eat, the other is by the bar and is incredibly loud so you won't be able to have a conversation or even order that easily. The service is laid back which means it can take a while to get the check. 

The margaritas weren't great and aren't cheap. The food itself was not the quality of Mexican food I was hoping for from the Mission. Its just okay, very large portions that are pretty bland and lukewarm. It looks better than is, with little excitement even from the salsas.
author: Jason S.

description:
My friend and I were in the Mission looking for some mexican food and we came across the Velvet Cantina - with the high number of reviews, I was pretty excited but ended up pretty disappointed. 

I ordered the carnitas, which were described as "crispy". I didn't get crispy at all - it just seemed overcooked. It seemed very dry and chewy - thankfully, we had some leftover salsa from the appetizer so that I could drown the meat in it. The rice and black beans that came with it were ok, nothing too spectacular. Although the portion was a decent size, I didn't really want to finish the food given the taste of it. For $15, I was pretty underwhelmed. 

The service was okay for the most part, our waiter checked up on us several times and seemed pretty friendly. The free chips and salsa they give you was also delicious, the salsa actually is pretty chunky and not watery like most restaurants that give you free chips and salsa. I don't think I'd come back here given that there are many other mexican restaurants in the mission that are much cheaper and taste better.
author: Michael Z.

description:
I took my out of town guests there. All the way from Asia. The place took reservations which is an excellent thing as I didn't want everyone to suffer from waiting in line. We got a booth table and ordered three appetizers. Then we looked at the menu and thought it was too much to order a full plate for each person. We ended up sharing an entree and it was still too much. We ordered a pitcher and that was also a lot of liquor for the 7 of us. 

The gist of this place is that the food is really good and the portion is huge. 

I got to play the host and that was great. Plus I had another place that I got to be at later that evening across the town so everything just worked out great. 

My colleagues saw me recently as I was abroad back in Asia and they still remember this Mexican joint. Quite different than what they'd get back at home and it was such a treat for them to experience the variety. I got the winning formula when entertaining out of town guests. Mission Mexican food is my go to place. Will be back.
author: Victoria E.

description: Loved the vibe in the bar here.  It was quiet on a Monday night, but had great service, food, and drinks.
author: Joann J.

description:
Chill vibes, good appetizers, just bring friends. 

My party of three stuck with appetizers and drinks and couldn't have been happier. 

Ordered chips, queso, enchiladas, ceviche, and quesadillas. Everything had great flavors, and decent portions. 

As for the service, the bartender made sure our drinks and chip basket were always full! 

Overall, the food was great and the drinks were stiff. I'd come back.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Yup. Pretty solid Tex Mex, and if you drink Margaritas this seems to be a good place to do it. 

I had fish tacos and they were not over-battered and came with a pineapple slaw which was great with the fish. Husband had 
green enchiladas and I'm almost sorry that wasn't my choice because they were really good too.

We sat at the bar, and the bartender was funny and nice. I can't comment on the table service, but there were a lot of large parties who seemed pretty happy but that could have been due to the Margaritas.
:)
author: El B.

description:
Love the inside decor of this place! Amazing service and really tasty food!

Why I was here // My friend from Reno came to visit and we kind of stumbled upon this place. We were looking for some good eats before getting ready for our night to start. We came on the earlier side of dinner and wasn't sure if it was open, one of restaurant staff came out and greeted us...we must have looked confused or lost LOL.....

Atmosphere // Inside decor is very red, with pretty ladies painted on the wall. Dimly lit, but we came during the day when the sun was up. 

Service // Superb! Chips and salsa were brought immediately and our host checked in on us every once in awhile. 

Food // 
- Tacos Valentina // 13.49 // Super tasty! The chicken was perfectly tender and well flavored and I loved the guac which added a creamy touch to the tacos. 

I wish I had the chance to try their drinks, but since I was previously at a wine bar, I decided to pass and just opt for the dinner. I definitely want to go back and try the other items out!
author: Emily T.

description:
Come here for the margs, stay for the queso. I recommend the house marg (the "perfect" is a bit too strong, and I'm not a fan of flavored/super sweet margs). They do great pitcher deals, and it's definitely the type of spot you want to come to with a bunch of friends.

...but back to the queso. It's out of this world. The nachos are also an awesome choice, because they have the queso AND guac. You really can't go wrong here - I've tried a number of dishes, and they're all super.

The ambiance is split between the two rooms - the back room is definitely quieter, while the front room has louder music, a more rambunctious bar, and red lighting. Great joint.
author: Katherine N.

description: Grant is the best server!! Danced to "Gimme That" in the lobby while waiting to be sat. 10 out of 10 recommend. Got the chicken burrito... A+
author: Katie G.

description: Great place for a big group with pleasing cantina fare and very strong margaritas. I thought the regular house margarita was better (and cheaper) than the fresh fruit one so go for that.
author: Misha T.

description:
TLDR: My friend and I were looking for a late night snack and drinks. This place was romantic enough, though a tad loud. I would never come back here based on the bad snack (Queso Macho) and margarita alone. Everything disappointed! WASTE OF MONEY. DON'T BOTHER! Overall rating: D-


Here's what we got:

Queso Macho (House made queso, chorizo, and guacamole): I was expecting this to come out like nachos. This was LITERALLY a SMALL bowl of cheese sauce with hardly any chorizo and guacamole drowning in the sauce. The sauce was fine. But they didn't give us a new basket of house made tortilla chips for the lonely cheese sauce until we asked for it. This sure as hell was NOT worth $10.79! What a rip off! D-

-They give you complimentary chips and salsa though. The salsa was ok, but the chips tasted very oily and stale. I only ate the chips for the sake of my tiny $11 bowl of cheese sauce. I don't even think a NYC restaurant would dare serve you JUST the sauce without additional chips for $11! C-

-Fresh Fruit Margarita: I choose the mango flavor. But they used UNRIPE mango so it ruined the drink. D-

-My friend's bottled beer was fine. Nothing special.


Go elsewhere! Just TERRIBLE here!
author: D D.

description:
Used to love this place.  Used to order guac here and get a big mortar and pestle bowl of it, now you get a 4oz scoop but it still cost $9 dollars! Wtf, worlds most expensive guac and I'm pretty sure it has mayo in it or some sort of non-avocado additive. 

Service is poor at the bar and at the tables.  Ordered a drink and 15 minutes later asked if it was still coming because the people sitting next to me ordered after they sat 10 minutes after me and already had their drinks.  The waiter replied that it happens in order of the tickets and it's coming.  Ok well I think you are giving the tickets to the line/bartender backwards then.

Food has become super mediocre overall as well.  My salad was almost all iceberg lettuce with a little cheese and garbanzo beans on top and a super weak dressing, of course it was like $16. 

I first came here maybe ten years ago and was blown away, loved the charm, style of food with good drinks and overall feel of the place.  The 2-3 times I've been here the last few years it has gotten progressively worse and worse, what happened?  At this point I for sure won't be going back even just for a margarita.
author: Bill H.

description:
Ambiance/wait staff: great place! Nice wait staff, very helpful and accommodating! Came here with a group of 10 !! The place is dimly lit, Spanish type vibe, great decor and fun! It is a little noisy inside, but my group was adding to that noise! Hahaa 

Food: my god, freaken delicious. If you live in San Fran and didn't eat dinner yet, or don't have a place to go this weekend, GO HERE!  Started with pitchers of mango and strawberry margaritas which were sweet but strong! Chips and salsa were put on the table, the salsa is delicious, very fresh and tomato-ey tasting! Then we got the queso with chorizo to start.... sooo good! We got two for the table of 10 and they were quickly devoured. We also got mushroom empanadas, my favorite of the night! They were smothered in a creamy mushroom sauce... and filled with sautéed mushrooms as well -  if you like mushrooms, this is the dish for you! Then I tried the fish tacos and the steak tacos! All taco platters come with two tacos, rice and beans (black, pinto or refried) the fish taco was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, and had slaw and a spicy aioli on it.. which was delicious and the steak tacos were well seasoned and juicy. I would have liked the steak pieces to be chopped up a little more, because they were a tad sloppy to eat, since the steak was cut fairly large for one of my typical mouthfuls! 

We didn't have room for dessert, unfortunately! But I will definitely go back to this restaurant when I visit the west coast again! 

Happy Eating !
Nicole
author: Nicole S.

description:
This is probably one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city. I always take out of town guests here. It has a very cool vibe and the service is always great in my experience. We came in around 6:30 and were seated immediately and there were other open tables available. It seemed to fill up quickly though and was full around 7. 

Food: I ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas and they were delicious. They are light and I didn't feel like I overate. I always consider trying something new but end up ordering this every time. 
My boyfriend ordered the carnitas but didn't love them. They are served "crispy" but he said they just tasted dry. He wouldn't order them again. 

Drink: We ordered a pitcher of the house margaritas and they were fairly strong. You can also ask for a spicy salt on the rim which is tasty.

Service: Our waiter was very quick and made sure our basket of chips was always full. 

Great food and great atmosphere.
author: Taylor F.

description:
Low stars because bathroom was horrifying. Toilet didn't flush. Soap dispenser was empty and then the lid popped off, and it was full of water and old soap chunks. Wtf? Meaning no one has washed their hands coming out of that bathroom in... days? Weeks? 

Food was meh. Queso was gelatinous and gross. How do you screw up queso?! Salad was sad - gross iceberg, few toppings, not good dressing. Mushroom empanadas were good, veggie sopes were fine. 

Kitchen closes at 10:30 pm. Got there at 10:15 pm. Didn't know, cuz it just says they close at 1 am. They handled it okay. Moved us to the bar but were nice about it.

Service was good.
author: Jessica K.

description: This place was great! Made the reservation on Yelp for a big group. The queso was fabulous. I shared steak and fish tacos and but had a little zip to it and we're phenomenal!! Highly suggest it. Strawberry and mango margaritas were also delicious! Highly recommend.
author: Meg D.

description:
The happy hour margaritas keep us coming back every time. 
 Bar area is small, so keep it short.  Great place to meet friends or mellow out on route to somewhere else!
author: Yadi G.

description: I made a reservation for about 5 people here for a Friday night. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas which is the best value and they're really good. We also got the queso macho dip to share which was bomb. For my meal, I got the chicken avocado enchiladas. Everything was absolutely delicious and I devoured all of it, haha. Service was great and prices aren't bad at all. Highly recommended!
author: Pooja C.

description: Great place. Nice, quick, great margaritas! Super place to spend an evening. Get anything on the menu and it will be good
author: Robert S.

description:
My friend Noemi and I have a monthly venture of drinks and gossip, and I chose Velvet Cantina because I had it bookmarked on Yelp for some reason. She told me that she used to be a regular here, and now I totally understand why. There are a few entrances, and after wandering into one of the doors, I eventually found the bar that she was sitting at. The whole place is drenched in red light, which was a little disconcerting at first but became more comforting. 

I had a Velvet Margarita, amongst the plethora of options on the menu. This is also what our bartender recommended. Alongside this, I ordered the Shrimp Enchiladas because we were both hungry. The shrimp was plentiful and perfectly cooked. So good! Would totally want to get this again. Noemi and I both ended up getting another Velvet Margarita. These are so strong, and the bartenders are such enablers. It's a nice feel-good place.

There is plenty of seating here, and I'm not sure if it gets busy at other times, but there was so much availability when we went on Wednesday after work. I'm appreciative that we were able to catch up in a relatively quiet environment with excellent food and drink service. They made us feel special, and it's right down the street from my weekly dance lessons, so I'll definitely be here again in the future!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Disappointed in the extreme.  The prices are very high for the portion size and the meat quality.  The Enchiladas Verdes pork was nasty.  The Chile queso was small and lukewarm.

The restaurant interior is nice but a bit too hot.

Definitely a $$$ place with food quality of a $ food truck.

Stay away...
author: Eric A.

description:
Alright, while I'm not completing writing Velvet Cantina off, I will say that the food there left much to be desired. I would say come for the drinks and camaraderie with friends. 

Located in the heart of the Mission district, Velvet Cantina is small, but able to accommodate semi-large groups. We made reservations for 8 p.m. on a Tuesday night for eight people and we all fit comfortably.

I ordered the achiote steak tacos, which sounded downright delicious on the menu. Strips of steak seasoned with achiote topped with pepper jack cheese, guacamole and sour cream. However, the flavor just wasn't there. The meat was also kind of fatty. I made it through about one and one-half of three tacos before I just gave up. Friends gave mixed reviews on their food, as well. From what I gathered, I should try the enchiladas on any subsequent visits. Duly noted. Also, the house salsa was salty and highly acidic. As in maybe too much lemon or lime juice. 

What Velvet Cantina DOES do well are their drinks! I don't think you can go wrong with any of their margaritas. There was enough variety to appeal to different tastes and budgets, although the prices are fairly close. I don't drink tequila often, but when I do, I enjoy the smooth taste of Herradura (I promise I'm not being paid to say this LOL). Hence, the "Perfect Margarita" was my favorite. It was strong and perfectly blended. I also tried the "Velvet Margarita," and since it's the restaurant's namesake, I expected it to be the best one. However, it was entirely too bitter for my taste. I didn't enjoy it.

Again, I'm not completely over this place, but there are better Mexican food spots where you can get your fix if you're in the city. (Don't sleep on our taco trucks). But, for the drinks alone, I would return.
author: Tashi L.

description: BEST PLACE FOR TEQUILA!!! They have rows and rows of tequila behind the bar. We only came here for drinks so I can't really comment on the food. However, the drinks we did get were sooooo good. Got a pitcher of mango margarita, super strong but doesn't burn your throat, also you can really taste the mango which makes these super dangerous. Also got the cilantro drink which basically  tastes like you're drinking SALSA. I highly recommend unless you don't like cilantro, but most refreshing drink I've had in a long time. They do not go light on the alcohol.
author: Tatiana T.

description:
Love this place! We were accommodated really quick even though we had a huge party.

Servers were amazing and on top of everything. When they made an error of serving us our Margaritas( which was amazing btw, and I'm very picky since it's my favorite drink ) and spilled it, the server was just very apologetic and dealt with it professionally. 

Got us another round with an amazing services.

Good vibes and friendly atmosphere.

SOLD.
author: Adrian P.

description: Delicious food all around - we had a party of 8 and everyone enjoyed what they got whether it be enchiladas, fajitas, tacos. Margs were strong and the pitchers were good value. Great service and extremely friendly staff as well.
author: Sandesh K.

description: Great service and good Mexican food in the Mission. Margaritas were strong and yummy!
author: Teresa S.

description:
This place is somewhere between three and four stars. 

Hadn't been here in a few years, but brought two groups of friends in the last 2 weeks and it was still a hit for both. The menu hasn't changed much because the options are very solid. Shrimp Diablo (i think it's called), the enchiladas, and carnitas stand out to me, but nothing here has ever been bad. Last night I went with the steak tacos which were also solid. 

From a drinks perspective I prefer the Paloma, very excellent. In a group go with the Velvet Margarita pitcher. It goes down real smooth but be careful or you will be nursing a hangover the following day. of course the hangover is WAY worse if you get the cheaper tequila.
author: David A.

description: Service  was great, food was awesome. Drinks were amazing!!!! Would definitely come bac!
author: Ashly G.

description:
The services: is excellent 
The place: the ambiance is really good with the drawings on the wall, the music and the lighting 
The food: didn't impress me that much, it was just ok. 
maybe I will be back for other reasons but not the food!
author: Fatma I.

description: Enjoyed my order much better the second time. The burrito was super tasty and margaritas were strong. I enjoyed the atmosphere. Maybe I was just in a bad mood the last time I went
author: Kelly G.

description: Fantastic Mexican spot in the Mission. Incredible burritos, chips/salsa, and margaritas.
author: Jarrad W.

description: Big fan of this spot. Had heard stories about the incredible queso and the fun atmosphere, and when I finally visited I was not disappointed! We were able to find a seat at a booth immediately upon arriving (a Friday at 8!) and enjoyed everything we ordered. Next time we will order a pitcher instead of just individual margs! Perfect spot for a tasty dinner and drinks with friends before a night out. DO NOT SKIP THE QUESO!
author: Abby R.

description:
I had a "fresh fruit margarita" here, which was almost entirely tequila and half a shot of mango juice. It wasn't great.

I'll admit that the location and atmosphere are decent though. It may be different if you're getting a bite to eat as well.
author: John L.

description: I just love this place. Great food, great atmosphere, great staff. Oh and then there's the homemade chips and queso.
author: Erika D.

description: Good vibe, good service, delicious vegetarian food. Loved it! Definitely will go there again.
author: Shokoofeh P.

description: Very good Mexican restaurant in a great little neighborhood.  The salsa is outstanding.  The quest was very good.  Loved the perfect margaritas and shrimp enchiladas.  Service was great.  Good for a group of 6....plenty of room at our table. Very reasonably priced.
author: Karen B.

description: Margarita pitchers are actually quite strong, be warned. Food way great, service was great, and so were prices. I got the fish tacos and had no complaints!
author: Meera D.

description: Such a sultry Lil Mexican joint in Mission I ordered light, empanadas mhmmm were so good I also tried a few items on my friends plates like he rice and beans, alll tasty my only gripe was the cold tortilla chips that were kinda hard! Nothing that would turn me away I was also blessed with a nacho  style smore dish that was sooo good. Gracias compa!
author: Tashi C.

description:
Delicious. 

Came here with a friend on cinco de mayo, as expected it was very busy but we were able to put our name on the wait list and we were seated in about 30 minutes. 

We got a pitcher of margaritas, a guacamole appetizer, and we both got the chicken avocado enchiladas with re fried beans.  

The pitcher of margaritas was about 6 drinks, standard but tasty. The chips that came with the guacamole were a little disappointing, but that could be because they made larger batches in anticipation of the crowd, the guac was great. The enchiladas were amazing. The cheese was the perfect amount of spiciness, the chicken was tender, and the avocado was ripe. The re fried beans were probably the best I've ever had. 

Even though it was crowded we got excellent service. I will definitely be returning.
author: Terri E.

description:
First time being here for 4th of July dinner, I chose this place based on its +1000 yelp reviews which totally misled us. 

 The waiter was totally drunk and behaved poorly. The food was too salty and the service was terrible. I asked clearly that I would like to have a corne Asada burrito with black beans, and they decided to change it to garbanzo and burned beef. 

 We literally waited for half an hour to complete the payment process.  Never gonna go there again! 

This place is a total scam!
author: Farzad M.

description:
I just love velvet cantina. Very relaxed environment, good strong drinks and good food. The staff is great. They are all very nice, attentive.
If you want a relaxed chill atmosphere, with cool music, good service and good Mexican  food, look no further. Velvet cantina it is!
author: Junior V.

description:
Great drinks and food - but OMG that music! Loud, loud loud! Club-level loud! Pounding! Deafening! Are you getting the picture? Obnoxious! 

Call me crazy, but I think most people go to a restaurant to relax, enjoy a nice dinner and socialize with their friends or family. They do not want to go home with a headache! 

We couldn't wait to get out of there.
author: E. G.

description: Great food and atmosphere. Great margaritas, music, great staff and variety of tequila. They also offer you chips and salsa at no charge.  The salsa was pretty good not mild nor necessarily memorable.  The chips were nice and warm. I'll definitely want to come back.
author: Doriana B.

description: This place is a fun! I got their ceviche which was okay, but their enchiladas are amazing. We got a pitcher of their house margarita and they were strong! I hate it when bartenders make drinks overly sweet. Also make a reservation, if not go to the bar and grab a drink.
author: Sandeep C.

description:
They have the BEST fish tacos in the city! I'm always trying to bring my friends to come try it because it's amazing. Definitely get that if you go there!! 

Some other must tries are the chicken tortilla soup and the Guacamole and chips. So good! My mouth is salivating just thinking about the food... 

Kevin, our server, was also wonderful - very attentive and provided great customer service!
author: Michelle F.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and man, was it busy! The wait was an hour and my brother was famished and getting crabby. We all had a drink at the bar and luckily, waited 40 minutes. Four of us were sat at a table, probably meant for 3 people but we made the best of it. The food was great and the service was decent. Make a reservation ahead of time and be prepared to feel like a sardine in a can.
author: Carly M.

description: DO NOT EVER COME HERE!!!! What a joke! We drove from Los Angeles to San Francisco to have tacos and margaritas like we use to enjoy when we lived here but this rude, inconsiderate jerk in the picture attached (because he wouldn't give his name but it may be Ron) decided that he had a slow night and was closing early upon our arrival. This was an hour and a half before closing time. Such a joke because this jerk had several friends sitting there but wouldn't let anyone else in. Please never come here. I expect and demand that a manager contact me to explain how a company survives on closing early and horrible customer service.
author: Stephen D.

description: Terrible food and annoying patrons. Shrimp enchiladas tasted like old time airline food. Frozen at best. Mole sweet and tinny. The crowd clearly not local. Frat house atmosphere. Where do these people come from?
author: A F.

description: I made a reservation at 7:30 for 8 people about a week in advance. We were seated 20 minutes later and given guacamole on the house I guess to make up for it. We sit down and the waiter asks us if we'd like some margarita pitchers, we all agree to have two pitchers (4 glasses/ pitcher). We didn't see it on the menu so we just didn't think much of it. The margaritas were not good and they were $78 for the two. Our dinner for 8 people was less than $100, but b/c of two pitchers, became almost $200. I give the food a 5/10. Margaritas 3/10. Definitely not coming back.
author: Acelia C.

description: I came after great recommendation, loved the food and half the service. But Darius has been a dark cloud within my friends group on multiple occasions. As I was complaining Abt him being abrasively rude. My friend mentioned he has actually touched her leg with no permission, saying he was just checking for hair. I will not ever come back after seeing this kind of guy being my guide through a nice dinner. Absolutely unacceptable
author: Cassandra L.

description:
Good food and stiff Margaritas, just the way I like them. ;)

Had the chili verde that was recommended and gf had the garlic shrimp. Both of us loved our food and would order again. 

Server was the bartender who took a long time to get us the check since he was doing everything and had a bunch of tables. Could use an extra server in the bar area but that's the only negative thing I can say. He was super friendly though and it wasn't so bad that I wouldn't go back. 

Check this place out for a date in the mission.
author: Eric N.

description: Festive vibe, yummy food. Don't go here if you want to have a quiet conversation.
author: J P.

description: Really good food and very friendly staff.  Pleasant surprise!
author: B R.

description:
GET THE GUAC AND CHIPS.

Service is a great and so is the food. Definitely check it out if you're in the area.
author: Graci B.

description: Haven't been to this place in a decade but decided to give it a try.  The menu is solid with lots of good options and the drinks equally good. They had one waiter who seemed a little surly at the beginning but turns out he runs the floor for the entire restaurant on weekday nights - give him a break and chat him up - he let us try a couple of the sauces and made sure our drinks were full.
author: Shannon M.

description: Popped in with the kiddos for an early mexican feast.  Drinks were great and the food was out of this world.  Waiter was really rad-- kids loved him!
author: Jason G.

description: Fabulous atmosphere! The music is hip and upbeat. The food is fantastic! We had a party of five and they seated us immediately.
author: Lalisa M.

description: went to dinner here for a friend's birthday. it's a fun restaurant with great food and drinks. we ordered a pitcher of strawberry margaritas and our waiter gifted us a second one on the house for the birthday girl. he also brought out s'mores nachos and sang her happy birthday! overall a great experience. i would recommend making a reservations as it was pretty crowded!
author: Natalie S.

description:
I like this place.  It keeps me regular.  I had really bad diarrhea after coming back from Mexico City.  Two weeks of water poops.  Then I ate here and it solidified everything!

Also, the chicken avocado enchiladas are great as is the salsa.  The electronica playing in the background is a bit strange, but not unpleasant.  The servers were all really nice and attentive.
author: Hillary B.

description:
Had the garlic shrimp appetizer with a side of half black beans half refried beans (currently on the slow-carb diet - hi Tim Ferriss) and it was DELICIOUS!! So kind of them to accommodate the half and half since I wanted both beans but not 2 entire side orders (pretty big portions for a side!)

I was there with a friend pretty early, like 6 pm, on a Wednesday but it wasn't super crowded even 2 hours later. I'm not sure what it's like on weekends but for a weekday, it was a great place to hang out and have a nice long dinner (:
author: Mio W.

description: Such great place to just hang on the weekday night or have your birthday celebration! Drinks are nice and strong. Amazing bartenders Alex, Rodrigo and Steve Aoki
author: Jaroslav S.

description: Place is a blast good priced food. The atmosphere is great and loud but perfect so you can hear your table
author: Joey A.

description: We were looking for good Mexican food in a quaint environment with a full bar close to our AirBnB in Bernal Heights. We couldn't have found a better spot. I had the enchiladas verse and the pork was delicious. Wife had the carna asada, and it was delicious. Overall, really great meal and solid service. Would eat here again and would recommend it.
author: DamonandShannon G.

description:
this place is so freaking loud, and their margaritas are overrated, yet it's pretty much my favorite restaurant in the city. i also don't really like margaritas, so take that with a grain of salt (rim). (sorry.)

really, the vibe is where it's at. the wait staff is always friendly and fun (and/or cute), the tacos are awesome, and the portion sizes are big and great. love the decor, love the free million chips, etc.

they also take reservations [and they have tables available in the same week], which is a premium feature in this hood.
author: Caroline S.

description:
This is my first time eating and drinking at this restaurant. 
The place is usually full, but you can actually eat at the bar or in the dinning area if you made a reservation or if it is a slow night. 

The people working there are very friendly and always try to engage you into small conversations. That's very friendly of them. 

The environment is very pleasant and everyone seems to be friendly. 

The food and the drinks are amazingly tasty. I ordered the Chicken drumstick (Mole I think) and it has the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. The Velvet Margarita was well balanced. 

I will definitely go with friends to this place again! Totally recommended!
author: Alberto W.

description: One of my favorite nacho dishes! Great service and the ability to get a reservation for 13 just a few minutes in advance is a huge win. Well priced for SF. A little dark/not much ambiance, but for a last minute solid meal, it's a good spot.
author: Sara M.

description: Loved the service here!! And their steak tacos were so so good!!! Loved the way they made their rice, fluffy and flavorful. And their ceviche was some of the best we've had. Will def be back!
author: Niaz N.

description: This place is good for drinks and has a lively, fun atmosphere but the food tastes bland and is nothing to rave about. Our party of 5 left most of our dishes uneaten even after downing a few margarita pitchers. There's plenty of much better Mexican food places in SF. I won't be coming back here to eat.
author: Michael D.

description: Don't forget to ask for their secret habanero sauce! We love this place! It can get a little loud, but the overall ambience and the food are awesome!!
author: Michael D.

description:
Danger, danger! Delicious margaritas. Really, really delicious margaritas. Large, "let's just get a pitcher" margaritas. Some "I couldn't even taste the tequila" margaritas. 

They have margaritas here. 

Okay, moving on. I met a group of friends here for dinner recently. We'd made a reservation but had to wait a bit for our table to be ready. We managed to find enough space near the bar to stay out of the way and still chat with one another while they made some room. 

We tried it all: guacamole, queso, steak tacos, tacos valentina, chicken mole, enchiladas. We were passing plates back and forth all evening, and it was delicious. Service was prompt, prices weren't too shabby, and everyone in the place seemed to be having a great time. I liked the energy. 

Great place for dinner with some low maintenance friends. The place is no frills, but I dig that kind of thing. Might be fun for a date night too, but the later it gets the louder it gets, so keep that in mind.
author: Brittany B.

description: Fun place with delicious food and even better margaritas. It gets a bit loud and crowded on weekend nights in the bar area, but it's one of my favorite places to take people for a fun Friday dinner or a casual margarita on Taco Tuesday.
author: Greg L.

description: There was a lot of hope on this place by locals as a must try. I'm in town for a few days and was able to get seats at 630 pm. As it party arrived, the host were welcoming and accommodating quickly. This was a 40th bday pre party dinner so I went to the bar (a nice setup) to get a couple of shots and a dinner drink. The bartender was quick to serve and made a great Paloma (signature house drink). The meal was ordered and served fairly quickly.... I had the enchiladas verdes and they were tasty, overpriced but tasty. Now the bad news: I went to the bar to close out my tab and noticed 2 other drinks were added to my bill. This of course is not cool! And the bartender argued it was correct. I was able to get the charges removed only after someone claimed the bars do this to increase bar orders.... I'm skeptical of this but as they say "buyer beware".
author: Gabriel L.

description:
Amazing mushroom empanadas and the service is amazing.. :) 
The ambience could have been a little better.. It was a little too red.. 
Their habanero hot sauce is super hot and goes well with the nachos.. 
The server was super nice and friendly... 
The smores dessert looked a little too burnt to me but I might be wrong... Saw lots of people order that so it might be delicious... 
Overall a nice place..
author: Rupa S.

description:
Came here for drinks with a couple friends on a Friday night! You can only sit down at the tables if you order food or after 11pm, so we just crowded around the bar. 

They have seasonal fresh fruit margaritas, and you have to ask which flavors they have that day. We split a pitcher of the raspberry margarita. The raspberry flavor wasn't very strong, but we watched the bartender make the pitcher, and WOW did he put in a lot of tequila! The margaritas tasted great but you will definitely be feeling it after a couple of them. I've also had the mango margarita before, and that was fruitier and had more of a tang.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Best Margaritas, Rodrigo is the best!!
He will take care of you. Great food great drinks. Best in SF!!!
author: Eric W.

description: Nothing beats a good margarita and bomb chips & salsa that go along with it. I got the watermelon margarita and boy was it strong! When I watched the bartender make my drink, he seemed to be pretty generous with that splash of tequila. However, I'm not complaining because I definitely did get my money's worth. The chips here are also really good. The chips are thick and crunchy, almost like made from flour tortillas. I probably ate a basket worth of chips while sipping on my margarita. There were also a lot of customers that sat in and ordered from their restaurant menu. I would definitely come back to try their food here as well!
author: Joy W.

description: Great margaritas. We Ordered just about every margarita on the menu. We came in at 9pm and left at closing. Initially went in for Margarita Monday's though there was no special. Spent around $99 on 9 margaritas. Tipped that helped us out as well as the bartender that made us the last drink.
author: Melbin A.

description: Strongest margarita you will ever have and you can't even taste the tequila. Come here to get smashed and eat really good food that you wish you could taste, if you weren't so wasted.
author: Arash Y.

description: It's a bar, so I was expecting noise, but it was extremely loud. We had a reservation for a 11 people for a birthday party, expecting to be seated in the back restaurant area where its a bit quieter, but they started prepping our table in the main bar area. We asked if we could be in the back room so we could talk and they were happy to help. We all ordered our food, but when the food arrived, we were told that they ran out of rice and decided to give those who didn't give rice double beans. What Mexican restaurant runs out of rice!?!?! during dinner?!?! It's mostly shocking because we made reservations, so they had an idea on how many covers the restaurant was going to have that night and how much rice was going to be needed. Never heard of a Mexican restaurant in the mission running out of rice before, but then again, theres a first time for everything. the food was pretty good, not great, but the margaritas were strong and three pitchers was more than enough for our group of 11.
author: Samantha E.

description: Came here for a team dinner (we are a big group) and service was great! They gave us a long table in the back, probably consisted of a bunch of smaller tables usually spread apart. I didn't even notice the other booths around the room (and our table) until later in the evening... this place definitely fills up! The portion sizes are very generous. Our entire team was so stuffed. Also, margaritas here are very. strong.
author: Grace J.

description:
I came here for cinco de mayo. Showed up 15 minutes before my friends and politely waited outside not putting my name on the list only for my friends to show up and ask if our name was on the list yet. Huge mistake.

The wait was considerable, but made ever more pleasant by the atmosphere of San Francisco denizens loudly talking over eachother and over pitchers of margaritas and every once in a while cheering when the Maitre' D would read out a name several times loudly, get no response, and cross another name off the list of those waiting for tables.

The marg pitchers here are a reasonable $33 for the house marg (I don't know what the other ones are but the house marg is good). The food here is good as well. Highly recommend coming here with a group and getting good and sloshed then scarfing down some quality mexican food. Sounds like a good time.
author: Andrew C.

description:
On walking in the door we were overwhelmed by a strong smell of disinfectant. We were directed to the bar area and seated right away. The restaurant was empty at 6 PM, however the music was turned way up. We asked the bartender to turn it down and he sis slightly. All evening the music was so loud that as the place filled up people were shouting at the table next to us. We could barely hear each other. The tables in the booths are small and the three of us were crowded with our knees against each other. I suggest you get a regular table if there re more than 2 in your party.

Margarita were good. We had a pitcher of the house.

Food was okay. 

I will not be back due to the ambiance.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Best queso in the city!! We ordered the regular queso, chorizo guac queso, and guacamole to start. All seriously so good! I got the fish tacos which were incredible! I'm not a huge taco person but I would eat these every day! We got a pitcher of margarita which was very strong. Usually I like a strong margarita but it was a Monday night so it was a little too much! I want to go back and try the edibles, too! The service was very good and quick! We had a wonderful time!
author: Samantha M.

description: This shit is good. Shrimp, steak, chicken, many types of animals died for our dining pleasure, and they died well.  Seriously, you guys, I'm in total full-on pedal-to-the-metal foodgasm mode with this shit. They crushed it. Eat here. You have to. It's that amazing. Six stars.
author: Scott S.

description: I go here at least once a week to meet up with friends for evening drinks. Great place for small groups. Super friendly bartenders and servers who will most likely convince you to get margarita pitchers for the table - don't resist! The margaritas there are the best margaritas in town and you only need 2 or you may stumble out the door on your way out. Free homemade chips and salsa. Ridiculous tequila selection and located right in the heart of the Mission of SF! Low lighting so great for first dates, just don't get there past 6pm or you'll be standing at the bar.
author: Carley H.

description: Great food , great staff !!! NO NEED TO SAY ANYTHING ELSE a must try when in the mission district
author: Robert G.

description: This place has some seriously bullshit service. We got there at 730, no one even said hello and when we approached them they brushed us off and ignored us. They sat some later party of two ahead of us on a big table so we waited another twenty minutes. After finally seating us, they didn't take drink orders or bring us water for another twenty so we just sat there like idiots. It wasn't even that busy. We haven't gotten the food yet (though they did finally take our order) so I have no comment on that, but I bet it sucks. Wish there was an option for less than one star. Also they play awful techno music so I think I have an ear disease now.
author: Boris B.

description: The food is wonderful, fresh, clean ingredients. Delicious! Great tequilas. Love the Velvet margarita, fresh lime no crap. Celebrating my son's birthday and they brought him a shot of tequila. Way better than a scoop of ice cream. I've been here before and I'm definitely coming back!
author: Deborah S.

description:
Food is very good here. 

You get complimentary chips and salsa. Chips are hard though. A little overcooked.

Guac is very good, fresh, and well worth ordering. 

I ordered the Velvet salad and dressing was refreshing. 

House margaritas are strong and more on boozy side so you'll have to sip slowly.
author: Chhaya N.

description:
Came to dinner on a Monday. It was wonderful great and fast service. Very accommodating. They let me try a few things out before I made my mind up. GET the house Margarita, it's really good. A great ambiance. We tried the Carnitas, delicioso and the fish tacos. Also good. Great ambiance and beautifully decorated. 
I will be coming here often. Lots of other things to taste.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
Some of the best chips I've had in a while.  Each one tasted different... which kept me eating more of them, trying to get back to that original "first chip" taste.  I know.. it's futile.

I really enjoyed the daily fruit margaritas. The pineapple and strawberry ones were very good.   It was odd though how it tasted like salt was sprinkled on top of the drink, not just the rim of the glass.

Music was LOUD.  Like, floor was vibrating loud.  Had to yell at my friend in order for her to here me.  This was 7:30pm on a Saturday, not exactly late night.

Also, the bus boy started busing our table including wiping it down with a rag while we were waiting for the credit card to come back to the table. Guy! Sit tight, all right?.... Rude.
author: Chloe M.

description:
Strong margaritas, hearty Mexican food, and relaxed atmosphere -- where will the night take you?

Velvet Cantina is one of the places that left a lasting imprint on my memory after my first visit to San Fran. So when it was a suggestion for a group dinner with a few coworkers, my mind was flooded with memories of margaritas and loads of guacamole.

The food is simple, fresh, and hearty. You will leave there full to the brim. But there's always room for one more margarita. I opted for the Velvet Cantina margarita, which is basically tequila, agave nectar and lime juice. Simple and strong. Two of those and I was feeling a-ok. A pitcher is also a nice option if everyone's getting the same thing. Also, try their fresh fruit margaritas - I tried a few sips of my friend's raspberry one and it was phenomenal.

A little sexy and cozy resto - nab the corner booth, which is perfect for a small group of friends. Everyone can hear each other and chat as a group. This was a plus for our crew who all wanted to catch up and hear about everything we've been doing in our own cities.

Guacamole is required. Chicken avocado enchiladas are the bomb. Yeah I just said that. I looove the jalapeño cream sauce and the cilantro pesto. Ahh, it's all so good. Then, I prefer the refried beans over the black beans. All around heavenly good Mexican eats. I think I will go every time I visit SF.
author: Breanna B.

description:
Really fantastic service in a pretty relaxed setting. The food wasn't mind-blowing, but that's not really the point. This is the sort of place that you went to with your family if you lived in a town that had five restaurants and only one of those was a Mexican restaurant. That doesn't sound like that great of a review, but it's exactly what I was looking for. It's comfort food, i's where you go after you won(or lost) a soccer game as a kid, or where you go to after a really bad (or really good) day at work.

Honestly there really aren't many places like this in San Francisco anymore. 

I will be coming here again on a regular basis.
author: Morgan H.

description: I went here with a friend on a Saturday night at around 7PM. It was pretty busy inside, but the host took our names down on their iPad and we waited for no longer than 15 minutes for a table to clear up. Be sure to wait near the restrooms as that's where the host will call your name from and you'll need to pay attention because as I said, it's noisy inside. We were finally sat and were immediately given water and tortilla chips (which are pretty damn good!). Refills were given for both without even asking. Our orders arrived fairly quickly and I liked how fresh the ingredients tasted on the Chicken Quesadillas that I ordered. It definitely could be split between 2 people. Did I mention that the wait staff here are friendly and quick? It looks like this place is dog friendly too as I saw a couple with a small 20-30lb dog inside.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Amazing food, intimate ambiance, and strong margaritas.

Velvet Cantina is great for many occasions - date night, girls night out, you name it. The portions are big enough for leftovers. I always want to venture out and try something new, but the steak tacos are just too good. Salsa game is also strong. One drawback is that it can get a bit noisy.
author: Emily F.

description: Fun spot! We had a pitcher of margaritas and shared a bunch of dishes, all reminding me of the old school Mexican stuff we grew up on.  It was a quiet night so we were able to have a conversation too. A keeper!
author: Ada C.

description:
I love this place! It's great for a group of 2-7 as they have nice big tables that are still small enough so you can hear everyone.

They have interesting and delicious margaritas (they're strong too) and you can try a wide range of tequila (to each his own). The restaurant has some good quesadillas, but the best thing on the menu is definitely the s'mores nachos. Man, these are dangerous!
author: Kate T.

description: I used to give it 5 ,but I just had my bday there and I always love the tortilla soup and the steak. The steak was sooo overdone,unedible.i literally couldn't chew it.every other time ,I've lived it here...but ,a birthday steak let down. I was sad.
author: Christina M.

description:
Coming in I was a little shocked at the lackluster environment.  I was worried they might be freezing everything so I ordered nachos thinking they would at least make that fresh.  They are really good.  Nachos are hit and miss. These ones are good,  very different cheese but good.  I hope you try the nachos they are filling too. 
I'm not sure how much if any is frozen.  Seems to be solid food though.  I'd come back.
author: Rose M.

description: If you want the ambiance of a real Mexican restaurant with American style Mexican food ie. Nachos enchiladas tacos ECT. Which are what I like this is the spot.the food however cannot be matched by the amazingly friendly polite and helpful staff which is hosted by the bartender Alex who carries one of the coolest sweetest sincere demeanors I have ever encountered. Fun friendly great atmosphere. I really always have good time leave full and content. All the staff are extremely polite cool cats.
author: Mia M.

description:
Decided to come here on a Friday with friends to catch up and the wait was about 30 Min. for a party of three. It wasn't too bad because we were able to get a spot at the bar and get some drinks in before actually being seated.

Those margaritas though...WHOA! Delicious and definitely a creeper. We ordered a pitcher of the house margarita and it really allowed us to get a good buzz going on. Bartenders were fun and made sure folks got taken care of. The area can get a bit crowded since the bar is located at the front of the restaurant where the entrance is located.

The food and service was a bit off to me. It took us quite a while to get our check. Maybe because it was a busy Friday night. The things that we ordered tasted very ordinary and didn't leave too much of an impression. Warning...steer clear from the cantaloup margarita. Tried to be adventurous and found that it was a tough one to swallow.

All in all, I had an enjoyable time based on the ambiance, great music they played (big ups to inebriated singalongs to throwback songs), drinks, and good company.
author: Vincent L.

description: One of my favorites in San Francisco! Owners are amazing and the food hits the spot. Those margaritas are a must. Thank you for making me a fan
author: Fernando G.

description: When we walked in I thought it was going to be a hit. Nice music, chill atmosphere. A little loud but that's ok on a Friday night. We felt like we weren't welcomed. We got seated in the back by the door. A door that kept swinging open almost hitting us. It was cold and uncomfortable. It wasn't packed so there were other comfortable seats, but unfortunately it was offered. It took almost 30 minutes to be asked if we were thirsty or ready to order. The party of 10-12 got more service than anybody in the place. The food was okay, I've had better nachos elsewhere. I hate to use the race card but I'll throw it out there anyway. The white customers were treated as royalty. So if you aren't white, I'd keep it pushing to a different place.
author: Marche B.

description:
I'll tell you right now, I will never come back to this place. Until Gabe The Hostess, gets a grip. He is in the wrong industry!!! Get it together baby boy. You need some training in the hospitality industry let me know. I have a few restaurant under my belt. I'm not done yet.

This is how it goes. We were a party of 7. It was busy. It's obvious that everybody working were all busy and running around. We were all seated at our table, Mr. Gabe already had a look on his face of frustration, not my issue. He chose to be a hostess in life not I. 

We get 2 pitchers of the Velvet Margaritas (they were scrumptious) while we make our food selections. We waited, waited. Again, we are patient as we know that it is busy. After 10-15 mins I simply call Gabe over and ask him to call our waiter over. He interrupted me and little did he know he raised his voice and said, "I have seated, that table (as he points out the tables), that table and that table. At this point, I'm confused because I wasn't one asking him to take our order or anything else. Simply asked to call our waiter over. He continues to get aggravated and says, "what,? I can't help you. I am busy." My whole table looked at each other in disgust! Like really?! Did that just happen? My friend across the table asked, "What is going on." I started talking to her about it and guess what?! Gabe is looking at me dead in the eyes and says, "You got a problem?!" So, we are fighting now? "Did he just threaten me?" I think he did. So, I call him over to ask him what his issue was and to just reconfirm the fact that all I wanted was our waiter nothing else. Words were exchanged. I sent him off. 

As petty as this is...He had no reason to treat anybody this way. Especially the people like ME, that pay his bills and keep these businesses open. We have choices, the mission has tons of other spots to eat. 

Maybe Gabe needs to change his career path and not be a hostess or whatever it is he does. He should be embarrassed as should the whole establishment. Don't let people like this tarnish your reputation. Your food is way too good. Get rid of the bad apple.
author: Carla F.

description: Ordered the chicken Brito and chili con Kso it was grate. Good food, good vibes, good music, awesome Margaritas's
author: Carmen H.

description:
Great quac, lots of tequila options, and fun atmosphere. Definitely a gem in the Mission.

Got a heavy handed pitcher of margarita, guacamole and chips. Yum
author: Mona A.

description:
Came here with a friend on a early Saturday night to get our drank on. However, it was pretty early, and thus, the place was pretty empty. We got a table in the corner, and honestly, this place is pretty intimate, especially with the red light. I can totally see bringing or meeting a date here. The staff and serve were good, and the drink prices were average for the area.

I came here with a buddy of mines because I've been wanted to check this place out for awhile, but the environment made it pretty uncomfortable for two dudes hanging out haha. Come here only if the girl to guy ratio in your group is at LEAST 1:1

Not really sure how the food is, or how the night progresses here, we left after a couple of drinks.
author: Phan H.

description: This place is so yummy with excellent white chicken tortilla soup (try it!) and reasonable prices. A gem!
author: Danielle P.

description:
This is a great sit-down Mexican restaurant located in the Mission. 

They make their own chips and salsa in house!  And it's really good. So good that I ended up filling up on them before my meal arrived to the table. Lol (ended up having to box my meal and bring it home. 

I ordered the Shrimp Diablo ($14.99). It was prawns with onions in a hot sauce.  They claimed it to be the spiciest thing on the menu. I love spicy food, so I was in.  However, Sadly it wasn't spicy at all.  Despite the lack of heat/spice, the dish was still very good. 

Also, they have like 4 different kinds of margaritas! The House, The Perfect, Fresh Fruit (which they have 3 different ones to choose from), and The Velvet Margarita. 

Ambience: During dinner time this place plays loud music, so prepare yourself for that. 

I would definitely come back to this place!
author: Rose Z.

description: In my opinion, the best Mexican food in SF. I am half Mexican and grew up eating Mexican food. This place is so delicious!! The first time, I had the carnitas. Very tender, tasty, moist pork inside and crispy outside. The house margaritas are great!! And the pitcher is very cost effective. Tonight, we got there a tad early but they let us sit at a table and order drinks under dinner service started. I had the bordello burrito with chicken. The chicken was so juicy and flavorful. Everything I have had here is superbly delicious and the wait staff is very friendly and accommodating! One of my favorite SF eateries!! PS - I am a big guy but I always have to take food home from here. Generous portions!
author: Sam R.

description: Funny my wife thought this was a strip club when she first seen it from the outside. Chips and salsa are on point. Mushroom empanadas are on point. And the chicken burrito is on point.
author: Michael M.

description: The service was terrible. Asked five times for an additional margarita glass for the pitchers we had ordered. Five times the same waiter said, "sure, with salt?" Only to disappear and never bring a glass. It was like Groundhog Day. I could barely eat my nachos. A goopy mess. I brought a group here based on the four-star rating. Two tables of people after a film festival. Embarrassed that I did so. I will not eat here again.
author: V. T.

description: Stumbled on this place based on Yelp reviews because Italian place down the street had an 1.5 hours wait. Only had to wait about 20 minutes. Margarita was really good, and strong! Grilled chicken quesadillas were so good. The Velvet Nachos was a massive portion. Unfortunately, the queso and guacamole on it was way too spicy for either of us to eat.
author: Monica H.

description: This bar has the best margarita's in the city, friendly bartenders, and great food. You can start your night here with dinner (I recommend the tortilla soup or tacos) but it will probably be your last stop of the night.
author: John P.

description:
Last Saturday night after I performed in a hip hop dance showcase I went to eat with a group of dancers here. I like the vibe here - a small divey eating place. I had a small dinner because we were heading to a nightclub later on. I ordered three items: mushroom empanadas, crispy pork street taco, and the seasonal fruit margarita. 

I'm not a big fan of empanadas. In the past I felt crust wasn't crispy enough and the filling too heavy. However the mushroom empanadas are the best I ever had. The crust was crispy and the filing was light. The crispy pork street taco wasn't really that good as the meat was dry. Also I expected some crispy skin with the pork, but that's just me as I always expect crispy skin when I see there is crispy pork on the menu. The street taco is the reason why I didn't give a higher rating. For the seasonal fruit margarita I had the options of pineapple, mango, or watermelon; I choose the watermelon. The watermelon margarita was refreshing on that late, hot evening. Overall I had pretty good light dinner before heading to the nightclub.

Be careful of ordering too many items as this place can be too pricy for this type of setting. I recommend ordering one item and the watermelon margarita. In addition take advantage of the free chips and salsa provided and you will be fully satisfied.
author: Gerald R.

description:
THIS is where you come if you and your friends want to get (or stay) drunk! Their margarita pitchers are really good and really strong. They are $33 a pitcher, and if you split among 4 people, you'd get 1-2 cups per person.

The interior is loud, dark and divey with lots of round booth seating, and I love it because it's so unique. It feels you're in a Mexican restaurant that's been converted into a dive bar - one of those places where you think, "only in San Francisco."
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
SO apparently I missed the memo that you're supposed to come to Velvet Cantina sloshed OR down a pitcher of margarita to numb your taste buds first because where else are most of these 5 star reviews coming from?

Sorry but this place is so overrated.

Velvet Cantina is Mexican food for hipsters. Don't get me wrong, I'm not hating because good food is good food. Period. Hell, I like Mission Chinese Food and most people know that it's not legit Chinese food but at least it's somewhat well-executed. Velvet Cantina, however, couldn't even execute basic Mexican staples like rice and beans properly. It was like prison food. Well, at least how I envisioned prison food to be like if I ever got arrested for public indecency.

We started with the Chicken Tortilla Soup w/ a Sour Cream Empanada ($6.99): http://bit.ly/13isQw1. It was no bueno and tasted like chicken bouillon soup; VERY artificial, salty, and with very few shreds of chicken. The best part was the empanada and only because it was fresh out of the fryer. The Queso Macho w/ Chorizo & Guacomole ($8.49) fared better: http://bit.ly/13isVzG. How can you resist a melding of ooooey gooey cheese with delicioso mildly spicy bits of chorizo? The thick tortilla chips held up well to this sinfully good dip. If you must order something to coat your stomach from the margaritas, get this!

My entree of Chicken Mole w/ Refried Beans & Rice ($12.79) was another disappointment: http://bit.ly/15eAzPu. Although the chicken was fall-off-the-bone tender, the mole sauce was unappetizing. While mole sauce should be richly thick, Velvet Cantina's mole was grossly thick; almost pasty with a very aggressive flavor profile (too much cinnamon and coriander?). I've grown to love refried beans but these were just awful with a chunky, toothpaste-like texture. And then, there was the mushy and clumpy rice. How can you mess up rice? *Sigh*

I wasn't impressed with the chewy Carne Asada either which I took a bite off from Mr. NSS' plate. Two of my friends ordered the much raved about Chicken Avocado Enchiladas. They said it was mediocre and there was barely had any chicken or avocados in it.

IF I ever come back to Velvet Cantina, I'm bringing hot dates with me: Mr. Patron, Mr. Don Julio, Mr. Tres Agaves and Mr. Tecate! Holla!

OTHER NOTES:
*Reservations were easily made on the same day.
*2 stars for the food and 4 stars for the service.
*Seems to be a place to go for drinks and not for the food especially if you're use to legit Mexican food. 
*Upbeat and friendly service (the saving grace). Our water glasses never went below the halfway point which is always a good sign of attentive service.
*Saw zero natives dining here. Are there even any Mexican natives who even reviewed Velvet Cantina? =/
*2 very dim dining areas: a bar area with 5 tables and a back dining area with 7 booths and 2 tables.
*Difficult street parking. There's a parking garage 2 blocks away on 21st/Bartlett.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Food was ok, nothing out of the ordinary. Same with the margarita. Service was one of the worse I've had in years. They took 15+min to take our name for the wait-list, after being seated we weren't given water and no one came by to even ask for drinks for another 15min until I flagged down a server. The server wasnt able.to take our order at the same time as drinks, this took like another 10min. They didn't know how to pronounce their tequilas. Again we had to flag down a server to ask for a check. Service was abismal.
author: Diego A.

description:
One of the best spots in the Mission to have dinner. Being a Mission local, I end up here a lot. It can be very challenging to get into all of the uber trendy Foreign Cinemas, Monks Kettles, and Berettas of the world on even a Wednesday night these days. I also sometimes realize that paying $18 for a burger actually isn't normal (most of the time I'm swirling around in the SF cost of living vortex and don't realize how ridiculously overpriced things are). Then there are those times when your friend asks what's a good spot to go to dinner with 10 friends in 4 hours? This is when we come to Velvet Cantina. 

Welcome to the stress free zone. Dim lit with perfect volume music playing that is upbeat but not top 40. Red little chili lights strung everywhere with cozy big booths just waiting for you and your friends. Grab a pitcher of margaritas and wait for 10 mins for them to arrange your perfect table for even a group of 8+ and serve you which ever dish under $15 you choose. Try walking into another restaurant with 8 people and no reservation...Monks Kettle couldn't fit you, Foreign Cinema would nicely tell you there's an available reservation in 6 weeks, and you would all have so many cocktails waiting for Beretta for 2 hours that you would just skip dinner or end up at a taqueria. 

Food - the food is delicious. Although admittedly I haven't made it past two dishes I love. We always order the Chili Verde and the Avocado Chicken Enchiladas. The Chili Verde comes with 4-5 corn tortillas and rice and beans. The Chili Verde is cooked perfectly. The sauce is delicious and full of flavor and the pork is super moist and falls apart. The Avocado Chicken Enchiladas are delicious too. They also come with rice and beans. The chicken is moist and they add a green avocado sauce on top of the enchiladas that has a great flavor. Both dishes are huge enough to share with someone. Especially if you dig into their chips (best homemade chips!) and salsa. If you like heat they have a habanero salsa they can bring you but you have to ask for it. 

Drinks - delicious margaritas. They have a bunch of different flavors and you can order a pitcher or glass. They have a full bar so you can get other items if you want or top shelf tequila shots if it's that kind of a night. They have a bar area that's big enough to wait and have a drink in which is nice. No one likes standing outside.

Service - awesome service. They seat everyone really quickly and efficiently and make sure everyone is happy even if you are just waiting for a table. If you wait at the bar they'll serve you chips and salsa. I like that the servers always ask what kind of beans you want and other thoughtful questions rather than just having a standard option and leaving it up to you to ask what it is. 

Reservations - no Open Table. Call and leave a message if they aren't open and they will call you right back when they open and set up a reservation for you. They will always squeeze you in somehow, even last minute large parties.

Overall fun, delicious dinner spot!
author: Juliet S.

description:
YUM! Came here after a breakup with some girlfriends and it was THE BEST.  Pitchers on pitchers and then tequila shots magically appeared.

Oh and the food is actually good too.  I'm a huge fan of the nachos and of Alessandro. Just saying.
author: Reyana F.

description:
I came here for dinner and drinks with some girlfriends, and it was great. Their margaritas are delicious-- I loved the Velvet Margarita, and my friends really liked the house marg. Plus they give you a generous supply of chips and salsa. 

The food was really good too-- I got the shrimp enchiladas and was pleasantly surprised with how great they were. Not a bad spot for Mexican food in the Mission! And they take reservations which is really convenient since most places that I like in the Mission don't. It was also nice that they didn't rush us out on girls' night but let us linger for a while and keep chatting. Overall, a very fun place with a great atmosphere and delicious food and drinks.
author: Lee A.

description: Holy wow. I've never been before, and that now makes me really sad. So good. So deliciously good.
author: Jamie M.

description: Was here yesterday evening and it was the best place I been too in San Francisco!! I don't know where to even start!! Starting with he staff... STAFF are super outgoing, fun, funny, friendly, YET professional!!! The food... omg!!!! My 3 friends got 3 other different entrees from mine and we all shared and tasted each other's food and it was freaking great! NO LIE! I tasted black whole beans, when I though they were gonna be flavorless like any other restaurant I've gone too, and they were the best whole beans I have tasted other than mines! Lol Highly recommended!! I will go back! I keep my word!
author: Jose A.

description: This is one of my sister's favorite neighborhood restaurants.  We came here for her birthday.  The seviche was excellent. She loves the cactus enchiladas.   I had the carne asada. The pork was like card board.  My brother had the tortilla soup that looked outstanding.  The vegetable burrito was enough for two people.  The price is definitely right.
author: Robbie M.

description: The bohemian experience is meticulous delivered by Bernardo! The crew here create an ambiance as if you're visiting old friends from a far away country. The type of feeling you get after flying across the Atlantic and landing in Malaga? Hahaha I know the food is Mexican but  the touch is full Latin. I heard several different ways of speaking. Obvious Castellano from South America (Chile) up to one spoken in Spain! Talk about authenticity! Yeah, the food is delicious but really, the spot is well rounded. Let the bartender from Spain make your drinks and Bernardo cater to your needs!
author: Harsha H.

description:
I'm not sure why it's called the Velvet Cantina and frankly, I don't care.  As for the atmosphere, it was pretty dark.  I'm not sure what else was going on in there, which is also unimportant.  What to focus on at Velvet Cantina is the Food.  This is the best "regular" Mexican food I have had to date.  Some of you may think I'm crazy but, I have lived most of my life in the northeast and the southeast.  Standard Mexican places are all the same with no creativity.  Let me clarify "regular" as well.  I have had high end Mexican dishes i.e. Dos Caminos in NYC, and it was great, but I am referring to more of your every day places.... am I making any sense at this point?

I would consider Velvet Cantina an everyday type of restaurant.  It's not for a special occasion or insanely expensive.  It's the type of place to stop in to for dinner because your craving Mexican food and in the neighborhood.  They aren't trying to be something they're not and they're not trying to reinvent the wheel with crazy ingredients or dishes you've never heard of.

Our group started off with the chips and salsa and an order Guacamole (Haas avocado, red onion, lime, cilantro, jalapeño).  Im not a huge Guac fan but, this avacado creation kept me digging into the bottom of the bowl.  For my entree, I was torn.  I wanted to try everything on the menu.  I went with the Chicken Avocado Enchiladas (Shredded chicken, slices of avocado, jalapeño cream sauce, pepper jack cheese, cilantro pesto, rice and choice of beans).  Every time I thought about getting something else, I kept looking back at that " jalapeño cream sauce" and knew that needed to be a component of my dinner. 

One of the best decisions of my night.  The enchiladas were exploding with flavor.  I would easily consider drinking that cream sauce too.  Even the rice and beans were over the top.  I really enjoyed the grated Parmesan on the black beans.  The cheese was a nice flavor addition.  Throughout the course of our meal, we went through a couple pitchers of The Perfect Margarita made with Herradura Tequila (a favorite of mine) and I must admit.  It was perfect.
author: Scotty C.

description: The velvet cantina is perfectly located in the mission for the vibe it has going on with a quirky spin to it. I only stopped in for a pitcher of margs with friends, so I can't speak to the quality of the food there, but the margs were good, they didn't wow me, but they definitely were good and got the job done. My only critique is that the staff was a little bit pushy about us leaving right after we finished our margs, and it wasn't very busy as it was a Wednesday night. Other than that though, the atmosphere was great and the margs were good, and I would go back.
author: Emily D.

description: Great food, place and workers!! Had a wonderful time  the entrees are big enough for two people and the margaritas are pricey but really strong. Will definitely come back in the future.
author: Daniela N.

description:
I love love love Velvet Cantina. Their chile verde is very close to my mom's, which is great when I'm feeling a little homesick and their spicy queso satisfies the tex-Mex craving you can't usually find in California. Their tortilla soup is also great and spicy and is served in a huge bowl for sharing or as your meal. 

Margs here are definitely on the stronger side, so when I'm here during the week I can usually only drink one. But maybe that just means I'm a lightweight - try one and you can decide! 

We live only a couple blocks away so we visit often and are never disappointed with the food or service. Plus they're open late which is always a win in sleepy SF.
author: Aida Z.

description:
I wish the evening had been more velvety smooth last night. Social issues aside, Velvet Cantina was just aight. Nothing really special, overpriced, and the chips that people rave about are not as great as I thought they would be. 

It was my girl Katie G's birthday on Thursday, 10/23, so a bunch of us got together for some celebrating. Unforunately, she's good friends with my ex, who chose to make things awkward by berating and flipping me off behind our friend's back who sat between us. Boys...

I nibbled on chips and tried to make light of the weirdness that had just occurred, sipping on my salty margarita, attempting to joke around with the rest of the people at the table. Note to self: in these types of situations, it may be better to just not go if your ex is going to be involved.

I had lost my appetite, but figured it would be bad form to just guzzle margaritas all night, so I ordered an appetizer for my meal and my friend George H shared his rice and beans. I got the Cornbread Sopas with Chicken and they were *eentsy weentsy*. Like seriously smaller than the palm of my hand. Now, I know in the nutritious school of thought, the palm of your hand is supposed to measure one portion. But for nearly $11? That was way too small. If I DO go back, I'll definitely get something more substantial, mostly for the principal of taking it home and being able to eat it in peace. 

The decor is cute, the bar area looked lively, the location is convenient for me and people riding MUNI / Bart, not sure about parking but I can only imagine it's a b*tch. Oh, and there I go talking about my ex!
author: Crystal C.

description:
So this rating would have been a 4-star had we decided to skip on the food. But since we did have dinner and I had a carnitas plate, I can't shell out that 4. This place is great fun if you're out to paint the town red and yes, for the margaritas. GREAT margs. They're strong and the flavor is class. I just went for the house and passed the other specialties. 

The service was solid. We made a reservations just a couple of hour prior and they held a table for us. It's quite loud and you'll have to stretch your neck to hear your friends a little, but still nice vibe and set up. 

I enjoyed the chips and salsa, but I didn't enjoy the carnitas. The thing is, it's so hard to justify spending $13 to $18 on a plate for mediocre food when you know you can step outside and find mind-blowing Mexican for a lot less money. I get it, we're paying for an entirely difference experience. But I just couldn't get with my meal. The carnitas were boring and so was everything else on the plate. 

I also was too focused on my delicious margaritas. I couldn't enjoy both of them together. 

I'd absolutely come to Velvet Cantina again for drinks, but I'd eat somewhere else before I head over there.
author: Priti K.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night after work with some friends and the place was packed! Good thing we made reservations.
