The table was set up with waters already (great, but not great with the drought...yeah I'm THAT person haha) and chips/salsa. Woo hoo! The service is impeccable here. Everyone wants to take care of you and you can feel that. I got the ensalada de pollo and it was really good! The portion size was perfect. Others at the table got tacos, enchiladas, etc. we had guac for the table, as well as the queso dip. Someone said they wished their food was spicy and I agree with that. 

Personally loved the dark, bustling atmosphere. Only knocked it a point because I've definitely had better Mexican food, but the service and laid back attitude of everyone makes up for it!
author: Louise Z.

description: Another mexican place in the mission, but this place is great! It's a little dark inside, but the decor is colorful and the music is lively. They're well known for their margaritas, and they change up the fresh fruit flavors for their margaritas and agua frescas daily. I had the raspberry margarita and it was delicious! They don't skimp on the tequila, but it's not overwhelming either. The salsa that comes with the chips and salsa tastes really fresh also. I also at the tacos valentina (chicken tacos), and they were amazing and really flavorful with a huge portion of fresh guac (not that watery pre-made stuff). They also double up the corn tortillas so that the filling doesn't come out in a leaky mess. The portion size are pretty big here, and we were not disappointed. I even had leftovers to take home.
author: Trena M.

description:
I'm giving this place 4 stars despite the bizarre ending to my meal.

I met my cousin here for dinner about a week ago and we were having a great time. Excellent tortilla chips and guac, and a waiter who was patient and didn't pressure us to order. He was helpful in helping me decide what to get (my cousin was a repeat eater, I was a first-timer) and I ended up going with the carnitas.

They were delicious. The pork was juicy and full of flavor, and I skipped the rice and went with two sides of beans. Everything was wonderful, including the cabbage slaw places on the side of the plate. But from all the chips and guac, I couldn't eat more than half the plate. I ask for it to be wrapped up to go and the waiter obliged.

However, I could see him packing it up. He got a to-go box and set it down. Next to my plate was my cousin's plate (with nothing taken to go). He scooped something off of my plate, onto my cousin's, and then the rest of my plate went into the to-go box and my cousin's plate vanished into the kitchen with the bus boy.

I thought, "Hmm....what just happened?" When the waiter came over, I asked, "I was watching you prepare this. What did you scoop off and not include in my box?" He said, "Oh, that was the cabbage slaw. A lot of people don't like that so I thought you wouldn't want it."

Huh? I am not aware of a waiter ever making a decision on my to-go box without my direction. I'll sometimes say, "I only want this or that," but my entire plate is always in my to-go box otherwise. I found this waiter's behavior very bizarre. He did, to his credit, go get some more cabbage slaw (which I did like and want) and put it in my box.

Outside of this weird ending, everything else was great. Food is my number one priority and it was excellent.
author: David B.

description: Small, cute, dark and yummy food. Nice neighborhood place that seems to never to be too busy. Try chicken mole, chile and enchilada. Speciality drinks
author: Donna M.

description:
1 Case of Nacho Envy + 1 Walk to Velvet Cantina + 

0 Velvet + 1 Kooky, Colorful Mural + 2 Uncomfortable Seats + 1 Dancing Bartender + 40 Brands of Tequila + 1 Sweet Raspberry Agua Fresca + 1 Bland Pineapple One + ($3 x 2) + 

1 Basket of Delicious Housemade Crunchy Tortilla Chips + 1 Cup of Fresh Mild Salsa + 

(1 Bright Yellow Platter Covered with Chips + Addictive Chile Con Queso + Sour Cream Swirls + Black Beans + Fresh Guac with Cilantro + $10.49 = The Best Nachos in the Mission*) +

(Spicy Shredded Chicken + Avocado Slices + 2 Tortillas + Melted Pepper Jack Cheese +  Jalapeño Cream and Cilantro Pesto Zigzag + Pinto Beans + Rice + Pickled Red Cabbage + $12.99 = "Good but Would Rather Have More Nachos" Enchiladas) =

NACHO CRAVING CRUSHED

More nachos:  http://xkcd.com/140/
author: Amy C.

description:
Fantastic place! The people that work here are super cool as well. When we were there the other day, they had the tunes of Santana, Guns N Roses playing...it was great. We're big TacoLicious fans, so we wanted to give Velvet Cantina a shot. Well, we will come back again!

Panko crusted crispy white fish alapeno pineapple slaw, mexican tartar sauce taco was my favorite. I had 4 of these. 

My buddy ordered 3 of the crispy pork cilantro chimichurri, tomato tomatillo salsa tacos--that was the winner for him.

My wife loves the mildly spicy Valentina chicken pico de gallo, guacamole and chile pequin cream.

It's a full bar, and you can order just about anything except for iced tea. We all had the Paloma--their most popular drink. It's awesome.
author: Al G.

description:
I used to have a good friend who lived near the Velvet Cantina and would go there when visiting him.  This was in 2009/2010 and hadn't been back since this past weekend.

My girlfriend and I were in town for the weekend and we stopped in on Saturday night.  Got seated fairly quickly and everything was perfect as always.  Chips and salsa are fresh and delicious, awesome margaritas, and great food.  

My girlfriend doesn't like spicy food and she asked a head of time how spicy her enchiladas were.  The waiter said nothing was too overpowering or spicy with the exception of the shrimp diablo.  She ordered the Verde enchiladas and they were a little too spicy for her.  The waiter noticed she hadn't touched her food and offered to replace it.  She said it was OK and just asked for some warm tortillas to make tacos with her beans and rice.  He was very helpful and brought them by.  When we got our bill he had removed her meal from the receipt since she didn't like it.  

Always nice to see an employee going above and beyond, especially when the restaurant was busy and he didn't have to do so.
author: Josh P.

description:
After seeing Velvet Cantina reppin' SF on Thrillist's "21 Best Nachos in America List," I HAD to see what these mysterious Velvet Nachos were all about. With so many great taquerias in the area, I was curious to see what could possibly make these so amazing.

There's only so much you can do with nachos, but Velvet Cantina really does make it an art. A big part of it has to do with their amazing house-made chips. They're thick, perfectly salted, and stay crispy for an unusually long time even after being drenched in the perfect amount of luscious chile con queso, creamy sour cream, and chunky guacamole. The spicy chorizo added great flavor and is definitely an add-on must.  I like how the toppings are evenly distributed and heavily drizzled on top instead of being unevenly slopped all over the place. All the chips had a generous and even amount of toppings, which led to a continuous stream of satisfying bites. At $14 they're a bit pricey, but completely worth it. I almost didn't get the nachos because I was already satisfied with my basket of free chips, but don't settle! Take the plunge!!! Are they the best nachos I've ever had? Probably. Nachos aren't really a common order for me, but these were pretty darn good and I can't think of another place where I've had better. 

I also tried the Chicken Enchilada plate, which came with two enchiladas and generous scoops of rice, black beans, and pickled cabbage. The enchiladas were kind of small, but the cilantro pesto on top made up for it. Not the most flavorful or memorable dish, but it was still good. The food wasn't at all greasy and with the nachos, was a perfect amount to share between two people. Washed it all down with a raspberry margarita and I was a happy camper. 

Velvet Cantina is either a great happy hour spot or a casual sit-down Mexican type of joint, not a grab n' go burrito spot. The servers are super chill and you'll occasionally catch them rocking out to the music, which by the way, was a great mix of jukebox classics, 90's hits, and current radio favorites. Of course, I highly recommend the Velvet Nachos! My one regret is that I didn't have room for dessert. I guess I'll just have to get those S'more Nachos next time...
author: Deanna Y.

description: This place sucks!!! Bartender was rude, chips tasted like they were 25 days old... my husband and I are in the bar business, we tip fat and from the moment we walked in we felt unwelcomed. F this place!!!!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Absolutely delicious Mexican food with great tasting, very strong margaritas. We started with a chorizo & guacamole queso, it was great! I had the enchiladas for dinner which were fabulous. We also had a pitcher of margarita and could barely walk out of the place. Highly recommend!
author: Mike J.

description: I like the vibe of this place but our fresh fruit margaritas (mango) were extremely salty and didn't taste like much other than tequila.
author: Katie P.

description:
Definitely a great spot in the Mission for margs and cheap grub set in a hip setting. Oh and how could anyone forget that queso!?

I came here with friends on a Sat night and this spot was bumping! Definitely a spot you go out with friends than take your parents, it's rather dark and loud. Without reservations, we grabbed a few seats at the bar and ordered a few pitchers of margs and some of that delicious queso while we waited for a table. Cut to an hour later, a little drunk, filled up on complimentary chips and salsa, we head to our table.

More margs please, we order up some enchiladas and tacos. Poor Mike, my friend's steak tacos were real bad, meanwhile everyone else ate up their most delicious enchiladas like nobody's business. What happened? The steak was inedible. Surprising, since my chicken and avocado enchildas were perfect. Not super authentic, but really good. The server removed the uneaten tacos from the bill, no questions asked and everyone went back to being happy.

Pretty damn cheap for a night out in San Francisco with drinks and all. 

Pro-tip: Don't go for the canteloupe margarita, it does grow on ya, but just not that good. 
Pro-tip II: Don't pay for the more premium margs, the regular is just as good, if not better.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I'm officially obsessed. Fresh, full, sweet margs with real fresh raspberries? Check. Guacamole and ceviche that is delightful and citrusy? Check. And the best damn fish tacos I've ever had? Check! 

There really isn't anything to not like about this place. Every time I visit San Francisco, Velvet Cantina is a priority on my to-eat list. And with all of the delicious, incredible eateries around the city, this is a hard spot to get. Aside from the delectable food, the service is phenomenal. Our waiter was pleasant and was majorly attentive, leaving no glass empty and no one unsatisfied. On top of it all, the ambiance seals the deal. It's dark, spotless and mysterious inside. There's nothing too fancy or intimidating about this place, but it retains a very authentic appealing hip sort of charm.

Great for a date night or a dinner with friends. If you're wondering what to order: FISH TACOS. Like I said, the best I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and get them. If only I lived in San Fran...
author: Helina G.

description: Get a pitcher of the margarita, you won't regret it! Velvet nachos are a must, and the fish tacos were delicious. We were asked to switch tables to accommodate a larger table that came in after us, and the bartender gave us free shots of tequila for the trouble! Cheers!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
Solid food, excellent drinks, awesome service and reasonable prices, can't be beat.
Amazingly yummy fresh fruit margaritas (pineapple is the bomb), really crispy chips with salsa (a little on the sweet side for my tastes), great carne asada tacos and my friend had carintas which looked really good, the entire menu looked awesome and at 8-12 an entree for large portions, even better. We sat the the bar, the bartender was awesome offering samples of Rita's, shots and new drinks (smoky Jalepano anyone?) Service was attentive but not pushy. Seems like a local whole in the wall, which I love, will definitely come back next time I visit! If you are local, go!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Fantastic food, friendly staff but they do need a few more people serving tables. Our waiter was great but stretched too thin.
author: Chris P.

description: The ambiance is cool and the lighting is sophisticated and lounge like but I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be. It's not a bad spot by any means but it just wasn't what I thought it would be.
author: Brittini S.

description: My one mistake was coming here on Cinco de Mayo. The wait was an hour and our solution was pitchers of Margaritas.... The food (or what I remember of it) was delicious, especially the vegetarian options. Mushroom empanadas and the enchiladas are to die for. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Shruti S.

description:
This review is really just for one thing; their Velvet Nachos.

Definitely the BEST nachos in the mission, perhaps the city. 

The nachos are not only topped generously with your typical toppings (meats, guac, avocados, etc), but with their cheesy house sauce which is simply delectable. The quality of their chips is also amazing. These are the kind of chips you'll see old ladies making from scratch in their kitchens, not the generic kind you'll see at almost any "Mexican" restaurant. 

I've had their other menu items before, which are alright, but nothing beats their nachos!
author: Andrew E.

description: Great restaurant! Their service was very friendly and food was delicious. Strong margaritas so no complaints there. Good location in the mission only a couple blocks from Bart and also close to Valencia street bars. My go to Mexican restaurant in the city for sure!
author: Sarah R.

description: This place is alright. I would say the food is 2 stars and the margaritas are a 4 to 5. Which leads me at a 3 star review. I had the chicken avocado enchiladas, and they were lacking flavor. They came with rice and beans and they were also just so-so. And at $14, that left me pretty bummed. The margaritas were really good though. Stop for drinks and then keep it moving. There are a lot better options in the Mission for Mexican food.
author: Liz M.

description: Excellent dining experience. We were early on a Sat night, around 6p, and were seated right away. Service was super friendly but not in your face friendly and efficient. The food was fabulous. Fish tacos was delicious and came with rice and beans - nice serving size leaving you feeling satisfied. Everything tasted fresh. Prices are fair and reasonable somewhere around $12-$15. It's popular, a great neighborhood go-to spot for good grub, nice vibe and a good time. Noise level is not bad too- we could talk and easily hear each other even with it full of people.
author: Helen Y.

description:
_Food: my boyfriend and I fell in love with the chicken avocado enchiladas! Everything was very flavorful, and enjoyable with a very very light "kick". 

_Restaurant: clean, dark, loud, and it's more of a red lighting.

_Staff: everyone was click, fast, and polite. 

Will return, duh (that burrito was calling my name).
author: Herald A.

description:
Yelp had me pretty excited for this place, but the Tex-Mex fare was average for the price and the environment was totally dead (we did come on a Wednesday night, but still, it's SF). My friend ordered the famed chicken-avocado enchiladas and I opted for the naked relleno. Don't get me wrong, food was decent, but I've had just as good food at other Tex-Mex restaurants both in and out of SF. 

When I think Mexican restaurant, I want either small and simple taqueria (i.e. El Farolito) or well-lit, bustling All-American fiesta (i.e. Chevy's). I was expecting my Velvet Cantina experience to match the latter but with much better food. Unfortunately, neither the enchiladas nor the relleno blew my mind. The ambience was also too dark and red. I honestly think I would have left as a happier patron with a better opinion of the food if I had at least enjoyed the environment!

Main takeaway: Errrr - the salsa is good. Their other famous dishes are tasty, but nothing out of this world. If I ever come back again, it will be on a Friday or Saturday for sure and I will have to try the velvet nachos as well as a margherita.
author: Arushi S.

description:
Surprised this place only has 4 stars!  Came here last night with a party of 8; it was easy to get reservations (a couple days before).  The bar area is pretty loud, but we were seated in the side room and that was perfect.  The enchiladas were amazing!  Recommended by our waiter, and we loved it!  Got to try all three of them.

Drinks were good too!
author: Cal C.

description:
5 stars for service
4 stars for food

My twin sister and I celebrated our birthday here last night with a rowdy group of 13. I called at noon and was able to secure a reservation for 10 for 8:00pm on the same day with no problems. They were extremely accommodating when we had some stragglers join the dinner. The service was 100% on point! Thank you so much to the wait staff for making sure we had an epic birthday party! We ended up only ordering appetizers and margaritas, as mostly everyone was there to drink. The chicken sopes were my favorite! We ordered 2 pitchers each of the fresh pineapple margaritas and fresh mango! So delicious! We capped our dinner off with the s'mores nachos, sooooooo good! And habañero shots, so spicy but a great way to end your meal! Bill was $350 for 13 people, pretty reasonable considering the amount of drinks we polished off! Thanks again Velvet Cantina! My sister and I had a great birthday!
author: Jessica A.

description:
Pitchers of margaritas for $27? Best non-happy hour deal i could find in the mission. Paired with the creamy, chunky fresh guacamole and free chips& salsa and you and your homies can get your drink on without a fat wad. 
Make a reservation if you want a table, drink and spread is my motto.
Friendly and good looking waiters, bartenders. Dark like a mexican bordello inside, pretty funky.
Did not try other menu items.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Came here the other night with three friends. We made a reservation on a Monday night for 7:30, which we probably didn't need. I had originally made the reservation for 3, and they put us at a table that could literally only fit 3, but when I asked to be moved to a different table because we had one more, they were fine with it. 

Ambiance: I do have to say, I understand what others were saying about the noise level. It was probably only about 2/3 full while we were there, and I had a hard time hearing the people at my table. That was definitely kind of a bummer. It was also very dark, which I guess is hip and all, but it was almost hard to see what we were eating.

Food: The food was pretty good. The portions were huge. I'm a decent eater, and I could only make it through half my food-- which is fine, because it meant I had lunch for the next day. I got the chilaquiles which were great. One of my friends got a burrito with cactus in it, and that didn't appeal to any of it when we tried it. We got a pitcher of margaritas which were very strong. They were good, but don't plan on driving afterwards! If you're doing margaritas with a group though, the pitcher is a way better deal.

Service: We loved that they kept re-filling the chip bowl before it was ever empty-- made us keep eating more! While they were on that, we did have to ask for re-fills of water and flag our waiter down to get the check.
author: Jess B.

description:
Extra-crispy chips are fantastic.  Margarita pitcher is a great value.

Achiote Steak tacos were delish - even if I did have to pick off the cilantro (could you warn us on the menu?  Those for whom cilantro tastes like soapy feet would appreciate that).

Very dark room gave the place a bit of an early-twentieth-century-bordello-slash-speakeasy feel.  Solid service.  Came here on a Sunday night with a group of 9 and were seated almost immediately.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Must get the pitcher of house margaritas! Such a deal! 

This place is a legit mexican restaurant, the Chorizo nachos are out of this world, the tacos 

Plus a huge shout out to the Bartender, Darius, who was super friendly and fun as soon as we walked in the joint!  Announced it was our gf's birthday (hence the girls night out and margaritas) and he immediately offered up a birthday shot to her.

Everyone in this place was seemingly having a stellar time and there was no shortage of drinks, food or friendly staff!  I would definitely recommend for dinner or late night drinks!
author: Alexandra P.

description: We stopped in for margaritas and now I see why everyone raves about their drinks. The pitcher of margaritas we ordered, while a bit pricey, was approximately 80% liquor and only 20% mixer. Splitting one between two people made for a very fun Cinco de Mayo. The place is small and cramped when there is a crowd, but definitely worth it for the delicious drinks!
author: Lauren H.

description: One of my favorite places in the Mission to get really good margaritas and Mexican food - the chilaquiles are my favorite and they'll make them with steak instead of chicken if you ask. I also really dig the dark, moody red interior and the fact it feels like an under the radar neighborhood gem.
author: Doug V.

description: Such a cozy little spot with an amazing Friday night vibe. The bartenders and barracks are a well oiled and fun machine. Super friendly folks, fabulous food and delicious margaritas. I really always have good time leave full and content. All the staff are extremely polite cool cats.
author: Brayden R.

description:
YUM.

I love this place. Parking is kind of a hassle, but if you're lucky enough to find a spot, check this place out. 24th Street and Mission BART station is just a block over, too, if public transpo is more your thing.

The chicken avocado enchiladas are SO GOOD. The salsa is fresh and the chips are just salted enough and super crunchy. The margs are awesome, too. I would definitely recommend coming here. Especially if you've got a night of drinking in The Mission ahead of you. :P
author: Melissa S.

description:
Original 5/27

Here twice. First time they "accidentally" charged me $16 extra tip to my card, and didn't reverse it until I called them out on it a few days later. Promised to make it right (which they eventually did) and comp me drinks & appetizers.

Showed up to redeem those, they comp'd a pitcher of Margarita, but not any of the three appetizers. Lady said I shouldn't push it and missed my chance when they told me about comping the pitcher, but I assumed since they said "drinks and apps" I would assume "drinks and apps". That was not the case, so I left afterwards, disgusted they baited me back in and still charging me for the apps. 

Did not recommend to friends who asked, and indeed recommended against. Extra star is for their empanadas, which were good (and the only reason i went back).

UPDATE 6/19 Blocked by the business. 

This is their message:

First I apologize you left feeling that way. Unfortunately we can't see when someone is overcharge until they claim it. I apologize for the overcharge (16$). There was a mistake and we are working very hard to avoid it to happen. Again, I'm sorry about that. The owner talked to you personally and then asked me to comp 30$ off of your bill. I thought it would be nice to comp the whole pitcher (39$ after taxes). I personally told the server to make sure you weren't missing anything and leave happy. It breaks my heart to read what you wrote about us and I would love to make it up. I understand your frustration for a possible misunderstanding. All I can say is I am sorry you feel that way and believe me it hurts seeing a customer leaving that way and writing bad about us. We will keep working very hard to make people happy. Hope you have a great weekend. If I don't see you again I wish you the best luck. Take care.


This is my response, which they blocked me and thus I could not reply.

That wasn't made clear. When I initially called, I was told a couple rounds of drinks and some appetizers. When I showed up, I got the pitcher, but not the appetizers comped. If that was made clear, I wouldn't have eaten. The first one was accidental, but the second one was intentional - and the fact you did not notify me of such means I am out. The empenadas are good, but this lack of respect and treating the guests poorly on two occasions isn't something I want to share with others.
author: Daniel W.

description: Nice selection of tequila. Ample portion size and very tasty! Great attentive service and nice dark atmosphere.  The chili pepper lights are a nice touch!
author: Dustin K.

description:
Let me just start off by saying that the tortilla chips I had here were some of the best i've had in my life! They were melt in your mouth amazing. 

We got queso for the table and it was really super super good too. I actually have no complaints about this restaurant. We came on a Saturday evening, without a reservation around 8:30. The host told us it would be an hour, but that it would probably be sooner since people were dropping off the list because of the hour. We were fine with it, squatted at the bar and started throwing back some margs. The margs were good too. I liked the original best, but my friend got the fresh fruit flavors and he loved them as well.

We both got enchiladas. The chicken avocado enchiladas were sooo good. We also ordered another kind of enchiladas that I can't remember the name of right now but they were delicious as well. I think something with pork.

I would definitely come back next time I am in the area! Still thinking about those chips...
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Came here a couple weeks ago for one of my friends birthdays and I loved it! I would definitely say it was extremely crowded but once I got my margarita in my hand that did not matter anymore ;)

I ordered the shrimp enchiladas and holy DELISH. SO GOOD. spicy but, I love me some spice! Tried a few bites of other dishes and was in love. Overall, my tummy was satisfied. 

I felt like I was at a music festival and a bomb.com food festival all rolled into one. With the loud DJ and awesome food. 

Definitely coming back to experience it again!
author: Chelsey S.

description:
Huge props to them for seating a group of 8 (big for that place) without a reservation on a Friday night a couple weeks ago. 

In the chaos of a busy night and a big group, it was difficult to get the staff's attention, but once we did they were prompt and accommodating. 

My experience was closer to three stars but for quickly seating our large group I've given the benefit of the doubt. I'll try again on a quieter night with a smaller party (and more choice about the menu than a group can reasonably be).
author: Krista L.

description: I came here to celebrate my cousins birthday on a Thursday night, and well we didn't waste no time to look at the drink menu lol. This place is like an upscale tacquiera joint. We ordered the fresh fruit margarita (mango and pineapple) and let me tell it..... 1 pitcher for 5 people had us pretty buzzed! I Definitely recommend their margaritas. I ordered the shrimp deablo, pretty mediocre. Not enough shrimp, and loaded with onions and tomato sauce which gave me heart burn by the of the night.  Although I wasn't thrilled with my entree, I am willing to give them another chance. Maybe I'll stick to what I know best.... carne asada tacos.  This place is good for groups. I'd recommend reserving a table, this place can get pretty crowded.
author: J N.

description:
I love the velvet cantina. It's a divey old 70's looking bar/restaurant. A good place to go for yummy Mexican food and strong margaritas. Casual and laid back with good music playing. The vibe is upbeat and fun and definitely a bit "hipster-ish". 

My experience with the service has always been good. I had no complaints there. Given all the great taquerias around, prices are a bit higher than the norm in the area. This should be expected though, since it is a sit down restaurant and full service bar, not just a quick stop taqueria.
author: Angela I.

description: Cozy little place with great food, exceptional margaritas and friendly staff. The nachos and salsa served for the table were particularly awesome. I am definitely coming back
author: Vinay Kumar V.

description: Stopped by last night after work for a drink. The staff is great. They've always been great. It had been a while since we've stopped by, but all the guys were great. Alex the bartender is my favorite!
author: Justin P.

description: Went on Saturday, two days before Halloween. It was not as packed as I thought it would be. I would describe this place a dive bar- you can eat, and drink. It's a great place to get a buzz and catch up with friends (given it's not too loud).
author: Arianne D.

description: Came here on a Sunday night for dinner around 7:30. The area near the bar was packed but luckily there were a couple tables available (it's all open seating). The music and margaritas were on-point but the food was not that great. I had the avocado and cactus enchiladas and wish they had more cheese and jalapeno cream sauce on top because the vegetable enchilada filling was lacking in flavor and spice. Probably won't be back here for food again but maybe for drinks when I'm in the Mission.
author: Nikitha R.

description: poor man's Keanu bartender was kind of a juice bag and turned us away at 12:55 on a Saturday night when it closes at 2 AM and I called and spoke to the guy to confirm 10 minutes prior
author: Jingo Django J.

description:
Velvet Cantina is one of my favorites! This place is perfect to grab dinner & drinks with friends before a night out. It's lively and loud, and a deceivingly spacious. Every time I've gone, the wait is usually about 30-45 minutes without reservations (less with). 

Their margaritas are hands-down the best I've ever had. They taste fresh and strong AND can be ordered by the pitcher, as margs should always be! It's not like the usual hangover-inducing, sweet-n-sour sugary mix you get at most places. 

Food is delicious as well! Queso is okay (I'm picky because I love my Tex-Mex), but the guacamole is good. Pro-tip: add a little bit of lime and salt to the guacamole and it's perfect. I usually get the veggie burrito here and split it because it's pretty massive. For dessert, try the s'more nachos. Yeah, they exist.
author: Mitalee M.

description:
As a native Texan searching for a go-to Mexican restaurant after moving here, I would say that Velvet Cantina has good food and drinks but the queso is just wrong.  Way too thin/liquidy, not enough of a creamy cheesy taste. Should have listened to other yelper Amy L... this is definitely NOT like what you get in Texas, and the other people raving about the queso here obviously haven't tried Texas queso.   My Queso Quest in SF continues. 

Service was kind of slow and inattentive.

That being said, the food and drinks were good, convenient location for me, so I could come back and just order a different appetizer.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Visited san fran for the first time recently with my husband. we had the best weekend ever -
stayed in union square and visited all the amazing neighborhoods in San fran! If you're going to venture in the mission district you must stop at the velvet cantina for some delicious food, margaritas & awesome cozy ambiance !!! great place :)
author: Alyssa F.

description:
Thier margaritas are sweet and yummy!  I don't remember which one I ordered, but maybe thats just how awesomely strong they are :P JK! 

I shared a chicken burrito and I thought it was kind of dry and it was ok.  I rather go to a taco truck where it's a fraction of the price.  

The place it really packed on the bar side and I was lucky to get a seat! It's dark but I guess most bars are hehe.  I got lucky finding parking around the corner after circling for about 10 minutes maybe.
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
"This is Beauuutiful". "What is that? Velvet?".    
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w-eb61BLIWw&feature=youtube_gdata_player

Actually that was a lion.  In my case Velvet is a Cantina.  Coming here with my friend who just got out of AA, who is afraid of anything with the word Bar, Pub, Saloon or Cantina,  It took a little convincing that we can actually go to a Cantina and just order food, believe it or not.

I never would have noticed Velvet Cantina in this part of the Mission.  I've passed by this area on many occasions and I only would notice the Walgreens and produce store.  Walking in, there is a nice level of music and intimate atmosphere.  A great place to come with friends and chop it up.

The menu was a list of usual  Mexican food.  However,   I thought it was weird the menu didn't have beef enchiladas.  Here is what I ordered:

First off, the salsa with chips at Velvet is great.  I could eat the chips and salsa all day.

Chicken & Avocado enchiladas:  

I came hungry, so I asked for an extra enchilada.  The food was good, nice sized portion of food.

My server was friendly, and cool.  My friend complained that the salsa was too mild so he brought out some habanero extract.   Hell has no fury as this habanero.  I dare you to eat about a spoon full.  I'll give you $50 just to see your facial expression change as your eyes well up and tears begin to roll down your cheeks.. (Really is there anything more hilarious than seeing your friends in agony from hot food?)

So what is Velvet?  It's a Cantina that serves pretty good food, friendly service, and believe it or not,(I know..what's the fun in this?)  food without having to order alcohol.
author: Michael L.

description:
From the outside it looks like an abandoned brothel or sex shop with the words "Alluring Edibles" written in gold letters outside but once you make it through those gold doors you are greeted with a delightful mission style cantina. There are two rooms that will fill up rather quickly as the place is incredibly popular and for good reason. The main bar is located in the doors on the left and there are a few booth seats and bar seats as well. 

You can come for just drinks or grab a seat with friends and enjoy the fantastic Mexican food. This is part of the reason why you come to the mission area because of the great food and this place holds its own. Choose from the regular staples like nachos, quesadillas, and tacos or branch our and try their ceviche, smores nachos or sopapilla dishes. The food is all excellent if you are in the mood for Mexican and they are open late and night so you can stop by here after one of your earlier bar hopping adventures. The kitchen is open pretty late so feel free to stop by when you get that craving. 

As with any bar a place is only as good as its drinks and luckily if you are in the mood for tequila you are in luck. They have several margarita options which are actually pretty cheap. They kind of skimp on the size of them though as they are not in traditional margarita glasses so you might need to do 3 of 4 of them to do justice. They have the traditional as well as rotating seasonal fresh fruit margaritas like pineapple and mango which are also delicious. There are several infused tequilas and specialty cocktails which also much be tried at least once. 

If you are looking for tasty Mexican food and a chill theme then velvet cantina is a great fit. It is not too hyped so you don't have to worry about major crowds except on the weekends and the drinks are good enough to keep you coming back. Who hasn't wanted to have a dinner with friends in a place that feels like someone has had sex on every surface?
author: Nick R.

description:
I've walked by this place so many times, but finally went in this past weekend. I love the retro Western vibe. The marquee sign is so great. Velvet Cantina has great strawberry margaritas that you can get by the pitcher. They are great for a group. You can also get pineapple margaritas, but the fresh strawberry was the best. 

Food was good, I had grilled chicken on a salad with a yummy cilantro dressing. My friend had street tacos. I liked that the tacos had two tortillas with cheese in between so that it was cross between a quesadilla and a taco. We finished up with the smores nachos. They were so unique! Mini marshmallows are piled on top of cinnamon and sugar chips and lit on fire. Yum!

Overall, the place was fun. They handled our large group really well. It was a fun time, not sure that I'd go out of my way to come back, but I'm glad that I got to try it!
author: Kari G.

description: Unfortunately I can't so much good about this place tonight. My friends dish was okay but mine was terrible. They only had one desert and it was terrible. There was no fresh air in the place. The music was just deep bass which would've been fine if we were going to a rave we were eating dinner. So people had to start shouting to hear each other and there was no sound proofing in the room so it got extremely loud. I guess there was some atmosphere in the place in terms of furniture and lighting but that's the only good thing I can say about it
author: John W.

description:
Delicious food and drinks in an intimate atmosphere of one of the few sit down Mexican restaurants in the Mission. 4.5 stars

Service: 3 Food: 4 Atmosphere: 3
Cost to worth it rating: 4
Return worthiness: yes!
Eve award: best queso outside of Texas

Highlights:
- Queso: French onion soup type bowl filled with cheesy goodness. Smooth texture with a subtle coffee undertone and a little spice that kicks in after the first bite. I've spent a good amount of time in Austin where I fell in love with queso, and this was the only one I've ever found that was on par.
- Fresh fruit margaritas: I'm not the biggest tequila fan, but I loved my mango margarita. On the rocks with just the right amount of sweetness. They were like Lays: I couldn't have just one.
- Chips and salsa: chips were fresh and had a great thick and crispy texture. Salsa was refreshing filled with ripe tomatoes.
- Chicken enchiladas: liked that slices of avocado were inside the enchiladas. Chicken was well seasoned with a bit of spice. Was expecting the jalapeño cream as a sauce on top of the enchilada vs a little inside. That would've probablt become overkill but I could've used a little more of it as that flavor combination sounded magnificent. 
- Music: not your typical Mexicsn tunes which was a welcome departure 

Lowlights:
- Single bathroom: not a problem when it wasn't crowded but more so when it got later.

Loved their queso and fruit margaritas, so I'll definitely be back for those. Hopefully soon.
author: Eve K.

description:
Great restaurant, we were in town for Mothers day, and we were not sure were to go. and Family member made reservations for the family, what a fabulous place, 
The food was so delicious and the service with outstanding. Thank you so much for allowing us to have our dinner their, It was a huge party and they were so accommodating, Next time I'm in town I will make sure I stop by for some Chicken Avocado enchiladas ...
author: Olivia B.

description: We had a surprise birthday party here last night and the venue could not have been better.  The staff catered to everyone's needs, our table was ready on time, the food was yummy, prices fair and the tequila selections (which was the important part for this particular party) top notch. We were loud, more people kept showing up late and wanting to order food, and the staff just rolled with it, super patient and lovely.  It also looked like a nice mellow place to go for a drink or dinner, provided there isn't a screaming party of 12.
author: Sandi K.

description: Awesome delicious restaurant that has been a fixture in the neighborhood for many years. Nothing beats a pitcher of margaritas and an order of quesadillas from Velvet Cantina. And if that wasn't enough, they also very generous support of local public schools by giving a portion of their sales some Mondays to local schools like Buena Vista Horace Mann Elementary School!
author: Mark C.

description: Good place to get a meal. The guac was a bit bland and my chicken avocado enchiladas were just ok.  Margaritas were pretty good. Overall pretty average but service was really friendly.
author: Debbie L.

description: Places like this remind me why I sometimes have the urge to no longer live in this city. Not anything particularly bad about it, it's really just a standard dive bar, and mediocre restaurant. Bartenders are kind of slow, spend a lot of time chitchatting with their buddies or each other but nothing particularly egregious. It's a small bar area so you shouldn't have to wait 10 minutes before they come by and take your order. The real problem with the place are the ridiculous prices. Simple drinks like margaritas are ridiculously expensive, especially when you consider the simplicity of what they're pouring you.
author: Luis M.

description: Visited here for Dining Out for Life SF, where they donated 25% of all food and beverage sales for SF AIDS Foundation.  The place was packed, but we were able to score some seats at the bar.  The bartenders poured heavy and were great personalities for how slammed it was.  Once we realized we could also order food at the bar, we ordered some awesome cornbread sopes and a chicken quesadilla.  This chips and salsa were fresh and plentiful and the food tasted incredible.  I really enjoyed my evening out here, and I'll happily go back, especially since I know they support great causes.
author: Jes G.

description: Went here for some chips and drinks. I was not disappointed as the both were great. The Queso dip they have is outstanding and their margaritas are right on point.
author: Randy J.

description: I come here just to get their house margarita, cause I've never had a margarita that strong but still tastes good! It is $36 for a pitcher and for 4 people you can probably get a cup and a half per person. they also salt the glass for you if you like! People tend to come here a bit earlier around 10-11 and this place can fill up. So if you want to not have to wait/ want to deal with less people/ be able to get booth seats, come after midnight and enjoy your really strong margaritas with your friends!
author: Derrick C.

description: Funky and fun! Great margaritas and delicious food.  Like an upscale restaurant wearing a vintage coat.
author: Jude H.

description:
Two words..Watermelon Margarita.

What Velvet Cantina lacks in food and service, they gain in awesome margaritas. A pitcher is around $30 - well worth the price and more then enough for two people. They don't skimp on the alcohol, so be prepared for a "rush" as the night goes on.

Cool place too.
author: Justin A.

description: Had the best time here last night for my birthday! Alex hooked it up with a free pitcher of margarita :). The food was delicious. I recommend the mushroom empanadas and shrimp enchiladas. The atmosphere was upbeat and the perfect start to a going out night. The food was very reasonable priced and I will be back again :)
author: Leslie S.

description:
One of those reviews that's not just about the food but the service, too. My friend and I ordered a round of nachos and a margarita pitcher. Staff couldn't have been more pleasant coming by to fill up our cups whenever they were low, but we were a bit confused when they took away our pitcher when we had a bit more left at the bottom!

We brought it up with our server, and what do they do? Bring us an entire new pitcher, that's what! They couldn't have been more apologetic or understanding, and we didn't feel like they'd been at all put off by our complaint. If anything they seemed happy we raised the issue with them. The next thing we know we're sharing shots with the bartender, and the night is one of the most memorable we've had in some time. We'd come back here anytime, and suggest you do too.

(By the way -- the nachos are as excellent as the margaritas!)
author: N. H.

description:
The nervous preparation, the stress of actually taking it, & the relief in finally finishing that test...I was a ball of anxiety that needed unwinding. I decided to celebrate my little triumph with Mexican food (can YOU think of a better way?!) Since I don't drink to relax, I skipped their margaritas & went straight for their raspberry agua fresca. Strong & concentrated, it was not too sweet & not too tart & 100% refreshing. 

Our starter of warm, slightly spicy chile con queso adequately coated Velvet Cantina's homemade thick, thick chips. 

He loved his Santa Maria tri tip, which was cooked exactly as he requested it. My chicken avocado enchilada was delicious, but like all enchiladas, I was missing that crunch (thank gawd for the tortilla chips!) Fluffy Spanish rice was well seasoned & well flavored without being overly salted, as some Spanish rice tends to be. 

Total: ~$50 including tip

We walked in on the bar side instead of the restaurant side & were greeted with 90's & early 2000's rap that hipsters seem to eat up (you know, the stuff they weren't listening to back then...) Atmosphere is a little too hip for my kind (you know, the very unhip), but I did like the darkened space. 

Now I just have to sit & wait for a positive mark...the more anxious I am, the more Mexican food I need. Thankfully, Velvet Cantina is there to calm & soothe.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
best. margaritas. 

This is absolutely my favorite place for drinks. I'm a huge fan of margaritas and they serve up some of the best I have EVER had, no kidding. And... to top it all off they come in pitchers. Split it between two people its about 3.5 margaritas each and $15/person. And you're feeling good after to say the least. I'm only giving four stars because I have eaten here a few times as well and just not impressed by the food. It is good, but for a mexican joint in the Mission, your mexican food better kick some serious ass. I'd rather go to Taqueria and then walk over here for margaritas after. But they often give you chips and salsa for free even when you're just drinking at the bar. but it's a must for margs!!
author: Mandy A.

description: This place is awesome!  I organized a 30-person birthday party here.  Matt was super easy to deal with in setting it up, and Rodrigo was an amazing server.  If you're looking for a super fun Mexican restaurant for a big group party, this is the spot!
author: Ben S.

description:
Food is good, and servings are pretty huge.  If you're not starving, I recommend splitting something. Cocktails are also good, and the bartenders and staff know their stuff about the manifold types of tequila they keep.

The ambiance isn't bad, exactly, but the bass on the music is pretty annoying.
author: Sam A.

description: Food was excellent and the prices were reasonable. Service was not necessarily friendly but it was efficient. The only problem was the seating process is unclear when you walk through the door. We stood there unsure for a good 5 mins trying to figure out if it was self seating or there was a host. The host tended to blend in with the crowd but we found him eventually.  That being said he was very nice and had us seated within 10 mins.  The margaritas were also excellent. And chips and salsa were very good! We will be coming back
author: Daniel A.

description: Walked in here blindsided looking for quick drinks and bar bites while waiting for Beretta nearby. Did not expect everything to be so good! Casual joint, amazing mushroom empanadas and salsa dip. We were satisfied with our round of Paloma's too. Bartender was super friendly and even took our order on the house because it was taking longer than usual.
author: K C.

description:
I was so excited to try this place! It was alright. I had been told to get he cactus enchiladas. Meh. No flavor and no cheese! I guess j am just used to a cheesier enchilada. Good option for a veggie, but just not my thing. Was missing something. The queso was pretty gross, we sent it back. Everyone else's meals were really good. The shrimp enchiladas pretty good. Just would prefer more cheese next time! :)

THe service was amazing though!
author: Lana S.

description: This review is for drinks/bar only - the bartenders are all super friendly and nice, and the tequila drinks are delicious and strong. The tequila shots also come free flowing if you catch them in a good mood :)
author: Amy Y.

description:
Come here when you're ready to feast, 'cuz the portions are huge and the food is heavy on the carbs and cheese.

Kinda the perfect casual dining spot for a Friday or Saturday night. Don't expect an atmosphere conducive to polite conversation -- it's super loud and lively in here -- but if you're just in the mood to chill, it's ideal for sharing a couple pitchers of margaritas (warning: they're slightly on the sweet side) and a whole bunch of plates of food.

The mushroom empanadas (filled with sauteed onion, garlic, mushrooms, pepper jack and cream cheese and mushroom cream sauce) are SO good. I hear equally good things about the velvet nachos, which I MUST get next time.

I shared the chicken avocado enchiladas with a friend -- they were phenom. I did have a bite of my other friend's steak tacos but found them a bit dry. She loved 'em though.

I can't return too often unless I want to be obese, but for special occasions, hell yeah I'll be back.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Great recent find......have their nachos for sure, very tasty queso cheese and beans.  Their tortilla soup is very flavorful.  Had their avocado chicken enchiladas that are tasty but spicy - the green chilies are not for coloring!  Also had their cactus enchiladas - very good.  Velvet chicken tacos were awesome.  Refried beans don't have lard.  Enchiladas do not have a lot of sauce - kind of dry for enchiladas.  Place is LOUD, part of a lively bar scene with awesome thumping music.  Not kid friendly (we had our kids with us).  Friendly, attentive staff.  WIll come back, without the kids.
author: Ketan D.

description:
This place is across the board 5 stars from every single employee to the drinks. 
For food I recommend the guacamole, nachos, street tacos, enchiladas, & carne asada. Actually, anything on the menu will be amazing.

For drinks - margaritas and order by the pitcher, yes they are that good. Oh this is where I should warn you DON'T DRIVE!!!! The fruit margaritas or the house margarita.

If there is a Cheers bar in San Francisco, this is it!
author: Teresa J.

description:
When my mother asked me what I wanted to do during my post-finals decompression visit to SF, I answered, "I could use a marg or three." Velvet Cantina, I'm happy to report, obliged.

A pitcher of marg is good enough to get three people decently toasted, but another pitcher really seals the deal. Nothing like broaching completely inappropriate topics with your parents, but hey, margs loosen everyone up. The guacamole was p. delicious - I had to snag a few tastes despite the saddest allergy in the world (RIP, avocados, I hardly knew ye) - but that's pretty much all the food we had. I think that's pretty much all the food you NEED when sucking back tequila in bulk quantities. 

Busy but not packed at 5:30, good music, attractive if perfunctory waitstaff...but those are all incidental. Come for the margs, stay for the margs. Get blasted. Talk loudly about past indiscretions and questionable pastimes. It's worth the brain fog and inevitable tequila hangover.
author: Corinna K.

description: Very Average Mexican food for the mission, extremely loud offensive music which made everyone shout causing the atmosphere to be very bad. Deep bass is all you could here all night. Save your money and go somewhere decent for Mexican in the mission.
author: Dan S.

description:
Such a fun place to start a night out! We came around 8 on a Friday night and put our names in. Since the bar was really full, we went to Beretta a block away and grabbed a drink at their bar. Came back 30 minutes later and our table was ready. 

Three of us got one of those cool round booths in the front room and chips and water were quickly delivered.  We started with one pitcher of watermelon margaritas, which was way sweeter than anticipated. I got the chicken and avocado enchiladas and enjoyed every bite. Not sure if the margaritas enhanced the meal, but hey, I'll take it. 

For the second pitcher of margs we asked the waiter what his recommendation was, which ended up being raspberry. This was less sweet and easier to down. Not sure what else they put in them, but they sure are addicting. 

Towards the end, it was quite amusing to watch the excessive pda at the bar. So I guess this is a great date night place, too.

For a solid $30 pp, got our full share of margaritas to get the night going and a bomb meal. One less star only because I have had way better Mexican food in SF, but this wasn't sub-par.  I will be suggesting this place for future group meals with friends and birthdays! New favorite place in the mission.
author: Alisha K.

description: All I can say is wow, how lazy can you be? My boyfriend and I went out of our way to come here and when we get there at 10:30pm, they tell us that they are closed. When we asked them about their hours, they reply that they "usually close at midnight, but since we're not busy, we're closing now." I guess youre too lazy to make more money.
author: Samantha G.

description:
This place is located in the mission in kind I a darker area- ladies don't go alone!

Overall I would say I enjoyed my meal here. They bring you lots of delicious chips which is a positive to start with. If you order cheesy dip it's $9 (doesn't say that on the menu I think) which is pretty expensive liquid cheese if you ask me! You might also need a flashlight to see the menu. It's essentially a bar in one room and a dinning area in the other.

I'm giving it three stars instead if four because we were excited to come here for taco Tuesday bc we saw that that's a thing at this place on yelp or their website (can't remember which). Well, they have no such promotion so you're stuck with full price tacos.

The platters ate BIG- mostly due to the fact that they laid it up with rice and beans (they have black!) The steak was definitely white-Mexican and chewy which I guess was an interesting change to your Mexican taco. They platters run about $14.

Overall id say the quality of the food is average+. I'm not dying to come back but I'm also not going to avoid it if a friend suggests we go here.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description: I feel bad only giving 3 stars, because their service was great (and we had a large group too!) and their margaritas were good.  But, I just can't.  I got the veggie burrito, which had all the correct ingredients, but their salsa was just flavorless.  Which for a veggie burrito is pretty important.  My sister said her tacos made her feel sick (she didn't get food poisoning or anything, but I don't know-that's just what she said, maybe the chicken was too dry or something).  Anyway, fun for ambiance, but not best on food.
author: Sonia S.

description:
Really good margaritas.

Only came here for margaritas with friends.

Margaritas, margaritas, margaritas.

Did I mention they have good margaritas?
author: Patrick T.

description: Ok food but you need noise cancelling headphones to hear anything including the waiter
author: Charles L.

description: I like all types of Mexican food, both authentic and Mexican-American and I know this place isn't trying to be authentic or anything, but unfortunately the food here is just not seasoned well.  This place has some of the most bland Pico De Gallo salsa I have ever had (no cilantro onions or chilies)  basically just chopped tomatoes.  Given it is a sit down style Mexican-American restaurant I usually order items like enchiladas, unfortunately the meat inside those enchiladas has no flavor other than the fact it is over salted.  They do load a heap of dry chili powder and salt on some of the items (like the rice), giving it that flavor like you just licked some dry cayenne powder,   but you will keep saying to yourself this dish is missing something.
author: Ryan S.

description:
The best part about greasy Mexican food is the agonizing churn you feel in your tummy afterward. Diarrhea cha cha cha? Yes please! But once in a while, you've got to give your bunghole a break with clean, non-greasy fare as served at Velvet Cantina. 

I need to dedicate an entire paragraph to the complimentary chips and salsa. DAMN THAT SHIT WAS GOOD! The tortilla chips were some of the best I've had in my entire life! Fresh, baked, non-greasy, perfect texture...I need to shove some in my piehole right now with a pile of salsa. THAT SALSA! There must have been crack in it because I could not get enough of the diced tomato goodness. They are not stingy with the portions either, and you can always ask for more, which is exactly what our fat kids' table did. We were also given some melted cheese to dip our chips in. Double explosion in my groin!

For my entree, I chose the Chicken Avocado Enchiladas. This is what I mean by "clean" Mexican food: instead of soggy, haphazardly rolled up tortillas swimming in a pile of sauce, these enchiladas were neatly rolled with just the right amount of cilantro pesto squiggles on top. When cut open, the cross section revealed perfectly shredded chicken and avocado as opposed to poo poo mush. It was delicious and actually tasted healthy. It came with sides of rice and beans (I chose black). I just wish there were more enchiladas instead of overly abundant sides. Yeah you know I'm a greedy bitch.

I almost forgot the most important part! We downed some tequila shots and ordered three pitchers of margaritas. The Perfect Margarita was pretty gangster. It tasted way better than the pineapple kind which we thought would improve our love lives. But no, skip it.
author: Suany W.

description: It was all of our first time at the Velvet Cantina, 13 of us.  Every single one of us gave it five stars. The food and service was off the hook.  Derek our waiter was great.  It's hard to get 13 dinners out timely and they had no problem.  All of us can't wait to go back .
author: Barbara M.

description: Guacamole and Chicken avocado enchiladas were fantastic! It's a pretty small place, really loud, and service was fine. Good value.
author: Stephen N.

description: Awesome, HOT wait staff!  Oh, Yeah . . . Oh, BTW:  The food served is excellent, too!
author: Shirley M. J.

description: Great Mexican restaurant. Came here a friends birthday and it was Soo many people. This place is packed on Friday night! Great selection of chips and salsa with awesome dish for dinner! Had a great time snacking and drinking margarita.. Ordered a whole pitcher and had fun. This place is little pricy if you don't watch yourself but has great and fun atmosphere. I do think they need to have a bigger bathroom, it seems very unhealthy of the bathroom being right next to the food and bar.
author: Nuno V.

description: Delicious and affordable! Also, 100% of the servers and bartenders are extremely physically attractive, professional, polite, and warm...so get ready to wonder whether your server is just being nice or might actually like you. But let's be real, we all know what the answer is ;)
author: Henrissa B.

description:
The best thing about this place: the fresh fruit margaritas. I've been here five times now and three of those were just to have drinks. I do recall on the second time enjoying the music, classic diva anthems (which may or may not be a regular occurrence).

As for the food it gets the job done. You'll leave full for sure. The nachos are my personal fav and great to share with friends.

Can be dark, can be loud, but also cozy depending on where you are sitting. At least size wise they have more space than most of the itty bitty SF restaurants around. The bathroom situation may be annoying to some, as they are right beside the bar, in the open. As you (and hopefully just you) wait for the bathroom, you can just stare at everyone while they eat. 

Waiters are friendly. I don't remember ever seeing a waitress.

Reasonably priced for how much food you get and the quality. All in all, definitely check it out. At the very least you have a new margarita watering hole.
author: Ashley W.

description: Delicious! My friend and I sat at the bar for dinner. The house margarita was awesome. Empanadas: good but beware they are fried. Tacos Valentina are delicious, spicy. Cactus Enchilada was delightful, not too greasy for an enchilada.
author: Tia G.

description:
I actually might put this place as one of my favorite neighborhood joints. I came here about a year ago when visiting SF and had some absolutely amazing margarita's along with food. After I moving here, I've been back at least 3 times now, and continually have a great experience. Great Drinks, Great Food and of course good costumer service. I mean it helps that my old college roommates friend works here but that doesn't take away how good the food is.

The carnitas are phenomenal, the queso, the chicken tacos, the chips and salsa, the nachos....all items you can't go wrong with.
author: Lindsey M.

description: I met a friend here for an early dinner and enjoyed the food. The service was great. It wasn't too crowded.  I LOVE that they have so many vegetarian options! It's rare for me to have a hard time figuring out what I want.  They're only getting 4 stars because I specifically asked to have my burrito without onions and they gave them to me anyway. Not enough to keep me from going back, but still not the greatest thing ever. When I'm in the area again, I will definitley give them another shot.
author: Shannan G.

description:
As a girl born and bred in the Southwest, I walk around with a craving for Mexican food that all too often goes unanswered in the Northeast, like an itch down the middle of your back that you can't quite reach. When I travel to cities with a plethora of options, I tend to go overboard. So when my ol' drinkin' buddies suggested margaritas near their Mission homestead, I was all for it, even though I'd had Mexican food just the night before. (I know, I know, two days in a row of Mexican ain't nothin' in SF.) 

Velvet Cantina did us right, too -- with Perfect Margaritas (their apt title, not mine), huge piles of nachos, and fresh fish tacos. From the first lick of the salty glass rim to the last black bean, it was all solid. Itch: scratched. 

The Cantina also distinguished itself even among its many Mission compatriots with one notable dessert: s'mores nachos, blowtorched at our table. How does this work? Well, just make a pile of those tasty fried tortilla strips coated in cinnamon-sugar, pile on the tiny marshmallows and chocolate chips, and light it on fire. I'd say don't try it at home, but uh, I totally will.
author: Ryan W.

description:
The velvet nachos are yummy, but don't bother with anything else on the menu.

The service is aggressive. I can't tell if the Asian guy is being friendly or a dick. The Latino (who worked last night) doesn't give a shit - he told me and my friends to get a  move on, so he could separate the tables we had just gotten up from. We were in the middle of a conversation, and it wasn't like anyone was waiting around for a table or anything.
author: Tracey W.

description: Decor, choice of music, and location are on-point, but the chile con queso and "Velvet Margarita" are far from delicious. Visited here Apr 19th for a quick margo (on the rocks) and chips & queso dip before heading out into the night. Being from Texas and experiencing true, tasty, chile con queso (like those of Trudy's and Chuy's - look them up) we were unimpressed by Velvet's bowl of seemingly melted cheese whiz - pretty bland flavors - we actually poured some salsa into it to spruce it up, but still no joy. The Velvet margarita was heavy on sour and light on sweet (like tequila and lime juice were the only two ingredients). I had to order a side of Grand Marnier to cut the edge off the tartness, but it only helped a little. Didn't try any of their main courses.
author: Andrew N.

description: While their signature velvet margarita was definitely strong, the place was very loud, dark, crowded seating-wise and food was somewhat expensive ($4 tacos...? With authentic taquerias down the street ). Meh at best.
author: Anita T.

description: Love the free chips and salsa, and the chicken avocado enchiladas were bomb.  The plate of food was also huge, so that's a plus (at least in my eyes).  Fun place to go with friends.
author: Kelly L.

description: We stopped here for drinks while on our way to Baretta.  I was just drawn in by the sign saying intoxicating elixirs.  It definitely is Mexican themed but the cocktails are no joke.  They are all muddled with fresh herbs. The habenero shot is spicy abut the bartender will adjust the drink to your level of heat that you want it to be.  They also offer you chips and salsa at no charge.  The salsa was pretty good not mild nor necessarily memorable.  The chips were nice and warm.  The great thing is that the bartender was extremely friendly and pulled off not knowing much English.
author: Zorin D.

description:
Everything you want in a neighborhood cantina. I had passed it several times but never been inside and a friend suggested we grab dinner there. The wait staff were really friendly and told us to sit wherever we wanted. 

We started by sharing a pitcher of margaritas, which was both excellent and seemingly endless. For $26.00 for the pitcher we got around 6 margaritas out of it which is really good value, and it was very well made. Not too sweet, just the right tang of lime.

For dinner we shared the Avocado Chicken Enchiladas and some steak tacos. Both were really good, but what made the meal exceptional were the rice and beans which normally is just filler at most Mexican restaurants, however here both were very very tasty. The  meal also included some pickled cabbage like dish which was also tasty.

I will return. Prices were reasonable and including my share of the margaritas it was under $30.00 each.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Love this place. Anytime a friend wants a sit down Mexican place this is my go-to. I love the dim red lighting inside and the pitchers of margaritas. My first time here we had ordered a pitcher of house margaritas and the bartender had a pitcher he had just made with better tequila that was a mistake for another customer. He offered us that one for the same price. They were so delicious and STRONG! 

The ceviche is great (big chunks and spicy). I've had both of the empanadas and both are great as well. The cactus avocado enchiladas I will definitely be getting again.
author: Maggie S.

description:
I do not like sit-down Mexican restaurants. I love Mexican food, but believe it's best when it comes from a taqueria or taco truck. Time and again, I end up being talked into trying some Mexican restaurant with $14 burritos and stewed meats served a dozen different ways on giant, oval plates overflowing with rice and beans. I keep thinking, "well maybe this place will hit the mark." Well no. None of them have to date, and Velvet Cantina continues that streak.

I guess I'm trying to say that I am not their target customer. So take what I write with a grain of salt. But if you have similar tastes to mine, this place probably isn't going to surprise you. 

The margaritas are not cloyingly sweet. The beer price is acceptable. It's crowded on a Saturday night, but not overwhelming. Overall, the food is not bad. It just doesn't live up to the hype. And while the prices here are better than many sit-down Mexican restaurants, the food still costs more than it's worth. 

Our reservation was for a party of 7. We were seated promptly. The servers were great. The food came out very quickly (too quickly, to be honest... not a lot of time or care could have gone into its preparation).

What people in our party had:

Chips and salsa -- Chips were great. Salsa was tasty, yet utterly devoid of spice. Chili's makes a spicier house salsa. 

Queso bowl -- Not bad, but again, just melted cheese. No punch whatsoever. 

Guacamole -- Fresh but boring. Needed salt, lime, and flavor. 

Achiote steak tacos -- Very bland. When you're charging $12 for two tacos, you expect to not need to put a half-pint of Cholula hot sauce on in order to taste anything. 

Cactus enchiladas -- These came highly recommended. They were slimy and devoid of flavor. She didn't even want to finish them. 

Chicken salad -- Lettuce, tomato, beans, and chicken. Blah.

Chili verde enchiladas -- The standout hit! The guy who ordered this liked them very much. 

Nachos with chicken -- Nothing on the dinner menu stood out to me, so I ordered the nachos for my meal. They were good-ish. I don't know what they were using for cheese, but I didn't much care for it. However, all ingredients were evenly dispersed, so no hunting for veins of salsa or sour cream. If I went there again, this is probably what I'd order. 

...but I don't plan on ever going to Velvet Cantina again. In my opinion, you should just grab a burrito or quesadilla at El Farolito (just a block away), then hit up a couple Mission bars. (Perhaps the bar in Velvet Cantina for a margarita?)
author: Walter P.

description:
Margaritas here are NOT f'ing around. Tread carefully, my friends. I remember not that night.

Chips, salsa, guac, ceviche, mushroom empanadas, service - all A+
author: Sonya Z.

description: For out of towners looking for queso: the Velvet's Chili con queso is not as good as Texas queso. Other than that the food is decent.
author: Amy L.

description: This is one of my top mexican places in the city and I absolutely love it!
author: Nicholas F.

description: I heart Velvet Cantina, especially the house margarita and the nachos. Normally opposed to liquid cheese on my nachos, VC is the exception. I order mine with refried beans instead of black beans. And the portions are enormous, great for sharing. Oh, and I love the chips here, thick and fresh and perfect for scooping up large amounts of salsa.
author: Teryll H.

description: I'd heard favorable things about the place before. So when we needed a bite to eat a little late in the night, came in for a bite to eat. First, our waiter was quick to state that they were out of chips which was totally fine except for when an adjacent table was quickly given chips a few minutes later. Then when the food came out, it was overall very bland. My carnitas was bland, dry, and rubber gummy, beyond any help that the equally bland pinto beans and accompanying pickled slaw could ever offer. We also had the favorably reviewed chicken avocado enchiladas which was mediocre by Mission standards. Overall, we left feeling that the 4 star Yelp average was likely more for the hip vibe the place afforded rather than the actual quality of the food. Just come in with the right expectations.
author: Mike M.

description:
2.5 STARS
Good tequila selection for very reasonable price. 
Service is okay, but not honest.
Before order I asked the bartender if lime juice is freshly squeezed, he said "yes".  
On menu it was stated that they use agave nectar as sweetener, but its not true, they use simple syrup. Margarita made with lime juice from the gallon container.
Margarita was overly sweet, and had lime concentrate taste. When I said to bartender that I can taste that it wasn't fresh lime juice, he said its impossible to squeeze so much juice, because they are way too busy.
Didn't like the food. 
Chile Queso was pretty BAD, tasted like Nacho sauce from jar. Skip!
Mushroom empanadas weren't good as well, mushrooms inside boiled, flavorless and saggy. Skip!
Few years ago I had their Carne Asiada/grilled skirt steak, was chewy and quality of meat wasn't good. It might change since than.

Not going back.
author: Natasha S.

description: Easilly a 5 star experience. The food is delicious and the margaritas are possibly the best I've ever had. I'll be sure to visit again on my next trip back out to California.
author: Katelyn C.

description: Reasonably priced food in the Mission? Yes! And it's delicious. And you can get a pitcher of margaritas. Yes.
author: Disco B.

description:
My neighborhood stop, for sure.

It's the perfect place to come for a late night bite after a Yoga Tree class, an ideal spot for HH, and well - come for it all: margaritas/food, you name it.

The wait staff is so kind and helpful.  The best part is ordering pitchers of margaritas!  I've come on a date, as well as with a crew, and it's fabulous.  On a busy night, one would be able to be seated within 30 minutes; all you'd have to do is stand by the bar for a couple drinks.

It's pretty noisy in there with tons of people.  I've seen a birthday party, groups of folks in the booths, but it's fun and not annoying.  They also play some Top 40 jams, which is really great.

The food?  Let's get down to it.  I haven't eaten anything I've disliked.  A crowd pleaser are the nachos with meat on top.  They put crack cheese in there, I swear.  Everything from the appetizers to the entrees - you can't go wrong.

Can't wait to explore more dishes!
author: Liz A.

description:
Best place ever, pues!

Bar: can u say friendly & welcoming, oh hello! grabbed a jug of margarita...rounds all around. some complimentary chips & salsa...eases the buzz!

Food: Tortilla Soup (drop in an empanada that when cut open, cheese spills out...delicious!), Ceviche (perfect portion) & Chicken Avocado Enchilada....Bau$$ it comes with a side of black beans & rice...mixed together with some salsa, phew. satisfied.


Service: perfection, friendly & relaxed.One of the best spots in The Mission. Expect it to be crowded on the weekend, so order some drinks at the bar and be patient...the food is worth the wait.
author: Priscilla N.

description: It looks dead from the outside but the other side of the bar was lively. We were seated pretty quickly in an old fashioned booth. The pitcher of house margarita gave us about 2 each for the 4 of us. Chips and salsa were served quickly and were a nice appetizer. The shrimp enchilada was bomb. I can't say the same for the diablo shrimp which didn't have that many shrimp. It's like a Celia's except not a chain. I would come again.
author: Marty J.

description:
Bar was PACKED on Cinco De Mayo. The food looked like it was a good portion. I didn't sit down to eat because there were no seats available, so to the bar it was!

Margaritas were $7, but you can also buy a pitcher, which serves 4-5 people for ~$26. It was more than enough to give 6 of us drinks. Perfecto! I was planning to bar hop anyway, so we got a couple of drinks of margaritas and bounced.

The floors were sticky when we went there, probably because people had been drinking the entire time. 

The only drawback I would have is that there was no announcement as to how to get a table to eat. I came with a group of 8ish people, and we didn't know we had to find the man sitting in the corner to put our name on the list. At least announce it, put it on the door, or have someone standing there directing people! Understandable, it was chaotic, but being in the Mission -- a restaurant should be prepared!
author: Christina L.

description: Had a late night bite here tonight. Literally had the DRIEST and blandest carnitas I've ever had. Bar none. Period. Should have just gone to El Farolito a block away.
author: Mark D.

description:
They make pretty awful shrimp enchilada. The smallest shrimp you've ever seen are in this thing. There's no real flavor to it. The black beans were really good, but who really cares about the beans. We ordered drinks and the food came before the drinks, so that sucked. The atmosphere and ambiance are inviting, but I'd trade that in for better food.  It sounds like the food takes a backseat to the margaritas anyway.

Other folks at my table had the street tacos, but I didn't hear much raving from them. The queso was okay, but overpriced.
author: Natalie F.

description:
Been here twice already. Really well made margaritas. Clean bathrooms and bomb guac. 

It's a place to be loud and enjoy your food and drinks. But if you're looking to have some serious convos and a romantic date - the place won't be as ideal. Just because everyone's having a good time and speaking loudly. 

I highly recommend this place. Parking is a little tough if you're familiar with the mission district on a Friday night.
author: Yasmin R.

description: Good food, handled a group surprisingly well. The mango/habanero tequila shots were AWESOME. You can't even taste the burn of the tequila. Genius.
author: David S.

description:
One of the things on my to-do list when visiting SF was enjoy as much delicious Mexican food I could. The Velvet Cantina provided. 

The chips and salsa were delicious, but I'm glad I didn't fill up on them so I had plenty of room for Chile Verde, a huge bowl of braised pork in a tomatillo sauce, bursting with tons of flavor, served with soft tortillas, beans and rice. Really authentic - I wish I could have tried the whole menu! 

I then had to stuff all that down to make room for the s'mores nachos dessert. 

The margaritas were really good - order the pitcher for 3 or more people. It's worth it and affordable. 

Entrees were huge portions at $11.50-$17 each, and most being around $12.99.

Great atmosphere, clean bathrooms.
author: Ana R.

description:
This place is overrated. Ew. The nachos had velveta cheese and my cousins empanada was made with a wonton rapper. Yuck. The rice was burned and beans were gross. The Chile reneo had two strands of cheese. There was a skinny white male waiter with a long nose who was particularly rude. He actually grabbed my arm and moved me to the side trying to get to another customers. 
I will never go here again, don't waste your money on this unauthentic mexican food.
author: Ariel B.

description: The food is just above average, but 4 stars for the Velvet margarita, ambiance, fun vibe, and service.  This is a great spot for groups... appetizers and margaritas.
author: Angelique B.

description: This is clearly a place to come drink, not eat. Though the staff was very friendly, the food was really sub par when compared to the Mexican you can get at almost any taqueria around the corner. Over salted beans and rice, boring enchiladas, and nachos that came with a house nacho cheese instead of regular melted cheese. Again - great people, terrible Mexican.
author: Jesse S.

description: Been to the VC twice. The first time, about six months ago, I had a huge burrito and guacamole. It was very good. I went with my wife last night: the nachos were only warm, and though they were pretty tasty, they were nothing special. I had the carne asada; low quality meat, which would have been IK if the sauce it came with was delicious. It wasn't. I'd give the plate a C grade. My wife had the chicken-and-avocado enchiladas, which she liked. I took a bite and honestly wasn't very impressed. We each had two margaritas.
