The regular one was made using--I believe--a store-bought mix and was OK. There was a good ratio of booze to mix, but for $10 that was expected, however, it was nothing special. If it was t made with store-bought mix, it could have been. We also each had a Velvet Margarita featuring a house-made mix; I'm pretty sure about that. This mix was so salty that I only took a couple of sips of my drink. It was really that bad. And my wife only finished half of her drink. We were both amazed at how terribly salty their signature margarita was. It left a taste in the mouth like seawater, I kid you not. We won't be going back to the VC. The food and even the drinks there have lots of room for improvement. Oh, and the service was dreadful. I'm not sure if I've ever given a 1-star review before, but that's all this place deserves.
author: Scott D.

description:
What a FANTASTIC place for a big party.  We planned a birthday dinner for 10 and about 16 showed up!  

The server and staff were amazing.  Instead of getting annoyed or not allowing additional people, they completely made the table(s) work.  

The server (I forget her name) was so friendly and accommodating.  The food and prices were great.  We loved the dim, red lighting and fun music.  They made our night GREAT. 

 We will definitely be back, thank you!!!
author: Ginger M.

description:
Just came here from drinks so I don't know about the food but the margaritas were tasty y strong y the ambiance was great :)

Friendly bartenders, an eclectic mix of people, y fun music puts this place on my short list for go to bars!
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: This is way over due I want to start off with the staff at velvet always treats me like I'm family and the service from the guys is beyond welcoming drinks are 5 stars and the food is great my new drink is now the jabenero shot a must here and the chicken nachos are to write home about ...the guys at the bar will make you laugh and there all cool in my book D&D are both super laid back great bartenders well take my work great place ...
author: Marcelo Z.

description:
To the write of my review composing, I see that Darin I is prominently featured to the right.  Which is surprising considering Oompa Loompas dwarf him in both height and girth, so I can't imagine anyone seeing him in a crowd.  The reason why I'm mentioning my favorite *other* pocket rocket is because...

I will do anything for my fiance.  ANYTHING.  Go to the city on a Wednesday night to a place that serves margaritas (not the greatest, in my margarita-expert opinion) when I know I have a meeting with my boss the next day.

Yes, it was my fiance's birthday.  He is FINALLY legal so I can take him to bars.  21 is an amazing age.  In any case, while the margaritas were not my favorite (probably should have upgraded, but I didn't want to be the bitch ordering the expensive stuff while everyone else was slumming with a pitcher), the food was awesome.  

Great guac, great queso, and the chicken/avocado enchiladas were delish.  I would have loved a smidge more of the green stuff inside, but drunkards can't be choosers.

The staff was great and on top of our large group, although I'm sure some of our group would have liked to be topped a little more.

This is a definite must-return.
author: Pam S.

description: Best Mexican food I've had in a long time!!  Magaritas were the bomb.com!!!!  Nachos... only one word  - YUM!!  Matt was our amazing host.  I wasn't sure what I wanted so he chose my plate for me and it was delicious.  Seasoned just right!!  The rice was fluffy with a nice spicy kick!!  All the better to wash down with the fabulous margaritas!!  I loved the atmosphere and didn't mind the "eye candy".  Looking forward to going back!!
author: Jen B.

description: This place used to be a staple for me during college and every time I visited the bay area. They lost my business forever tonight.  They refused to serve us because they were closing a little less than 2 hours earlier than their posted business hours.  I've never known this place not to be busy a few years ago, failure to bring in sufficient business on a Thursday is reflective and a direct consequence of their poor business effort and values. Given the tech money pouring into the bay area and gentrification happening in the mission district, they're clearly under achieving by not attracting enough clientele to remain open Thursday evenings. Velvet Cantina will not earn anymore of my hard-earned money from such laziness.
author: Damon K.

description:
So my friends went on a bar crawl where we dressed up our friends as clowns and had to find them as they wandered the city. Our loud and by now very drunk group finally found them at Velvet Cantina, bar #6, so I decided to join in on the party.

First, the large sign says Elixirs and Edibles! Well.. not those kind of edibles. I wish...

The atmosphere in the bar is fun, like a, well, cantina, with an eclectic mix of people and mood lighting. There's some tables and booths off to the side and in the back for people eating, but we were just drinking. They play fun music here! From the latest electronica to rock to hip hop, it was good times.

We didn't try any edibles but we did get a couple of large pitchers of Margaritas from the very awesome bartenders. The margaritas were *curse word omitted* strong. It was like mostly tequila and triple sec, with some sweet and sour splashed on top. Still very good!

Anyways, a great place to stop by and have a drink with a fun crowd!
author: Michael W.

description: Velvet Cantina is three things to me: giant yummy portions of food, great chips & salsa, and tasty, super-boozy pitchers of margaritas.  The wait is usually fairly long, which is a shame, but it's not like they can help it.  Staff has always been friendly.  The place is bustling but not so loud that you can't carry on conversations with your friends.
author: Brian T.

description: Dim, but well appointed Mexican restaurant. Nice drink menu. Good for dates and groups. Bar area seats about 8. Pretty good tequila menu. Food is only average. Great table service.
author: Will D.

description: Pretty good food. Service was a little off, our food came out before our water and margaritas did, but granted it was a Saturday night and I think they don't have many servers. I got the nachos with chorizo which were alright, not the best but others love them. The hubs got the avocado chicken enchiladas and I had serious food fomo! Will be back to try other menu items for sure!
author: Sally S.

description: A red light lit atmosphere. Loud but okay for close quarters conversation with one other.  Good margs in a loungey space with an accompanying loungey vibe...though only was at the front bar, did not see the rest of the place.
author: J K.

description: So damn good!! Margaritas, food, and the hot waiter in the white t-shirt!!  Seriously, found this on Yelp because my niece wanted a margarita. Great, strong margaritas!! Have a DD.  Huge portions at a great price. Visiting the city. Safe area. Love places off the beaten path. Very authentic, fresh food! Must try!
author: Jennifer S.

description: One of our favorites! Great location and food is exceptionally tasty and true to Mexican glory. The chicken avo enchiladas are so good there's also a veggie version . So good! The Margs are the best part so boozy and you can't even taste the Alchy so it's partially dangerous. The house margs are stronger compared to the fruity ones. Great for group dining - they hosted our 17 person dinner and it was great. Good service and even complimentary mango habanero shots for all of us. A true gem!
author: Priya S.

description:
Hip spot, this place is packed on weekend nights and noise level is *loud*. House margaritas are very good and very strong, the high point of the evening!

Overall the food was bland - nachos and enchiladas were just ok. With so many great mexican spots in the hood, I won't be coming back here to eat.  To drink, si!
author: Kim W.

description: Excellent all round - chips, salsa, service, great atmosphere and ambience, superb vegetarian choices.
author: Philippe A.

description:
Friendly Staff.
Food comes out quickly and is flavorful.
Chips and Salsa = good, order the queso, yum!
Chicken avocado enchiladas very tasty, $13.

Sort of an interesting atmosphere, sort of feels like you're eating in an old dive bar?  Either way, would definitely recommend for a "under $20" dinner if you're in the area.  We went after drinks and apps at Beretta.
author: Melody T.

description:
Actually surprised that it did live up to expectations. In contrary to all the Mexican food in the Mission, this place had a mean margarita (got the Velvet) and a great Achiote steak Tacos, mmm, tasty. My roomate got the avocado chicken enchiladas, and he was very pleased! Chips and salsa was a plus, but the salsa was watery and needed more tomato chunks. We got the additional guacamole appetizer to use with the chips, that was great too. Waiter was friendly and helpful, and good ambiance inside. They also have a bar too, and definitely try the margaritas.

Definitely recommend, a good change of pace from traditional Mexican food places here in the Mission, and had a solid meal all around.
author: Howard J.

description:
I wanted a fun, casual place to host my birthday dinner, and Velvet Cantina fit the bill. It didn't hurt that I'd been craving nachos like whoa and they have a delicious version of them.

Their chips are tasty - salted just enough and with tasty salsa to accompany it. They refill those baskets of chips quickly, which is an awesome plus.

Those nachos - oh such heavenly nachos!!  A ginormous platter (yes, platter, not a paltry little plate) is chock full of their tasty chips with lick-your-fingers queso, guac, black beans, etc.  I would have gladly eaten the whole platter myself, but I was a good birthday girl and shared with my siblings and friends (it went quickly).

For an entree, I wavered between chicken mole and carnitas.  Thankfully I have an awesome brother who is the ultimate entree splitting partner, so we ordered each dish and split them.  The carnitas was friggin' awesome. Nice and crispy on the outside, still flavorful and tender on the inside.  The accompanying black beans were tasty and the rice was the bomb. I mean really, I've had a lot of Mexican rice in my day and these take the cake.  Well-seasoned, fluffy, and the perfect side to these glorious chunks of pork.  

The mole was also good.  The chicken was tender and boy was there a lot of it.  The mole sauce here was more on the chocolatey/sweet side than I've had at other places. Certainly not a bad thing - a mere observation. It was yummy.

I also had a bite of the chicken avocado enchiladas, which were also very tasty.  OVerall, I was a very happy birthday girl. The service was amazing - didn't have to ask for more chips or water. Even better, we didn't have to ask for more pitchers of margaritas! Our server read our table very very well - knew to put the nachos in front of me (my mini sombrero probably helped) and just refilled our margarita pitcher at the appropriate time. He didn't do it so often that we felt forced into buying additional pitchers - it was perfect.

Really, the best birthday dinner experience I could have asked for.  Lovely company, awesome nachos, and great service.  Thanks Velvet Cantina!
author: Naoko M.

description:
Nothing special here.  The food is ok, but nothing mind blowing.  My party started off with the House Margaritas and Fresh Fruit Margaritas.  They were fine, but nothing overwhelming.

Then started with the queso macho- a mix of chorizo, guacamole and queso.  This was particularly underwhelming as the dip was completely cold.  Not sure if it was meant to be cold but I would have preferred warm queso.  Also, the chips were overly cold (not even room temperature) and didn't taste like tortilla chips much.  The free salsa also wasn't as good as the stuff you can get in the jar.

Shrimp enchiladas were not very special.  The shrimps were not especially flavorful.  The beans and rice were solid though.  

Service was lack luster.  Not too much attention at the table.  The atmosphere was too noisy to be enjoyable.  I did like the music that was being played but it was a bit too loud for a restaurant setting.  Could barely hear my guest.  

I was hoping for more in terms of the food quality and service, but egh- I'll pass next time.  I'll just go to a taqueria on Mission Street next time- it'll be tastier and a lot cheaper.
author: Laura R.

description: I went here for a friend's birthday and absolutely loved it! It's super close to bart and absolutely delicious. I am crazy about empanadas and so I ordered the mushroom ones at the server's recommendation. I believe they are vegetarian but don't quote me on it. 2 came on a plate and they were amazing. Filled with gooey creamy mushroom awesomeness. I guess my only complaint is I would have liked 3 for 8 dollars but it was still totally worth it. I want to try the chorizo ones next time. I drank the habenero Margarita and it was the perfect amount of spice. The place is a little on the dim side, I personally like a bit more light when I eat but I think this place is fantastic and will absolutely come back
author: Ali R.

description: I loved the bartendars! I loved the atmosphere. I was invited to late night after hours. And great prices for shots and beers.
author: Tracy E.

description:
Once you make your way through the crowded bar of Mission hipsters, an eclectic dining room with string lights will become your fun-dining destination for the evening. Try to get into one of the booths if you can, it enhances the experience.

As with any casual place, there must be at least one menu item that can stand up on its own and keep me coming back. At the Velvet Cantina, it's the chicken avocado enchiladas that are very good and fresh tasting, along with the chips and salsa. The also open late which is a plus. I like how the Spanish rice is kind of dry which feels like it is cooked with less lard. It's hard to find Mexican food that is "healthy", but places like this that prefer fresh sliced avocados inside your enchiladas as opposed to being drenched in fatty cheese and sour cream definitely give you a lighter feeling when you are done with the meal, which is preferable for an everyday kind of place.
author: Mark Y.

description:
The food is delicious and the vibe is fantastic. It's the perfect weekend outing and had the ambiance of a West Hollywood restaurant. Cool, chic & energetic w/o trying too hard. 

Margaritas are good and strong. Chips are good but not a fan of the salsa. Chicken avocado enchiladas stole the show. Don't reco the shrimp diablo though. Everyone at the table who got it was disappointed.
author: Nadine H.

description:
I came here last Friday for a friend's birthday and my first thought was "is this a club?" LOL the entrance & location definitely looks like they'll be checking some ID's to get in, but no it was just super packed.  I like the fact that they have a full bar, but the space was very limited.  

The back dining area where we sat was very confined, I couldn't move back too much or else I'd hit one of the cute waiters LOL so I stayed in my little area.  The seating bothered me the most because I felt so crammed in, which was one of my 2 problems with this place.

I ordered Ceviche, which was a mistake! I looove that stuff, but not this time.  It was very chunky & had chunks of pineapple in it as well.  No where close to your traditional ceviche, which was a problem for me.  I didn't like it very much.  The appetizer Nacho's on the other hand was amazing! They were sooo cheesy I couldn't figure out what kinda cheese it was, but hell that shit was gooood!! Definitely recommend the nachos any day.  The watermelon margaritas were tasty too, but for $26 a pitcher I'd like a lot less ice lol because it didn't even make it around the table.  If you ever spot me there, it's cause I came back for those nachos :)
author: Christina O.

description: This place is amazing. Great service and staff, food is good and the ambiance is definitely fun
author: Kenny V.

description:
I don't like Mexican. My California boyfriend says it's because as an Australian I'm haven't been exposed to it enough....hmmm, whatever. I say it's because it's too beanie, too ricie, too corny, to cheesy etc 

However, I think the chilli verde at velvet cantina is one of the best dishes I have ever eaten. Get yourselves down there for some awesome green pork on your fork! 

(the margaritas are pretty darn good too )
author: Sally S.

description:
Great, friendly, hardworking staff! The vibe is laid back and cool, great music. Excellent margaritas and guacamole!
Becoming a regular, driving all the way from pac hts, lol, pretty much every week.  The chile verde  and fish tacos are awesome! Can't wait till my next visit -)
author: Scott V.

description:
Came here to celebrate Aaron V's belated birthday after the Nom-bay YEE (http://www.yelp.com/biz/city-by-the-nom-bay-elite-party-nombe-san-francisco#hrid:ntmDbg7AmUnpKz-7QuX-Lw).  And I'll definitely agree with his review (http://www.yelp.com/biz/velvet-cantina-san-francisco#hrid:fCrE5BXTBESkHl6lt2_9Gg), the food is not great...if you come here, stick to the alcohol!

The staff, however, is friendly and helpful.  They agreed to seat our huge party of 15(?) in the back room that they had already closed down so that we could all enjoy.  (Jason A and Alan L: you should have joined our table!!) 

Doubt I'd return unless someone suggested meeting for drinks.  But enjoyed the dim settings of the restaurant all around.  Mysteriously romantic ;0)
author: Ninja H.

description: Had a great time in this place.  The staff was great, food great, but it smells like a dumpster of diareah in the middle of a flounder factory in the mens restroom.
author: Don H.

description: Great atmosphere, margaritas and burritos! Parking also isn't toooooo difficult to find.
author: Julia O.

description:
When I sit at Velvet Cantina I look around and it feels like I'm sitting inside a black velvet painting. Why is that? Are the walls velvety? I'm not sure, but I don't think so. It is very dark in there, but I don't even know if the walls are black. In fact I'm fuzzy on a lot of the details of the surrounding décor, mostly because I'm focused on shoveling queso into my mouth along with guacamole and margaritas. Other details escape my notice when I'm in this state. But, I do always recollect the feeling of being in a black velvet painting, which is supremely cool in my book.

Be ware the margaritas though. They are dangerous - deceptively delicious, inherently strong.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Darn someone stole my 'witty' two words" review. 

Anyway, here goes: Two words: Margarita pitcher.
author: Priscilla M.

description:
Fun casual place for good Mexican food in the Mission.

We had the ceviche, guacamole and Chicken Avocado Enchiladas and all were good.  

I like how the place is small...  the intimacy of it makes it more special.  I can only imagine how crazy the place gets on Friday and Saturday nights (we went on a rainy Tuesday night).  And on Cinco de Mayo?  Friends have said that you can barely walk around.

Need to try the S'mores nachos and Shrimp Diablo next time.  And there will be a next time!
author: Ray M.

description:
Just a quick update to say that it's still good. The food is still tasty, and while they don't seem to have the same focus on custom fancy margaritas that they used to, they're still good, solid well-made margaritas.
Happy they're still in the neighborhood!
author: Don H.

description:
Came here with a friend who was visiting after seeing all the great reviews.

As usual, I had a lot of questions...typical me:P At this place, it was mostly about their sauces...I wasn't sure their chile sauce was going to be "too spicy" for me and was curious how their spicy their "mildly spicy" mole sauce was gonna be. (I like a little spice, but not too much...n everyone ya know has their different spice tolerances...literally and figuratively)

anyways...on with the overly drawn out synopsis: I asked our waiter how spicy the chile and mole sauces were and instead of trying to convince me one way or the other (yes/no it's this spicy), he offered me a very generous sampling of each of the sauces...perfect for dipping with their complimentary chips (and salsa).

the chile sauce was a bit "too" spicy for me personally. as for the mole sauce, it had but a hint of spice (with a really deep chocolate note)---while it may have been on the sweeter end in terms of the variety of mole sauces out there, i liked it cause i like chocolate. i went with the chicken mole. it also featured cinnamon (another favorite thing of mine) done deal. 

moral of the long review= go here and get the chicken mole...if you like chocolate and cinnamon like me :) if not, don't be afraid to ask for samples of things you're not sure about.
author: G L.

description:
I haven't met a margarita I didn't like. 

Until the pineapple margarita here at Velvet Cantina.  

It just didn't do it for me AND I like pineapple!  * sad face * 

Good thing the free chips and salsa made up for it. Big triangles of thick crispy chips with a delicious salsa that's not too chunky. I had the Taco Valentina for my entree: 3 soft corn tortillas with achiote marinated chicken topped with chile cream, salsa and guac. Don't expect Taqueria style greasiness here, the food here is delicious but definitely healthier. The sides are very generous and a lot of places overdo the salt on the Spanish rice, but not here. 

We were celebrating my friend's birthday and our server was sweet enough to give us complimentary dessert S'mores. This is the only dessert they have on the menu and it has nachos with chocolate sauce and burnt marshmallows. It's good and yeah it's a novel idea, but come on people, not the greatest invention out there.

Velvet Cantina is fantastic if you're looking for something low-key and you have 10-12 people in your party. We had good service here and they were able to keep up with our group.  I'd go back for the addicting chips and salsa and the healthy Mexican food, but I won't order the pineapple margie anymore.
author: Janice C.

description:
3hrs after:
Pineapple margarita
Mango margarita
Bottomless chips and salsa (free!)
Pollo ensalada
Chicken avocado enchiladas

... a long day of managing diarrhea and upset stomach.  Called the restaurant and left a message for the manager ... the food from your kitchen made us sick!  Not okay.
author: Matthew K.

description:
Setting was solid. Bass was heavy. 

The price is too high for the neighborhood according to our local bros/gals.

Marg pitcher crushed us. Strong and $28, can I get an amen!? 

Jalapeño pineapple slaw should go on any taco you get. And I would stay away from the pork carnitas, really dry.
author: Max K.

description:
Margaritas are what people come here for the most,

but for me, the food is what draws me here. 

The mole and the cactus (nopales) are incredible.

You kind of feel like you're in an underground Victorian parlor.
author: Solitaire M.

description:
Food: Not your typical Mexican food. The food is high quality, fresh tasting, with respectable portion sizes. I ordered the guacamole to start, it was chunky and delicious. Chips are crispy and salty and oily, they seemed like they were homemade, I would have liked them served warm. The California Chicken Enchiladas were awesome, the jalapeno sauce they served them with made the dish. Prices are great! 

Margarita: Average,  I tried the House and Platinum margarita, they were good but nothing special. 

Service: OUTSTANDING, we were told we would have a 60 min wait but it was only 30 min wait. They texted us when our table was ready but we were a few blocks away so we raced back to get seated, the host gave us the next available table. The waiter was very friendly and did not rush us at all. Food and drinks arrived in normal amount of time.

Ambiance: Loud and dark-but nothing unreasonable.
author: Julie J.

description: Good place. We were a party of 7 two kids included. They were very accommodating. The food was good. The servers were helpful and cheerful.
author: yarah b.

description:
Just came here for a drink while waiting for a table at another restaurant.  Strong margaritas, environment was decent.  

I know it's the mission....so it's no surprise that it's cash only.....but that doesn't mean I like it...

I don't really see the big deal; it's a divey mexican cantina.  Nothing to write home about though.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
For the longest time I thought this place is called "Edibles & Elixirs". Har har silly me.

We came here after dinner for drinks - since we didn't get dessert at dinner, we thought, hm, let's try their smore's nachos!!!!  I was super excited about it but they told us that their kitchen was closed.  Oh what a bummer.  

We ordered a pitcher of margarita - ugh (for personal reasons)!  It was strong and enough to be split between 7 of us.  We had to look for salt to make it more bearable, though!  Apparently all the salt shakers at our table contained flavored salt...

I really liked the ambiance at this place, even though it's small and looked sketchy outside.  Loved the booth seating and the dimness of this place.  It seems like their food is decent as well - maybe next time, and I definitely have to try their smore's nachos!!
author: Peggy S.

description: Eh.. four stars was pretty generous. Velvet Cantina is pretty average. The queso dip is delicious.. everything else, not so much.
author: Aaron V.

description: I love to take my out of towner friends to this spot! Great ambience, booths to snuggle in with a date and attentive staff. The mango fresh fruit margarita pitcher didn't taste like it was made from a mix, über fresh and totally within my price range ($30ish for 7 margaritas we milked out of it) this time we got just drinks and dessert and their one dessert option of S'mores Nachos which will leave you asking for more. 4 people eating one serving left everyone with a hunky portion. I would prefer if they turned down the music a tad to hear my compadres more easily but I love Love love love this place!
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Again I visited velvet cantina...and all I remember was the liquid dinner I had.

The food is ok, sometimes pretty good. The real reason you will find me here is because:

1-I can stumble here after work
2-The bartenders pour a strong drink

It isn't the most authentic Mexican joint in the Mish, but you can order a pitcher of margaritas and slowly feel your troubles melt away.
author: Hilda Z.

description:
This place is awesome.

If you are looking for a chill place to relax, drink good margaritas and eat good food, this is it!  From the outside, it looks like nothing special but inside it's nice and cozy. The servers and bartenders are really cool and very attentive. The cactus enchiladas are amazing!!

It's a good thing I don't live in the Mission because I would seriously eat here every day..
author: Gabrielle N.

description:
Someone yelped that this place is like Chevy's but it's not.

Velvet Cantina's has excellent margaritas with fresh juice!  Their specials on my visit were fresh mango, watermelon and pineapple juice.  The watermelon was my favorite :)  Chevy's only has good margaritas.

Velvet's chips are thick and their salsa is definitely fresh, but bland.  Chevy's chips are thin, crispy, and addicting; and their salsa is tasty!

I had the Shrimp Enchiladas with rice, no beans, and it was better than Chevy's.

Enough said.  Better than Chevy's except for the chips and salsa!
author: Christina L.

description:
Fresh Chips and salsa.

The tri-tip plate was decent.  Waiter said he would recommend the fish tacos, but were sold out.

Margaritas were strong.

I thought it was quite expensive for mexican food.  But it was quite busy on a wednesday night, so they gotta be doing something right.
author: Steven F.

description: 1000 review for velvet cantina deserves a 5 star from me.  Great service by Derek and another guy with long hair (didn't catch his name).  Derek enthusiastically sang happy birthday to two separate tables, despite how busy he was.  Food was awesome as well, including the chicken tortilla soup, which I got to go.  Will definetily go back again!!
author: Shannon S.

description:
We had dinner in the bar.  Sweetheart servers!  Charming & attentive.

When I crave mexican - I want the cozy, crowded neighborhood mom & pop, red vinyl booth experience.  This place is a bit different - in the low-lit, eclectic dive bar way. 

- Tortilla chips are BOMB.  Homemade, thick and crunchy.  If you are looking for the tomato-y restaurant salsa - this is not the place.  Velvet's is more of a finely minced pico de gallo.  Although the flavor is tastier than it looks. 

- Margaritas - they are seriously clean, crisp and on point.

- Achiote steak tacos- seasoned, juicy & tender.  Served with a unique 'slaw (think mexican style kimchi) that does well to cut the heaviness of straight rice & beans.  

- Mushroom empanadas - decadently rich.  Delicious!
author: FancyPant S.

description:
LOVE IT! If you're in the mood for some great Mexican food with even better margaritas, Velvet Cantina totally hits the spot. It's got an eclectic-fun vibe with the most entertaining waiters/bartenders. Seriously, we were chatting with our waiter for at least 20 minutes. 

Here's what we had: 

Shrimp Enchiladas: Absolutely yummy! The shrimp was very fresh and well-cooked and the cheese was perfectly melted on top. But I think what really made this dish special was the avocado crème fraîche... so creamy and buttery, perfectly complementing the shrimp

Chicken Avocado Enchiladas: My friend ordered this dish and it was seriously my cup of tea. The Jalapeño cream sauce and pepper jack cheese totally spiced up the chicken and took the dish to new heights

Naked Relleno: My vegetarian friend ordered this and although I try very hard to steer clear of veggies and anything remotely healthy, I had to succumb to the whims of this dish. The vegetable stuffed peppers with the special Chile sauce were so addictive.

S'mores Nachos: We ordered this since it was the only dessert item listed on the menu. And once we ate it, we understood why. It has pretty much got everything - cinnamon, graham crackers, sugar, chocolate, marshmallows. Oh yeah, and did I mention it is served FLAMING? 

Also, the portions are huge so I definitely recommend wearing your best pair of trendy fat-pants. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
My friend and I decided on this joint to kick off our Cinco De Mayo evening and our expectations were well exceeded.  Upon entering we were informed of the 45 minute wait for a table and we were fine with this as we figured it would be packed and it was!!  

We saddled up to the bar after a bit of friendly "pushing" and ordered a pitcher of pineapple margaritas.  The bartender wasn't quick about it but we were patient considering the 44 shots of tequila he had to pour for a big party at the end of the bar.

First he set a pitcher down and filled it (I mean FILLED it) with ice and my friend and I were thinking "that better not be ours" but it was... And we were patient again.  Next came a pineapple crush concoction and then bottle after bottle of tequila, he literally DUMPED 3 different varieties in amounting to about 20 shots easy.  The pitcher was basically pure tequila with a splash of pineapple.  We weren't complaining.  Somehow he managed to get some fresh lime juice on the top.  Next came the tasting. I don't think I have ever had such a strong margarita in my life!   Pretty soon we were good and buzzed.

After about a half hour we were seated at a fantastic corner table with a view of all the LOUD drunk folk.  We ordered the queso and the naked rellenos (extra on the naked per my request) both delicious.  The chips and salsa were also tasty.  All the waiters were downright adorable, easy on the eyes and friendly with their mannerisms.  We couldn't finish our pitcher of margaritas though we tried.  It was time to move on.  But I'll definitely be back to this hip spot for some more grub soon and maybe a few less margaritas.  Thanks Velvet Cantina for a Cinco De Mayo meal and cocktails to be remembered.
author: A H.

description:
As much as I thank my girls for arranging a lovely birthday dinner for me at VC, I have to also give thanks where thanks are due!

Thanks VC for having us last week. I hope we weren't too rowdy or didn't ask too many annoying California Girl questions about your delicious and hard-to-pick-what-to-order menu. The Birthday Girl (me) had the Santa Maria steak (yum) with grilled veggies (yum) and rice (yum). She loved the guac to start but wasn't a fan of the cheesy sauce like everyone else was. She adored the Smores Nachos dessert but hilariously missed the cue to blow the lit marshmellows out (!!!!). And she also loved loved loved the fact that the bartender didn't have grapefruit juice for her greyhound so substituted grapefruit soda - Mr. Bartender - you have my heart - you are smart AND creative...!

The service was super chill; he was non-intrusive and handled us ladies with grace even if he was super annoyed with us (insert major smiley emotion here).

Can't wait to come back. This place is a steal for what you get: big portions, tasty food and a great, celebratory atmosphere.
author: Meredith R.

description:
This sultry little minx of a Mexican eating house really ranks high on my list for savory south of the border grub. The dimly lit nature of the front room wins over the less moody back room, so make sure you request the darkened den.

The food is pretty good too but maybe not as inspiring as the crafty cocktail bar. Mean margaritas are the business here, but who can say no to some bottomless chips and salsa. Speaking of which, the queso was a winner and the simple chicken tacos were a satisfying treat.

This is a great place for a rowdy meal with friends where catching up and margaritas are the agenda.
author: Monica S.

description: I always have a great time when I come here. Whether it's just for drinks or dinner & drinks. Great place for girls night or for a couple drinks with your significant other! Good time all around.
author: Kellsie F.

description:
Would definitely go back. Not "authentic" by any stretch of the imagination, but very tasty and fresh food. Great drinks, and really good service. It's very noisy, but it definitely has a fun atmosphere.

One funny thing I did notice though was that no women seemed to be working there.
author: Kyle D.

description:
The place is definitely cute. It's dark, homey and has that smell ... like my grandma's house. But the food, for me, leaves much to be desired.

Where's the spice? Where's the pow in my mouth? I need some jalapenos, please. 

I'll give it to them for whipping up a nice side of guac and serving pitchers of margaritas (oh, and very attentive service), but the food just didn't do it for me. Especially the queso. Tastes like powdered cheese. And the cinnamon and peanut butter overwhelmed the mole sauce. I'd just stick with the drinks, chips and salsa here (And the s'more nachos. Just 'cause I'm a fatty.).
author: Farrah A.

description: Great place to celebrate birthdays or just to start your night out. Very good food. Margaritas were awesome. Make reservations if you can. The wait staff was very friendly and we didn't have to wait long for our food:)
author: Shanna M.

description:
Great place! It gets crowded sometimes, but that's not an issue on a weekend if your plan is to go out drinking.

My favorite thing about this place: Margaritas. Holy sh*t. The raspberry margarita tastes like if you crushed a raspberry jolly rancher in the fire breath of God,--if God was literally Bowser and that was actually a thing. The watermelon margarita literally made me orga...I'm not sure if I can say the word, but you get the idea. Think watermelon jolly rancher mixed with a touch of Jesus.

Food is of great quality and tastes awesome. Get the tri tip!
author: Victor A.

description:
The house margaritas are great. Like one of the best margaritas I've ever had. I have not tried their other flavors that seem like maybe they're on the sweet side.

The food is good, not the best mexican you can get in the Mission, but still pretty decent. 

The wait staff is surprisingly friendly and energetic. I'll be back!
author: Maggie C.

description:
Deal with the devil.

One must have been made to create the Shrimp Diablo.

An unholy amount of prawns. A nefarious amount of cactus, onions and black beans (subbed for rice). A hellish kick from the spicy garlic tomato sauce.

So good. So big. Almost couldn't finish it. Almost.

Which brings us to another round of the sinful S'mores Nachos.

Fried tortilla strips, cinnamon, sugar, crushed graham crackers, Mexican chocolate and marshmallows lit on fire as the dish is brought to the table.

Planned on two or three bites. Still wanted more after ten.

Did my will power get signed away in exchange for culinary indulgence? It wouldn't be the first time I accelerated my path towards hell. And it most certainly won't be my last.

Bet they've got those S'mores Nachos down south. Fire included.
author: Jason B.

description: Atmosphere is fun, staff is friendly. Food is ok, chips and salsa were not good at all. I would recommend the corn bread sopas. Smores nachos smelled good. If you are in the Mission district looking for Mexican you can find way better.
author: Eric F.

description:
margarita time!

speaking of time, VC (not an investor, except in your relaxation and sanity), registers somewhere on the anachronism scale but, !no problema!  I like tuck and roll booths and margaritas grandes.  when they bring the pitcher, ask your tablemates what they are having...   we had the normal, coach-class pitcher of margaritas.  bastante tasty especially after two pitchers three ways.

back to present time - the food is standard not-bad mexamericano.  resist the urge to eat too much, you are a very short if wobbly walk to los shucos.  

fun place for groups judging by the parties around us.  go, drink, smile.
author: Bob K.

description:
Its Saturday night and the bartenders have the right attitude which makes all the difference: tip of the hat as they whip up their liquid poetry, a smile when they realize that you've been there before the last time you were in town (well, that wasn't me but my friend was visiting and she was warmly welcomed back). It took a moment for me to notice the bias for tequila, but our bartender was obliging of drinks with other spirits when necessary (I like rum...)

The margarita pitchers seem to be the draw for return customers, and I was barking down the street after that mess!

While there note the chili pepper lights, the scent of burning marshmallow/jabba the hut dessert of some sort, and the pulsing music that gives you a little "uh uh" to bounce to as you go ham on those chips con queso fundido.  

Also, be advised that Velvet Cantina is a "real people" place.  This may or may not be a blaring exception in the area of hip-less-hoppities, if you knowimsayin.
author: Lara W.

description:
This place is ridiculously overpriced for mediocre and bland "Mexican" food. The margaritas are their saving grace because they are strong. Maybe that's the point! If you are too drunk to taste the food, why not give it a 5 star rating? 

The service was terrible, as well. Our waiter forgot about us after we ordered a second round of drinks, and when we reminded him, he made the drinks quickly, himself. They were not half as good as the first ones. 

With so many great Mexican restaurants in the Mission, why pay three times as much for a watered down version of it? 

Avoid, avoid, avoid!
author: C.J. L.

description:
Went here about a week ago for dinner with some friends. Two of us arrived a little early, so we sat at the bar and tried the pineapple margaritas. They were tasty, but I'm not sure why they were hyped so hard in some other reviews.

The place is super tiny. There aren't a lot of tables, so reservations are a good idea. The tables themselves are pretty small too, even the ones with booths, so once all the large plates come out with the different glasses and chips and salsa, the table can get super crammed super quickly.

I had the burrito, most of my friends had the chicken enchiladas with avocado. Overall everything was good, but again, nothing spectacular. I wasn't too big a fan of the chips, super oily, and not as crispy as I'd like. 

For dessert, we had to get the s'mores nachos. Again, hyped super hard in the reviews, but I don't feel that they lived up to that hype. The marshmallows get burnt on the top, and its hard for the different ingredients to mix onto each bite. Overall, messy and hard to eat, and not especially tasty.

Would I go again? Sure, it's a cute little place with a nice ambiance and nice staff. I wouldn't really go out of my way to go though.
author: Brittany P.

description: I am Velvet Cantina's newest fan, and it's obvious that Velvet Cantina has many, many fans. I chose puerco con chile verde as my entree; mostly because I was curious to find out if it is as good as a friend told me. My only complaint is that it was a tad on the salty side, but if you eat it with refried beans, it balances out very well. That also helps to cut the heat, as the dish is quite spicy-hot. The pork was fork-tender and there was plenty of it in the bowl. I would definitely order this dish again. The atmosphere is charming and intimate.  The food is tasty and reasonably priced. Love this place!
author: Aaron D.

description: I planned a big dinner here for my sister's birthday last week. And I have never, ever received such great service from both the host and out witted. We were a little late and their reservations are 2 hours max. Yet the host and waiter did their best to get our food  and drinks out fast! And they kept checking him regarding the arrival of the group that had our table for 9, giving us more time. Honestly, I couldn't have been a happier client. I just wish I could remember both of their names because they represent this business well! Food is solid, drinks are good and good value. Overall, just a great place to have a wonderful and fun dinner. I've recommended it to all my friends. Really happy! Thanks Velvet Cantina!
author: Miriam L.

description: Great food, very fresh. This place has a ton of tequila options, however, as someone who doesn't like tequila, I was hoping for a mojito. Alas, they did not have fresh mint, so that was a bummer.
author: Sa J.

description: I'm pretty sure I just paid $30 to get food poisoning from this place.  The day I ate here, I had pizza and Velvet Cantina. Everyone who shared the pizza with me is fine. Judging by the contents of my expulsions, I'm going to guess Velvet Cantina is the offender.  Literally, I regurgitated my entire meal--none of it digested, after 4 hours.  The peppery salsa was a nice touch.  I had the queso, chile relleno, and pineapple agua fresca.  Then I had 24 hours of terrible.
author: Jolly G.

description: There was a dinosaur pinata sitting at the bar. That's the precise moment when I knew Velvet Cantina would be a great match. The drinks are good -- they make them using fresh fruit, and I ordered the steak tacos -- and the tacos, rice, and beans were flavorful. I also went on a Wednesday night so didn't have to deal with things being too crazy. Plus -- right off the 24th street BART!
author: Mel G.

description:
Velvet Cantina has great drinks, appetizers, enchiladas and service. Darius particularly was very attentive and offered kind and generous service. Viva la cantina! 

GREAT margaritas!
author: Alex S.

description:
I took a group of colleagues here for a social based on Yelp reviews. Here's my own.

Firstly, and briefly, the good: we could get a table for a large group at short notice, and that's a rarity in San Francisco, and especially in the Mission.

Then the mediocre: the food was ok, but I wasn't overwhelmed by anything I ate (which were all vegetarian options). I live in the Mission, and there are a lot of places, big and small, which are outstanding eat-out options. This isn't one of them. I didn't dislike anything I ate, but didn't have the kind of superlative experience that others who've reviewed this place did.

And lastly: the bad. And it was pretty bad. They were playing loud music which was base-heavy and had a high-frequency beat on a poor sound system. The place was full and noisy, so you got to shout over a drumming ompha ompha ompha throughout the meal. I kept on asking them to turn it down (we were easily the largest group there, although no closer to the loudspeakers than others), They would, and then turned it back up. People in my group left early because they couldn't bear it. To be clear: I like a party atmosphere, which is loud and lively. But this was just acoustically painful and irritating, and a reason to never want to go back.
author: William M.

description: Stopped off at Velvet Cantina after being at Beretta down the street for a quick drink with friends.  We hung out at the bar area the entire time and ordered a pitcher of their margarita of the day, which happened to be raspberry.  Raspberry margarita?  Not sure I've had it before, but I'd have it again!  It wasn't strong and overpowering, which basically means that it tasted like fruit juice but kicked like a Manhattan.  The bartender was really nice, and the fact that you get free chips and salsa when you sit down is really great!  The bar crowd was a little unsavory, so I guess that's the only ding against here.
author: Lisa I.

description: Love the customer service. It felt like we were at a friends house for dinner. Warm sensual environment and the food was great! They gave my friend free guacamole and tequila for her birthday. The waiter was always checking on us to make sure we were taken care of. Definitely a favorite.
author: Erin P.

description: I didn't think it was possible but Velvet Cantina was even better than last time!!!  Everything was just as wonderful this time around, except that this time, we sat at the bar and got the pleasure of being served by Rodrigo.  This guy seriously knows what he is doing behind the bar.  I have never in my life tasted drinks as delicious and well-balanced as what Rodrigo was creating for us last night.  Such a fun experience getting to watch him make all the different drinks.  He has such a great energy and had us laughing the whole night!  Not to mention the food was delish as well.  We each got something different than last time.  I got the steak tacos and my handsome date got the burrito again but this time asked if he could get carnitas instead, which he loved!  Velvet Cantina, you have stolen our hearts.  Already can't wait to come back.
author: Jeneah B.

description:
Good afterwork chill place in the mission to grab a drink with some friends. Had standard margaritas, and chips / salsa and queso were all tasty. Service staff was great, really friendly and even gave us a couple food freebies (we of course proceeded to order more drinks)!

The only down part was when the credit card machine didn't work. It hadn't been an issue initially since we had put a credit card down for the tab. Now we had to scrounge up some cash, and run to the ATM outside to get some more to pay off our tab.But the bartender was good and friendly about it, so still giving them 4 stars.
author: Kalpesh J.

description:
Asides from the very tasty queso, this place is marginally between below descent to mediocre.
I guess you could qualify the experience of dining here as atmospheric, if you prefer not to be able to hear yourself think.

The watermelon margarita tasted like a pitcher of backwash.
And holy mole, the chicken mole is beyond pathetic.  
Basically someone plated a very dry and un-flavorful chicken breast on my plate and slapped a very strange tasting mole on it.
Nothing like some true mole sauces I've had, the flavor had none of the rich, complex tastes and was very over salted.

Simply inedible.
Simply not coming back.
author: Ty T.

description:
6 stars for the food, -3 stars for the less than potent overly iced pitchers of margaritas. Where are you hiding the tequila, boss?

"fusion" next to the word "cuisine" usually = comprising the food of both cultures involved, and though they would never use those words here at the Cantina, their blending of Mexi-cali makes for some super delicious grub. Chicken avocado enchiladas TO DIE FOR. 

The next time I drink 4 margaritas though, I want to be so wobbly someone calls me a cab and I can't remember where my car is and it takes me an entire lost weekend to find it. Call me old fashioned.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Strongest margarita I have ever had. Super tasty though. Good bar service, very friendly. Cool small bar area with a sit down area. Wouldn't need too many of these drinks to get the night started!
author: Livia M.

description: So good! Great food and amazing drinks! Went for a casual date night, but would also be perfect for a night out with friends. He had enchiladas and I had an awesome salad - always happy when there is a healthy option. Both were great. Chips were good too. Everything seemed fresh. And there are endless tequila drinks to boot! We left happy and can't wait to go back.
author: Rachel B.

description:
One of my fav in SF.
Great service; good food; great ambiance, and very affordable.
Cactus enchiladas it's my favorite.
For drink, I prefer to start with a Cilantro Gimlet, then beer.
author: Francisco B.

description:
Fun atmosphere, lively bar. 
 
Everyone liked the margaritas and I liked my raspberry aqua fresca. 

Solid food, the chicken avocado enchiladas were very good and the mole was done surprisingly well. I would go back again for sure
author: Tara H.

description: By far my fav Mexican spot in SF! I'm kinda a snob for margaritas and only like fresh ones- no 2.99 margarita mix from 711. Velvet Cantina has some of the best, fresh tasting margaritas I've ever had!Regular or watermelon are my go-to! Chips and salsa are amazing. My favorite dish here are the fish tacos- melt in your mouth! I've come here with just a girlfriend or with a big party of people and everyone always enjoys it!
author: Leanna B.

description:
I was about to give this place 4 stars until i read some of the negative reviews. So to balance out the people that like taco bell more than they like taco trucks I will give a 5.  This place feels fun. Loud, frantic, exciting. I was ready to drink margaritas from the second I walked in, and they have VERY good margaritas. We tried about 3 different kinds, you can't go wrong.   
The food was fantastic. Chips and salsa are so easy to mess up, here they were wonderful. Get the Queso its fantastic.  Steak tacos are some of ...neigh they best steak tacos I have had.  Great food, good vibe and wonderful service. Look forward to going back again.
author: douglas B.

description:
Visiting The City from the Pacific NW where good Mexican food is so darn hard to find. Our cabbie suggested this place and the 40 minute wait for a table (w/no reservations & on a Sat nite @7) was well worth it. 

Ambience: We're not '30 something's' so the music was very loud for our taste. If you're looking for a quiet atmosphere the VC is not for you. The noise level is pretty high. We were happy being seated at a window seat in the dining room behind the bar area. More lit and not as tightly packed. 

Food: We loved the salsa which was hearty and spicy. Chicken avocado enchiladas were to die for. Don't expect it to be smothered and drowned in red sauce. The shredded chicken practically melted in our mouths! Fish tacos on corn tortillas...oh so yummy. Good size portions that I had to use a fork.

Service: From our host to our waiter, for  quite the hopping place the service was really good. Friendly and attentive staff. 

The VC more than satisfied our craving for Mexican food.
author: J F.

description:
Two words: velvet nachos.

They are absolutely incredible.  First, the chips are really good (homemade, I think) - you will notice this right away when you start eating your chips and salsa.  Second, the nachos are covered in homemade queso...WOW.  On top of that, guacamole, crema, etc. etc.  They are unstoppable.  There hasn't been a time that I didn't get these nachos.  I dream of these nachos.  They are the best.

The margaritas are great as well, and can be strong at times (somewhat inconsistent in my experience).  I've only actually eaten a main course there twice (I usually stick with only margaritas and nachos), and wasn't particularly impressed either time.

The first time was some steak dish, which was decent, but the more recent dish I tried was the chicken mole...fairly unpleasant.

BUT, the nachos and margaritas are so good that I can overlook the lack of quality entrees.  And I still haven't mentioned the ultimate topper: the s'more nachos.  The same great chips, covered in crushed graham crackers, cinnamon sugar, mexican chocolate, and topped with flaming marshmallows.  It is amazing.

I highly recommend checking out Velvet Cantina for the lively (yet darker) atmosphere, margaritas, and nachos (x2).
author: Will A.

description:
I continue to go to Velvet Cantina for their great food and sweet margaritas-- and it has become a regular spot for me to take out-of-towners who want decent Mexican food outside of a tacqueria. 

Yet, on my most recent trip, I was impressed even further. Not by a new menu item or a change in decor or even the level of service (which remains great!) But instead by the EXTREMELY attractive staff. Allow me to flex my gay rights here, but I was thrilled to see the entire waitstaff was male and HOT. My crew (of gay boys, so take it with a grain of rainbow salt) all took notice. If this is the usual dinner crew on a Friday night, call me a regular.
author: Bryan B.

description: Had to be the worst food I've ever attempted to eat in the Bay Area. Chips were hard and stale, salsa was like thick, goupy, flavorless water. The beans lacked flavor, the rice was stale and hard and worst of all the fried fish in my fish tacos taste like it had been fried in 2 week old heavily used grease. Gross, gross, gross. I gave it 2 stars because the atmosphere is great, loved the music, loved the peeps. Very diverse and friendly crowd. The servers, host and bartenders were awesome and the drinks were kick azz! I just felt duped by my meal. I basically just left it there. I couldn't even stand to wash it down with a margarita.
author: Tali L.

description:
My mission amigos guided me here and was really good!  I'd call the menu more Tex-Mex but had great empanadas and super authentic sopes which I've only found in a handlful of places across both LA and SF, so blew away my expectations of just being another average Mission gringo food joint.

Super chill staff and good vibe from the clientele so definitely worth checking out (not exactly a news flash with 550 reviews).
author: Geoff C.

description: My friends and I came here for my birthday. I was welcomed with a raspberry margarita and chips as soon as I walked through the door. Once we were seated, the servers were just as attentive. The drinks were plentiful and potent. The guacamole was fantastic. My burrito was the size of a small child. And the s'mores nachos were too big for a table of five to finish. Everything was delicious!
author: Elisha A.

description: This place has great food and service. There are a tonne of Mexican restaurants in the SF mission area, but this would be one of my favorites!
author: Teresa L.

description:
I'm Velvet Cantina's newest fan.

At 4 stars with 481 reviews, it's obvious that Velvet Cantina has many, many fans.

Our group of 7 arrived in stages over a half-hour period. The nice staff had no problem letting us occupy a big table during that time rather than spout the dreaded "we-can't-seat-you-until-your-entire-party-is-here" line.

We killed time with a couple of pitchers of deceptively-strong margaritas. It took only two small glasses for some of us to break into a sweat and start feeling happy. We also demolished a few bowls of insanely good queso dip; being the non-foodie that I am, I thought it was made with Velveeta (shut up...you KNOW you love Velveeta too!), but it's actually made with real cheese and at least a few types of peppers. It is creamy, rich, chile-packed perfection.

I chose puerco con chile verde as my entree, mostly because I was curious to find out if it's as good as mine. Mine's STILL the best, but this came pretty close. My only complaint is that it was a tad on the salty side, but if you eat it with refried beans it balances out very well. That also helps to cut the heat, as the dish is quite spicy-hot. The pork was fork-tender and there was plenty of it in the bowl. I would definitely order this dish again.

When the moment of truth came (THE CHECK), I did a double-take: 6 adults and 1 child ate their fill, including two pitchers of margaritas, and the entire bill, including tip, was $146.

That made my cheap little heart do a queso-fueled dance.
author: Valeria R.

description:
Randomly ended up here last night with a friend I hadn't seen in 7 years and a few of her friends. It was Sunday night but we were still boozing. I was impressed with the drink menu. It wasn't just your typical girly-frou-frou-fruity-sweet-ass drinks. We tried the Gingerly Ginger, Cilantro Gimlet, and Pineapple Margi (names may be a little off). All of them were good, especially the Ginger one! The Cilantro Gimlet was very different, lacked a little flavor but was still refreshing and satisfying. 

For food the 5 of us shared a bunch of dishes. The chicken Mole was chicken legs which I thought was kind of strange. The sauce was yummy, filled with spice and flavor and different than any I've had. The Garlic Prawns were pretty basic, nothing special. The ceviche was definitely a trendy version and wasn't anything I'd order again. The fish was hard cubes and did not taste marinated. The tortilla soup came in a huge bowl and was not what you would expect of tortilla soup. It was thick and remined me more of an Asian egg drop soup. It was incredibly spicy, which normally I like, but this version was almost difficult to eat. Not at all horrible though.

All in all, the food wasn't spectacular but it did the trick and I still like the place. The drinks are definitely original and different, it has a nice dark boothy atmosphere, and the food is priced right (dishes around $12). If I am out this way again, I would go back.....
author: Rachel G.

description:
It's a dive bar! It's a mexican restaurant! It's...Velvet Cantina!

I was in here for 15 minutes before realizing I'd actually be here before, and not because of the tequila shots we took the first time. Confusion stemmed from the fact that while the front area looks like a run-of-the-mill restaurant, there's a full bar in the back room.

Okay, maybe a little bit because of the tequila.

The bar/restaurant intersection makes for an interesting vibe - they blast top 40 music, loud, which you're eating, and while I really enjoyed myself at my roommate's birthday dinner, this definitely isn't a place I'd take my family. With friends though, I can see a leisurely meal turning into drinks, and more drinks, late into the night.

Thumbs up to the chicken enchiladas as everyone else has said. I might have to disagree on the magaritas, though - we tried the fresh fruit one, as watermelon was the choice of the day, and they were a little too strong.

They let you call ahead to put your name on the list, which is a huge plus in my book.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I was really excited to love this place.  But I can barely remember anything about it.  Lackluster?  Apparently.

The chips and salsa were so-so; the chips were great but the salsa lacked major flavor.  
The margaritas were sneaky... meaning I only drank 4, felt fine, but hurled my life out all over my kitchen floor about four hours later.  Hoping it was the drinks and not the food.
I ordered the shrimp enchiladas.  Meh.  The pics on Yelp make them look so much better than they taste.  

Darn.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
I love the food here, well made and with a lot of unique flavors.  They also have a great mixture of drinks.  

The only bad things I would say is that this place is more of a hipster spot, so if that's not your scene you might not like it as much.  

Prices are okay, some people complain about the expensive mix drinks, but if you go to any other place such as the Elephant bar or such, you will find pretty much the same prices for drinks there. 

Anyways, I go here for the food, the drinks and the great service, and not so much for the hipster scene.  

I would recommend to go here when it's not prime time, any restaurant that is crowded will take longer to serve your food and drinks, that's just a given. 

Give it a shot.
author: Christiani C.

description:
When I first heard of this place, I was whelmed.  As in, I had no reaction.  True, I love bad rec room paintings and 1970's cantina decor as much as the next compulsively-ironic southside Friscan, but I wasn't sure I wanted to wait around with a bunch of honkey hipsters to eat fake comida.  

And then I went.  And I got clonked with the velvet hammer.

From the smoooove cheese dip (I've only had it once and it still shows up in my dreams) to the silky margaritas (it's not uncommon to be profoundly drunk here -- and not know it) to the ego-stroking servers (there are several winkers on the payroll), this place will make you feel so velvety, you'll think you've been lovingly swaddled in one of Stevie Nicks' ankle-length capes.  

Vegetarians will feel especially velvety.  Cactus enchiladas?  Don't mind if I do.  No fatback in the beans?  Thanks for giving me an hour of my life back.  (I won't get into how that hour would've been spent...  You deserve a classier review than that.)

I didn't want to love it.  But I do.  So the honkey hipsters and I will dine together.  And I'll be so drunk and full of delicious queso that I won't hardly notice them.
author: Rosie W.

description:
Gneeeeee :(
Not so good. The personell is very very efficient and friendly, but for a Mission place they really need to step it up!!

Everything was flat and too spicy. 

Definitely too pricey for what you eat.

Not impressed.
author: Gianguido G.

description: I love this place! Margaritas are amazing and the guys that work  there are super sweet!  Derek is  my favorite and i especially go on Fridays when he's bartender. Highly recommend
author: L P.

description: Food was delicious!! I got the chicken avocado enchiladas and they melted in my mouth. Lots of flavor. The drinks were great and they had quite an selection of different tequilas. Their house wine was good as well. Inside decor is really dark and it can get noisy really quickly. -1 star for our server. He was rude and rolled his eyes when we told him to come back since we had not decided on our order.. Will definitely go back..
author: Das M.

description: This is a modern hipster/Mexican restaurant/cantina. Great vibe great lighting ,I love the murals on the walls, love the decor. The  fruit margaritas are really good,they're made with fresh fruit, and they're very strong. Always a plus!! The only food I was able to try was a appetizer, The macho queso is regular nacho cheese and chorizo , witch you dip chips into it. It was 9 dollars for a small cup of it. Not worth the money, it was steep for what it is, makes me concerned about ordering anything els on the menu that might be over prices and afraid to be un- impressed . Service was good
author: Jessica S.

description:
Wow! I'd heard of watermelon martinis but watermelon Margarita - that was a first.... 

Nice and cozy and atmosphere at Velvet Cantina while we sipped our watermelon margaritas waiting at the bar for our table.

We got seated quickly. The salsa was super fresh! Usually, I try not fill up on the chips and salsa, but this one, I couldn't stop myself!

My friends and I ordered a vegetarian appetizer to accomodate my dietary preferences. We started with cornbread sopes and WE ALL LOVED IT! For the main course, I ordered the cactus and avocado enchilada and my friends ordered the chicken tacos and enchiladas. 

My veggie enchilada was super delicious, fresh and at the end of it, I did not feel stuffed like I usually do when i eat a whole burrito or enchilada.

Wanted to try the dessert here but decided to leave it for another day.

I wanna go back here!
author: Kinjal S.

description:
3 strikes, and Velvet Cantina is officially off our list of SF restaurants. We attempted to call their restaurant for take out tonight, and after six attempts with no answer, we gave up and called Papito instead.

Sorry, Velvet Cantina. You have lost our business for good.  Shame.
author: Holly B.

description: Love this place. Amazing chips and queso and chips and guac. Had a great chicken enchalada. The margaritas are a great deal and they make them SUPER strong :) The one downfall is the service is a little slow/unpredictable. They are super friendly and will make up for it (with free tequila shots for example) if they get backed up. But don't come here if you want to know for sure you want to eat quickly. But all in all a great spot for medium-priced Mexican (i.e. higher than a taqueria but not Rick Bayless for all you Chicagoans)
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Not bad at all! I enjoyed the HUGE steak taco plate, the margarita pitcher, and the generally non-douchey-but-fun vibe ADJACENT to the main bar. (Tip for those with a large party: Don't sit in the crazy part. You'll regret it. Also you won't be able to hear.) So why only three stars?

Because this is the Mission, and Velvet Cantina is basically a way cooler, better Chevy's. It's not the best Mexican food in the Mission, and you know it. Hole-in-the-wall taquerias are just superior.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
I have absolutely NO complaints about this place. I arrived with my friend to eat some dinner on a Friday night around 8pm. The wait was about 20 minutes so we sat at the bar and ordered a pitcher of their watermelon margaritas. The pitchers are huge, and they don't skimp on the tequila or fresh watermelon puree. The bartenders were funny, and enjoyed conversing with everyone at the bar counter. We were served chips and salsa at the bar while we were waiting for our table which was nice. I must say (and I'm not even close to exaggerating) these were the BEST chips and salsa I've had not only in the city, but ANYWHERE. A fresh tomatoey taste, and the chips were light, salted perfectly, and warm. I crave their chips and salsa just about every day.

We were seated at a table right around 20 minutes later and were handed more chips and salsa and some menus. I ordered the naked relleno with rice and beans. It didn't take long to get the food out to us and our server was outstanding. Not only did I experience the best chips and salsa ever, but this was seriously the best chile relleno I've ever had as well. Be forewarned... the relleno is SPICY. It was almost too spicy to eat (ALMOST). But I ate every single bite. The refried beans were thick, not soupy, and the rice was perfectly cooked (and you could tell it hadn't been sitting in a serving pan for hours as some restaurants tend to serve crispy spanish rice). 

I had a wonderful experience here, and can honestly say that this may be one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I'll probably be back every week.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Excellent margaritas.

Excruciatingly painful wait, even if you have reservations. It's just so crowded and loud and claustrophobic. 

Food isn't bad and portions are huge. 

In theory, this is a fun place to start out your night, but given the long wait, slow service and heavy food, you might want to end your night here...
author: Richa A.

description: Delicious! We moved to San Francisco four months ago and have finally found REAL queso! You're from Texas if you understand what that means. Fish tacos were a little bland but the rice and beans were fresh and tasty. We also had the avocado chicken enchiladas and were very satisfied. Margarita pitcher ($30) served about 10 drinks! No joke. Definitely going back.
author: Kyle L.

description: Great food and great service.  Darius the bartender was great, fast and remembered my drinks.
author: Nino P.

description: The food was fresh and incredible. We had our family of six with us. Every item ordered was fresh and tasty. The margaritas are the best. Strong! We will be back. Love the Mission District.
author: Kim M.

description: Found a hair in my food, waiter said "that's disgusting" and walked away. No sorry, no compensation. Horrible.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great music, but the scene is a little rough on the edge. Had a pitcher of Margaritta and that made the night.
author: Ashley F.

description:
Very cool Spot! I went there randomly with 2 friends and it was a very cool experience. It was crowded especially on a weekend night but the crowd was very interesting. velvet Cantina is a great place to have Margaritas, lots of Margaritas but still have amazing food to satisfy your appetite if you're hungry.

Very cool place! I highly recommend it! Lots of FUN!

Thanks Velvet Cantina!
author: Tony D.

description: Boyfriend and I spent an hour and 2 pitchers of damn good margaritas waiting for our friend.  The staff was realistically and authentically warm and friendly with us, joking with us and never making us feel guilty taking up a table in such a packed restaurant.  Friend arrived, various types of margaritas were happily consumed.  I don't remember what we each ordered to eat, but we all were happy, and enjoyed bites of each other's entrees too.  Good music, nice level of red light and darkness.  We left drunk and full.  We spent the rest of the night wandering the mission ordering margaritas from each bar, comparing them to velvet's and they FAILED!!  We will be coming back.
author: Katie H.

description:
This is my favorite mexican place in SF. super tasty food, attentive help, and killer margs. 

Only thing is, beware your timing... could be a wait.
author: Tiff ..

description: Dark ambiance.   Deep groove music.  Stiff/cheap drinks.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
This review is based only on a quick drink experience I had, I did not sample any food. 

I want to like Velvet Cantina because it's not that far away from where I live, and the ambiance is fun, but the service, at least at the bar was atrocious.  I was waiting for a table at Beretta, up the street and was told there was a 30 minute wait time.  Just the right amount of time to go grab a drink at Velvet Cantina....which would have been perfect except that it took 15 minutes to even order a drink and then almost another 10 before I got my drink.

This was on a Wednesday night at about 7:30pm, the place was hoppin' but not packed.  The bar tender looked at me multiple times, but never so much gave me an "I'll be with you in just a minute" or a "sorry for the wait" when he did finally take my order.

There were three of us in total, and we would have been happy to drink a couple of drinks each in those 30 minutes, but instead we all had a velvet margarita that wasn't as good as it should have been considering it took 25 minutes to order and get our drinks.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Love this place! Great Margarita's...(do I need to write anything else?). 

This little place serves the best chips/salsa. The guacamole, if you buy it, is amazing. The food is not your standard Mexican 'fare' and is so wonderfully fresh.. We keep going back for more and more and more...

Love it!
author: Mark M.

description:
This review is only for the bar as I had heard the margaritas were really good. How in the world on a Friday night is this place heavily packed as a can of sardines at 6 in the evening?! All I was asking for were a few drinks, not to be seated to eat. 

It was awkward because you come in and the place is a tad small for a restaurant. Pretty dark in there too, though Velvet Cantina stays true to it's name, it was dark and velvet-y. The lights were dim and had a red glow or gloom? 3 of us girls waited for a spot to clear, but apparently everyone had just started to drink so we were awkwardly standing in a random place almost near the bathroom just waiting not being acknowledged yet until someone said "uh, yea we're full. sorry."

Left, ate somewhere else (many options sine we're in El Mission here!) came back around 8 and wow! It has cleared up! Was ready for the margaritas! Bartender recommended what was good, blueberry or pomegranate? Hm, mixed? ...Bad idea. Tho, at least he was nice enough to remake a new one, one fruit choice this time. These margaritas were strong! 

Overall experience, meh it was ok...at least most of the staff and bartenders were nice young gentlemen - nice eye candy for all the ladies out there *wink.
author: Christine F.

description: Great food & drinks. Service was friendly & attentive.  Will definitely go back.
author: Johna W.

description:
Solid nor-cal style mex food. 

Salsa and chips were good, although, I personally prefer a spicer salsa. I ordered the verde chicken enchiladas with avacados. Again good but not mind blowing. Rice and black beans were tasty. 

Overall nice dark atmosphere. The food was good and the service was too. I'm not sure if I would go back with so many Mexican joints in the area that serve equal or better food.
author: Jade W.

description:
I hail from a land of supreme Mexicanity (San Diego). It's always interesting to experience "Mexican food" in other cities besides my own... because it usually sucks arse. Sorry San Francisco, but your Mission-style burritos don't hold a firecracker to the Baja-style eats in the 619.

Velvet Cantina isn't necessarily a burrito joint, but they do OK Mexican grind. It's more Tex Mex than anything else, but it's not as good as most of the places I've tried in Bush Country. 

The chicken mole--not bad. 
Chicken enchiladas--not the worst thing I've tried. 
Queso--YUM! They definitely did that right. Queso is delicious. Margaritas--um, can anyone say sugar coma?

The ambiance is pretty dope. It's one of those places you can hang at all night long. I really dig that about a restaurant. No pressure to leave and completely comfy. The staff are cool as well, so that adds to the welcoming environment.

I honestly have no clue where I'm going when I visit San Francisco, because my co-workers just pile in a cab and throw out strange addresses. Looks very similar to almost every other neighborhood in San Francisco I've eaten at. Is that a common theme in the Bay Area?
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Latin Mexican cuisine,  Luscious margaritas, Low-key, Lively crowd

'Oh my' portions, Original favors, Outstanding vibes, Outright yummy

Very fresh, Vegetarian available, Varied menu, Vast selection

Easy for groups, Energetic service, Excellent value, Eating here again?


Hecka yes!
author: Jessica T.

description:
So. Effing. Good.  

My mouth waters when I think of the avocado and cactus enchiladas. And the pineapple margarita was delicious (but not cheap, but worth it).  I don't know what that incredible spicy cabbage slaw was, but I loved it.  People at my table had the fish tacos and steak tacos and thought they were good but not great.

Seriously, I want those enchiladas right now.
author: Chelsey B.

description:
If you are in the Mission with 4 of your fabulous friends and are planning a trip, then chances are you should go here.

Because spending the entire time staring at the cute waitstaff is really the entire reason you should come. Interjecting each part of the planning process with, "oh baby, you can totally forget my water so I can watch you walk away again", and "No, I think THAT one is hotter. Are you out of your mind?!" is commonplace by the end of the meal.

I had their ensalada de manzana (which means apple salad in spanish, THANKS ALISSA), and of course the only reason was because it had GOAT CHEESE. I LOVE goat cheese. And the salad was muy bien. Muy.

The pineapple margaritas were good, but not *awesome*. I will be trying the mango ones next time. To each his own, I suppose?

I would gladly have everyone's babies here. I mean I would totally come back.

That's what I meant.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Beware the SBD (silent but drunky) margarita pitchers...

Holy hell. I'm thinking I'm all sober and stuff, and then I stand up and realize I'm pretty much 7 sheets of tequila to the wind. Damn. Fresh watermelon seems to be the only thing that can get me to down the devils poison, and in hefty quantities...apparently. Just sayin', check yo self. 

Chips + guac + queso + salsa + nachos + quesadillas + margaritas + chicken tacos = the urgent need for sweatpants. 

Seriously, those chips are laced with something divine. 

Service was fantastic, accommodating, and the man/boy taking care of our table was frankly, delightful. Maybe that's why I kept ordering all those drinks? Dunno. 

Good stuff...good mood, sweet vibe, and sweet jesussssss, the margaritas.
author: Colleen C.

description: The restaurant is the best in San Francisco for tequilas, nachos, Mexican fusion food and of course exceptional service! The atmosphere is also kick-in it and I would recommend this restaurant to everyone in San Francisco!
author: Gregory B.

description:
How can I complain about a place where 4 friends can share a pitcher of yummy pineapple margaritas, awesome thick and crunchy homemade chips (much better than Papalote!), and enough food to feed 8 friends for $23 a head?? I CAN'T! Not when the food is mad decent and the beans will keep you fartin' til Tuesday. MMmmm! 

My Tri-Tip was tender, juicy, and super duper flavorful with cumin. The rice and black beans were on point. Not fried and not soggy. Ole! And hole mole, were those mixed veggies it came with incredible! And the salsas all our plates came with were fresh, house made, and spicy. Arrriba!

The place is fun and funky with velvet and sparkly curtains! The servers are super nice! And the quality of the grub for the price point is damn good! I think I'll be in the mood for Mexican more often after discovering this little gem.
author: Raquel C.

description:
I came here with a group of 35 peeps and we took over the area in the back.  This is one of those restaurants where the chips are so good that you can't stop eating them. This is also one of those places where the margaritas are just as addicting (especially the watermelon margarita!). Thank goodness for all those chips or my colleagues would have seen a whole new side of me dancing on the tables!

As for the entrees it was a pre-selected menu with 3 choices: steak tacos, chicken enchiladas, or mole chicken. To be honest none of them sounded great to me, but I opted for the enchiladas. Most people got their food after about 30 minutes, but for some small reason my table of 6 or so people didn't get our food until about an hour after everyone else.  And so we ate more chips and drank more margaritas.
