Once my enchiladas finally arrived I was surprised to find that I actually do like enchiladas (who knew?) and regretted filling up on all those chips.  Somehow I discovered some more room for the enchiladas and pretty much cleared my plate...and I wonder why my jeans feel tight after my trip to SF??

As for dessert Velvet Cantina topped their tasty chips with chocolate and marshmallows.  There was officially no more room in my stomach for this, but I'm not quite sure how I feel about smores made out of chips anyway...even Velvet Cantina chips!
author: Andrea R.

description:
I was expecting a dimly lit lushy velvety sexy food experience, in part because their awning is painted with allusions to such.  I was a tad disappointed though.  There was a surprising lack of velvet in the decor, and the atmosphere was much more "WOOHOO TEQUILA" than "oh baby, let me lick the salt from your rim".  

Observation #1, IT'S LOUD IN HERE!  WOOHOO! 

Observation #2, bar tenders are hot

Observation #3, where's the velvet?

They have you enter through the bar side which sets you up for an awkward moment of trying to find someone to help you.  There doesn't appear to be a host, so I guess you just shout over to the bar tender that you want a table.  The initial seating process is a bit clumsy.

Once we were seated in our not velvet booth, service was pretty good.  The chips were fresh but a little greasy, and the salsa was weird tasting.  My enchiladas were yummy, but nothing to write home about.  

I dunno, I'm not sure this place is quite alluring enough to seduce me away from the sea of taquerias calling my name all around.
author: Linda L.

description:
I'm sure that at least a few of the lbs I gained in SF last week were from my dinner at Velvet Cantina... but you know what?  I would do it all over again!

Colleen nailed it in her review when she said "Chips + guac + queso + salsa + nachos + quesadillas + margaritas + chicken tacos = the urgent need for sweatpants."  That is exactly how I felt...

Sub the margaritas for Coronas in my case, and I was ready to be rolled back to my hotel after dinner!

Service was fantastic, food was some of the best Mexican I've had EVER, and company rocked!  

Check out VC for a group meal or on a date - you'll enjoy it for sure - just make sure you have sweatpants ready or at least an elastic waist of some sort!  Gracias VC!
author: Gabi M.

description:
This place was a little bit sketch going to, but it was some of the best Mexican food I have EVER HAD! 

I usually will eat just anything and expect it to be mediocre, but I ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas and they were AMAZING! ($11.95). My friend ordered the Chile Verde ($12.95), which was also amazing. I'd have to say-the best i've ever had. 

We also had some good ceviche, chips and salsa were yummy, and some margaritas that were a bit strong. 

ambiance- cool, dimly lit
service-great and attentive 
alcohal-full bar and margarita pic hers 
prices-moderate 

My advice: Pineapple margarita and anything on the menu. Must TRY!
author: Heather H.

description:
Yes, you are probably going to wait forever for a table. But you know what, it's ok because all you have to do is get a $30 margarita pitcher that is basically all tequila and touch of lemons, and you won't care about your wait at all. 

Hint: Tip well and your second pitcher will be twice as strong.. if that's even possible.
author: Mariko F.

description: Really awesome atmosphere! Red lighting & a mirrored bar. This is a great place for a drink at the bar. Unfortunately the food is subpar. The enchiladas were small, the potatoes undercooked, and there was barely a sauce. I wouldn't really recommend dining here. The food was disappointing.
author: R. J.

description: Great chips and salsa. The guacamole was good too but pretty over priced. The perfect margarita was great, it's made with agave and not triple sec so it's not as sweet as most. Their black beans were FANTASTIC. Probably some of the best black beans I've ever had. I got the steak tacos and they were alright. Good flavor but the steak was pretty chewy and a little fattier than I like but the tortillas were good. Overall recommended.
author: Grace P.

description: Awesome place! Love the food and their margaritas. The staff is always on point. I have been going to this place for the past 5 years and they always shine! Just sit  at the bar and Darius or Gabriel will make you some kick @$$ margaritas. Gets pretty packed Fri and Sat so you will have to wait but it's still worth it.
author: Ed F.

description:
Timing was probably my issue, showing up at 6:30 to meet a friend without a reservation.  That said, do you really need to hold 6 empty tables for 30 minutes?  And when you tell us we need to wait until 7 (fair, reservations come in), when I ask at 7:15, why suggest a group table that must have been available for the last 45 mins?

Food was solid+...high-end Mexican, but still not really enough vegetables/creativity to elevate it to anything more.  People seemed to like the scene, and I'm sure it's a fun crowd if you're in the right mood.  I'm just not sure how this place is better than the majority of other options in the Mission.
author: Trent W.

description:
I like where it is,
i like the dark booths inside and dark lighting and i like the color red
i like the tacos, the ceviche, the gaucamole
the chips and salsa- chips are thick and homemade
their special gimlet margarita- it has lime and cilantro in it and is shaken. 
the service is nice.
It's comfortable in a sleazy 70's sort of good way.
It's one of my favorite little mexican places to go to.
author: Noe'lle M.

description:
There is Subway sandwich people and there Is Quiznos people. Both think that they have good taste, when in earth's reality they both have bad taste. 

U could also say there are Chevy's tex mex people and Velvet Cantina fresh mex people. Both might think that  they love authentic refried beans and sour cream, but both are wrong. Velvet Cantina was mediocre at best, but I suppose it was better than Taco Bell. 

Actuallys, I would rather have beef supreme Chalupa than enchiladas at Velvet (no velvet in sight) cantina. I know my latin food (see my cHIpotle review!!!) but COME ON. At least my date finished her margarita and came back to my house :)
author: Merland S.

description:
Most important--- the waiters here are hot!!!  

For some reason, there are always super cute waiters here, and they are always really fun. I've come here several times for birthdays, etc., and it's always a blast.

Great ambience and fun music.  The later you go, the more they blast the music, which is super fun. The generous complimentary salsa & chips kicks a**. For appetizers, I am obsessed with the queso con chile (so good you want to just dive in and swim laps around in the bowl if you could). The empanadas are great, too. 

The margaritas here are AWESOME!  We couldn't decide between the watermelon, mango, and traditional margaritas, so our hottie waiter brought over samples so we could decide. 

For main courses, I am obsessed with the Chile Verde with Pork, it's fantastic. The enchiladas and burrito are good, too. My friends have gotten the chicken mole in the past, and every time they order it they often think it's too rich and chocolatey, so just a warning (maybe ask the waiter for a sample of the sauce before ordering, just in case).

Also, for dessert, the churros with chocolate, as well as the s'more nacho plate thingy they light on fire is amazing!!!!

Portions here are really generous--- I suggest splitting food and instead ordering twice as many drinks, because frankly, when you're in the Mission on a Friday or Saturday it's best to invest in your tequila consumption.
author: Jessica L.

description:
THE BEST MARGARITA'S I HAVE EVER HAD HANDS DOWN!! 
THE BEST SALSA I HAVE EVER HAD HANDS DOWN!! 
THE BEST TACO'S  I HAVE EVER HAD HANDS DOWN!!

I went during the day so not a lot of people where there, the music was blasting and I was getting drunk...that equals a good ass time (-=
author: Kitty G.

description:
Had a great Friday night! From the moment my friend and I walked in we could tell it was going to be a good night. The atmosphere of this place is great- young and trendy. A good group of young professionals and not sketchy people given the area. The BEST chips and salsa! I mean I have had chips and salsa at many many many Mexican places and I would give them the award! AMAZING. I woke up the next morning wanting Valvet Cantina's chips and salsa. 

I got the chicken tacos and they were good. The service was great and I would come back in a heartbeat! 

4.5 stars!
author: Aneliese R.

description:
I love this place, I recommend it to everyone, if you like great Mexican food and bold margaritas you should go there as soon as you can fit it into your schedule.

- Takes reservations
- Cozy corner booth for 5 where you can see all the action
- Chicken and avacado enchiladas
- Margaritas by the pitcher (not frozen, just rocks)
- Can accommodate larger groups
- Enticing vegetarian options
- Great salsa and chips
- Is also, literally, a cantina, so gets boisterous on drinking nights

If you need it to be quiet, go somewhere else so as not to ruin it for yourself, but if you are gearing up to go out this place has the perfect spirt and some of my favorite food in SF.
author: Megan G.

description: Sorry velvet cantina. The only Good part of My night at This place was leaving It. It was small, musty And extremely loud. Drinks were not at a reasonable price which is not a Good thing when the drinks are not good flavor wise. Worst margaritas I ever had the salsa was disgusting. Didn't bother to try The actual food after those fails.
author: Adrian A.

description:
We had a girls' night dinner planned here for 8pm on a Friday.  Because of unforeseeable BART issues, the last of our party did not arrive until almost 45 minutes after our scheduled hour.

During this wait, I decided to have a fresh fruit (watermelon) margarita.
And another.
Let's get some chips and salsa at the bar too, while we wait.
And why the hell not just get a whole pitcher? (Split between 3)

And so, I did not care one whit that we did not eat dinner almost an hour late.  The margaritas were fantastic, the chips and salsa were great.

I don't remember what I ended up ordering for dinner...
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Came here already wasted after watching the World Cup in the park several years ago.  

Finally found it again a few weeks ago and it was just as good now as it was 5 odd years ago.

Great reasonably priced food, attentive staff and cool digs.

Watermelon Aguafresca Margaritas are no joke.
author: Double L.

description: Came to this place for the first time, nice atmosphere and good music. Ordered a chicken burrito and it was okay. I go all over the mission searching for the best Mexican food and although this place is cute it's definetly not a place I would come back to for food. I think this is more of a cocktails with your girlfriends kinda spot.
author: Julia ..

description:
Fact: Velvet Cantina is my first dining experience in the Mission since I've lived in San Francisco. (Apparently, I don't get out much.) It's been on my list of places to try- so I was super excited when the boyfriend said "Forget the gym today! Let's go to VC!"

We Had:

- A Pitcher of the House Margaritas, which were by far the most memorable part of our meal...and probably why I don't remember a whole lot of it.

- Chips & Salsa (Loved the greasy, thick chips...salsa didn't "wow" me.)

- He had the steak tacos...he liked them, but didn't love them.

- I had the Tacos Valentinas (sp?). These were delicious. I'd absolutely order them again, but there are so many others things I'd like to try!

The place is gritty and grimy, and the wait staff are friendly and fun. I'd certainly come back for the Margaritas alone! (They're my favorite in the city to date!)

However, with so many other options in the Mission, I've got a lot to try before I establish an absolute winner.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Impression upon first stepping in? Looks like something straight out of the Orient...(not that I've been or anything).

The place was dimly lit and all I noticed were the completely red walls. Couples were seated in a few booths and small groups of friends were socializing with dinner and pitchers of margaritas at the smaller tables. 

Apparently the Velvet Cantina is known for their margaritas. I personally had never heard of this place prior to coming here with some friends. 

The margaritas were a bit stronger than I prefer.

This bar is great for grabbing drinks before heading out for a night of dancing at the Make-Out Room!
author: Elaine T.

description:
I had such a nice time here ... and I'm not saying that because I was already 3 margaritas deep!  Sat at the bar, the bartender was a doll (though not sure if he read this how he'd feel about being called a "doll").  I had the Tri Tip - medium rare and my homie had the cactus enchilades.  They were generous with the chips and salsa and the meal itself was very tasty.   This means a lot coming from me because generally, outside of steak houses or my own grill, I don't usually order beef ... but the meat was tender and juicy and just the right amount of bloody.  Not bad for a cantina eh?

They've got (what looks like) a great selection of tequila.  Their menu margaritas sounded delicious - but the flavors were mild.  This isn't good or bad either way, but just a heads up.  I believe that evening the seasonal flavors were cantalope, peach and pineapple.  I had the peach margarita and it was very subtle ... not bad mind you, but I sort of wanted a fruitier drink.  In retrospect though - I will admit it's a good thing it wasn't super sugary and sweet because this was 1 stop amongst many that evening.  

Before we paid our bill, we did a shot of Corozon ... and the bartender gave me one on the house because he felt bad for taking my glass of ice before I was finished with it.  In other words, he totally didn't have to ... but it was a nice guesture.  I'd definitely like to be back.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Cool restaurant located in the Mexican barrio of San Francisco. Hard to find a spot to park, bring your quarters for the meter. Parking is free after six pm. 

Food was awesome! I had the chicken avocado enchiladas and they were delicious. My buddy got the Chile Verde plate, which was also super bueno. Stick with the regular margaritas, the mango margs were not that great.

Overall good experience, enjoy some good Mexican food without worrying about your Daily value intake hehe.
author: Steven R.

description:
A beber y a tragar, que el mundo se va a acabar... ;0)

Love the low key vibe. The local flavor. Stellar margaritas - none of that mix crap, all fresh, all the time. Chips. Salsa. Queso. And the kind of Queso I dig - that gooey, spicy yummy kind. And oh yah, the hot Waiters. Bartenders. Think Abercrombie ad. Mmmmmm...

The best part?  The company!!! Finally a night out and we did it up - right! ;)
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description:
San Diego girl about to speak about Nor Cal Mexican food. 

 Ok, so this is not your grease bucket totally yummy dripping off your burrito into your clogged arteries Mexican joint (God I miss SD), but it is really good food! 

Love the rice! The chicken tacos are also really well done. We have been here a few times for events and the staff has been pretty good about things. 

Yup, we will be back for sure!
author: Kat M.

description:
I dig this place. Now I've only been for drinks so don't credit this review for anything more than awesome margarita's with fresh squeezed juice and great late night drink specials (11pm-12am - $3 Margaritas, $2 beers, and $3 Fernet shots!). Their bartenders are friendly, attentive and knowledgable. I stumbled over here the other night after the YEE @ Nombe and they were more than accomodating for the 15 or so of us that showed up at 10pm to take over their bar area. 

I'll definitely be back (they had me at $3 fernet shots!!)
author: Kristy M.

description: The house margarita was not very delicious but the chicken burrito was out of control good! Free chips and salsa are of course always a bonus. The atmosphere was really awesome. Made me feel sort of old school retro. Red lights throughout. Good service. I will definitely go back and refer friends.
author: Rich S.

description:
$23 pitcher margaritas. . . .STRONG margaritas but strong in the laced with a heck of a lot of real lime juice so you can't taste the tequila sort of strong. 

Best enchiladas I've had in San Francisco. The Chicken and Jalapeno enchiladas are SO good. I spilt entrees with a friend and tried the Achiote (sp?) steak tacos which were also out of this world. Normally I stick to the main item and skip the rice and beans but even the R&B situation was laced with flavor and spices. 

Great margaritas, reasonably priced, kitschy decor, overall a great experience. I would come here alot more often if it wasn't a $30 round-trip cab ride to the Mission.
author: Heather A.

description:
We took a relatively indirect route to the Velvet Cantina...via Beretta to be exact.

We parked on 23rd and passed the swank VC signs on our way to Beretta, where we spent 17 minutes playing the hipster version of frogger trying to get a drink at the bar. I could see the agitation mounting on my date's face at the frenetic vapidity that surrounded him.  He is a walking Zagat and this was actually a pivotal night in our relationship.

Sigh.  

The night I officially got off the hook for EVER having to pick a restaurant again. Thank you Beretta and a big shout out to the uber vexing guy in the tweed turtleneck- kiss kiss!  Needless to say, we bolted.

As we opened the heavy wood door of the Velvet Cantina to the red pleather booths, the warm crowd celebrating Mindy's 26th birthday and the two empty seats beckoning us from the bar,  I think a tear actually formed in my eye.   

The jovial bartender, Derek, served us up a gynormous batch of the best homemade tortilla chips I have possibly ever eaten.  They were the size of a human head and so salty they literally glistened..and for me that is a good thing....a very good thing!

We ended up splitting a pitcher of watermelon margaritas:
  a) not my idea
  b) an idea the next morning we swore never to repeat  

But we will never regret the creamy guacamole and savory chipolte chicken chiliquiles.  The latter being far more crunchy or 'nacho' style than say the ones at Mamacitas...but delish nonetheless!

Though in reality it was only a number of yards from Beretta it felt a happy world away!

On our second visit the bartender graciously indulged my whim for a custom drink that consisted of watermelon aqua fresca with gin!   See a girl can learn from her mistakes!
author: Josie J.

description:
The food here is pretty forgettable, especially when there are so many other good Mexican/Central American places nearby.  However, the service is good and they do have an impressive array of tequilas.

Think of Velvet Cantina as the Mission version of Chevy's ... Group-friendly American-Mexican food with big ass margaritas, perfect for an after work outing where you drink up the nerve to hit on your hot new coworker.
author: Dave S.

description:
Yuck!   VC fails the chips and salsa test, fails the beans test.  Tacos weren't bad but were somewhat soggy from all the guacamole.   On the whole, a sorry interpretation of Mexican cuisine.  Rarely have I been so turned off by refried beans, which were seasoned with what tasted like american chili powder and whipped to a thick, poopy consistency.  The chips tasted like yesterday's doughnuts, very poor.  Salsa was gringo-style (which can sometimes be good, not bashing it for that) and insipidly bland.  Perhaps a jalapeño was waved in its general direction at some point but I doubt even that.  I don't know what the deal in the kitchen is, but they're not trying.  Throw a rock outside the door (as I like to cliche) and you will hit someone's Mexican grandma who can show you how to make decent beans.  

The bar does pour a stiff cocktail, hence the 2nd star.
author: Jared L.

description:
A self-proclaimed "modern" restaurant needs to know that in order to me modern, they must provide superior and competitive foods and drinks. I feel as though I got half of that, and half standard mediocrity.

This is the restaurant of poor pairings. The tortilla chips are crisp and fresh, not too salty, but paired with the thinnest, most lackluster salsa I've ever had. It's like pico de gallo, but with all the tomato removed, leaving some measly juice and tomato pulp behind. So sad. My chile verde had the perfect sauce, but the corn tortillas it was served with were bland and cold. The rice was disappointingly mediocre.

The margaritas, on the other hand, are so lovely. Upon ordering a pitcher, it came with a stirrer and two glasses with salted rims. The waiter even poured our drinks. And so next time, I'll just hang out at the bar with my $25 pitcher of margarita.

The music is also too loud, there are many drunken women (who my boyfriend speculated don't get out too much), but the paintings on the wall are fantastic. Everything just can't be right.
author: Peter H.

description:
I enjoyed the food (as in the entrees), but definitely NOT the queso.  Being from the midwest and having queso as an option (more like a staple) at EVERY TEX-MEX restaurant in middle America, I was soooo excited to hear it was on the menu at Velvet Cantina.  

QUESO=DISAPPOINTING! It  tasted like it was made from powdered cheese and I couldn't even tell there were chili peppers inside because it was so bland.  I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but the tabasco sauce I drenched it with along with the heavy salt and pepper sprinkling didn't even work, and tabasco makes everything better in my opinion.  We also started off with the ceviche, which came with citrus marinated white fish with pineapple, mango, cilantro, and tomatoes, which was OK, nothing great though.  Many, many, other places in SF kick their rear when it comes to ceviche.

The entrees were the highlight of the meal as we split the chicken quesadillas, the chicken and avocado enchiladas and the achiote steak tacos.  Everything was fabulous!  The table favorite was the chicken/avocado enchiladas which came with a lovely and flavorful jalapeno cream sauce, a spicy pepperjack cheese, and a yummy cilantro pesto sauce.  Very flavorful--I wanted more than I was allotted!  The steak tacos were also wonderful, though the steak was on the tougher side and I was unable to keep my taco assembled correctly, which made it hard to eat.  The tacos were stuffed with thin strips of beef marinated in achiote and lime juice, with pepperjack cheese and avocado.  The chicken quesidillas were simple and exactly how a chicken quesadilla should be.

All entrees are served with your typical rice and beans (beans good, rice was kind of dry) and an amazing mexican slaw made with cabbage marinated with something like red wine vinegar. Delish! 

Service was great and ambiance was fun.  Great music - think Bloc Party, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, Muse, etc.  For for some reason I was expecting it to be a fancier Mexican restaurant, but it definitely wasn't that, but nicer than a dive I suppose.  Service was fast, efficient, and friendly and the one drink I took a sip of was awesome - something like a Cilantro Gimlet. Delish, I'll be getting that if I ever make it back.
author: Jenny W.

description:
This place just makes me happy. Everything from the location, decor and the damn cute waiters/bartenders.  

We ordered a pitcher of watermelon margarita to start off. It's $28 for about 6 glasses. It's a great deal if you are with some people, or an alcoholic. 

Food was pretty good, but I've had better. Chicken tacos: very well marinated chicken with just the right amount of everything else. My friend got the ceviche and nachos, but I didn't get to try it. They looked delicious and the plates were empty at the end. The chips were on the greasy side, not a huge fan. 

Overall, a cool place to get your tequila/mexican food fix.
author: Emily T.

description:
What a great find...!  If I hadn't heard about it from a friend, I would've never found this place.  The food is great, the margaritas are cheap, and the service is really prompt and nice.  After nachos, entrees, multiple pitchers of margaritas and tip, it ended up being $40 per person (which isn't bad considering how much food and drink we had!).  

Great place for groups considering that they take reservations...!
author: Wendy L.

description:
This place is still solid! It's been a while since we've been and I was a little bummed to see that my all time favorite salad in the world is no longer on the menu. However, it forced me to spread my wings and I loved their take on the relleno I had instead.

Tasty drinks, tasty food and what really stood out is the service. It's chill, they don't get all up in your business. What I really appreciated was on my error, I ordered a flavor of margarita I didn't like. I should have known better, it wasn't my favorite fruit flavor so naturally it wasn't going down smooth for me. I hate sending things back so I simply ordered another - they asked why I apologized for not liking it and whattddaya know, they comped the drink I didn't like.

A nice touch, and I'll continue to pop in now and then.
author: Allegra F.

description: Apparently one of those rare Mexican joints in the Mission that has amazing food, ambiance, *and* awesome margaritas. Highly recommended.
author: Zach M.

description: Loved the chile con queso, hands down the best I've ever tasted! The pitchers of margaritas were perfect for our table of 5, we will definitely go back! Oh yeah and the s'mores nachos for dessert were amazing they torch them for you at your table!
author: Holly G.

description: Will definitely come back.  Love the food, strong drinks, good service.  Lots of people here.  I love it!
author: Kevin J.

description:
Thanks to Velvet Cantina, I had the best 21st birthday dinner.

I commend them for being able to handle our party of 22 people. The staff was amazing and managed to squeeze all of us in their small dining area (1 star docked for the cramped space). We all had pitchers of margaritas, the strongest margaritas I have ever had! I was worried the food would not be as great as I anticipated, but thankfully it was delicious! Everyone in my party seemed to enjoy their dishes. I got the chicken and avocado enchiladas and fell in love with the dish! 

I also appreciated that they had a full bar located on the other side of the dining area so the area was not too cramped. It was nice being able to go back and forth to grab shots and other drinks and bring it back to our table to enjoy with our meal and friends.

As you can imagine, dealing with the bill was hell with 22 people. However, our waitress divided us into 3 groups and told us that whatever we were short on she would pay out of her own pocket. I wish I would have gotten her name because that was beyond excellent customer service.

I highly recommend this place- excellent food, exemplary service, and strong drinks ;).
author: Surge C.

description: Came here for New Year's Eve as we didn't have any reservations anywhere. It wasn't too packed and the servers were very friendly. We each had an entree; I had the carnitas which were large chunks and cooked perfectly. We also had a few pitchers of margaritas, the fruit one being pretty good, and some of their beers. Their tequila selection is also very good. Would come back again.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Love the limitless chips and salsa, although the salsa is more water and tomato than actually salsa.

Fell in LOVE with the white tortilla soup. OMG so good. House margaritas are really fresh and tasty. Also tried the cactus enchiladas which I didn't really find to my taste. Kind of bland. I like my enchiladas thick and dripping with sauce and cheese (ay yes).
author: Cheryl F.

description: The service is great and the food is delicious! If you like mexican gourmet food, this is the place to go! Everything about the food is delicious, I am very fond of Mexican food so I loved this spot.
author: Lucia C.

description: Bad food for a vegetarian, can't really comment on the non veg food though my husband said it was pretty average. Bland salsa. Everything was bland actually.
author: Avie V.

description:
Why oh why have I not discovered this amazing Mission spot before? 

So I stumbled upon Velvet Cantina last night, thanks to the Yelp Elite staff suggesting a small after-party following an event down the street. This place is rad! The interior is super retro and doused in soft red lighting and the soothing flicker of candle light. There are leather booths flanking the walls and a small bar right at the entrance. 

My partner in crime, Noelle and I sidled up to the bar and opted for the late night happy hour option of $2 Tecates (God I love the Mission) and were amazed to hear that shots of Fernet were a mere three bones. Being two, tall, outgoing and sauced up blondes on the town for a much needed girls night out, we quickly made friends with the adorable bartenders and decided to try one of their mind blowing margaritas. They...are...delicious! And, they come by the pitcher should you so desire. 

We danced, we laughed, we drank tequila...and we were home and in bed by 10pm like good little career girls. I'll be back to Velvet Cantina very soon, and perhaps this time I'll even try some of the food!
author: Lynsey C.

description: Being a vegetarian, I found the options to be limited.  Ordered the nachos & burrito, and thought the nachos were much better than the burrito (but I've still had better nachos). The queso cheese is VERY good. The environment was really cool and service was excellent.
author: Veeral S.

description:
the male servers are HOT. ladies, you definitely wanna have a girls' night here. well, i'm only objectifying (partly) in jest, though you might wanna give me credit for not mentioning burritos or cacti or any other foodstuffs in the likeness of... well, you know. *nudge* oops.

don't be fooled by the weird decor: mural vs. 80s chinese restaurant mirror vs. saloon style ceiling fans with no blades on them... curious. 

above all else, the food is straight-forward and delicious. while not commenting on the authenticity of any said dish (because that's not really the point), the VC offers a lively and unique hybrid experience likened to the grubbage of your favorite taqueria, the fun atmosphere of your favorite bar, and the eye candy of your favorite stripcl... never mind.

try the chicken avocado enchiladas. the sauce is divine. they have all types of tequila, and the drinks are made with a very heavy-handed pour. they usually have a couple of drink specials that use the fruits they bought that day. it tends to get crowded pretty quickly, so expect a wait.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Great music, good vibe, strong drinks, they even offer fernet.

But, the food is only mediocre.  The refried beans taste like they're from a can (ahh, I see... they're vegetarian. Which is to say, totally inauthentic. You need lard in mexican food)

 the purple pickled cabbage on the side is good.  The green chile pork was too salty.  The tri tip however was perfect, juicy on the inside and crunchy bits on the outside.  

Service was slow and a little spacey.

An alternative to taquerias, if you want to sit down at a cozy booth under dim lights.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
So I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food or margaritas, but it seems usually it's all the same, nothing outstanding or special.  This place was just that, we had pitchers of margaritas which tasted like something like a store bought mix with some cheap tequila added in, I'm more of a martini girl so I rarely drink tequila.  But I know what makes a good drink.  

The food was OK, I had the chicken enchiladas which were fine, but again nothing special.  We had chips and salsa at the table and guacamole, which was good.  

One thing I will say, there was a group of about 15 of us and every time a new person came in the waiter gave them a glass for the margarita without asking and our food did come out at the same time so they were able to handle a large group very professionally.  

But of course with a large group you end up paying more, and I walked away paying $40 for my entre and maybe two drinks.  We did have a good time and the b-day girl was nicely buzzed and off to another bar.
author: Inga W.

description:
Winners:

Velvet lasanga, chicken&avocado enchiladas, margaritas, dessert thingy with cinammon, chocolate, and seared marshmallows.

Losers:

The nutmeg chicken (should've been called the Holy F#ck that's a lot of Nutmeg Chicken), rice and beans.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Went to Velvet Cantina for a large group birthday dinner this past Friday.  I thought our servers did an excellent job dealing with so many people - the drinks kept flowing, food came out fairly well timed (with the exception of a minor mishap for a vegetarian's order) and answering all of our questions - all while smiling.  The party was a great success.

The food was quite tasty - a bit more selection might be nice - especially for the vegetarians.  But all of the food I tried - from multiple people's plates - I really enjoyed.  I particularly liked my tri-tip and the velvet lasagne had such a complex and rich flavor - YUM!

The fresh fruit margaritas were sweet and strong.  Tried both the pineapple and watermelon.

Overall, I had a great experience here and am looking forward to going again.
author: Mac M.

description:
Friday night...

7:45pm arrived at Velvet Cantina
7:55pm finished a round of Pineapple Margaritas
8:00pm seated for dinner
8:15pm Pineapple Margarita pitcher arrives
8:20pm first round of chips/salsa disappear
8:30pm entrees arrive
8:35pm second round of chips/salsa disappear
8:45pm annihilated 

Thanks, Velvet Cantina.
author: Ken G.

description:
FYI - Arrive here before it opens and you'll think the place has been closed for years!  With the giant chain and padlock on the doors and not a person in sight waiting for the place to open.  Luckily, I knew better and had my friends meet there at 5:30 pm (when it opens).  

The space is full of warm, dark wood and has more of a bar vibe then a restaurant vibe...which only made me like it even more!  The margaritas are fantastic - the house version was the best.  The food is good with slight twists on the stables.  The enchilada didn't come out drenched in sauce, but the cilantro sauce was a great sub.  The free chips and salsa was the least tasty, but you really couldn't complain about free food.  The atmosphere is great and pretty full crowd that Sunday night.  The service was also very attentive and friendly.  I like it and would totally come back!
author: Lisa R.

description: Great margaritas and delicious Mexican fare. Our waiter brought us unlimited chips and salsa. The atmosphere is awesome too. Definitely a fun place to go with friends and it's pretty affordable!
author: M M.

description: Good food ( enchiladas and taco platters),  large amounts at a pretty good prices. I like the atmosphere, and if you can get in on off nights there are fewer obnoxious folks, even better. The staff are funny and fast, and the margaritas are pretty damn good!
author: Uda W.

description: A nice surprise! Found this on Yelp when meeting up with friends. The facility is looking a little worn, but a tasty meal. The best surprise was the kimchi-like cabbage on the side of every dish though! Hearty portions, all were happy with their meal. My carnitas was a little unusual - lightly fried pork cubes - but enchiladas verde and margaritas especially good.
author: Anna M.

description:
I went here last Friday night for a Friend's birthday dinner.  The place was packed with people in costume (it was halloween weekend), but they had our table for ten waiting for us  *bonus points*.

Our group started off the evening with chips, salsa, and two pitchers of margaritas.  The watermelon margarita wasn't my cup of tea, but the lime/original was delicious  (maybe that's why I had 5 glasses over the course of an evening) and strong. The chips and salsa were great too.

We ordered some appetizers.  I only tried the chicken quesadillas, but they were great.  The chicken was flavorful and moist and the cheese was gooey. I followed it up with some enchiladas which were wonderful as well.  I'd been here before so I knew that the black beans and rice were extremely bland, so I only ate the enchilada.  My friend ordered a burrito that was as big as his head.

I think if I go there again I will just sit at the bar, order margaritas and munch on chips and salsa (maybe order an appetizer).  I don't think I'd go back for a full dinner.
author: Lara O.

description:
Oh, what a night. You should be like Velvet Cantina, instead of like Mike...nah nah la la de de da da...This is ladies night and our food is tight...this is ladies night...

That's all I got; Missy Elliott would bitch slap me for that rendition but I can't help but shamelessly profess my love for the VC. The queso dip...the guac...the raspberry margies...the SMORES! 

We were a table full of hot ladies scarfing food and drinks like there was no tomorrow. Oh, what a night.
author: Julia N.

description:
Went late on a Saturday night (~9/9.30pm) without reservations and not even sure if they take reses. Anyways, we waited a good 45 minutes - super tight spaces and tons of people waiting (and we were there with an 8-mo pregnant friend! yes, she is fabulous like that!)... 
Anyways, was the wait worth it? Difficult to say.... I think its between 3 and 4 stars, but i couldn't bring myself to rate them 4. 

So we got a pitcher of the watermelon margaritas... it must have been cheap tequila, coz it was strong and not smooth at all. we actually asked for more watermelon juice to mellow it down a bit (unsuccessful). I personally didn't mind it much, but the others (minus the preg friend of corse!) kinda hated it.

Got the ceviche and the cornbread sopes for apps. It was quite good. For dinner, two people got the chicken tacos from the apps menu and the portions are generous. I got the avocado/cactus enchiladas (decent again) and the other friend got the naked relleno (decent)...

Hmm, i am rethinking the rating. Ya, I am gonna stick to it. maybe need to try the place one more time at least before changing it up. 

If you are considering going here though, definitely go! its especially fun with big crowds.
author: Sapna E.

description: This was an interesting little place.  The chips and salsa were OK.  My chicken and avocado enchiladas were OK.  Many of my Fellow Good Yelpers were raving about the margaritas, and I had the Velvet Margarita.  It was OK.  The Cantina was dark, and I loved the candles on the walls.  The only thing that really wowed me were the hot and friendly guys working there!
author: Blondie R.

description:
Hellllllllllo DIVE BAR!

You get a "red light special" feel at this bar.. once you visit this place, you will understand why.

The only lame thing is that they close at 12am.  REALLY?  It's cool.. on to the next!
author: Jennie P.

description: Bartenders are hella koo they hook u up. The velvet nachos are hella good and can feed two with some good ass margaritas.
author: Daniel V.

description: I love this place! The margaritas are the best and the waiters are so chill and on it. I am obsessed with the Carne Asada... I actually went three times this month just for it. This place is definitely a go to spot!!!!!
author: M Q.

description:
Whooo-weee! The margaritas knocked me on my butt (in the best way possible).  When I asked if they were strong, the sever assured me that they were. He was right. Delicious margaritas that go down a little too easily (if you know what I mean). 

Now a word of warning.  The food is standard Mexican-fare with a twist.  So cactus enchiladas, instead of just cheese. Chicken and avocado with Mexican pesto.  Just be prepared that if you want typical sit down Mexican food, you may have to make a few minor compromises (I totally recommend the chicken and avocado enchiladas though). 

One point off though for the server who took my margarita away (twice!) before I was finished with it.  Mister, that's just not cool!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Sole purpose of this review is to document the fact that i ate here along with corresponding memories of that fact.  NOT  to contribute my opinion to the 600+ previous reviewers.

Good service, good strong margs, good vibe, good chips and salsa.  

Only see myself returning per someone else's request as the food was still "meh" after 2 pitchers of margaritas...
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
I rarely write reviews, but after our disaster at the Velvet Cantina I feel compelled. It wasn't just a "blah" experience, we actually left there feeling punished. 

My husband and I have been looking for a great go-to spot for Mexican food in the Mission. How hard can that can be, right? Based on the reviews, we thought Velvet Cantina might be it, and had been looking forward to our dinner for more than a week. 

There are two rooms in the Velvet Cantina: a bar/eating area in the front, and some booths and larger tables in the back, off the kitchen. When we arrived at 6:00 (on a Sunday) there was plenty of seating in both rooms, but they ushered us into the back. 

The first thing we noticed was the music: they were playing one type of music up front, and something totally different in the back. It was loud but fun in the front. In the back it was earsplitting, boring disco. I guess it would have been okay for dancing, but we were there to eat and -- one would hope -- talk to each other, for crying out loud.  

There was only ONE other party in the entire room, a corner booth with three obnoxious, narcissistic, potty-mouthed drunks who were shouting (after all, they had to compete with the music to be heard) remarks about excrement and vomit at the top of their lungs. For some unexplained reason, our seater decided it would be a great idea to put us smack dab next to these boors. (I dunno, convenience?) I realize the restaurant is not responsible for the bad behavior of  drunks, but putting us next to them showed a remarkable lack of awareness. 

Not that we should have been surprised, since we were neglected the rest of the meal. The food arrived fast and was mediocre, so any hope of redemption was lost at that point. Our waiter didn't bother with us again until we were done and had been sitting awhile. (Meanwhile, waiters were always within sight of us, madly folding napkins -- another annoying, distinctly obnoxious facet of the dinning experience.) 

Once the table was cleared, we sat. And sat. And sat. The drunks had just left, and we were still entertaining the thought of trying the S'mores Nachos, since we had read about them and thought they sounded fun. However, we were never offered a dessert menu, or even another margarita, for that matter. In the end, we finally signaled for the check and got out of there. 

I think one of the saddest things is that there were three parties of tourists, guidebooks clutched in hand, bless 'em, who arrived and were seated near us while the drunks were still there. I hate to think that the Velvet Cantina may have been their definitive "Mexican food in the Mission" experience: it does not reflect well on our fair city.
author: Paula T.

description:
So I finally ordered the S'mores nachos even though I still didn't really have room for dessert.  This dish is:

Crack.
Crack with cinnamon-sugary sprinkles, molten mexican chocolate, and flaming marshmallows on top.  Stunning and decadent and delicious and addiction-inducing.

Was I hungry?  No.  
Did I really need that sugary desert?  Now that I've had it, the answer is yes.  Yes.  I needed that.  Thank god for that.  I'll have it again and again.
author: Ravena F.

description:
You win this round, Velvet Cantina.  I don't usually fall for the put-a-mirror-on-one-wall-to-make-your-restaurant-look-gigantic trick, but you had me completely fooled.  How you managed that I will never know (could it be the delicious and stiff pitcher of margarita? (hint: yes)).

Really, though, this place is tiny so make a reservation if you can.  We were suppose to wait 1.5 hours for a table for 6, but we got lucky and crammed into a corner booth in 30 minutes.  Immediately, a basket of fresh chips and salsa were put in front of us.  Almost simultaneous, we devoured the entire basket, and more were put in front of us.  And endless fountain of delicious chips, this place is.

Food was pretty good.  I very much enjoyed my chicken avocado enchiladas, and from what I gathered, my friends really liked its vegetarian counterpart, the cactus enchiladas.  The chicken mole was too sweet.  The rice that comes with, though, I really really liked.  Very flavorful and the perfect texture.

But wait there's more!  S'mores, to be exact.  I have never had dessert nachos before, but thanks to Velvet Cantina, I can cross that one off my bucket list.  The chips are sprinkled with what appears to be (cinnamon?) sugar, and then drizzled with chocolate, then finally topped off with marshmallows that they torch at your table (!!).  

I will DEFINITELY come back again.
author: jon y.

description:
Note: Food worthy of Four stars, but the margarita forced me to subtract one.


After hearing such great reviews of Velvet Cantina we finally gave it a try last night, much to my surprise I had actually been here before but I'm guessing it had a different name.

It's a family style Mexican restaurant with a good vibe and you sit down at a booth and are immediately served up chips and salsa and get your drink order down....love that.  The margarita was just OK though, not bad, but not that good either; I think they used some pre-fab margarita mix.

The food was actually very good; I had their vegetarian Enchiladas which were sort of unique and very tasty.  Wait staff very pleasant and attentive.

They would get four stars but that margarita really was a let down especially since I had such high expectations.
author: G L.

description:
Hard to find better chips and such a cool, friendly staff. Margaritas are great too. Main meals are pretty good but oooh the chips - just those are worth it. All the guys working here really seem to like their jobs and have a great time doing it which translates into you having a great experience with some of the coolest bartenders in the city.

Velvet Cantina is located in area chock full of bars and restaurants so it is a great place to start your night.
author: James H.

description:
Why is it that there is nowhere in this goddamn city that has a fucking blender?? Sometimes you just want a cheesy fucking blended margarita, and there is seriously None to be Found. Seriously, in San Jose, blended is ALL YOU GET. It comes blended every time unless you specifically say "on the rocks".

After stomping around in the Mission fruitlessly in search of a restaurant with a blender, we decided to settle for this place. It had gotten to the point where we were so hungry/thirsty that we just couldn't search any longer. But, I'm glad we landed here anyway! These were probably the best non-blended margaritas one could have hoped for. 

We got here right when it opened so the only "wait" we experienced was the wait for the kitchen to be open. We sucked down our drinks with an intensity usually reserved for those Polk street girls tryin' to make that dollar, and powered through a large basket of (homemade?) chips + salsa. Needless to say, we were halfway through our pitcher and thoroughly bedrunkened by the time the food arrived.

We had: Ceviche, chicken-avocado enchiladas, and the Dude had chicken tacos. I would say skip the ceviche, it was pretty boring. No tentacles or anything, just white fish. Chicken avos were delicious, though majorly spicier than anticipated. But coming from me that doesn't mean much, because I am very sensitive to spicy. The only person I ever met who was more sensitive than me, thinks ketchup is spicy.

The service was pretty great, the only stumble was we waited way too long for the check, but that was probably because they got slammed with people by the time our food arrived. Also, the music selection was extremely tasteful. I'll most likely be back!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Be warned: Velvet Cantina has transformed from restaurant to club, complete with absurdly loud music and aloof service. 

Food is still good when you get it, as are the drinks. And the servers are perfectly nice when you see them, but you won't see them much. 

I like the ceviche, the burrito, and the avocado/cactus enchiladas.
author: Susan J.

description: Amazing!!! The drinks, the food, the experience were all heavenly!!!! The mushroom empanadas were my favorites and the Paloma drink was very delicious. Highly recommend.
author: Rocio A.

description: The ambiance walking in was just as delicious as food we had. The red light bulbs glowing throughout the restaurant with Phoenix, Kaskade, and Santogold playing in the background was a great scene to enjoy our chips and salsa. We ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas and the tacos Valentina. Both were delicious in a generous portion. Definitely going back on my next trip to the mission.
author: Jaszmin W.

description:
Birthdays are awesome, but tragically short.  Which is why we celebrated day two of birthday boy's birthday here.  We dined early on a Wednesday, and the boisterous atmosphere was just starting to pick up.  

The food-inventiveness-level was a nice balance between grimy taqueria and nouveau mexican, as evidenced in my tasty naked chile poblanos and the coconut ceviche I kept stealing from the kids sitting next to me.  (In my mind raw fish and things that aren't fried also manage to seem healthy, which further endeared Velvet Cantina to me.)   

Last but hardly least, the margaritas were also damn good, and packed a damn good punch.  Perfect second birthday spot.
author: Dana S.

description:
Came here last night with the usual clan and got a pitcher of margaritas. I think the bartender was new cause he didnt really know where much was on the shelf but he was super friendly and nice. He didnt have the tequila we wanted for the margarita but gave us what he thought was the next best option. It was not the greatest in taste but because of his great customer service in getting us everything we needed this place made it so much better.

I will be returning again but next time I will make sure I know exactly what I want to be extra sure. 

To the bartender last night, thanks for being so warm and hospitable, you helped make a night that was not so great more enjoyable
 
I plan on re reviewing when I return
author: Lisa W.

description:
Drinks - The margaritas at this place are the best margaritas i've had ANYWHERE. I typically do not drink sweet, mixed drinks but this place is different. I got the original margarita and ended up having 5. I couldn't stop. They were so addicting and went down so smoothly with my food and the salsa. It wasn't sweet but made just perfectly. 

Food  -The chicken Avacado enchilda is the best enchilada i've had anywhere. It was just soooo yummy! Definitely recommend it. 

Service - lousy! This place gets so insanely busy which is a good thing but our server that night just looked so frantically stressed out. She was grumpy and just sort of throwing our food on our table so she could be done and move on. Didn't have a good attitude at all. We asked her if she could take a group picture of our table and she had 3 cameras, and she looked soo annoyed that she didn't even want to be bothered but then had the nerves to say "this is the last one, i don't have time to take pictures for you guys, gotta get back to my tables" Conclusion - from a service stand point, i give it a 2/5.

I would come back here just for the margaritas and the chicken enchilada. YUM! I'm trying to convince a friend to have her bday dinner here. Hopefully she chooses this place so i can have another 5 margaritas. =)
author: Ms C C.

description: Was looking for a great Mexican restaurant that also served more than wine and beer in the mission area.  Found it!!  The food was amazing, especially the service it was amazing!!  I would recommend this place to anyone!!  The wait staff and the owner were there to make sure that every part of our meal from the begging to the end was absolutely perfect!!  I will be back!
author: Brandon R.

description:
One of the best things on the plate of food was the pickled mexican cabbage.  I put that in the tacos and it was great!  Let me back track some.  Their chips are the best, lite with the right amount of salt.  In fact I ate too many of them while waiting for the other guests.  The salsa though, was not the most flavorful in town.

The Nachos are huge and tasty, add in a couple house margaritas and yum, yum, yum.  I ordered the Achiote steak taco.   There is a layer of cheese in-between the soft shells, which is a nice touch.  I thought the steak was tough and could have been spicier.   Also at our table, was the shrimp enchiladas.  The Enchiladas sauce was really tasty; however, the shrimp inside were 'just ok'.  The chicken mole was excellent.  We ordered Agua frescas, and they were sparkling, which threw us all off the taste.  They had lots of flavor and if you knew you were getting more of a soda, I think it would go over better.

Velvet Cantina is a great place if you want a more upscale Mexican food experience.
author: Francis B.

description: Try the seasonal marg- made with fresh fruit purée,
author: Lauren C.

description: I'll start off by saying that the waiter was friendly and it is by no means his fault that the food sucked. The food was awful. I had heard pretty good reviews of this place and it was full of people when we arrived so things were looking good..until the food came out. The guacamole was probably the worst I've ever had. It tasted and looked pasty and there was no spice or flavor in sight! Basically just mashed avocados and that's it. Tacos were the same. There was just no flavor! I doused my meal with Cholula hot sauce but there was no saving it. Needless to say, I actually wished we had gone to Chevy's instead. Didn't try the margaritas so can't vouch for them. Come to think of it that was probably my first mistake.
author: Julia C.

description:
Good but not amazing. Affordable but not cheep. Nice location but not perfect. 

However the margaritas were fantastic and by your third you will think this place is the end all be all.The staff is helpful but quick with you. Their chips tasted like they are homemade. Inside Velvet Cantina does have a great "dark mysterious" vibe to it. Great for friends or a date that does not mind a ton of noise.

Have a dinner there next month so we will see if they can earn another star.... :)
author: Ryan B.

description:
+: i think they make the chips there
+: fresh fruit margaritas w/ what is in season (pitchers available, too!)
+: tacos valentino - 3 street tacos w/ yummy sauce & guac
+: black beans
+: good place for a weekday dinner w/ good company

ok: table salsa, appetizer guac 
ok: atmosphere - doesn't look like much on the outside, & the inside definitely has an outdated feel, but it works if you're there for the food & company and not for the environment. 

-: while we were there longer than normal, we were never asked if we wanted dessert, another drink, & the waiter kinda disappeared after dropping off the check. 

really only checked out b/c of the high ratings, but may go back if i want something easy (no wait, easy parking).
author: Tammy T.

description:
Oh Velvet Cantina you are delicious.

Margaritas not quite as good as the now defunct La Rondalla, but what are?  These are a close second for sure.

The atmosphere is charming and intimate.  The food is tasty and reasonably priced.

It's a good place to hang out and get your night started with friends.  I'll be back, and probably leave a lil bit drunker than I originally intended.
author: Chris H.

description:
The only reason I would go to this place again; one word: Tequila. They have some really good Tequilas. I noticed people were downing buckets(more like jugs) of the sweet stuff called margarita, NO...try the the good stuff, tequila, straight.
Here are the three that I had
Casa Noble's Crystal
Corralejo Reposado
Cazadores Reposado
My man drank Micheladas all night( beer, with hot sauce, lime and some tomato juice), if you have never tried this highly recommend...at the VC, you can pick your beer and then they will make a Michelada, my suggestion would be a light beer like pacifico or corona.
As for the food, this was my second time, and the first time I dont remember, so that means food is probably average. We did have the gucamole with the tortilla chips, naaah...plus if I want to eat good Mexican food there are zillion other places here...but do go for the tequila, it is quite an experience.
author: BOSHIKA T.

description: Delicious and reasonably priced for San Francisco!  I ordered a house margarita and the chile verde.  So yummy.  Just warning you their menu isn't for the non spicy eaters.  I love hot food and found it to be the right amount of heat for the dish.  My Caucasian boyfriend on the other hand said it was spicy and was slightly red.  It was tolerable for him but perfect for me.  Ask the waiters and bartenders for suggestions and what you usually like along with your spicy level.  They will provide you with great suggestions and are super laid back.  None of this fancy shmancy Mission hipster stuff...
author: Nicole C.

description:
Margarita-mixing has to be one of the most dangerous tasks that bartenders have to carry out on a regular basis.  Margaritas contain nothing but the most volatile flavors that react to create an invigorating intoxicating concoction, so it is absolutely vital that bartenders emulate the precision of chemists when it comes to margaritas.  I say this because my experience with 'ritas at VC has been somewhat inconsistent (anywhere from the best I've had to meh).

Before you eat at VC, try to forget everything you know about Mexican food.  If you do that, it will be easier to order and you'll appreciate what comes to your table a little more.  VC is a good place for an adventurous palate.  With dishes like Cactus Enchiladas, Azteca Cake, and shrimp diablo, you're sure to eat something fun if you try.  The food is anglicized enough to separate itself from the tejano-bumpin' burrito factories of the mission, but zesty and spicy enough to be appreciated as latin cuisine.  Oddly enough, one of my favorite things about the food is the spicy-cole-slaw-relish-stuff that garnishes the beans and rice.

Olé!
author: Jesse M.

description:
Tack on another swell review for these ladies and gents. 

Place is cool. Great way to start off yes? I mean it's interesting...for tex-mex grill it's far more bar-y than it really is a restaurant. I came in at around 7:30 to meet some friends and as I walked through the front door, I figured it was definitely more of a bar setting than a restaurant. 

Nonetheless, the food was great. I mean pretty run of the mill tex-mex stylings but the small touches like the pickled cabbages with my quesadilla and the delicious (apparently house made?) chips were real winners. 

Oh and we should certainly mention the margaritas: 30 for a pitcher that pours essentially 4 is, in a sense, a bit steep but it goes well with the stiffness of the margaritas themselves: really it'll get you going by the first pitcher no doubt. 

Servers were great. Very friendly and very efficient is generally the mark of a good night. Simple as that. 

The vibe is nice: noisy and dark. Again, the ambiance more of a night club or deep lounge than a restaurant but I guess it's an interesting juxtaposition with the norm. 

I'll come back for some drinks and appetizers but I dunno if i'd stick around for dinner...the ambiance and the drinks is what sells it for me but, being in the mission there are a whole host of tasty taquerias serving the same fare for half the price. I'll come back to this joint for happy hour for sure.
author: Dzu N.

description:
Last week my roommate and I decided we wanted to "eat nachos until we sweat."

It happens. 

We randomly went to Velvet Cantina without knowing what the nachos would be like - too much chip, not enough cheese? Too much goopy crap plopped onto soggy chips?

Oh no. 

They were, in fact, the BEST DAMNED NACHOS I'VE EVER EATEN.

Smooth and creamy and complexly flavored cheese sauce is drizzled lovingly over crisp chips, topped with shredded chicken (an add-on) and the appropriate fixins. Even after we were both, indeed, sweating, we couldn't stop scarfing these, like little nacho piggies. 

I can't stop thinking about them. 

Cocktails were great. I had a paloma (grapefruit juice, tequila, soda water, and lime) and it was terrific. Some bars like to add simple syrup to this tart cocktail. Those bars are smoking the crazy. A paloma should have a teensy bit of natural sweetness from the grapefruit, but be otherwise tart and dry. And this one was. So perfect. 

Am I giving a restaurant 5 stars based on nachos and cocktails? Hell yes I am. I think you can definitely judge a kitchen by their appetizers, especially on something that's as easy to phone in as nachos. 

I'm going to get fat on Velvet Cantina nachos. Happily.
author: Sara A.

description: Love the vibe of this place! Awesome margaritas, cool staff, good music, and great food. I am a celiac and vegetarian so I was pretty limited, but good stuff!
author: Cat B.

description:
Well, from what I remember of the evening, it's a five star joint all the way (in the Stephanie F. world of five star dining anyhow).  

Let's see...Margaritas by the pitcher.  Check. 

With salt or not they were the tastiest margaritas in town. (They're actually the only ones I've had in San Fran, but whatever. 

Vegetarian Friendly. Check.  

I know they've been mentioned in other reviews, but the nopal enchiladas were EXQUISITAS!  

Ambiance. Check. 

Straight out of an old Mexican movie: dark, red, great for photos.  As shocking as this sounds, I don't remember anything else about the decor!!!  

The place was packed but not jammed, and I think we got a table within 45 minutes.  As we were a few pitchers in by then, not too sure, but it seemed pretty fast.  

A fabulous first stop on the Mission birthday train.  In true Edith R. bay area spirit, I had a hella good time :) 

Great friends, good times.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
This place is awesome! The food is sooo good (even though I have only ordered the Chicken Avocado Enchiladas the couple times I've I gone). Went one time with my mom and brother and one of the waiters hooked it up with some awesome cheese dip as well since we were waiting for awhile [busy night]. I love the atmosphere and the drinks are very good as well!  fresh fruit margaritas!!

I highly recommend this place and will definitely be a regular soon ;)
author: Jackie S.

description:
Awesome food, especially the mole, chile verde. Really sweet staff (Travis, especially, is a really fast, friendly bartender.)  This restaurant is unarguably one more nail in the coffin of gentrification, (a fancy Mexican place with no Mexicans present!) but after friends convinced me to give it a try, I've been back a few times: you can only resent such yumminess at such reasonable prices so much.  :-)

Warning: the two rooms at Velvet Cantina have really different vibes. Unless you want to eat your dinner while feeling like you're in a kickin' gay dance club, though, make sure you get a table in the other room (without the bar.)  Decent music, but LOUD.
author: Jeff G.

description: Came here with a big group celebrating a friend's birthday. Micheladas are yummy and tangy. The ceviche was tasty too, but probably wouldn't get it again. Tortilla soup was nice and spicy, and the floating empanada was a little weird. The avocado cactus enchiladas were also pretty good. Seems like this would be a great place to get trashed!
author: Denise H.

description:
I've been here twice. Both times followed epic SF weather days and playing in the sun. See my review of LIME for reference. 

The main draw- are the PITCHERS OF MARGARITAS. $27 for a pitcher of super stiff margaritas. Some of the strongest margaritas I've had. We easily poured 6-8 drinks from each pitcher. 

The food was mediocre at best. Any of the surrounding mexican places in the mission (la cumbre, taqueria cancun...etc) have better food. 
FOOD:
guacamole- nothing special needed some more salt and lime

Achiote Steak tacos- two small tacos with a big portion of rice and beans as well as Mexican slaw. The highlight here was the Mexican slaw

Shrimp enchiladas: I was picturing big pieces of shrimp in these enchiladas but they were tiny probably 80 count shrimp. Nothing special here at all. I'd cook better ones at home. 

However we were in a group of 20 ppl and for what seemed like unlimited margaritas and tons of food it was only $30 each. So go here for to have food with your drinks not drinks with your dinner. 

Like others mentioned it's pretty dark in here too.
author: Mike K.

description:
I don't come here that often, but I have a good time whenever I do. It's kind of small and apparently can get a little crowded, but it's worth it. 

Their margaritas are great. They have a bunch of different fruit flavored ones (on the rocks, not frozen) that change all the time. The watermelon ones are particularly delicious. But their regular margaritas are really good too - and they have a decent assortment of tequila in case you want something a little nicer in your margarita - or a lot nicer in a shot glass. 

The food is good. Not great, but very solid. 

And the boys... oh, the boys. Oh so cute. And so nice. The ones who work there, anyway. Cute and nice and funny. A rare combination in this city. The ones who wander in aren't so bad to look at either. 

One thing - their website says they're closed Mondays when you first open it. Then it says they are open 7 days a week. They are OPEN on Mondays. They should really fix that shit so I don't have to answer a bunch of emails from my friends "Their website says  they're closed. Are you sure they aren't? Why does it say that then?"
author: Suge K.

description:
There's 3 types of Mexican places in SF: taqueria, casual, and upscale. Unfortunately, there are few excellent choices in the "casual" category (or in the upscale category, for that matter) especially in the Mission, where you can choose between Puerto Alegre or Velvet Cantina amongst the plethora of fine taquerias (Taqueria Cancun being my favorite.) I've been to Puerto Alegre, and while wildly popular, serves pretty sub-par mexican, unless you've have way too many margaritas to notice. 

Velvet Cantina has a chill atmosphere, fun mexican decor (not like Chevy's fun, but old-school red candles and unique murals fun), and great food. The menu has a bit of a creative southwestern and cali flair - still has the staples like faijiats, burritos, tacos, etc. but includes dishes like catcus enchiladas (awesomeo), chicken avocado tacos, velvet nachos, and a smore plate for dessert. It's a nice variety, even if it's not the most 'authentic' if you're used to Pancho Villa plates.

Margaritas are fantastic and a good balance of tequila (strong) without being too sweet. Props to the bartenders who can make a good pitcher (even my Dad was impressed, who is actually quite critical of waiters who put small amounts of tequila in margarita pitchers.) Great for groups and overall a nice in-between mex joint to eat and drink in the mish.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Velvet Cantina is so so fun.  

The staff are really really friendly, always making you and your friends that you bring in feel welcome.

A margarita with a salted glass, those amazing chips with that addictive liquid queso, and the warm red interior, is always a hit for me!
author: Suresh K.

description: wow!! amazing vibes kicking while sucking down strong marg's and licking your lips from the tasty mexican flavors that are provided at this delightful joint in the mission district. The guac was killer and my fish tacos were a must! Would love to eat at this restaurant when I revisit the bay area!!
author: Meredith P.

description:
Finally!  A chance to try the food.  And I have to say, I wasn't disappointed.

Allow me to proceed chronologically.

First came the chips and salsa.  Bravo, chips!  Homemade, piping hot, thick, crispy, & with just the right amount of salt.  Salsa was not the most amazing I've ever had, but still pretty good.  We had their Perfect margaritas, which, as I remembered, were fantastic.

The second course was the guacamole course -- very fresh & green-tasting, with big chunks of avocado, and plenty of it.  (There were two of us, and although we ate a bunch of it, there was still a lot left over.)

Course three was the ceviche course.  This was a fruity, almost tropical sort of ceviche, with chunks of pineapple mixed in.  I thought the acidity of the pineapple went really well with the acid from the ceviche & really dug it.  My boyfriend wasn't crazy about it, but I thought it was a successful attempt at trying something new & different with a classic dish.

For my entree, I had the chicken avocado (or was it avocado chicken?) enchiladas - tasty, tender white meat with cheese, topped with a creamy avocado-jalapeno sauce (really good - I only wished there were more of).  And, the obligatory rice and beans were delicious (to me, bonus any time they're more than just garnish & actually worth eating).  My boyfriend had the chili verde pork, which I only tried a little of.  The pork was good, but we both agreed that the green sauce was a bit watery & lacked good spice.

$68 for the two of us after tax & tip (including 2 Perfect margaritas).  Overall, a really tasty meal that stands up well to other Mexican I've had in SF.  Will definitely go back to eat. :)
author: Angela B.

description:
Uhm, did I miss something in the 700+ reviews? Is this place owned by the guy who gave the emperor his new clothes? 

We walked in, place was busy (always a great sign). Drinks were $7-9, but when the margaritas showed up, they were in small highball glasses, which isn't a BIG problem except that they tasted just mediocre. The fresh fruit margs (pineapple) were alright, but nothing to write home about and given the size of the drink, a bit pricey. If there are several people (or maybe 2?), get the pitcher, although it won't improve the quality of the drinks. So good luck with that. 

The food was even worse. TINY enchiladas, and only two. Over-thick beans, flavorless rice. And the guacamole was more-than-a-little bland. Even the salt shakers on the table didn't work well. At one point, I put the salt rim from my glass into the guacamole. 

For a total of two plates (chicken enchiladas, steak tacos....another yawn), three drinks (fruit, perfect and the house marg) and a small bowl of guac, we dumped almost $75. Seriously?

I say: go somewhere else.
author: Emil W.

description:
I had been a devoted fan of Puerto Alegre since I moved here.  It was one of the first times I've had the more authentic California Mexican food, much more accurate than NYC fare.  In NYC, most Mexican restaurants don't even have Mexicans working there.  Shocking, I know, but there is always something interesting about getting what suspiciously tastes like Chinese vegetables with shredded chicken...

I finally decided to branch out after a less than fantastic experience at Puerto Alegre and tried Velvet Cantina.  And I'm seriously so impressed, I don't know that I can ever eat at PA again.

I service was very causal and friendly.  We had a 7.30 reservation and came a little early and got seated right away.  The waiter was attentive and relaxed, really made you feel at home.

The margaritas were tas-ty.  The complementary chips tastes crisp and fresh - perhaps fried on site?  We ordered the guacamole appetizer which was delicious.

I had the Chicken Mole- prob the best damn Mole I've ever had.  The portion was enormous.  I literally fell over from eating so much, but could not stop myself.

Go.  Go today.  Go tomorrow.  Go this weekend.  Just Go.
author: Mister G.

description:
Full disclosure: I came here to eat, not to drink. 

Rolled in after work one day to try out this seemingly upscale Mexican looking joint. I was so, so disappointed. The food is not nearly as good as anything offered in most taquerias on 24th or Mission. Furthermore, it's not cheap enough to justify the meh food. 

It was also really loud. Again, I came to eat, not drink. Probably my own fault for choosing a place that seems more about the drinking than the food. Maybe the drinks are good?
author: Madeline N.

description:
This restaurant gets two stars from me solely because of the two outstanding margaritas I had here. 

The food on the other hand deserves negative stars.  

If you are looking for true Mexican food (which why wouldn't you be, if you are out cruising the Mission) this is not the place.  This is the place to get drinks before or after your dinner.
author: Katie B.

description:
When it comes to sidestreet must do's in the mission this place kicks ass. I have been to loads of mexi resturants in San Diego growing up and this place makes par for sure. 
I have a renewed vigor for life complimentary of a bar tender whose name started with a D (I was too drunk and talking to too many girls to recall his name (cool dude thou)). By the time I finished guzzeling a bunch of chilling margaritas the bartender I was calling D rocked me with some chili con queso. This chip dip "dip slaps" all other dips I have had. I have been two times over the past few months on sats and the crowd is pumping and there is lively happenings. 
If one was looking for a crackiling spot in the Mission with great margo's and a dip that I would like to skinny dip in then please proceed.
author: Frank S.

description: Fabulous margaritas, gorgeous bartender. The food is perhaps lacking some spice, but very delicious. For a trendy place, this space wine
author: Simon W.

description:
"EDIBLES & ELIXIRS"

It's a mexican restaurant/bar with a happy hour that starts at 11pm. If you can't wait for that special, they have $2 Tecate served with a lime all hours.

They have a peculiar 1920's-esque mural that highlights a special of the times:
25 cent kisses
30 cent whiskey
And my friend asks, what do you get for $1?

My friend spent a good part of our night here peering back towards the bar at a boy she thought she had met in Greece a month earlier. Apparently Greece boy was going to move to SF, so it was fully possible that this was him. She finally walked up to the bar to check it out, and he wasn't the one. Bummer. That would have been awesome. Regardless, it would be a good pickup line right? "Did I meet you in Greece?" Maybe I should try it. It's too bad I haven't been to Greece.

Special Dessert: Smores A'La Nachos served with a blowtorch...
author: Sarah T.

description:
Velvet Cantina reminds me of El Carmen one of my favorite restaurants for food and fun in Los Angeles. Both are small and intimate but big on personality. I look at restaurants like friends. Who wants dull friends without any personality? I don't!!! I have friends with loads of character and know how to have a good time. And these two establishments are GREAT friends.
But hush, shushhhhh. Keep a lid on it. 
NS
author: Chris H.

description: super loud but delicious! wait was about 40 mins at dinner time, and the waiting area by the bar is pretty packed. all in all, it was entirely worth the wait. wife loved their margaritas and we both agreed that the food was tasty!
author: Susie L.

description: shrimp enchilada?? who the hell would order such a bastardiz.... okay... I did.  Awesome!  And good, if a little effeminate, margarita selection.
author: Josh K.

description:
STRONG MARGARITAS!!! The pitcher of their Watermelon margarita is a great deal!

I think this place is great for grabbing margaritas and their nachos (yumsville), but not a place for dinner. It has much more of a "bar" -esque atmosphere. The music is pretty loud so you definitely have to do the "WHAT???" about a thousand times. The entrees themselves were a bit a bland. With the amount of Taquerias in the area you can easily pay half as much for twice the amount of flavor.

They do take reservations, which is great since it's so rare now.
author: Rana A.

description: Great margaritas!! Had a fun night here with friends ! Only giving it 4 stars since it is so god damn loud ! I like busy and vibrant bars but man I could not hear the person right next to me even when they were screaming. Good food and service. Try booking in advance if you can and get there while the sun is still up because when night time rolls around it's really loud and hard to get to the bathroom cause of all the people and limited space.
author: Kayla J.

description: I've drove/walked by this place and finally decided to give it a try.  Came with a party of three and waited about 15 mins on a friday night.  We shared a pitcher of the house margarita, which are very strong and to my liking.  I had the avocado and chicken enchiladas (+rice/beans/pickled cabbage salad) which where pretty damn good.  I sampled my friend's and sister's dishes and they were equally tasty.  I would come back to try other items form the menu and the dessert nachos!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Watermelon Margaritas
Cantaloupe Margaritas
Original Margaritas

A glass or a pitcher, which are you?
Either one you pick it will be good for you.

Salt or no salt?  How about half salt?

Chicken Mole, tender, flavorful with a little kick at the end.
Can't go wrong with the other dishes, Mole is just my fav.
Servers will do it right with prompt and friendly service.
You'll be friends with them by the end of the night.

Great drinks, great food, great service, at a great price.
Bring your friends and they'll be thanking you and maybe, just maybe, they'll buy you a pitcher with a straw.
author: Po L.

description: The food was delish (guacamole and chicken enchiladas stood out, drinks were ok (the velvet cantina marg was good, the blackberry marg was meh), service was very friendly, ambiance was divey but fun and cozy... but it was just WAY TOO NOISY for us (minus one star).  You have to raise your voice and lean across the table to talk, and even then you only get about half of what the person is saying. We'd come again if wasn't so noisy, the chicken enchiladas were divine... Maybe it was so noisy because it was Friday?
author: Lani N.

description:
I had no idea what kind of food they served when I arrived w/my friends, but I was pretty satisfied at the end. 

Now, it's not your typical grimy mexican food joint where everything is made hella fast, cheap, and greasy. And it definitely is not comparable to any mexican food joints in SoCal. But, it was actually really good for a sit-down restaurant with a nice vibe. 

At first when I looked at the menu, I was thinking, "Whaaaa...? $14 for enchiladas?!"
