(when I think mexican food, nothing usually costs more than 8 bucks) But when the shrimp enchiladas came out, I was impressed. The tortillas tasted really fresh and homemade and the shrimp was cooked perfectly. Not too rubbery or fishy, and not raw. And the sauce was spicy deliciousness (I friggin' wiped the plate clean of the sauce). Yea, I'm glad I ordered the shrimp enchiladas. The refried beans and the rice were also good, and it came with this slaw that was a nice touch.

I had a watermelon margarita that was a little too strong for me, but I tried my friend's pineapple one, and that was dangerously good.

For dessert, they came out w/this ugly-looking concoction called "s'mores nachos" and I was kinda turned off at first. It was chips with chocolate and burnt marshmallows on top. But I couldn't knock it w/out trying it, so I took a bite and OMG....I really liked it! The chips were actually coated in cinnamon and sugar and reminded me of churros, and it was drizzled w/dark chocolate and topped w/broiled marshmallows. The burned parts of the marshmallows surprisingly added a nice touch to all the sweetness. 

I would definitely order the same dishes if I go back again, so that already says something!
author: Emy s.

description: Great food. Quick service. We loved the Queso. Entrees were solid, go chile verde,  and our server Travis, kicked ALL of the ass!!!  Thanks VC!!! Oh yeah, have the dessert nachos!!!
author: Jeffrey+Kathi A.

description:
Let me start by saying I love this place, however it's not for the food.  I mean - yeah - food is pretty good (The Verde is actually quite tasty) - but it's not THE reason I continue to frequent the place.  The real upside is the atmosphere.

Sometimes you just want a nice, dark, place to go have a couple drinks and see some friendly faces.  Many years ago (before the remodel) Bruno's was that spot in the Mission for me, however Velvet has certainly become a more than worthy successor.

I've taken dates here, I've met friends here, and I've gone by my lonesome.  Each time I was met by a friendly, attentive staff who knew when to leave me alone (when with a date) but were equally happy to lend an ear and make me feel at home as I leaned into the bar for another shot.

Highly recommend.
author: Mystery V.

description:
YUM YUM YUM GET IN MAH BELLY!

Excellent waitstaff, delicious drinks, and really great food. It's loud and lively so it makes for a great high-energy experience. Let's start with the beginning:

Bartender was super attentive, fun, and delivered. T had a margarita and judging by how fast she slurped it down, it must have been good. 

Appetizers were awesome. Their chips are super thick, the salsa is really fresh and medium chunky. The guac was outstanding!

When we finally got to our meals, we were shocked at the portion size (except for mine, which was tiny but perfect based on the amount of chips I ate plus the beer that helped them expand in my stomach).  T's nachos were three times the size of what they should have been, and she said the cheese sauce was unusual but impeccable. D's veggie burrito was delicious, and I actually liked the addition of chickpeas in it. My sopes were awesome, stacked up on cornmeal beds amidst what seemed to be finely chopped cactus, tomatoes, lettuce and cheese. 

We tried to get dessert but were just too stuffed! It's too bad,  because those s'mores nachos smelled AMAZING.

I will be back.
author: Amber K.

description:
I love this place and I have only been here once. 

Their margaritas are amazing and they are made there. The night that I went they had two special margaritas: Watermelon and Pineapple. We ordered the pineapple and it was very good and it was very strong.

The prices are reasonable and their chips are amazing, they taste very authentic and home made.

We were sitting at the bar while we were there and the bartender was very attentive to us and always checked on us to make sure we were doing good. He also gave us good advice on our Android phones and is very knowledgeable in the subject. I learned a lot from him and he even gave us some tips on how to make our battery life work longer than it was working. I never really expected this kind of service from a bartender and I was pleasantly surprised. 

overall this place is amazing and has a good vibe to it, i recommend this place to anyone who want amazing margaritas and great service by the bartender.
author: Alicja D.

description:
White-people Mexican food at it's worst. The Chilaquiles de Pollo were bland and lukewarm, and the rice had a mere shadow of seasoning. Embrace cumin and caldo nor, Velvet Cantina!  My friend had the Naked Chile Relleno...unmemorable. 

I give it two stars because the chips were fresh and tasty. 

It's places like this that make me long for a restaurant with real Mexican cuisine in this city.
author: ciara s.

description: Great margaritas and the food is always amazing. Try the chile con queso and you'll be hooked for life
author: Joe M.

description: Since I'm from LA and have been to some of the best Mexican restaurants in So Cal, I tend to be critical of Mexican food. However, this is definitely one of the better Mexican places in SF. The tortilla soup, margaritas, chilaquiles, empanadas, and cheese bean dip are all really good.
author: Romita J.

description: This is a good solid cali-mex place.   I've been here several times and the food never disappoints.   They do good fish tacos and the drinks are excellent.   However, given the plethora of good mexican food in the mission, and the occasionally indifferent service, I can't go higher than 3 stars.   Don't get me wrong, I'll come back, but only every once in a while.
author: Travis B.

description:
Every time me and my girlfriends come down to Velvet Cantina we always have a blast.. We share appetizers and we order rounds of pitchers of margaritas!! 

What definitely needs to be on your menu when ordering here is there 
-Carne Y Queso Empanadas 
-Chile Con Queso dip with there wonderful chips!! YUMMY 
(Cheese Crack!! its addicting I tell you.. for all you cheese lovers, its like heaven!)
author: Shirl C.

description:
I've been to this pace 3 times now - twice for dinner, once for drinks and have not been disappointed.  

While taquerias abound in the mission, this is definitely the place to go for more high-end Mexican food.  Delicious, interesting options, and not too expensive.  

I was happy to see that the place seems to stay open till bar closing time on weekends, I assume as along as there are folks there still drinking.  "D", the bartender this past Friday, was fantastic and took great care of me and my friends.  He made us a mango-habenero shot that was amazing.  

The place always packed though around dinner time, so not great if you're in a hurry.  Low lights and constant noise might be off-putting to some, but I enjoy the ambiance.  Would be good date spot too.
author: Cat M.

description:
I really love Velvet Cantina. The food is above average, the drink specials are great, the staff is super friendly and the atmosphere feels right. 

I had the chicken chilequiles (forgive my spelling) and tasted my friend's chicken/avocado enchilades. DELICIOUS.

Definitely one of my favorite moderately priced mexican food/bar joints in the mission.
author: Emily I.

description:
Yay! Good Mexican food!  I'm so excited that we found this place. 

The food, overall, was really good. The dishes had lots of flavor, with good variety and creativity. 

I'm not sure that I would go so far as to say their margarita is the "perfect margarita" as it's titled on the menu. If by perfect you mean "ridiculously-strong-barely-taste-anything-but-tequila", then yes. But taste-wise, I'd rather my margaritas be smoother. That being said, they certainly do the trick...I barely remember paying the bill! 

The chips are really interesting. I usually don't like thick chips, but these work. 

xoxo Velvet Cantina - till we meet again!
author: Lauren F.

description: Excellent food! The homemade salsa is to die for. I also suggest the watermelon margarita if it's the fruit of the day. Can't wait to go back.
author: Chloé M.

description:
I was just here last night for dinner with friends and we had a really fun time.  We had two waiters taking care of us and both were very funny, sociable, and prompt.

It's a small place with two separate dining areas connected by a hallway in the back.  It's dimly-lit and cozy and can get pretty loud since everyone is so close to each other.  It's a lively vibe, but don't go here if you're seeking a quiet place for intimate conversation.

Food was pretty good and appropriate for the price point.  I had the chicken mole and loved the flavorful sauce but got turned off by the fatty pieces of chicken.  My friends had the shrimp diablo (spicy and delicious) and the chile verde (also delish).

Solid place to go for dinner and drinks and I suspect that I'll be back.
author: Matt C.

description:
Fun little spot to meet friends or throw a bash.  Went there are on a Friday night so it was packed with people and loud but had a nice fresh vibe.  Service was excellent and food was quick to arrive- guacamole and drinks were on the table within 5 minutes of ordering dinner within 10 minutes.  

Chips were fresh and salsa was good (although it could use a little more heat).  Gobbled down the Chicken Avocado Enchiladas and sampled the Chicken Mole which had a nice flavor.  Ciltantro Gimlet was a nice fresh drink with an essence of cilatro, good tequila and lime.  I'll be back!
author: moodyfoodie m.

description:
I came here on Cinco de Mayo with a group of friends and had a great time. I had never been to Velvet Cantina before so I was excited to try some of the delicious food that I had read about through reviews. After some margaritas and beer we finally got seated. I ordered one of the specials that night -Valentina tacos with black beans. I must say that those were some of the best tacos I have ever had! It was definitely a huge portion of food - 3 tacos, rice, beans, and a salad. I wouldn't come here for burritos or a quick meal, I would come here when I want to have a more sit-down-dinner with friends and have huge plates of food.

The wait wasn't too bad considering it was Cinco de Drinko, a lot of the groups ahead of us on the list had left due to the wait, so we were seated faster than we were told. Service was also pretty good considering how busy it was. I would definitely come back here - good for groups and its delicious food.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Yarrrrr.....iba...Yariba..Yariba!!

Surrounded by crowd roar & excited fans...we sat and faced each other with that uncontrollable look of fury. Napkin on lap & salt on one hand...we gazed at the crunchy, fried tortilla chips with tangy salsa as both made its way to our table. This was not a date....this was the highly anticipated...Tortilla Chip Face off...off off off off off *insert echo effect*

Of course I won...

Who wouldn't be able to resist Velvet Cantina's tortilla chips? This by far is "the joint" to devour on some fried crunchies along with their tangy salsa. And to pair it up with the Coconut Lime Ceviche just made it all the more yummy with marinated shrimp, pineapple, tomatoes, cilantro, red onion and mango pieces...surely addictive.

My opponent had the equally yummy chicken avocado enchiladas made of shredded chicken, cheese, avocado, cilantro pesto with rice and refried beans. He ate like a king.

Impressive food & a merry atmosphere (it was lively for a Monday night when we went)...I would love to bring my girlfriends here to celebrate a birthday or just for a girls night out. And that would've been a battle on the tortilla chips...believe that!
author: Charmian D.

description:
Went here for a birthday celebration this past Thursday and was less than enchanted with the food, drinks, and service. The staff lost our reservation (for a party of eleven: this is why we made a reservation, people!) and seemed put out at having to assemble a large table for our group. The food was inconsistent: the chips were wicked greasy, the rice was bland, but the mole was pretty darn good. Margaritas were just what you'd expect. Like many have noted here, the dining room was too loud for conversation and too dark to see much of anything. 
The one redeeming aspect of my dining experience: s'mores nachos. Cinnamon chips + chocolate syrup + toasted marshmallows = hella goodness. Would I once again withstand the surly service and clublike dining room for this luscious dessert? Probably not - but I'd get the s'mores to go.
author: Kate G.

description:
April 10, 2010, Saturday night, Chicken Mole was tasty and I gobbled the whole thing up. Two hours later, barfed my brains out. Drank a few margarittas and a beer over the two hours we stayed there and didn't feel drunk, so that wasn't it.  Sad really, because I was raving to my fellow patrons how much I enjoyed the food...

Food poisoning is my guess. Felt terrible most of the following Sunday.
author: Justin B.

description: Their food was good. They were a little crowded and in a part of the Mission that isn't especially pretty. Their drinks were a bit weird and I didn't like them.
author: amber h.

description:
Chicken-Avocado enchiladas. 








I thought I'd let you think about that a while. 
This place hits it out of the park with food and drink. The service is slow, so don't fill up on chips and salsa! The drinks are steeply priced but worth it. The ambience - well, it's loud and kind of dark, but I love it just the same. It's not exactly 'date night' material, but who wants Mexican food on a date night? 

Go with your friends on a night you're sure to sleep alone. 

I think it's worth noting that Velvet Cantina is not afraid to spice their food. Gods bless them for serving well-spiced, spicy-hot food.
author: Amani Ellen L.

description: Best Mexican food in San Francisco! Everything on the menu is excellent with a unique twist on the traditional. Service is superb. Order the fresh fruit flavored Margaritas. A must visit.
author: Liv M.

description: nice place to have a drink. nice tequila selection. very divey, but nice. food is pretty good too. would have given a better rating but I tried to reserve the place for a party and never got a call back, even tho I met with them and they said they'd work out a quote. oh well, still good neighborhood place.
author: Roy N.

description:
Great margaritas in a young, fun environment! The decor is a little much, but it's definitely bold and unapologetic.

When I was there, the entire staff was boys and they're definitely easy on the eyes (friendly too)!
author: Vicente G.

description:
I'm not really clear whether it is the queso dip or the Superman-strong margaritas that make this my favorite local Mexican restaurant (maybe even favorite local restaurant, period), but every time I think of dining somewhere a little fancier than a taqueria, this joint sits high atop the list of possibilities.

I'm thinking it's probably the margaritas. The bartenders, competent and quick, pour more tequila and triple sec into those pitchers than you can really wrap your mind around. Split a couple of those badboys with friends, and you won't know where your mind is anyway. I'm just gonna cut to the chase here: I always leave this place drunk. If not drunk, then definitely tipsy. I cannot resist their delicious margaritas that punch you right in the mouth when you drink them.

The food is good. It's solid. I wish they hadn't changed the ceviche, but I ain't hating on them for that. The entire menu is worth a try. 

Make a reservation, and you'll get a good seat and good service. The waiters and waitresses are friendly and speedy, and they get increasingly good looking with each new bar drink.

I love this place because it is a little dark, a little divey, a little rough around the edges. There is zero pretense, but lots of Missionites looking for good booze and substantial food with which to soak it up. For a party kinda dinner out, date-wise or with a group, this place is hard to beat.
author: Brittney G.

description: Had the chicken avocado enchiladas which were delish. I wish the beans and rice weren't room temp though. Also, tasted the chile verde and wished I had ordered that instead! YUM!! I'm sure I'll be back at some point to explore more of the menu.
author: Natasha P.

description:
I was sitting in the living room last night around 9:30pm and I was hungry.  My girlfriend asked what I would like to eat.  My answer was somewhere we have never been, preferably Mexican food.  When the name Velvet Cantina was presented as an option in the Mission, I jumped up and headed straight to the door.  What is it about that name?  I love it!  Velvet Cantina.  I didn't even ask if the food was good.

So we get there and are blessed with rockstar parking within 50 feet of the front door which had to be a sign of good things to come.  As we walked up, I noticed a really cool door and signs that say things like "Edibles and Elixirs".  I liked it already.

We walked inside and we were basically in the bar/lounge area.  We were immediately greeted by a nice woman who asked if we wanted to eat dinner.  We responded that we would like dinner, and she promptly seated us at the perfect booth in the middle of the room.  Looking around, I really liked the feel.  There were red lights hanging down from the ceiling and an interesting bar.  This is the type of place that immediately transforms you once you are in the door and I really liked the ambiance.  My girlfriend agreed.

I believe that there is another dining area that is not attached to the bar (with separate entrance) but we did not notice that until we were leaving.  I only post this because a family might want to dine on the other side, away from the booze.

First, the chips rolled out with salsa.  The chips were thick, crispy, and very tasty.  The salsa was thick and chunky...much thicker and chunkier than any restaurant salsa I have ever had.  It was delicious.  We had to have more chips and salsa brought to the table because we ate them so quickly.

Next, it was the ceviche.  Yum!  There were mangos in it, which added a pop of flavor that was very good, and I am not normally a fan of mango.  This plate lasted about half as long as the first basket of chips.

Finally, our main courses arrived.  I had the chicken avocado enchiladas and my girlfriend had the steak tacos.  We both got the refried beans and rice that come with.  They also offered black beans and something else that I can't remember...maybe charro beans, but I am a die-hard refried bean guy.  My plate was fantastic.  My girlfriend agreed after a little taste of my enchiladas.  I tasted her steak and it was also very good.  We were both completely satisfied.

Overall, we didn't have a single complaint between us.  This place is really good and I would return again tonight if asked to go.  The price was very fair for all that we ate/ordered.
author: Ryan W.

description: Cute place in the Mission.  Plus they agreed to make my marg with fresh lime juice, instead of the premixed sweet and sour.  The chips and salsa were good, addicting as always.  The atmosphere was lively, especially for a Tuesday night.  I would definitely go back.  The food was decent, but I only had apps.  I didn't stay for dinner, but will def report back when I do.
author: Keshia H.

description:
I went a few weeks ago, can't NOT rate it as it still is good in my book!

It was quite packed when 4 of us went there, and as we stood draining our $20 margarita PITCHER, we were able to get a booth by the time we finished it!

The food was great, nothing over done or overly greasy, as well as decent price for the quantity and quality you get!  I'd totally go back, not a quiet environment, especially around happy hour, but totally great for food, friends and drinks!
author: Scott M.

description:
I find myself craving Velvet Cantina mole. It..is...amazing.  It's perfectly sweet, salty, a little bit spicy.  And I love that they serve you chicken drumsticks, non of that all-white-meat-chicken-breast BS.

All the other food is delicious too.  The sopes, the chile verde - all noteworthy dishes.  Also, don't forget to try some tequila!  It's really fun to come here with some friends to share a pitcher (or two) of margarita.  

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city.
author: Carmen L.

description:
This is a funny place. The crowd here is always completely dissimilar from the crowd you'd find at any other Latin restaurant in the Mission. Somehow this place has a "safe" reputation and most everyone who eats here is from god knows where.

Also, everyone is in large groups, celebrating birthdays with co-workers or college buddies or whatever, giving the place this a weird, falsely cheerful, after-work vibe:

"Ashley, OMG, everyone's meeting at Velvet Cantina in the Mission after work for Julie's b-day! They have like the nummiest margaritas ever! We're gonna get her so wasted! You just HAVE to come!"

The margaritas are hit or miss depending on the flavor and who's behind the bar -- often too sweet. Once the pitchers start getting passed around the table, they definitely do the trick though.

Props for the homemade chips and salsa. The food is okay, and plentiful, but not particularly memorable. The weeknight happy hour from 11 pm 'til midnight is a nice touch.
author: Adam Z.

description: Can't comment on the food, since we only came here to pass time while waiting for our table at a nearby restaurant, but goddamn the bartenders here make a mean margarita. The watermelon margarita I got was absolutely delicious. The free chips and salsa are pretty good, too -- almost as good as the free mango habanero shots our bartender gave us. Be careful with those! The only way we survived them was by using our margaritas to chase them down. #noregrets
author: Annie Y.

description: ewww! this stinks. t h e foodyestyay5an tzran tuauntanytayntynutau nay5e u5auna5u6eayn5 auya nuaun 65anu6 a ana4unnu6a4nu6a4anua4n
author: Rollan G.

description:
Love this place. Let me tell you why.. 

A) The waiter was Hot 
B) The menu is original and absolutely delicious.
C) The waiter was HoT 
D) Excellent service. Attentive but not in your face. 
E) Great Vibe. Great background music, red lighting, a very.."Yes everyone, you're in the Mission!" vibe to it (in a good way). 
F) Did I mention the waiter? Highly doable..Highly.
author: Shreya C.

description: My only complaint about this place is not their fault:  there is often a long wait.  So instead I always make a reservation.  The salsa is amazing.  If you get their early the chips are super fresh.  And the mole must have crack in it, as that is the only explanation of how much I love this stuff.
author: Tia B.

description:
One of my primary go to restaurants in the hood.

Food is always good, atmosphere is always good, bar tenders are cool, waiters are a little slow sometimes but always super nice.

Yes it is fairly small, and pretty loud, perfect!
author: pat y.

description: Good margaritas.  The food is OK, more Tex Mex style IMO than Mexican though.  It wasn't as flavorful as I'd like and not very memorable... like each time I go here, I struggle to remember what I've eaten here before.   That said, I like the atmosphere a lot, they're open late, and the tables in the back are suitable for larger groups.
author: Heidi M.

description: 1st off the restaurant is super small. So if you have a party over 4, don't go here. Find another spot to have dinner and margaritas. The menu seemed limited to me. I had the super burrito which was beans and chickpeas on it (ok I guess, hella weird). I had a watermelon margaritas with salt. It was horrible! No watermelon favor at all. All I could taste was tequila and salt. If I wanted tequila shots I would have asked for it!!!! and to top it off the place was dead. This was just a no for me, all the way around
author: Krystle S.

description: Really unique bold and delicious take on Mexican food and ambience, awesome staff and overall service! The perfect margarita is perfect, the mushroom empanadas are killer. This is a serious hidden gem that is one of my new favorite restaurants. Oh and you are lucky if you get Erik as a server!! He's the best.
author: H B.

description: This is my new favorite spot in the Mission.  The staff somehow rolls it out super cool without being pretentious, it's not too loud to have a conversation without yelling, the margaritas are top notch, and they throw in a complimentary bout of chips and salsa to boot.  What's not to love??
author: Jim S.

description:
Whaaaaaaaaat?!?!?

How have I not reviewed this place yet!! It is one of my favorite restaurants in SF!! Clearly the margarita brain eraser theory is in action here. ;)

So lemme tell ya about Velvet Cantina. They have a cheese dip here that borders on crack. Seriously, I crave it. I yearn for it. I dream about it. And often I have completely inappropriate and naughty fantasies about it. Clearly, I either need psychological help or it is that good. I will go with the latter :)

Then there are the enchiladas. Chicken, avocado, cheese and yum. The mole is great here too from what I can smell and see from the faces of my friends who have ordered it. I would partake, but it has that cinnamon thing and I can't eat that due to a deathly allergy. And who likes dying over chicken. Then there are the margs. While a little on the sweet side for my taste, they are still really good and after a few pitchers with friends all is good.

The vibe is also super fun. Everyone from the bartenders to the servers to the owner and the patrons are all lively and fun and in the 8 or so times that I've come here, I've never had a bad meal or a bad time. And that's sayin somethin! :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
My favorite casual Mexican dining spot in the Mission.  

The highlights: the staff (mostly family) is always amazing when I go to VC.  One server has looked up bus routes for me, they are always in a good mood, and the bartenders at night are super attentive and friendly.
The fresh fruit maragritas are great. Awesome, in-house made, tortilla chips.

The space is cozy, nothing fancy.  Good, casual night time spot to grab a drink with friends.
author: Nicole Q.

description: I love this place!  The food and drinks are always good.  They're great at accommodating large parties... just make sure to call in advance to set a reservation.  Oh and pretty much all the guys that work there are hot... especially this one server... I just want to throw money at him every time I see him.
author: Jessica F.

description: This place is a great little cantina with a good ambiance.  My date and I had food at the bar and we both thought it was pretty tasty, but what made this experience really great was the asian bartender...I think his name was Darius.  He had us laughing all night!
author: Carl B.

description:
I was expecting better based on reviews. Its okay but don't think I will be back. 

The place is way too dark for my taste. I like to see what Im eating. All the food needed salt and spice and nothing blew me away. One plus is the backround music. Im sure if I had had some alcohol I would have disregarded the food and given it more stars. Oh well.
author: E. Y. G.

description:
The only thing keeping this place from "methinks not" territory is the fact that the margaritas are decent. 

The food? Not so good. It's a far cry from authentic, flavorful Mexican. Think fusion and overpriced instead. 

I made the mistake of ordering the caesar salad last time and it reminded me of a salad you get from Wendy's or some other fast food joint. I've had the chicken enchiladas twice now and I just don't really love them. I thought they were OK the first time so I ordered them again but when I was digging in, I realized that I must've been drunk to have liked them. They are dry enchiladas. Sad!

I think that for a big group of people who want to have a rowdy dinner, this isn't actually that bad of a pick but I don't see myself coming back here again.
author: Alli J.

description:
One of my favorite places in the city for great margaritas, atmosphere, and food.  You have to try their fresh fruit margaritas...sooo delish!!  I love the tortilla soup, the tacos, and the nachos!  

The staff are always friendly and make you feel at home.  I highly recommend this spot!!
author: Taña Marie R.

description:
I came here for my friend's bday and had a great time.  Despite our large group taking up half the room, service went smoothly and there were no delays with our food.

Dranks: Strong margaritas!  They have different fruit flavors.  I wouldn't drink it for the taste but if you want something with a kick, these will do it.

Food: The complimentary chips & salsa were so good that I couldn't stop eating them.  You would think salsa would be simple to make but it's always surprising to find how many places get it completely wrong.  I got the shrimp diablo for my entree.  It had just the right amount of kick and was packed with flavor.  It was so good that I'm willing to brave crappy Mission parking just to get it again.  The nopales veggie mix was delicious but I did not like the "Mexican slaw" AT ALL.  It made me think of a bad knock off of kimchi.  Next time I will definitely try to sub the slaw with something else.

Parking: Not surprisingly, parking is horrible.  You can test your luck with street parking (we got lucky) but there is also a parking garage nearby.

Service: Great.  Fast.  Friendly.

Prices: Reasonable prices but not cheap.  If you get drinks, expect to pay about $25-30/person.  No drinks, probably around $20.

Ambiance:  It's pretty dark inside.  Nothing fancy.  There is a bar area with dining tables and also a separate room with dining tables only.  If you don't want to be in the very noisy area, you should eat in the separate room where it's a little less noisy.

Overall: Great place for a celebration with a big group.  I'd come back.
author: Justine L.

description:
Just went here with a friend for a dinner on a Tuesday night, as I eat my way through the mission.  Overall, the food was very tasty, as well as very reasonably priced.  I highly recommend that you try the Chicken Mole.  I've had a good variety of mole in my life, and nothing compares to this one.

Expanding more on the mole in particular... it came with a choice of refried or black beans, a spicy side (wasn't so memorable), and I had some caesar salad instead of rice because they ran out of rice.  This dish also came with 3 tortillas.  The mole itself had 3 big, tender, and juicy, drumsticks.  I gave one of them away to my friend, and still had enough to fill me up for dinner.  Yes, the tender chicken was pretty cool, but really the warm mole sauce takes the cake.  It had the right balance of cinnamon, chocolate, and sweetness.  It even goes well with the tortilla!  Almost like a Nutella of sorts!

I saw the multiple mentions of poor service.  I can't say that I've noticed this.  The one slight complaint is that the booths we sat in were not very comfortable, but that's not a big deal.  

Dimly-lit with strong margaritas, I think this place would be a great date place!
author: Leo C.

description:
I am giving 5 stars for the margaritas alone!  I used to go to Puerto Allegre on Valencia when I craved a margarita, but no more.  After a little sleuthing on Yelp, I decdied to go into the Velvet Cantina for drinks after having eaten at our fave taqueria.  We were NOT disappointed.  We sat at the bar, and had a great conversation with the bartender--Peter--who was friendly and made fantastic margaritas.  I particularly enjoyed the fresh watermelon margaritas...it's not candy sweet like some...and it was light, refreshing, and kick ass.  

Next time we go, I will try the food as well, but the margaritas alone make this place well worth your time.  After three, I was toast.
author: Julie T.

description:
Service: 3.5/5
Food: 3/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $$
Presentation of food: 3/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 3/5

had their Chicken Avocado Enchilada and it was very bland ): but my friend had the Chicken Quesadilla which tasted really good and flavorful. The drinks were pretty good, i personally got a Sex on The Beach (kind of strong for my taste); and a Sour Amoretto which was extremely yummy!
author: Eva H.

description:
GOOD:
- Nothing really.

JUST OK:
- The STEAK TACOS were very average. The meat didn't really have much flavor to it. They seem to compensate for their weak entrees with a big serving of beans and rice on the side. I can't believe I paid $13 for this.

BAD:
- The MARGARITAS were not good. I have no idea what other Yelpers are talking about. We got a pitcher of the MANGO MARGARITA and it was so bitter and salty that no one in my party could drink it and we sent it back. We replaced it with a pitcher of PINEAPPLE MARGARTIA and it was more drinkable but still on the bitter and salty side. 

CONCLUSION:
- This place totally caters to the gringo crowd and should be ashamed that they serve such average Mexican food and sub-average margaritas in the Mission.
author: Alex P.

description:
It's been awhile since I've been here. The last few times, which have been saturdays, we've gone it was a complete effing blast. I have to admit there was a bit of a wait but we were in sure hands. 

My previous visits have been marked by  a whirlwind of margs. To top it off, the bartender was keeping my friends and me well entertained with his wild comedy. He also pointed us towards what he likes to call the "Mexican flag," which is basically the best possible shit we could dip our chips into. 

I feel like the only knock on this place is the premade marg mix, but the bartender did the best with what he had.

All in all, a solid go-to in the mish before going out.
author: Kay L.

description:
Ever had one of those days when
a) pedestrians the city over are practically jumping in front of your car
b) you almost get arrested. twice.
c) you get stuck in traffic on the way to your bitchy girlfriend's house 
d) and run over glass because of the accident that caused the delay
e) are a bloated, hot mess
f) have gained about a million lbs and counting because you're too lazy to go to the gym or put down the chocolate. and cheese.
g) are in desperate need of a drink but can't get where you're trying to go to get all sorts of inebriated and because of all of the above?

Well...welcome to my world. Our world. This list was a combined effort. Some of the above apply to both parties.

Go to Velvet! Do not pass go (you can totally collect $200). Do not hesitate. The margaritas wash away all the ick and the bartenders will make you feel like the most un-bloated, beautiful girl in the world. They will make you laugh and your all-girl bitchfest will go swimmingly. The food? I wouldn't know too much about but it looks delicious and their salsa is to die for. The nicer you are, the stronger your drinks are and you will find yourself stumbling out the door with a big, stupid grin and a whole lot of happy in your tummy. Especially if you and your friends drink a pitcher of margarita each (not recommended, but highly enjoyable). The special fruit margies of the day are total winners! Try the melon if they have it on special. And don't drink and drive! Or do and really get arrested.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Chicken avocado enchiladas. Pitchers of margarita, mango and watermelon. Smores with nachos. Heaven already?? I think yes! 

Only complaint is that my party of 19 had to wait a bit after we arrived for our reservation...but once we were seated, party officially started! Great environment. Dim lights. Music in the background. Hot waiters. Large ass portions of food and drinks. I could have stayed there all night, no joke. They can expect another visit soon, ready for another good time!
author: Steph W.

description: This is our backup when we can't find a seat at Papalote! They have nice crunchy chips and the salsa is so YUM! I tried the prawn enchilada's and that was a hit for me. I was not in love with the lemonade tasting watermelon agua fresca.....but the margaritas are great and there is always a seat and magical parking spot right in front for us every time!
author: Lee M.

description:
One of the best Mexican food joint, ever. EVER! What we had and you should to. 

White Tortilla Soup-Be prepared for the sour cream empanada. Salivating just thinking about it again!

Chile Verde-That sauce!

Shrimp Diablo-Such richness and tender in the shrimp 

S'mores Nachos-Like churros

Avocado Cactus Enchiladas-Light but sooo good.

Velvet Nachos-not your ordinary nachos. What the hell is in the sauce, crack? Soooo yummy.
author: Jason D.

description: If you are in SF, you need to visit the Velvet Cantina!   Not only were the Margaritas TO DIE FOR, but the food was too.  We sampled about 50% of the menu and it was ALL GOOD.  Starting with the salsa - one of the tastiest I've tasted, to the outstanding Queso and Guacamole.  My favorite of the night was the mushroom empanada.  I could eat them all day long.  The staff was attentive and efficient.  Will go there everytime I visit the city by the bay and I recommend that you do too!
author: Robyn S.

description:
This place definitely has a cantina feel to it. It's old, dark, kinda stinky, and roudy! 

The food is above average. You'll find better Mexican places and worse ones for sure. I had the chilaquiles which I got well after the others at my table had finished eating...grrr!  They were good, but have had better. 

I did nibble on a friends cactus enchiladas - very good! Awesome veggie option!

I'll probably come back another time as everyone else seemed really pleased, but this first go round for me was just a-ok.
author: Zeke A.

description: One of those places you find yourself going to repeatedly even if you don't live in the neighborhood anymore, and it doesn't get old. Not that three times in a year should be called "repeatedly", but still, let me exalt consistency. The margaritas are consistently good and consistently plentiful (ah, yes, I have a dependency, thanks for asking). The food, same. The atmosphere is comfortable but bustling, specifically designed for a nice hour or two of getting fat and happy while carrying on scintillating conversation with a few friends. And I mean, come on, "Velvet Cantina", that is an awesome name for anything, let alone a restaurant. This place is on your list, trust me.
author: Peter B.

description: I've ordered food from here and it was good. I had their mole burrito. I love the ambiance of this place, it would be great for a date or just a day out with some friends.
author: Liliana C.

description:
Unbelievable nachos.  Honestly my honey and I could have just ordered those and walked away full and happy. The sauce on top is rich and almost tastes like there is butter in it.  
The fresh fruit margaritas with pineapple were awesome.  I'm not used to pineapple with tequila and it was a nice change.  Goes really well together.  We also tried the mango but it seemed to be missing something - mangos can be hit or miss and I think the one they used wasn't very sweet.
Our server was great.. very thoughtful and even offered to switch us to a booth when one opened up since that's what we initially wanted.
One star off bcuz the guys who work there were a little too preoccupied in their own affairs... goofing around. We had to wait a while to get boxes for our to go food and then for the check.  They were having fun so that's good but it shouldn't interfere w customer service.
Other than that I highly recommend it.  Great margaritas, great ambiance and very friendly staff.
author: Alisa M.

description:
So. Disappointed. 

How much of a Fail was Velvet Cantina? 

Not this much of a Fail: 
http://failblog.org/2008/11/10/dear-abby-fail/ 

Nor this much of a Fail: 
http://i141.photobucket.com/albums/r60/mr740ti/fail/millionaire_idiot_fail.jpg 

But maybe, just maybe, this much of a Fail: 
http://treebeard31.files.wordpress.com/2008/04/fail.jpg 

Because, you see, just like that little moose, I had some big plans. I wasn't about to hump a buffalo, but I did want quality Mexican fusion food and I thought Velvet Cantina was THE place after seeing review after review from people who loved it. Hell, for a period of time I was even considering having my birthday soiree there after reading Nicole G.'s and phil h.'s glowing reviews in June and July. 

Not so much. 

Slow service, disgusting drinks (granted we didn't have the margs - but as someone who adores lemonade to the point that I down 2-3 glasses normally and I couldn't even drink half of what they made me, I think that says something), chips and salsa lacking any sense of spice or salt or ANYTHING that resembled flavor, and a general lackadaisical approach to our dinner from the waitstaff. I will say that the waiter was gorgeous, but a waiter's tip cannot be given on good looks alone. 

Our main dishes somewhat salvaged the night - the burrito was decent and the chicken avocado enchiladas were nothing if but creative. But by that point we had waited so long for the food and were so unimpressed with the ambiance, service, and drinks, that it was pretty much a lost cause. 

And instead I found myself apologizing for an unimpressive meal, just like the moose found himself apologizing for molesting a statue.
author: Devon S.

description: This place has excellent service, delicious margaritas, great food, and funky-casual ambiance.  I am from out of town, and Velvet Cantina was exactly the kind of Mexican joint I was hoping to find.  Highly recommended!
author: Gem B.

description:
Love the ambiance but *nothing* makes up for the horrendous service we received at the bar last night. 

Friend and I grab two bar stools and order a couple of their top-shelf margaritas. After ten minutes of watching the bartender show off his best dance moves instead of making our drinks, he comes back to ask us what it was that we ordered again...? 

Right. 

Another ten minutes later we get our drinks. Not sure what the guy did to make all those premium ingredients taste like watered-down sweet & sour with a tequila shot on top. Needless to say we didn't guzzle them down. So he comes back and sees our lack of progress and here's where it ends up:

Bartender: Are they not good?
Me: No, they're pretty sweet.
BT: Oh, THEY'RE NOT GOOD?! 
Me: No, they're not too good.
BT: (yelling) WELL THANKS FOR THE BLOW TO MY EGO!!! DON'T WORRY YOU DON'T HAVE TO PAY FOR SHIT!!! (storms away)

Wow. What an angry little guy. Hopefully he's new (that would explain the craptastic margarita) and won't be around too long. With all the great places in the Mission though, I won't be looking to get drinks at the Velvet Cantina!
author: Kerrinski S.

description:
Chile con queso.  Three little words that together must form the phrase "Cheese dip of the Gods" I wanted to drink it from a shot glass, lather it on my face and let my friends dip their chips in it, do all sorts of naughty things. 

I've always tossed Velvet Cantina in the same company as Tommy's and Puerto Allegre as in horribly overrated. Boy was I wrong. EVERYTHING we tried was fantastic and super inexpensive for the quality. Service was fast and friendly (our waiter even spiffed us some free guacamole - thanks!) and the margaritas were delicious.

Not only is Velvet Cantina my new 'go to' Mexican spot, it's right up there with one of the best meals I've had so far this year. While all you suckers are waiting an hour plus at Tommy's (did I mention VC takes reservations?) I'll be sipping a tasty margarita on the rocks in a corner both with queso on my face.

ps...dude with the shiny pants and cowboy hat slamming Corona's on Saturday night was creepy yet hilarious in a way that can only be appreciated in the Mission. Thanks, Velvet Cantina!
author: phil h.

description:
Someday the cirrus vaults of the heavens will crack open and the answers to all the damning questions in my life will descend like a summer rain.  I'm not talking about eleusinian mysteries or profundities; I no longer have the stomach for the big questions of metaphysics or epistemology or some fucking bullshit I studied in college but can't remember.  

No bitches, in my rapidly advancing old age, I'M SIMPLIFYING.  I'm talking about questions like: how do businesses decide what to name their new venture?

Take the Velvet Cantina, for example.  Upon entering this "Modern Mexican" restaurant, I expected a throne or perhaps a velvet cushion for my bony ass.  Now maybe they had just shaved off the soft fibers, but my seat was made of cold and unwelcoming leather. Velvet Cantina, how dare you! YOU LED ME ON!!!

Well. To Velvet's credit, the food was quite delicious to my totally fucking GRINGOFIED palate.  The chicken avocado enchiladas were excellent, and I appreciated the added kick of the pepper jack cheese.  The velvet lasagna was a rich and earthy affair while the chile sauce kept things interesting.  And both dishes came with a wonderful pickled red cabbage (?) that I really appreciated as a tart counterpoint.  The prices were a perhaps a bit high -- my enchilada was $12.  But you know what? I guess that's just the "Dining With Hipsters" markup. I'm a cheap, crazy bitch -- I guess it's nothing to complain about.

I also thought our waiter was unquestionably hot, and wondered if he had a ballsac covered in soft peach fuzz that I could feel and, possibly, tongue.  I should have asked him, because at least I would have been able to die happy: I would have known why this restaurant is called the Velvet Cantina.
author: d s.

description:
Best_Birthday_ Evar! I might still be drunk if I'm talking like a pirate.

Velvet Cantina turned out to be the perfect place to celebrate my 30th. Our group of 20 hit the bar for pitchers of classic, pineapple and watermelon margaritas. And let me tell you... those fruity ones are dangerous. I'm a classic margarita girl all the way -- on the rocks with salt, please -- but once I decided to throw caution to the wind and partake of the fruity goodness, there was no turning back and a hangover was inevitable.

Once we were seated and the menus were passed around, everyone was blown away by the options and the fair prices. The sweet and spicy chicken mole, the cactus enchiladas and the trip tip were huge hits. I'm pretty sure ordering the tri tip was my saving grace and the reason I didn't end up in the gutter. For a group of 20, the bill came to $25 each! Not bad, but I don't think that included the pitchers.

The night was so good I think I'm even going to forgo throwing a big birthday bash. What could be better than getting loosy goosy with my besties? Nada.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Moody and hip, a natural choice for some tastebud titillation on a lively date. Down two of their pitchers and your date will be so impressed by the fresh watermelon juice in the pink margis, and tipsy from the potent tequila you'll be pleased it's so dim in there. 

Their plates of grub don't play around. Rich and hearty this is the kind of Mexican food that leaves you full the morning after. The molé was had some serious spunk, nutmeg coating your tongue. And their queso? Wow, I could drink the stuff straight. 

Accommodating to big groups, with affable servers, chances are you'll stagger away smiling.
author: Ligaya T.

description:
After being rounded up by Sav, Kathryn and others to head to da mission...we were outside of radio and leggy Laura was whispering in Sav's ear--he then yelled out-- to Velvet Cantina!!!  Chicks be always runnin things huh??  

Some of us hitched a ride with Bella, Jeff or BART...

On arrival to my surprise the place was a restaurant and bar- woulda been cool if i was able to drop off some kids at the bus-stop, but i was still carrying the burden of HCW.  The bar on the left was a neat setup with counter to the right where most folks were chillin, we ended up grabbing a bunch of tables on the left--very comfy =)

I made amends(well kind of) with AKA G and Jeff T by taking care of their coronas...Hannala, Britt, and leggy ran off to grab some food which they okayed w/the bartender...cool.  Cassio, K Paka Celebguru, Kate, Elena, Bella, Kathryn and Jeremy were all just marinating and jibber-jabbing...Gabe and I kinda got our soul clap down a bit more..and Sav was speaking the gospel on how they have modelo and some other beer in a can for $2--hallelujah!!!!!!!!!!!!!

From all the running around like half of us ended up calling it a night tho Britt was having a keg at her place--or at least that was the rumor Sav was spreading...hmm. oh well, gotta save some yelp'n for later!! 

Some cool cat i met- charlie said there is a mean Cinco de Mayo jamm here...this seems like quite the hot-spot and will return to soak it all up fer sure.
author: omar b.

description:
The queso is to die for.  Which is fitting, since I walked here from BART.

After getting lost around Capp & 18th, you'll be so thankful you're alive that you'll order half of the menu.  That's why I ordered the queso ($5.99) AND a chicken quesadilla ($7.00).  Not because I'm a glutton, but because I'm lucky to not be in the trunk of a Buick right now.

Make sure you knock before entering the unmarked restroom.  If you don't, then you might walk in on a prostitute.  Or me.  Big diff.  Sort of.
author: Janney B.

description:
I could have SWORN I gave this place a review before, but... well here it is... it's been a while, but... 

Go for the dark and cozy but almost burlesque side of the restaurant with the curiously bawdy mirrors by the bar. 

Bask in the open but private tables in the midst of the loud chatter and close quarters of the energetic and friendly clientele. 

Sample the traditional and excellent CalMex food and wash it down with a pitcher of stiff and fruity daiquiri. 

As I remember it, nothing could be finer.
author: Kingpin X.

description:
I may have to use one of my magic formulas to assess this place*. Here it goes;

     food                   energetic crowd
---------------  x  -------------------------------  = A
margaritas        hot attentive wait staff 

my friends       atmosphere
--------------- +  -------------------  = B
free tequila      value for the $

A x B x more free tequila = C

C = four stars. Duh! 

Notes on how I came to this answer: The energetic crowd here fit right in with me and my friends who were drinking lots of pitchers of tasty and strong margaritas served by the hot attentive wait staff in the dimly lit cozy restaurant. The food, after several shots of tequila that we were comped by yet another hottie, tasted better than it probably was. Okay, I can actually almost guarantee it was 3 star food to the sober palate, but remember the free tequila and it makes the food a good value for the money. 

*please note it is in no way an actual tested scientific formula.  I haven't worked with fractions since I got out of school, except for that time I took that class to learn how to frame stuff and those were basic fractions and my frames turned out all janky anyhow. So please don't criticize my math skills when you actually try to do this equation (geek) and my final rating makes no sense at all!
author: Drue C.

description:
they knew i was coming!

this place was so packed when i showed up that when i opened the door  i hit someone. less than three minutes later 1/2 the occupancy was gone.

the margaritas were delicious and well priced. the bartenders were hip and on it. the atmosphere was red and dark wood, i'd love to spend an evening here with 4-5 friends just drinking and hanging out in a booth.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Once again...a great meal here.  I was meeting some friends for dinner here and good thing I got there when I did.....they were trying to order margaritas by the glass.....bring me the pitcher.  The mango margarita.....gosh I love it here.

Since there was 5 of us and all of us love to eat...we ordered 3 appetizers to share.  The cornbread sopas with chicken...were delish....my friends loved the slaw...aka they nicknamed it mexican kimchi.  We also got the coconut lime shrimp ceviche...I've tried this before its ok but a bit too sweet for me.  Now the empanadas....that was a meal itself.  2 beef empanadas served with rice and refried beans...lol I even ate the beans...they were pretty tasty.

I ordered the shrimp diablo...no rice and extra veggies....I'm doing this low carb thing.  Large portion...very saucy and boy did it have a kick to it.  Now normally I like spicy but this dish was definitely something I needed my mango margarita to wash down...so I don't burn up.  

Other dishes to try here is the velvet lasagna and the chicken avocado enchilada.  Bring some friends, have some margaritas and enjoy a great meal.
author: Allison T.

description:
I've had better mexican food in Delaware. I'm totally serious. 

(I spend more time in Delaware than is socially appropriate to admit.)

I mean, dang. I brought my ex-stepmom here for what was supposed to be a sorta trendy, what-the-kids-are-into kind of dinner, and we ended up with a sorta shitty, "is this what the kids are into? because your generation has no taste" kind of dinner.

I'm not trying to be overly harsh; I know people are doing the best they can with their businesses and fuck yelp for providing an open forum to spread detrimental information like how the space looks like a glossed-over italian joint in des moines, or the "ceviche" is swimming in a cold tom kha and nearly impossible to eat without splashing coconut milk all over one's shirt.  

Because the service was really sweet and helpful and cool, and the tasty margaritas sort of make it okay that the taco plate is straight out of Chevy's, and that they were out of sangria (which had they had it  would have made everything seem more palatable.)

It's the only place I've had to struggle to meet the cozmo card's $40 food minimum, and the only place that's been a stickler about it. The cozmo card was really the catalyst for the visit and now I still have it. 

Anyone want it?
author: Megan W.

description: Meh, not as good as it should be or used to be.  Everything was very, very undersalted. Lots of good energy, but we were told we'd have to leave our table by 7:30 pm (we weren't lingering, this was before we sat down).  I don't like a ton of salt, but the food REALLY needed more... I was sad to not love my chicken avocado enchiladas...
author: Melanie K.

description: Best place for late night nachos and jugs of margaritas!
author: Marc S.

description:
I went here with a group of four people.  My wife and I had heard that this was a pretty decent place and, frankly, we were intrigued by the name.  My wife had the shrimp enchiladas and I had the chicken mole.  The enchiladas were okay, and the mole was actually pretty decent.  My wife had a beer and I had a margarita.

If all of this sounds pretty mundane, that's because it is.  See, we're not really "watermelon margarita" type of people.  We had heard that this was a decent Mexican place, and in the Mission, if you're a decent Mexican place, that means you're actually pretty good.   What we later realized is that the people who think this is a decent Mexican place are actually more interested in the various types of nontraditional margaritas they serve, and the loud rave music.  I can tell you that the cackling 20somethings celebrating a bridal shower in the booth next to us freaking loved it.  For me and my party...it was...not bad.


Service: 3 stars; no major mistakes, neither fast nor slow
Food: 3 stars; the selection is okay, and the mole is really quite tasty, but everything else was just ho-hum.
Ambiance: 2 stars; loud and dark.  Like I said, this is a Mexican joint for people who would rather be at a rave.
Price: 3 stars; I thought it was a little expensive for what you got.  I'd reviewed the menu on-line before going, so I wasn't surprised at the prices, but I was surprised at the portions.

Oh, one thing I will say: the chips were pretty damn tasty
author: Thomas K.

description:
Their oh-so-refreshing watermelon and pineapple margaritas are awesome! Thanks to Darius and Jason, who were behind the bar, our group was never without a pitcher. I think I probably ended up drinking an entire pitcher myself. Did I get wasted? No way! I may be petite, but I can hold my liquor. 

We were there celebrating Nicole's big 3-0, and we had a blast! The vibe is casual and lively, so our rowdy crowd fit in perfectly. The food was really delicious and cheap to boot (nothing over $16)! I had carne asada tacos and a couple bites of chile verde and both were tasty. Our bill came out to $25/person -- not bad! My sweetie took care of the pitchers, which were about $30 a pop though!

After a filling meal and 1.5 slices of the German chocolate cake we brought in from Just Desserts, I went home and passed out around 10pm. Ok... so maybe I was a little buzzed!
author: Connie C.

description:
I had a hankering for margaritas and guacamole so onto Yelp we went to find somewhere Mexican to try out. Velvet Cantina seemed to have pretty good reviews so we headed down to the Mission to give it a try. From the moment we walked in we loved the decor and vibe. We sat down and ordered the guacamole and a pitcher of margaritas. For me the guacamole wasn't anything to write home about. It just seemed to be missing something. The trick is to dip your chip in both the salsa and the guac. The combination of the two flavors is right on point! The chips and salsa that they bring to your table were definitely good, although the chips were a bit thicker and heavier than I like. Since we had a really big lunch earlier, we decided to go light on food. We ordered the appetizer tacos and it was exactly what we needed. The appetizer tacos certainly will not fill you up if you are looking for a full meal, but they are just the right size when all you need is a little snack. As for the flavor, the tacos were delicious! The chicken was tender and the sauce was something special. Finally, the best part was the margaritas! Its $25 for a pitcher and not a small pitcher either! It was worth it to go there just for the margaritas. 

Final synopsis: Its not the best Mexican place I've ever been too but its most definitely not the worst. Its got some highs (tacos, salsa, MARGARITAS) and then some lows (guacamole, chips) and its certainly worth a try if you are looking for a Mexican place.
author: Julie M.

description:
I'm no molé expert, but the Velvet Cantina molé?  Holé molé!  It was savory and spicy and magically textured with smoky chocolate.  Dark, smoky chocolate.  Mmmm sex on a plate.  And I never use that phrase - "sex on a" anything.

And my dish complimented the dark and sexy interior perfectly.  Come to think of it, maybe I wouldn't have found everything so sexy had I not been drunkity drunk drunk on their yummy margs.

Either way ... four sexy stars!
author: Audrey T.

description:
Starla just had to go and write the funny review.  That leaves me with nothing really more to say.

My salad was delightful with the vinagrette.
My $2 tecate was cheap and ...well cheap
The waiter, whom we remembered from our experience at Bluestill remained a cutie patootie.
And Starla's mole.  That was where the party was at.  And by mole i dont mean the cute one on her face.  I mean the coffee / chocolate whatever flavor that brown sauce is.  That was my first mole experience (aside from the one on my own face.)

But...you should go there.  Get the mole.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Went here for a friends birthday on a recent wednesday night. Waitress spilled 8 tequila shots on me. I though maybe I bumped her. But I hadn't yet been drinking and my friends who witnessed the incident remarked "I can't believed she spilled those on you!" 

After the incident I asked if she was OK, I was concerned about broken glass. She gave us attitude. SERIOUS ATTITUDE. the manager had to come over. There was over 10 of us at the table. She expected us to pay for all of the spilled shots, despite the fact that they were all still on her tray. The manager eventually made us pay for HALF OF THEM. 

The waitress was a total Bitch for the rest of the night. Our party was horrified. We  definitely refrained from ordering more and we went elsewhere promptly. Look spills happen. WE were apologetic and we would have done right by her in the tip. 
BUT her outrageous attitude and the fact that we bought 4 Shots of Heradura that we did not drink in order to avoid ruining our friends' birthday was outrageous. Next time we will go elsewhere. OUTRAGEOUS.

The food was also bad. Guac that tasted like pistachios. Greasy chips.

You can def. do better.
author: Alex K. W.

description:
Pitchers of Margarita..

Can't get that in Seatown, now can we??

Velvet Cantina boasts tasty authentic Mexican food, solid service, and some excellent libations that come in bulk!

For starters, we tried the Chile Con Queso. It was just okay. The guac was good, the salsa tasty, and the chips- never ending.

I had the Marinated tri tip, which was excellent. Perfectly cooked, Medium rare, and it came with grilled vegetables and Spanish rice.

I had bites of the:

Velvet Lasagna- WOW! Very tasty and aptly named. Apparently, this is a favorite..
Chile Verde- the pork was tender and the Verde sauce, spicy.
Chicken Avocado Enchiladas- avocados, chicken, and cheese.. this one was so good!

The margaritas were exactly how I like them- No mixer, just lime juice.. Oh, and they come in PITCHERS!?! Authentic 'mixerless' 'ritas are proving hard to find these days. These bad boys were strong and tasty. They also have a few other flavors if you're feeling adventurous- Banana and Mango.

The ambiance was that of a 'not so mainstream' Mexican restaurant. Nice, but not over the top. Great, speedy service and very acommodating with out big group of folks!

Oh.. and did I mention..

Pitchers of Margarita?
author: Katie A.

description:
This is the only restaurant in San Francisco that gets me homesick for Austin: strong, tasty margueritas, chili con queso (we're north of the queso line, so this is a rarity. Texas people know what I'm talking about- it's not just nice, it's damn near obligatory to have a bowl of cheese with your food in Texas, but once you're north of, say, Dallas, people have strange assumptions re: your colon), and fantastic mole sauce.

And, through the course of my pitcher of marguerita, I developed a wholly understandable crush on our waitress, making me less and less able to look directly at her, so I probably seemed like a drunk, aloof asshole rather than a drunk and sheepish schoolkid, which was actually the case.
author: jason l.

description:
I was drunker than a skunk the last time I had a meal at the Cantina, so I didn't think I was capable of giving it a fair review until today. I went back completely sober on a hot hot day looking forward to some cool margaritas for a little birthday dinner. First of all, I have to say I like how dark it is inside, sort of sets the tone. What that tone is, I'm not sure, but I like it. Cue up pitchers of booze, which is never a bad thing in my book. The margs were interesting mixes of watermelon and pineapple flavors, a little sweet for my particular boozerific palette, but still delicious. And I have to say, the food was pretty darn tasty, even without beer googles on (or beer tastebuds, or drunk munchies or whatever phrase the kids are using). I could only eat half of my bordello burrito, though, it was the size of a house cat. All in all a worthwhile experience that I'll have to repeat. 

Oh, and the best part was our huge group was ordering pitchers with about as much reckless abandon as a group can have on a school night, but that said, my bill was about $15 less than I had expected for all the food and drink I shoveled in. Gotta love tasty, cheap Mexican, baby.
author: Michael E.

description:
Watermelon, watermelon, watermelon margaRRR(roll it)RRRITAS!!!

Margaritas always seem like such a fantastic idea.  There's farking TEQUILA in them, AH!  Why don't I think of this before opening my throat to the third margarita pitcher/funnel?  

My own demons and addictions aside, this place rocks!  It's truly a divey Mexican food spot, complete with the perfect lighting and comfy chairs.  The menu is readable and had enough options, but you weren't bogged down with the painful decision making process of most Mexican food places where you have to choose one entree out of a 4 pager, double sided menu.  The entrees are always the same shit just concocted different ways visually on your plate, anyway.  Velvet Cantina minimizes the confusion with ordering, and they've got some great dishes, ie. the Chicken Avocado Enchiladas, mmm!!!

The White Tortilla Chicken Soup was OK.  Not so spectacular, it was a little too thick .  Not the way I usually like my tortilla soup.  The cornbread sopes, again OK.  Hadn't really tried anything like them before and was looking to get wowed and I ended up not even finishing them.  The food could improve, the service was great, the drinks made the night.  Margarita stories are always the best!  If you can get past the 'someone's cat took a shit in my mouth feeling' the morning after from the Tequila, you're golden!
author: Kelly H.

description:
Came here for my brother's 30th Birthday dinner this past weekend. This was my 3rd time here. I actually recommended it to our large party of 20- as I thought it would be a fun/yummy place for dinner before a night of debauchery. Man- I was disappointed! What the hell happened to you Velvet Cantina?! 

First, after got in, we decided to get some drinks. The bar was between shifts, so it was chaos. I just wanted a beer and a mixed drink. They were making pitchers of margaritas, and setting up the bars, and blah, blah.. It was taking forever! We had to end up sitting down because my brother was on his way in and we were surprising him. 

The chips and salsa were good. The apps were meh.. The nacho-type cheese that everything was topped with- nachos, sopes, and empanadas had a burned taste. Not good. 

The entrees weren't any better. The rice tasted old. You know the taste- stale, kind of crunchy. THEN- my bros friend found a long blond hair in his taco. WTH? And of course he announced it to our entire party- which sucks because then everyone is double-checking their food for hair. It just turns off the entire meal. The server did comp his dinner, which was only right. 

Our server was meh too- didn't seem very happy to be serving a large group. I don't see why not.. We weren't drunk, picky, etc... 

So overall- I was very disappointed with this visit. Not sure what's going on at the Cantina, but don't think I'll be back anytime soon. Sorry....
author: Angela L.

description:
Well, I was quite impressed with the ole VC.  The decor was perfect, and the hot waiters were friendly and professional.  I made a joke about VC being a Mexican restaurant for gringos, but by that I meant that the place was full of hipsters.  Until they all left.... then some locals came in to hang out at the bar.  You have to respect a place that's so multi-use.

The margaritas were fantastic and reminded me that I get yappy when tequila is involved.  (Note to self:  drink tequila alone.)  The nopalito/avocado enchiladas were compelling, the black beans smoky, and the rice was the perfect unobtrusive mortar that held the meal together.  My pal had the huge veggie bordello burrito and it was aptly named.  Really!

I'd ding the table next to us a few stars for being ridiculously loud, but that's not really VC's fault (the margaritas may be accomplices, but I'd never turn them in ).  Once the dinner crowd had moved on to the next hipster venue du jour, the place was actually quite mellow and cozy.  I'd consider living there.
author: Andi T.

description:
The nachos were something out of a dream. Perfectly crisp chips and sublimely delicious liquid cheese. 

Everything was so magical that I was extra sad when I mysteriously barfed it all up an hour later.

Was this Velvet Cantina's fault? Perhaps. Could it have been due to me scarfing down an entire plate of nachos and half a pitcher of sangria after not eating all day? Also a possibility.

Sorry this review is unpleasant. I will stop now.
author: D e v a n.

description:
So it was a Saturday night, my 30th birthday. I had 22 guests. The waiter was so speedy and very patient with my loud crowd. I was most entertained by the fact that I slipped through the back and thought the restaurant was only that back room. HA. 

The food all came at about the same time, I'm impressed seeing as though my party took about 30 minutes to sit then order. The margaritas are SO good. I drank um like juice. (my date had his hands full). I ate the diablo shrimp, omg that shrimp was so hot and yummers. I also had bite of the cevica, which was ok. Something else to a chicken something. Clearly I had to many cups of juice. 

I'm going back so that A. I can walk not crawl out of this restaurant B. taste the food and remember what it was called.
author: Desiree Y.

description:
Here's what's fantastic about The Velvet Cantina:

The mole. I never liked mole before I tasted this particular dish. Eat it slowly, because the full flavor of the sauce is only revealed after you've had it in your mouth for a few seconds. The fact that I stole a bit of it off of someone else's dish while she was outside made it that much better.

The service. It was crowded and busy when we were there but they really took care of us*.

Here's what's pretty good about The Velvet Cantina:

The chicken & avacado enchiladas. Tasty!

The margaritas. I'm not really a margarita person but I enjoyed them.

I have nothing else to talk about. Everything about this place that I recall was either pretty good or fantastic. I'm gonna say 4.5 stars.

*For various reasons other members of our party were treated to free shots of tequila, but mainly because The Velvet Cantina is run by really nice people. I did not have any free tequila so unlike the reviews of some of my co-diners you may regard this review as completely impartial.
author: matthew r.

description:
Stopped in with a group of friends on a beautiful Saturday afternoon after beer & jäger in the park. Everyone kept raving about the house-made tortilla chips and the margarita pitchers, so I decided it was time to investigate.

We were promptly seated despite not having a reservation. The venue is rustic and warm with random brick-a-brack decor and quirky paintings on the walls. Great ambiance. I'm not sure who owns the place, but judging by the youthful, handsome all-male waitstaff, it must be a cougar or a horny old gay guy (either way, no complaints here).

The chips & salsa were indeed some of the best I've had in SF and the margarita pitchers pack a hardy punch (I was looking forward to the Cucumber Serrano shot, but alas... it had been 86ed for the evening). Our group ordered family style.  

Although the portions are fairly substantial, most of it is beans and rice. The Bordello Burrito in particular was suffering from serious rice overkill. You literally had to cut into the middle of the burrito to discover the nucleus of meat. The chef at Velvet Cantina knows how to do a great sauce... unfortunately its not used enough. Ultimately, I found the food a little underwhelming. If I had to recommend something, I'd suggest sticking with the quesadilla or the nicely-marinated tri-tip.

As the evening progressed, the crowd in the restaurant grew significantly louder and larger. At one point, a group of rowdy bros & bro-hoes were practically hovering over our table, which was mildly annoying. Arrive early so you can be out before the chaos commences.

I'm sure I'll be back at some point to try the S'more Nachos. This time around, we were too full on rice and beans.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Another Cantina/Taqueria in the Mission? "hmmm...the Mish needs another mexican place as much as the Gav needs more gel in his hair", so I was a weeeeee bit skepticalish of this place, especially since the kitchen fire shut this place down for like 3 orbits of venus. I mean seriously, I know this place is supposed to be hot, but burning down the kitchen hot.? SRSLY kids.

and i mean SRSLY!!! To quote Tito C- "holy shit this place is good"- and i've got to throw down props on top of that, with a side of Guac (hold the sour cream). Lets start with the chips- no staleness, only crispity crunchety goodneses, with the salsa that hits that oh so diffiuclt balance between tomato-ness and spicyness and general hella goodness. 

Appetizers of the the corncake somethingorethers with chicken was crazy tasty- almost like a cornbread muffin stuffed with chicken, guac and salsa. yeah. tasty.

But that's not what sent me into that orgasmexican place- it was the Mole. I've been searching the city for the best mole since coming back from a few weeks in the Yucatan, and nothing has really caught my crush- until Velvet Cantina. The mole sauce is PERFECT- its rich, chocalatey, and even a little sweet! plus the spice gives it a nice kick. My buddy loved the steak tacos too- saying they were some of the best he's had here in the misison- and he's been living close to papalote/Panch villa for years, so its a fo' real recommendation.

5 stars, no looking back, unless its to grab that last chip that I didn't think I had room for.....
author: Tim V.

description:
Ahhh, the Velvet Cantina, serving up down-home Mexican food with a side of trance music and a whole lotta cumin (the spice, silly!) -by adorably twinkie waiter-boys.

From the beginning of this description, you may be expecting something pretentious like Zazil or Tres Agaves. But the Velvet Cantina does it well in a dark downstairs room with wood paneling,  lots or old red lamps, and some racy murals.  There are even a pair of matching Charro Candles behind the bar --the original Hoochie-Coochie Girl!  I think their carpenter may have gone overboard with the crown molding and a miter box.  

Apparently, they do happy hour at 10pm, including weekends.  Note to self: check that out!

This is a seriously odd little restaurant, but the food is very very good, the prices are low and the margaritas kick ass!  And I sure as hell can't find any fault with that!
author: Amy A.

description:
While I disagree with Megan about the quality of the food here, she's onto something (as she is wont to be).  To the layman's eye, a mid-priced Mexican place with bordello-red walls, squat booths worthy of a cattlemen's club and a prominent bar dishing out mango margaritas would be just what the doctor ordered for the denizens of the Mission.  But there's a sort of earnestly-trying-to-be-cool vibe that's exactly the kind of thing the desperately hip locals are prone to scoff at.  And it's not like you can show off your disposable income either, what with the highly-reasonable prices and all.

Luckily for me, I'm down with the ironically unironic, and I'm also a sucker for any place that serves up free piles of hot-out-of-the-fryer chips (even though they ruin my appetite every time).  I highly recommend the Shrimp Diablo (ask them to give you a few corn tortillas with it and you've got some awesome makeshift fajitas).  Just be sure to sit in the east room; the bar exudes far more ambiance than the door to the kitchen.
author: Wes M.

description: The chicken mole is superb, the chilli verde is amazing and the margaritas will kick your ass. Bonus, the marshmallow nachos ain't bad either.
author: Mateo E.

description:
A friend of mine brought me here once for the killer margaritas the first time...bartenders were great fun and super cool people to hang with while drinking. (yes they actually hang with you if it ain't packed)

the food is also pretty friggin amazing.
so far the cactus enchilada, chicken enchilada and Velvet Nachos have made it to my all time fav list.

the service has also been consistently great..just a few days ago I was there with my girl we had just placed out order and about ten min in we had to leave because of an emergency call she received on her cell.

without any hesitation they packed up our food before I even asked (our server overheard the call) and helped us get all organized so we can leave quickly.

this place is great...Velvet is a cool hang out, great casual date place and killer food.

I will always be a patron at Velvet
author: Dean M.

description:
Came here after a show on Saturday to meet up with some friends who happened to know one of the bartenders.  So basically what I'm saying is I had too many tequila shots that I didn't have to pay for.

Awesome.
author: Erika C.

description: Went there a couple of weeks ago to celebrate a new job with friends and we had a great time. The food was outstanding, the service was very good, and the atmosphere was fun and lively, even later on in the evening. Yummy, strong margaritas, delicious, rich chicken mole, and the s'mores nachos are totally overwhelmingly to die for. Great place for a special occasion when you don't mind yelling to be heard, though.
author: J.J. P.

description: There are sooo many great Mexican restaurants in the Mission that I'd be hard pressed to come here. The best part about the Velvet Cantina is that it's pretty big and not as popular as some other places so I find the wait to be reasonable which I cannot say of various other places I have tried to get seating at on a Friday or Saturday night. The coolest thing here is the s'mores nachos thing they do for dessert. It's quite a show and pretty tasty too. Drinks are good, chips are good, entrees are totally skippable.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Wow.  We had a fantastic meal at Velvet Cantina.  When I first walked in, I admit I was a bit taken aback.   From the pictures on yelp, I thought that it would be more intimate and nicer-looking inside.   But hey, we figure if the food is good, who cares right?   The crowd was lively and it was VERY crowded on a Saturday night.  Even with reservations, we had to wait another 10 minutes for the table to become available.  We noticed a lot of large groups and couples having dinner/drinks.  We decided to grab some margaritas at the bar until we were seated.  We ordered the raspberry and blueberry margaritas.   They were both great, but I didn't really taste the fruit flavors like I thought we would.   They were very strong though...I got a buzz off of one drink!  

We were seated in a cozy booth near the front of the restaurant.  The chips they serve are so addicting and delicious.  They could possibly be the best chips I've ever had.  The salsa was pretty good too.   We decided to start with the chile con queso and the carne y queso empanadas.  YOWZA.  These were so good.  The queso was smooth and creamy...it went perfectly with the chips.  The empanadas had a fantastic flavor and they were served on a bed of rice and beans.  I would highly recommend these appetizers.  

For our entrees, we chose the tri-tip and the steak tacos.  Our waiter was very helpful with our questions and he was also very attentive throughout the meal.  The steak tacos were ok, but the tri-tip was really fantastic.   I will probably order the tri-tip or the chicken avocado enchiladas next time.   The prices are totally reasonable and the portions are huge.  This restaurant would be a great place to come with a group of friends.
