Velvet Cantina blew Colibri Mexican Bistro out of the water.  Sure, Colibri has a nicer decor...but Velvet Cantina has so much more to offer: a relaxed/fun atmosphere, better food, superior service, and cheaper prices.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Overall, I think this is a solid 4 star place - food was good, portions were big (I definitely went home with leftovers), excellent tortilla chips, and good for big parties.

The margaritas were good - not standout per se, but I give them props for the cool flavor infusions like mango and watermelon.  Sometimes, with drinking, you just have to mix it up a little bit.  (No pun intended.)

The standout item in my mind was the cucumber + serrano pepper vodka shot.  It may sound gross, but trust me, if my liver weren't such a naysayer, I could drink pitchers of this stuff forever.  But there are veggies in it, so you should get as much as you can, right?
author: Alice C.

description:
Let's see how much more food I can fit into my belly. Oh yes, more more more!!! We had a Mexican fiesta here with a gang load of people. The company was awesome, the service was beyond great and the food was so good we were all scooted out in wheel barrows. (Gawd, I hate that saying.)

We started the night out with pitchers of margs, fried tortilla chips, REALLY good salsa and REALLY good queso. Then we shifted into thin, and flaky quessadillas and black bean nachos. We were nowhere near done. I ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas which sounded kind of boring, but were a party in my mouth. The Mole dish is hands down the best things to order even though it is SUPER spicy. The sauce reeks (in a good way) of cinnamon. The meat is so tender that it falls apart at the sign of a knife and fork. To top the night off, we attempted to eat the flaming Smore nachos. Very clever, dudes. I wish I had enough room to fit it all in my bellay, but sadly I did not. I think i did walk out of there with an extra arse and a few hundred extra pounds. 

Come here for a date night or to catch up with the honeys. The restaurant is split into two creating a more romantic mood in one section and a more party atmosphere in the next room with a bar. Yes, me likey. Thanks for making me a heffer, VC.
author: Melody L.

description: There is really nothing to not love about some tasty chips and margaritas! The guac was good too.
author: Christy K.

description:
I liked this place much better when they used to have a sign up that said "Second Best Margaritas in SF." It was a different place back then, and way mas Mexican.

As my Tom K. pointed out in his review, the shrimp may have created a problem for me. But it could have just as easily been the gusto at which I got after the food in front of me. Either way I didn't feel great.

The chips and salsa were the highlight, which doesn't bode well for future visits.

I mean cheese whiz, nachos? Come on.
author: Jason R.

description:
Velvet Cantina has been on my to do list for a while, so when the opportunity arose to take a hot date out on the town, I jumped at the chance to bring her here.

I had a great time, and I think she did too.  She laughed at my jokes, she dug all of my stories, and she only checked her phone a few times over the course of the evening.  I tried to be the gentleman, doing all the chivalrous crap like ordering for her and leaving her the last shrimp.

We sat at the bar, and were well taken care of by the bartender who grabbed us chips and salsa right off and mixed a mean pair of cocktails.  The Ginegr-Ginger was great, but did nothing to cool my palate, so if you order it, get a glass of water too.  The ceviche was more like soup-viche with a bunch of tasty shrimp swimming in a bowl of coconut milk, pineapple and lime juices.  Different from what I am used to, but good.  The queso was good too, a real cheddar and jack concoction, which is a giant step above the melted Velveta that a lot of places are slinging in this city. 

I hope she calls me back.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Velvet Cantina is my favorite Mexican restaurant (not taqueria) in the Bay area. Here's why:
-the food (well, the chicken & avocado enchiladas - they're so amazing i've never tried anything else on the menu) is incredible. the queso & guac are divine. the margaritas are strong. all in all, perfect.
-the prices are totally reasonable. most recently i went with a group eight - we went through several pitchers of margaritas, had starters, etc. and the bill was $250. seemed fair.
-the atmosphere is fun (though it's always packed so make a reservation) albeit loud, and the service is attentive but not aggressive. The bar is a little hectic but that's a good sign.
The worst part about Velvet Cantina is definitely the parking issue (but where isn't that the case?).
Go!
author: Megan Q.

description:
Super accommodating and nice...we walked in with a party of 16 without a reservation after being turned down at Lolo's, and they got us in no problem.

Good margaritas, and good Mexican bar food.
author: Emily E.

description:
First off, I would like to apologize for any rude or lewd behavior that may or may not have occurred the last time I was at Velvet Cantina. I'm embarrassed to say that I do not remember how the end of our evening together went. This fact has raised a few serious questions in my mind, but that's for another time. (Hello, my name is Tiffinie...)

Second of all, I would like to compliment you on your tasty margaritas. Just the right amount of salt and lime. Sadly, they were the root of the possible rude/lewd behavior that I cannot seem to remember, that may or may not have occurred on the Monday night in question. (...Hi Tiffinie)

Thirdly, I would like to give an extra special thank you, VC, for delivering the yummy, warm chips and zesty salsa at just the right moment. You know the one. It was right before I forgot any possible aforementioned embarrassing behavior.

Finally, I would like to say that I will be back. (this is not a threat) And I will eat... something more substantial than chips and salsa, and grovel for forgiveness.  And I promise (::cross my heart::) not to exhibit any more bad behavior that may or may not have happened on the night in question.

Crap. I hope I tipped you guys before you tossed my drunk ass into the cab.
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
Man...I want to give this place one more shot.  There was some major love/hate going on at my stop here, so I have to give it an okay rating for now.  

Had reservations here for 6:30pm on a Friday night and it was pretty quiet.  Not too many people in sight.  Sat down right away with a little corner window seat.  The waitress was very prompt and helpful.  Told us about the drinks of the night and all that goodness.  Big plus was the giant basket of chips with salsa waiting for us.

The drinks were great!.  Nothing to complain about here.  I went with the chicken avocado enchilladas for my entree.  It was really good, not spectacularly outstanding or anything, but there was a lot of it (at least a lot of beans and rice)!

The weird thing though was, after about 10 min. of getting our food a dude comes by and asks if we're done with everything.  I'm shoveling rice and beans into my face...so no, we weren't done yet.  Our regular watiress checked on us twice during the meal before we asked for the check.  It almost felt like they were rushing us out maybe?  I guess there's a fine line between attentiveness from service and annoyance and that was pretty borderline.

Place is reasonably priced, and I would give this place one more shot with a group.
author: Tom Y.

description:
Was in San Fran for a couple days, and local friends suggested we meet here. So glad they did!

Service: So friendly. My friend and I were early and had a seat at the bar. Bartender made us fantastic margaritas (friend had watermelon margarita and I had mango, both with fresh fruit puree). Bartender was also friendly enough to share his delicious s'mores nachos (freshly fried tortilla chips with cinnamon and sugar sprinkled, chocolate sauce, and freshly roasted marshmallows), which was a great start to the meal. :)

Once seated, we had chips and dip, which I immediately ate too much of. Salsa was fresh and delicious.Server suggested an awesome sipping tequila for dinner, that's name escapes me at the moment. Point being, she knew her tequila.

My friend and I split the steak tacos and the avocado cactus enchiladas. Both were great. A bit under salted, but really, really good.

Ambiance was great. Place had a bunch of large table who all seemed to be enjoying themselves. Music was awesome. Overall, a really good time. Highly recommended.
author: Claire W.

description:
I don't know that I can go another trip to San Francisco without hitting this place up. I must admit I'm a bit snobby about getting my mexican food outside of SoCal, but if a restaurant wants to get me drunk on baskets of tortilla chips, salsa and mind-numbingly delish queso, I gueeeeeessss I'll give them a few brownie points. And if they want to put pitchers of margaritas in front of my face and ask me to drink them I guesssss I will.

Okay, who am I kidding? The chicken mole here was the best damn mole I've ever had. There was so much cinnamon in it, it might have knocked out anyone within a mile radius, but the sweet touch was a welcome change from the more bland varieties I've had in the past. 

The smores nachos we finished with for dessert were definitely tasty, but I'd eaten so many tortilla chips before my mole I didn't think I could do much more than lick the chocolate off of those sugar-coated triangles.

The vibe is chill yet fun, and the service is always stellar, as I've usually had more than one ubercool waiter making sure all is bueno. I'll bask myself in this velvet wonderland of mexicali goodness anyday.
author: Veronica R.

description:
Not sure why they call it the the Velvet Cantina.  Velvet is pretty luxurious.  This place is not...

The food is good.  The chips are amazing.  The guac is delicioso.  
The dessert -- well, that was lit on fire.  So they get some points for flambe. 

The best part --  the waitstaff -- well one or two of them anyway.  Nice, sexy guys.  We like.

All in all, fun times.  Good spot to hit for a casual pre-party meal.  You can't really beat cheap Mexican beer, right?  I've always been a sucker for a cold can of Modelo.
author: Rachel G.

description: This place is great, even for big groups. I have been here three or four times now and am still dreaming about their queso and ''velvet cantina nachos"  so freaking goooooooooooood YUM! They have a ton of different flavored margaritas too that you can get in a pitcher for the table.  Also, the bar tenders and wait staff are all super nice and cute and they are always playing great music. They are a little on the pricey side, but I think its worth it. I definitely recommend this place and will certainly be back soon.
author: Jo A.

description:
The dark atmosphere and red lighting really complimented the pitcher of fresh fruit margaritas. The tone was just right. It's the kind of place you go with good company and get lost in conversation. The booths are rounded so you feel like you have your own private corner. The overall vibe is cozy.

Excellent food! Home made chips? SO good. Thick and crunchy and not salty, perfect. I ordered Cornbread Sopas, yum as well. My friend and I both had this pile of pink cabbage garish on our plates...even if it was just garnish I ate every piece of it. What was this delicious surprise?!

We got there on a Monday night evening 5 the place was empty. The crowd started to pile in while we were leaving.
author: Jenny K.

description:
The guacamole at this restaurant is to DIE for. Enormous avocado chunks and just the right amount of spices...ahh, writing this is making my mouth water.

For my entree, I ordered their chicken mole dish. I'd never tried mole before, so the spicy, cinnamony, chocolatey sauce was exciting to me. My only complaint: the chicken was served with bones, which made it difficult to eat. However, the meat was soft, well-marinaded, and worth the effort.

As if it couldn't get any better, the service here is fantastic! We called last minute for a party of 7 on a Saturday evening, and even though the place was crowded, the staff arranged the tables creatively and we were seated within half an hour. All the waiters were charming and pleasant to boot.

The venue itself is a little bit dark and cramped, but that's part of its charm.
author: Jen L.

description: Chorizo velvet nachoes and s'mores nachos.  The perfect date night.  Phenomenal!
author: Todd W N.

description:
This weekend I totally had a Jimi Hendrex experience.  Face down, vomiting into my hands, in bed.  That was from the strongest margaritas I have ever had and tequila shots.  

The morning after I totally had a shrimp diablo experience.  Damn I knew those little suckers were spicy, but I didn't expect the to burn this much the next day. Wooooooo.

Velvet Cantina is awesome.  I have had a few different dishes here and all were surprisingly good.  I can't really recall what they were (see paragraph 1) but none of them have been the typical rice-beans-cheese remix.  But on the rice-bean-cheese remix note, their nachos and guac are awesome too.  

The service here is amazing.  I have been with large groups each time with no reservation and have always been sat immediately.  Within seconds  of sitting we are surrounded by pitchers of special margaritas (see paragraph 1), plates of nachos, bowls of guac, did we even order this stuff?  No, thats just how we roll.  It really pays to know the right people.

The food, the decor and the service really make this place worth every one of those 5 stars.  Being sat in front of all the hipsters waiting for tables and slamming straight tequila margs without even having to order them makes me want to give Velvet Cantina 5 more.
author: Ian M.

description:
I met some friends at Velvet Cantina last night (Tuesday) and enjoyed having drinks and dinner at the bar after getting my groove on in bhangra class a block away.    The bartender was cool, the people hanging out at the bar were cool.  The chips were warm and DAMN good.  I ordered the mole and the chicken was so good the meat slipped off the bones. The mole was dark, chocolate-y, and SPICY.  I sucked the margaritas down like they were lemonade and would've had a third, but it was a Tuesday.

To my surprise, when I mentioned Velvet Cantina to my coworkers, they (in that San Francisco kinda way) turned their noses up complaining that they didn't like Velvet Cantina.  Not sure what their deal was, but the food was good, the music was good, the drinks were good, and the environment was chill...what more can you ask for?  I would definitely go back...at least on a weekday (I hate the Mission on the weekends).
author: Diana M.

description:
A solid offering in the deep Mission. 

The food is very very good. I probably had the best chicken quesadilla there ever. I know, hard to go wrong, but the chicken was full of flavor and it was nice and cheesy. The Ensalada de Manzana was fresh and light, a very nice salad to start off with. My companion had the Avocado Cactus Enchilada and  was very pleased with it. 

The Margaritas were good made with Sauza silver. I would have liked a blended option, but they do not do blenders. They were on the smaller side and kind of pricey at 6.25. 

The staff was clearly hired first on their looks and then on their skills. Only beautiful people may work here. I believe they would prefer only beautiful people attend as well. The service is lacking, but they get the job done. 

Its a small two room place that I liked atmosphere wise. The music was turned up quite loudly. The place would be only moderately noisy without the loud music, but with the music blaring conversation is hard to have.
author: Christopher N.

description: Great food and ambience! Had to wait a bit to get seated, the place was packed. But the food was great. The fish and beef tacos were great!
author: Hissam A.

description:
Walking into Velvet Cantina felt a little bit like stepping back into 1995, when San Francisco was recovering from the fall of Grunge and everybody desperately clung on to their last shreds of being alternative and hip and cool.

This place goes so far beyond un-cool that it's come back full circle to being super-hip. The under 30 crowd definitely goes there to be seen and to get plastered, while the seniors seem to come for the food, which is very decent. Didn't care for the Empanadas, which were too greasy even for this fat-loving Austrian, but the Quesadilla, chips and salsa were yummy. The entrees we tried (Chile Verde and Chicken Mole) were scrumptious. The meat was tender, sauces flavorful and the beans were out of this world. Rice was a bit mealy though, but that's par for the course.

The cocktails sounded exciting and creative, but definitely lacked in execution, the balance of the ingredients was way off on my Gimlet. Service is personable, friendly and across the board better than what you'd expect from a "hip joint".

To sum it up: comfortable, cheap, great value for your buck. Yes, you can eat just as well at many taquerias in the Mission, but No, you can't do it as comfortable.

3 1/2 stars....
author: Tatjana G.

description: This is my favorite Cal-Mex food in the city.  Everything I've tried has been great--chicken avocado enchiladas, tacos valentina, chile verde.  The "Perfect Margarita" is delicious and powerful.  (I think) I've finally learned to limit myself to one.  The pineapple and the watermelon margaritas are also delicious.  I often really wish they were open at lunchtime on the weekend.
author: Veronica J.

description:
Yummy food, check
Cool vibe, check
Relatively cheap and strong and not too sweet drinks, check
Enthusiastic servers who don't hate their job, check
fun experience without the mission/hipster bullshit that permeates throughout most other mission restaurants/bars at 11:30 PM on a friday, check.

It's almost like I'm back in austin again.
author: Joe K.

description:
Hello pitcher, my old friend,
I've come to drink you up again,
Because a hunger softly creeping,
Left its nachos while I was sleeping,
And the margaritas that were going to my brain
Still remained
providing a sound audience...

Ok, after a pitcher of canteloupe margaritas, my friend and I talked and talked and talked about life love and the pursuit of balance. We ordered the steak tacos which were to die for...and then the chili verde...but that's really a dish for like, 3 people to share. I don't know about you, but the last thing I want to eat before a night out in the mission in a tight skirt is a cauldron of spicy sauce, peppers and shredded pork. It was ok, not great, but tasty enough for me to munch on during our chat. Repeatedly.

And yes, I have to agree, it didn't hurt that the staff looked like a Menudo tour and American Apparel ad campaign that merged and was there only to entertain ME. 

I wonder why they call it the Bordello burrito...oh nevermind.
author: Jessica P.

description:
We went for a late dinner on a Friday night.... the place was definitely festive (aka loud loud loud) and the service responsive and adequate, though it took a bit for our margs to arrive from the bar and there was some general confusion with the waitstaff (they all seemed a bit loopy and were most likely partying right along with the patrons.  I saw one chef sipping out of a tall boy but in their defense it was close to closing time)

Guac is tasty, chicken avocado enchiladas seem to be a hit and friends say that's all they order.  I had the chile verde and it was almost impossibly spicy to eat though the flavor was amazing.  Maybe I'm just a pansy?

For a fun dinner with friends, this is your spot if Porto Allegre is crowded out the ass, which it almost certainly is.  Prices are reasonable and service good.  If you're wanting a romantic spot, this may not be the ideal spot.  Booze is cheap which that equates to quite the party atmosphere.
author: William G.

description:
**Update 10/30: We've eaten here several times now and love it even more! Most recently, we went with a group of 7 and everybody raved about it. Viva la Cantina!**

Me encanta Velvet Cantina, baby!  What a welcomed addition to The Mission.  We are always looking for new restaurants with just the right menu, just the right vibe, just the right music, etc....

Well, we found it all at Velvet Cantina.  What a laid back, hip (without being too hip or pretentious), fun place to spend an evening enjoying margaritas, eclectic Mexican food, and great music.  The night we were there, we enjoyed a great mix of Thievery Corporation, Portishead, and lots of other trip-hoppy sort of stuff.  

The chips and salsa are so yummy, as are the avocado/cactus enchiladas.  Also, in the words of my friend Sara, "the waiter was a hunk."  

This place also gets big points for steering away from the typical Mission restuarant scene, having a clean bathroom, and for being tucked away in a residential pocket between Valencia and Mission.  

They also offer a late night happy hour (I can't remember the exact hours).  I hope this place stays put!
author: Abby W.

description:
I'm right smack dab in the middle on this place.  Went the other night with a group and we split a bunch of appetizers and entrees, so I feel like I got a good sense of the food, overall.  The space is very cozy and I like the detailing in the decor.  The margaritas are quite good, just a little too sweet, though.  I really like their salsa.  
For appetizers, we had the ceviche and guacamole.  The guac is great, but they give a pretty small portion for the cost of it.  Same with the ceviche--delicious but hardly enough to go around (lots of tasty sauce and just a few shrimp).
My favorite dish was the chicken & avocado enchiladas and the chile colorado.  Both dishes were tasty and filling, with just the right blend of spices.  I was impressed with the entrees, overall.
So, it was quite a mixed experience, but I'd be willing to give it another shot.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I went here for my birthday dinner, and it was a great place to take four of my closest friends for a nice, chill meal.  We had a few pitchers of margaritas, which were tasty.  As a former bartender, I'm pretty picky about my drinks, but they made the cut.  Also, they used Sauza for the house margarita, which was more than acceptable (Jose Cuervo, for example, is the top 40 of tequilas).  

The food wasn't that terrific, but the chips and salsa were mighty tasty, and we got a free, delicious, Mexican/smores/chocolate/tortilla desert-thingy  that was AWESOME.  

Everyone stumbled out happy.
author: Alissa K.

description:
I'd definitely go back to this place to start my night.  The drinks are stiff, I love this place.  Our group started out with a pitcher of Margarita and woah this was a creeper-good but be careful.  

Also tried the S'more nachos which was ok but I suppose I was in the mood for just salsa and nachos.  It was entertaining how they come out to your table with a torch and burn the marshmallows.  

Overall awesome people work here and friendly vibe!
author: Sinclair T.

description:
Every craved a margarita around 5, 6 or 7 at night?  If you're craving 'the most delicious margarita in the world', this may not be the right spot for you.  If you're just craving that sugary salty tequila-y mix with a great atmosphere to drink it in, this is definitely the right place. 

Dark, Velvety, Booths, tables, cute little bar and a great mix of mission-ites.  A great place to start your evening before a movie, or more drinking...
author: Best M.

description:
Great for a group dinner/drinks fiesta.  Affordable, fun & loud.  Vegetarian refried beans - hell yes!  The drinks strong, good, and some are quite unique.  Javier was bartending and set us up right.

The enchiladas are great and the queso is acceptable, spicy, but a little chalky.  Fresh-made chips.  Depending on the day, the salsas need salt or more spice usually.  For a group of 6 people with dinner and drinks - total was $20 each.  Not bad, not bad at all.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
The food, the crowd, the drinks, oh my! Velvet Cantina knows how to host a group and do it well. Not only were we full of watermelon and house margarita pitchers but the chips and salsa were a great start to the meal. I was able to sample a couple entrees and each were good. 

Its always greta to find a place that mid-week can seat a large group of twenty or so and handle the noise. The dishes came out in a timely matter and the whole group fit in with the loud buzzing of the restaurant. This was a great place to house Nicole G.'s big 30!
author: Natalie N.

description:
Velvet cantina is definitely a good place to go with a group and have a strong margarita! They are very tasty and super stiff here....  

The bar tenders are very friendly as well!

I love their tortilla soup however the rest of the menu i havent been too impressed with. Thats why i say come for the drinks and vibe, but not soo much for the food
author: Tyler L.

description:
OH yay! I had visitors in from out of town who were craving Mexican. We wanted dinner to be a little more of an event than standing in line at a taqueria and scarfing our food down in a cafeteria like setting. However, we didnt want to spend major $$ on a fufu place trying to be trendy or high class. Velvet Cantina was the perfect inbetween! 

My experience started with calling in to see if a reservation would be necessary. The guy on the other end of the line said probably not, but that he would take it anyway. I called back when we were running late and he had remembered my name and said "No problem Megan - we'll see you when we see you, you should be fine on getting a table." Very Nice.

Walked in to find our waiter dancing to the music that was playing. We were seated right away in a cozy booth facing open to the rest of the restaurant. Given chips & salsa immediately. Ordered a pitcher of the fruit Margs - with sugar rim - loved em. Best meal out of everyone's at the table - BEEF TACOS. Especially if you had the queso app - glob alittla that on there. 

Every table was full, but despite not knowing ANYONE else in there (aside from the ppl at my table), it felt like we were all just hanging out. No group was loud or obnoxious. The ppl at the bar were intermingling with some people at a nearby table. Our waiter was chatting with everyone, including friendly little side talk with us. I can't quite put my finger on it....but I was totally digging the vibe at this place man (meant to be heard in the voice of "the dude") 

We didn't get  the flaming smore nachos. But the waiter did treat us to a complimentary pitcher of cantelope margaritas. Good reason to go back.
author: Megan M.

description: They have so much tequila here. And a cute Filipino bartender who shimmies behind the bar.
author: Mandy H.

description:
based on the reviews here, we decided to try this place out before going to see the Get Thrased doco at the Roxie last week (shameless plug: THIS MOVIE ROCKED!! http://www.getthrashed.com/). 

Yelpers prove their mettle once again: watermelon margaritas? Ohhhhhh yessss! My only regret is that I kept ordering singles. I clearly should have just gotten a pitcher for myself and have been done with it.

The ceviche was kinda crazy...mebe I'm a neophyte, but I thought ceviche was supposed to be like a salsa, not a soup...nonetheless, it was good. Just odd looking; I thought the dude had brought me the tortilla soup by mistake. Tortilla chicken fingers were awesome and the dipping sauces were ffffffrikkin' excellent. Very complex flavors.

Steak Tacos and the Chicken Guac enchiladas finished us off. Both were amazing. And I want to throw down one vote FOR the Mexican slaw. With a nice little zing and then a kick, it's kimchee from South of the Border. And I loves me some kimchee so this shit was all on my plate. 

I wish I could say we'll be back but it's sooo far away. Perhaps when we move to the Mission. We need to move to the Mission--everyone is much louder there and we won't get in as much trouble.
author: SheRat R.

description:
Pros:  Chile con queso, good chips & salsa, love the Michelada (beer w/ hot sauce lime juice and a salt rimmed glass.  Yum.)  

Cons:  Food and margs.  

Recommend it for late night drinks in the Mission.  Not for dinner.  There are too many other great cheap-eats like Bissap Boabab, Charanga, etc.
author: Kelli R.

description:
Nice little mexican joint.  I met up with Eric F. and Jason R.  and their gf's for dinner here last night.  The place has a cool atmosphere and we got a table in the back behind the bar.  We got a couple of pitchers of margarita's which were OK.  I wasn't a huge fan of the unique mix they made which seemed like it had some fruity Schnapps kind of liquor in it.  But it wasn't terrible.  The chips at this place are great, crsipy crunchy and still warm when you get them.  We ordered some nachos and as soon as I saw them I realized this place was not a as authentic a mexican joint as I was figuring it would be. (the name of this place should have been my first hint).  The nachos were decent, not great.  I got the steak tacos for dinner and they were quite good and their servings were big.  

Its interesting that a few people have reviews complaining about feeling sick since Jason R had the shrimp and it seemed to disagree with him.  Overall worthy of a 3, not a 4.
author: Tom K.

description:
I had a great dinner and time at Velvet Cantina on Saturday night!
The place was pretty crowded, but we got a nice corner table. Our server was on top of his game and actually kind of funny. I was with a group of 5, so we kept him pretty busy.
We started with the Blueberry and House Margaritas. I was not so sure about the Blueberry Margarita at first, but it was pretty tasty. We also tried the Queso and it was really good. The steak tacos and the shrimp, were both big hits. We also had the Empanadas for dessert and again, the plate was cleaned pretty fast. 
I have to thank yelp for again, getting me to try a place I would have never found on my own!!!Can't wait to go back.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Lively crowd, with good music and great food. This is not the spot for a quiet intimate dinner!
I hate stuffy quiet dining, so this is right up my alley. Just give me drinks, feed me and make it a fun experience...

The chips are so yummy you can have them for desert (tortilla smores)
The drink special ginger ginger was interesting and strong.
The service was exremely fast and friendly- even though it was obvious that they were understaffed on a busy Sunday evening.

The food was quick to get to our table. Chicken avacado enchiladas and steak tacos. Both dished were excellent. I grew up in San Diego and Im familiar with mexican food. This is was I would consider "modern mexican".  Flavorful but a little healthier and a bit on the creative side. Creative without being so adventurous that it looses sight of what it is.
author: Melissa B.

description: Came here for my birthday.  Super loud and packed on a friday night! Five stars for the vibe but only 3 for the food.  Over priced for average. The staff was nice though and the bartender was HOT, which is always good!
author: Rebecca F.

description:
**Bar Review**

Had a great time (maybe too good of a time) here at Velvet Cantina. We came here for a friend's going away party in the bar area of the restaurant and killed a bottle of their top shelf Milagro. Yup, that's how the night went. Needless to say, everyone had a good time but paid for the consequences a few hours later...including myself ;)

Our bartender that night was so awesome...probably one of the best bartenders I've ever met. So nice and down to have a good time (read: tolerant). Haha. Anyway, we all loved him so that made the experience here that much better.

The only food I had here were the chips, which were fantastic. A little oily with a very satisfying crunch. Delish.

Definitely a great spot in the Mission if you're craving tequila. Oh, and I hear the food is pretty good too.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
I really like this place. I would give it 5 stars but I've only been there once so I don't know that I can definitely say either way. I went with a friend from out of town and both of our meals were AWESOME. The place is small and quaint with a good vibe. 

But let's be real - the best part is that the bartenders are actually NICE. Yes, this is the only place in the mission where people have been nice to me. Some birthday boy even bought us tequila shots.

They give you chips and salsa right away, which I like, and the salsa is tasty and homemade. They can change your order however you want it because everything is made fresh, just for you (example: I got the chile relleno without the cheese - now that is not easy to find)

We had fun drinking at the bar, and sitting at a table eating. Unusual to find a place that's great for both.
author: L C.

description:
it may be a better name for a gay bar but the Velvet Cantina is an amazing, imaginative, comfortable, modern mexican restaurant. I think it probably takes some balls to open a mexican restaurant in the mission, but these guys do it up right. Couple of things to try, the roasted burrito is a generous burrito with a wonderfully roasted smoky/sweet/hot chili sauce smothered all over it. The nachos are amazing, and the chicken and avacado enchiladas are wonderful. For wonderfully decedent desert check out the Smore Nachos, yep melted chocolate poured over graham crackers and marshmallows.  Oh and the drinks, margaritas are killer here and they have a stellar tequila selection.

The atmosphere is really nice in this place as well and they have a nice bar to hang out at and eat if you like. The place is busy on a friday but it doesn't feel to crazy. Bartenders are great as well, what can I say, i'm so glad I live 3 blocks from here.
author: Karl L.

description:
Super friendly waiters, never had to wait (although apparently there is often a wait) but I'm always underwhelmed by the food.  First of all, you don't get a lot of choice and several items you'd expect to be on the menu are missing.

Decent chips and salsa - but to be honest, I prefer Chevy's (shock, horror!)  - really good guacamole and strong margaritas.  Overall tho, the food is mediocre.

It's nice to have another sit down Mexican option in The Mission (Puerto Allegre wait is RIDIculous) - I only wish the food were a bit more inspiring.
author: Melanie N.

description:
I've walked past here almost every day for the last two years and it took a friends going away party to finally go in. 

The staff were friendly, although we did get a "lesson" from the bartender who came over to our table speak to us when we asked for a little less ice in our margaritas (which were delicious). Sadly the margaritas and staff were the only good things about our meal. 

We shared the huge cheese gooey nachos, and they were pretty disappointing, not nearly as tasty as Papalotes or even my own homemade ones. They had a weird cheese combination on them that just didn't work at all.

I'd definitely come back for a drink, after dinner elsewhere.
author: Jesse S.

description:
OK, yeah yeah I don't know from Mexican food, blah blah silly New Yorker, etc. Maybe I don't, but I do know I had an excellent meal here. Came in with coworkers based entirely on Yelp reviews..thanks, Yelp! You rule. We started with the guac, some amazing cheese dip thing, and ceviche. Then someone brought us a new ceviche that they were testing out for the menu...it was sooooo good. This lime-coconut shrimp and calamari ceviche. A little messy to eat and a little soupy but taste definitely scored way above the mess. Add a pitcher of margaritas and we were on our merry way.

We were stuffed by the time our food came, but we ate it anyway. Burritos the size of a small child, for sure. I had the cactus-avocado enchiladas, delicious. It was probably the first time that black beans tasted good...I'm usually not a fan. Another coworker got the steak, looked good. Add a pitcher of raspberry margaritas for good measure, and we were flyin high. Of course no one finished their entrees, but that didn't stop us from ordering the chocolate peanut butter tamale. Totally tits. Would definitely hit this place up again, especially for the kickin margaritas and ceviche.
author: Irene F.

description:
Fuck. Yes. (in that starting to bug the people at the next table kinda way)  To the Coconut Lime Ceviche Goodness.  And the hottie waiters.  And the fresh ass chips and salsa.  And the tasty margaritas of which I may have had one too many of.

Minus one star for not getting the marshmallows all the way melted on my s'more nachos.  

That brings the grand total down to.... about 18 stars.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
Warning:  if you have too many of their delicious margaritas you might lose your car.

And only have one bite of your yummy enchiladas because you're so drunk you forget to eat.

And then forget your nearly complete (minus one bite that you probably won't even remember) boxed up meal.  Dammit.
author: Jen S.

description: F yeah!  Best ever!  Chips and Salsa, delicious margaritas and fantastic service, this is my kinda place!   Give them a shot and you won't be disappointed, but you may leave in a food coma. droollsss
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Preface to this review, I probably could've given four stars but I ordered something not so great and didn't taste the margs...stay tuned for my next review when I go back and get something better!

I came here with a friend recently because Beretta had a really long wait.  No big deal, I was excited to try Velvet Cantina anyway.

We were seated right away with no res on a crowded Tuesday night.

We ordered the cornbread sopas to start.  They were great.  Lots of flavor, little bit of kick.  I unfortunately don't like cilantro (weird I know) and there was a lot on there.  But I could definitely order it without it next time.  

My friend got Chicken Avocado Enchiladas and loved them.  I ordered the Velvet Nachos from the appetizer menu as my dinner.  Sorta silly now that I think about it.  Normally nachos are my fave but these were a bit different.  They had chile con cheso rather than the pounds of melty cheese you might be used to.  I was not expecting this because honestly I was paying more attention to catching up with my friend than the menu.  I guess I learned my lesson.

BUT THEN, we got the s'mores nachos for dessert.  AMAZING!  Cinnamon chips drenched in chocolate and then marshmellows flameb-ed or however you'd spell that word.  GREAT!!

Can't wait to come back!
author: Angela S.

description:
FINALLY I got to Velvet Cantina!!!

Had my Birthday dinner, which they COMPLETELY ROCKED, on accommodating our 16+ people..and a few extras, while the whole place was packed!!

Loved the place, wait staff, was extremely helpful, with ALL of our orders!
Got a free pitcher of Margaritas, because they couldn't help us seat, some last minute friends!
Margaritas, were SO fresh, strong and tasty!!
...things got fuzzy, after a few shots...and pitchers...

The Chicken Nachos & Chili con Queso,  lived up to every review i read on here!
Spicy Chicken soup with that little sour cream empanada...ORDER IT!
Everyone else was raving about the Chicken & Avocado Enchiladas too!
And i got the flaming Smore Nachos, as the whole restaurant, sang Happy Birthday to me!!
It was a great night, and the Perfect Spot for a Birthday!!!
I will be back, but with less people next time!! : )
author: Molly M.

description:
I came here for the nachos and the margaritas.  The nachos are fantastic, just don't bother to add any meat, it somehow throws the balance off.

Margaritas: also fantastic.  Late night happy hour?  A little too fantastic if that is even possible.  

Once I came in for late night happy hour on a Monday after a class in Berkeley.  My sister was in town for a short visit and I wanted her to try margaritas.  They were awesome and let us in for a drink even though they were closing up.  That's what earned the fifth star!
author: Adrienne W.

description:
Incredible food....muy delicioso! And the ritas aren't half bad too. I'm usually a harsh reviewer but I have nothing bad to say about this incredible restaurant. The cactus enchiladas are divine and I hear the Mexican lasagna is better than a great Italian one. I have to say that my favorite part was the homemade tortilla chips with the Chili con Queso. This dip is DIVINE and the finest Mexican fondue you'll ever taste.
Thanks Velvet Cantina! I'm coming back next weekend and the weekend after that. 
VIVA VELVET CANTINA!!!
author: FA B.

description:
10:30pm.

Lightweight drinker + a pitcher of the house margarita = great buzz

great buzz + friendly bartender + the best chips I've had +  the giant plate of nachos sans the chorizo (to share) + caramel empanadas for dessert = TRULY SATISFIED

The place has great "Mission"  twists to traditional Mexican food.
author: Dudley F.

description: I love this place. Its my go to Mission spot when I want to sit down and have an extended meal over tacos, chips and margaritas. The people who work here  are always friendly (if at times a little slow, but who cares, have another margarita). Be prepared for loud music and a pretty packed house past 7:30. We always hit this place up on the early side which serves us well.
author: Ellen S.

description:
Yum Yum and so much fun!

The margaritas are delicious and a VERY reasonable $24 for a pitcher.  Fresh fruit flavors are delicious!! I tried the watermelon and the pineapple (cause thats how I roll!) both  were super tasty!

I also really enjoyed the food. I can't wait to go back again on my next trip to SF.  The place was jumping on a friday night and my girls and I had a blast.  

Hot waiters TOO!!
author: Josie C.

description:
mmmm, delish!

This is a really great place for sit down Mexican a few steps up from taqueria style.  The food is great, the margaritas are even better, the service is friendly and efficient and it's a great place to accomidate large parties.

plus, it's in my hood. sweet!

UPDATE:
Adding another star ... GREAT for large groups.  Not only was the service awesome and the food great but they did a really amazing job tolerating our table of 13's drunken antics for over two hours.
author: Shayna N.

description:
Sadly, the worst experience.

Being a consistently great neighborhood place to bring out-of-towners was a shockingly and embarrassing failure tonight.  

If i heard the excuse "it's the busiest night of the year", one more time, I wouldn't have been surprised. To be honest, I don't care if the wait staff is blatantly drinking in front of everyone, but when it interferes with my service and meal, that I am paying for, that is when I have a problem with it. 

After 45 minutes of waiting, we were seated and ordered a pitcher of margaritas, which didn't come until after we were served our meal (Cue excuse #1). Apparently the kitchen ran out of beans, so we were served whatever else they had left (cue excuse #2). Watching the entire bar and wait staff take shots right in front of you, then have the waiter make a comment to my guests in the restroom that he needs to get "F*$%'ed up tonight" (needless to say he was still our waiter at the time), does not make a great experience. (Cue excuse #3). Then they take our credit cards to run the bill and "forget" to return them until we remind the 20 minutes later... (Cue excuse #4). 

If you can make it through all of the excuses and (horribly drunk and /or F*$%'ed up wait staff) the food is spectacular.... if you ever receive it. 

Seriously lacking consideration for their paying customers.
author: Lindsey T.

description: Small and cozy atmosphere.  The chips/salsa/guacamole and margaritas were some of the best I've had in a while!  The pork tenderloin was excellent and everyone that I went with was happy with their meal.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I love you, Velvet Cantina.  You've fed me the best nachos I have ever had, you have great service, and your ambience is warm and friendly.  If I'm feeling like a margarita (and I often am), you have an excellent house margarita as well as tasty daily specials which often involve berries (yum). 

The food is fresh and innovative (cactus avocado enchiladas, for example), though I wish there were more vegetarian items on the menu.

On a couple of occasions, my friends and I have tried to spend forty bucks on food so that we could use our Cozmo Card (http://www.cozmocard.com/) but we haven't been able to do so because the food is so affordable and the portions are decent.   What can you do?

Plus, if you can stay up until after 11 PM, you can get your margaritas for only 3 bucks.
author: MA f.

description:
I really enjoyed the food....everyone is correct; the chips and salsa, the guac is excellent.  The drinks are yummy and potent.  But the service was SO SLOW.  It literally took 10 minutes to get any drink that wasn't a House Margarita.  

I had the achiote steak tacos and one of my friends had the chicken avocado enchiladas.  My tacos were really good, but my the enchiladas were better.

When I'm in the Mission again (I don't go there too often) I'm willing to give it another run to grab another star, but for now it is just a 2 star.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Holy shit this place is good.
Got the chicken and avocado enchiadas and they were very tasty.
Girl got the cactus enchiladas and they were also very tasty.
Great service.
Fun times....
author: Tito C.

description:
Oh Mexican food, how we missed you during our time in London! Highlights of last night's dinner at Velvet Cantina:

- Chunky, zingy, tomato-laden salsa made exactly the way the Srinivasans like it. Chips were plentiful, non-oily and a worthy support act. 
_ Chicken with the mmmmmmmmole sauce is not to be missed (I ordered the chicken avocado enchilladas, which were decent though a teensy bit drier than I would have liked, and subsequently had minor entree envy).
- V accommodating, congenial and above-average cute (sorry Joel) waitstaff.
- 2009-friendly pricing - large party gorged ourselves for $17/head.
- Lovely low lighting and kitsch decor - love the ladies dancing on the wall by the bathroom!

Reading some other reviews, it sounds like we committed a party foul by not getting the guac. Sigh. Will just have to go back. Life is so hard sometimes...
author: Leela S.

description:
What I wanted was a place to get a margarita and really good chips and salsa.  I got it!  Mighty tasty was the chunky salsa and homemade were the thick chips.  The margarita was strong and two little ones was enough for me.

For dinner the chicken avocado enchiladas were okay although the chicken was a little dry.  The Carne Y Queso Empanadas on the other hand was awesome!
author: Mike C.

description:
The food is good here, the drinks are excellent, the ambiance is fun and lively... Why then should it be only 1 star? One word: Service

Our experience was marred by the terrible service and lack of sincerity from our waitress. 

I order the chicken avocado enchiladas without avocado. I am allergic to avocado and asked the waitress twice while ordering my dish that it was prepared without avocado because I get sick from it. She assured me that the order was in correctly. The dish came out, I asked her again about the special preparations and reiterated that avocado makes me ill. She assured me it was in fact prepared correctly, checked with the chef, and reconfirmed that it was prepared correctly.

About four bites into the entree, there was avocado. For the next hour I was sick to my stomach and unable to enjoy the outing with my friends. The waitress gave me the excuse "another waiter took the enchiladas without avocado and there was a mix-up at the kitchen" three times before making an apology... which was not even sincere. 

In the end I had a few bites of something else, since I was feeling sick to my stomach... and they took away the alternate dish, barely touched. When I asked that the alternate dish be comped as well, since obviously my night was ruined by the incompetence of the staff, our waitress said no, but after talking to the manager grudgingly comped all the dishes.

At the end of the day, the food is probably good, the drinks were excellent, but the service and refusal to take responsibility or show sincere empathy for a grave mistake on their part is why I will never eat at this restaurant again.
author: Mukul K.

description: Thanks Yelp for telling me about this place.  I used one of their nifty coupons from the deck of cards I picked up at the Yelp Mighty Event.  Tasty, homemade chips, killer service..good food you can't go wrong.  We ordered way too much food for three girls but still...I enjoyed every bit of it.  We ended up getting the Nacho S'Mores which weren't as messy as I thought which was good.  This is a great little hole in the wall worth checking out.  I'd go here again for sure.
author: Amy J.

description:
The cilantro gimlets are amazing, the decor good and the micheladas decent. Chips and salsa pretty standard, BUT the food is just pretty average and bland. For a place in the Mission, this isn't exactly stellar Mexican food. 

Go for drinks and apps and go later when the crowd is cool, not early when all the Marina types are in there. If you don't go at all, you won't be missing much.
author: Brandi S.

description:
First off let me start off by saying the only reason this place got 4 starts instead of 5 is because they didn't have sangrita which is a MUST as it is the perfect chaser for tequila.

That being said this place is great. The waiter knew sangrita and agreed it is a necessary element but sadly didn't have it. Darius aka our waiter was amazing even bringing out chicken and cheese samples in order for us to gage the heat factor on the Spice Scale. 

The food was delicious, omg the nachos, lasagna, enchiladas, and the pitchers of margaritas hit the spot, with just enough salt. There were several other large parties and everyone was receiving the same great service.
author: Maria A.

description:
Some of the docked stars aren't entirely Velvet Cantina's fault -- after all, the person in charge of arranging a birthday affair didn't come up with this idea until about two hours before the gathering was set to occur on a Saturday night. So we waited on the curb for a bit over an hour, then crammed into a corner booth.

And once we were finally sitting, it was very, very, very loud. Too loud.

Everyone was pretty nice, especially given that we were asking to seat 8 on short notice, and the margarita pitchers were strong and tasty, and my steak tacos were smothered in guacamole and thus, pretty yummy.

Summary: it was OK. Be sure to make reservations.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Another date night with The Boy (I swear, he's going to get a list of places we have eaten together sooner rather than later) a couple of weeks ago. The way it works with us is he picks a Genre, and I pick the place. 

I had been meaning to try Velvet Cantina for awhile - I had heard good things about it, and was always curious to see what exactly they offered. It's an odd little spot; it's two rooms (what looks like it used to be 2 separate businesses at one point in time) that are now mashed together as a restaurant/bar. They were very nice over the telephone when I placed the reservation, but there was definitely a little bit of fumbling when we got into the restaurant. The boys that were fumbling were cute though, so that always helps. We get lead to the back room to our table, and it was a nice cozy booth. Water was brought out quickly, and we ordered drinks - he got a beer, and I got a watermelon margarita. Chips were also brought out, and those were DELISH. Really, freshly made. We pretty much destroyed those, but it took them awhile to bring out another basket.

We decided against a starter, for some odd reason, and he ordered the Tri-Tip Steak, and I got the Naked Relleno peppers. Both were served with beans and rice, which were really nicely seasoned. The Relleno was nicely spicy, and the watermelon margarita cooled off some of that heat. The portions were generous - though he cleaned his plate, I had enough left over to take it to work the next day. A word of advice; if you take home leftovers from Velvet Cantina, they are amazing the next day, when all the flavors get to meld together.

So why only 3 stars? The place was just OK. It wasn't amazing, but it wasn't horrible either. This isn't the best date place if groups decide to descend upon Velvet Cantina, because it gets LOUD quickly, which is a mixture of the actual restaurant fixtures and the pitchers of Margaritas that are available off the menu. Service was just OK, and I felt like we could have been checked in on a bit more. Their sign says "alluring edibles and drinks". Were they alluring? No. Where they good? Yes. I would take out of towners here for a nice change-up for Mexican food that isn't served in a dingy taqueria, but not necessarily native friends.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Velvet.  I never was a fan of it, myself.  Cantina's?  Sure love em.  Specially Mos Eisley.

But I get the reference.  Velvet implies "smooth" and "supple" and "plush."  It is also a more common adjective now, with the addition of a "y."  Or maybe it's a literal reference and it is truly a bar made of velvet.

Is this cantina smooth, supple and plush?  EEhhhhh... it's a toss since it definitely isn't made of velvet.  Friends took me here for my birthday, which is on el Dia de los Muertos.  Since it was after the parade, this place was jammin'.  We waited for our table for 20 minutes, even though we had a reservation.  Curse me for being born on a swillin' holiday!  

All was forgiven when we sat down and ordered 5 pitchers of margaritas and were given some delicious complimentary shots.  Then came the guacamole and entrees.  The portion sizes are way too big.  And then they brought me a birthday dessert!  

I had a blast, so it is a very comfortable atmosphere with good food and attentive staff.  I think the decor needs some updating, since it's falling apart in places.  Perhaps a little velvet?
author: Jessica M.

description:
Things I Like About Velvet Cantina
1) Affordable prices - all entrees are under $16.
2) Atmosphere - fun and lively, including the other patrons
3) Service - we came as a bachelorette party group and they were good in taking care of us.

What Makes Me Give 3 Stars
1) Margarita - They are STRONG. I like to taste a bit more of the watermelon rather than just pure tequila.
2) Chips - I was starving so I ate up the chips but they aren't my favorite. These are double layered chips - meaning they were thick, more like fried pitas 2 layers. They were oily too. I prefer a thinner crisper chip.
3) Food - It was good. I had the Shrimp Diablo ($13.99) which as the server described, was lighter in flavor but had a spicy kick. There were lots of shrimps, liked the cactus veggie side and the picked cabbage that accompanied the plate.

Everyone in our group had a great time.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Chill, relaxed place in the mission, not overrun with hipsters? CHECK!
Greasy, addictive chips and spicy salsa? Check!
Spicy, hearty chicken tortilla soup and tasty grub? CHECK!
Getting propositioned by a drunken gay man? CHECK!
Addictive, potent pinapple/blueberry margaritas served by charming, cute bartender for hours on end? CHECK!
Taking multiple shots of tequila on a Sunday night and spiraling into self destruction and insanity? CHECK!
D-man- thanks to you, I broke my no tequila vow and ended up dazed on the couch this mornin, with a raging headache. I don't think my friend is faring much better. We are both pissed at you, but we will be back to drown our sorrows and visit you another Sunday!
author: Manali K.

description: The ambiance is the only thing I really liked about this place. But it's not enough to make up for average food and margaritas. I wouldn't go back.
author: Aleysa R.

description:
To the tall curly haired server who has a brother with an international Brazilian lover: Thank you for telling great stories, being attentive and indulging us in our questions like, "What's your favorite font?"

To the server who let my friend do a half & half meal of two different things she wanted to try and who kept coming by the table as I joked about writing a scathing review of the service: Thank you for being so accommodating, keeping up with our party of 17 that kept switching seats and still remembering who ordered what!

To the brother with a hot international love affair with your Brazilian lady: I hope everything works out and talk to Oprah, maybe she'll hook you up with free flights for life!

I've been to VC on a date and we sat in one of those cozy booths, sipped blended margaritas and people watched all night.

Now I've been to VC for a friend's birthday with a large group that destroyed over 7 pitchers of margaritas (house, pineapple and mango) and an assortment of other beverages and took up several tables in the middle of the restaurant.

Both experiences were great. Tons of chips and salsa before you decide which huge plate of food you're going to actually order. 

Note (not VC's fault): Don't go with people who say they chipped in for the bill but actually didn't pay their share. It's really irritating when you count up the cash and you're $100 short and the birthday girl, her girlfriend and my boyfriend end up paying the rest.
author: Rikki W.

description:
Nothing beats a salty-rimmed margarita and big bowl of queso. Sure, it's not authentic Texas queso, but it's velvety smooth nonetheless. Hmm...maybe that's why the joint is called Velvet Cantina. 

Newly reopened after a kitchen fire, the Cantina is back to serving up greatness. I've never heard any complaints about any of the food (is this due to the drunken state we are always in when we eat there?). The service is always top-notch; including last night, when we had to wait over an hour for our table (note: get there early). As a show of goodwill, the owner gave our starving group 2 plates of nachos and a round of margaritas. Now that's customer service.

Maybe the only downside to the VC is the price. There are plenty of delicious taquerias nearby serving similar fare for less. But then again, that comes without the delicious queso, the margaritas and the atmosphere. Definitely worth the money.
author: Billy L.

description:
The margaritas:  TASTY.  I'm not a fan of tequila, but 1 of these knocked me off my ass.  Recommended.  But I haven't tried the fruit flavored ones yet.  

The food:  DELICIOUSSSSSSSSSS.  So far, I've tried the coconut ceviche, the chicken avocado enchiladas, the empanadas, the tri tip steak, the lasagna, and the chile con queso.  

- My favorite is the lasagna.  I dream about it.  It's like a big mess of something, but it's so goddamn dark in the restaurant that you can't really see what you're eating.  Totally awesome.

The empanadas are really, really fucking good.  It's an appetizer, but the portion is large enough that it could be a meal in itself.

All in all, pretty tasty.  I've been here a bunch of times and it's always great food.  The service can be kind of frat party style, but maybe that's part of the charm.  I always see the staff here at Mission Bar, so they must be good people.
author: Meh M.

description:
My second time at this place, and it doesn't disappoint.  Honestly, I have no idea if the food is authentic, but I know it's gooooood! Great place to have dinner with friends, nice fun atmosphere and the staff is awesomely attentive.

What's not to like?
author: Kristine C.

description:
I really enjoyed it.  Dark, drinks were reasonable.  The chips were AWESOME... I enjoyed my tacos... and even though it was only two, I couldn't finish the rice... and black beans.  They actually offer you black beans as a choice... what a treat.

Now I want chips and a marg.  Damn.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Everyone was my best friend by the time our table's 7th pitcher of margarita arrived.

Here we are celebrating the non-existent celebration - Cinco de Mayo. As an uneducated foreigner I first thought we're doing something with mayonnaise. But of course, mayo has nothing to do with Mexico...  duh.

Went with a group of regular Cantina diners... we divided and conquer with some arriving right on 7p. Got a table within half hour (2nd pitcher), and started ordering right away.

The waiters are cute, and relatively quick. They were frazzled by the volume of the night. But polite, as always,

The food is not refined... but should Mexican fare be? The servings are big though, and if you're not particularly hungry you can get away with the chips and one main between two people.

I don't know if it is real Mexican food - just as I'm first to admit I don't know for sure what is good Indian - but damn, this is tasty.

The drinks, however, is another matter. The margaritas are TASTY. As my buddy Eric observed;
- One pitcher, about 3/4 ice
- Tequila (top shelf, or basic)... filled to about 3/4 also
- Add lime mixer

Contemplated 8th pitcher... decide to accept defeat and went home after a very satisfying celebration (on a Monday night).
author: Joyce L.

description:
Velvet Cantina has a pretty solid rep for what it does best, drinks and atmosphere.  House margaritas at only $6.25, and fresh fruit specials for only 50 cents more, struck me as a screaming deal (and for late night happy hour it only gets better--something I hope I remember the next time late night margaritas feel like a good idea).  Bartender (Darius) is fun, funny and personable, but our server seemed a bit tentative (a tadpole amongst the cast of bullfrogs that people the service staff here).  

Food was meh, ceviche with pineappleand and mango is a meager portion, and pineapple is weird in ceviche (overpowering and over-sweet).  My shrimp enchiladas were full of the baby shrimp you imagine coming out of a freezer bag, and dwarfed by the rice and beans that take up 2/3 of the plate, the little cabbage salad is very good though (Mexican kimchi!)  

Also, the interior is kitschy and fun, but in a way that attracts a lot of Lexus SUV driving, white pants wearing, blond hair bobbed ever so correctly tribe (and the men that drag after them) out for a night of great Facebook tags (I did see this group arrive personally, and the driver blocking off 23rd while he did a 32 point U-turn).  I like it here, and will come back for drinks (and good chips and salsa), but will skip the full $70+ dinner experience in lieu of a solid, good time at the bar.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
This restaurant is by far the best place to bring a large party to celebrate your special event.  Our reservation was for a party of 20 at 7.  By 7:50 pm, only 10 people had arrived.  We ordered dinner 6 times as guests arrived and left an hour later than we promised.  Gabriel, our star waiter, never grumbled or complained once.  He kept laughing and joking along with us and was always ready to bring over another pitcher.  The margaritas hit the spot and the nopales enchiladas were delicious.   

Still not sold??  They have s'mores nachos.  Need i say more?
author: shilpa s.

description:
My friend said, "These margaritas are SKANKY!" 

Velvet Cantina's menu specifically advertises that they use "fresh lemon and lime juice and a simple syrup" in their margs. 
We ordered the $25 pitcher, and couldn't drink the margaritas. They were too sweet, not strong AT ALL, and tasted like they used margarita mix from safeway. 

Never again.
author: Amy J.

description:
Warning - if you want authentic Mexican food, this is not the place to go. If you want a quiet dinner spot on Friday or Saturday night, this is not the place to go. 

Now, if you want to drink a few margaritas and have some killer cactus avocado enchiladas or some fresh guacamole or some corn bread sopes before heading to some club in the Mission, this is the place to go! Nice staff, very decent Tequila selection.  

Conveniently located on 23rd street between Mission and Valencia, walking distance to bars and clubs or just a cab ride to 16th and Valencia for more bars and clubs.
author: Anabelle B.

description: Yummy nachos and great margaritas!! I went last night and was definitely a fan! The chips are wonderful and on the nachos they actually give you a good amount of guacamole! I always had the naked chile relleno and it was so tasty! Our service was awesome and we had a wonderful server! Everyone seemed to check on us thoughout dinner which was also nice. The staff was very knowledgable about the menu and just so friendly! Great atmosphere and a great time! My friends I went with said they typically had to wait a while because its always so busy but we barely had time to finish drinks at the bar before being seated which was a pleasant surprise!
author: Trace H.

description:
First and foremost, their tortilla chips are ridiculous! So effin good that I could have seriously skipped my entree and filled up on their chips, salsa and guacamole! The chicken avocado enchiladas were yummy. The chicken was well seasoned, although some bits were a bit too salty. I love the chunks of fresh avocado in the enchilada, it gives it a nice creamy texture.  Even their black beans are full of flavor!

Now, the margaritas are another story!! We ordered a pitcher of the watermelon margarita and man they were strong!! They tasted like watermelon infused tequila over ice. Okay, that sounds sorta good, but it wasn't my preference. I think the fact that they use real fruit juice, makes the margaritas taste stronger because the fruit sinks to the bottom of the pitcher. The bottom of the pitcher tasted better and more balanced. Note to self: next time ask them to add more fruit!

Overall, the service was pretty on point. We were a party of 8 and it was my birthday. The atmosphere is very casual, low key and almost homey. I love how their tables and chairs are kind of random. We had cake, and the forks that they gave us were all different sizes and shapes! Very eclectic, sorta how my grandma's house used to be.

I'd definitely be back for their chips & margaritas!
author: Joshua C.

description:
I liked this place a lot.  I met a group here for "happy hour"on thursdayy night.  I don't know if they even offer a happy hour but we got a pitcher of margaritas and were pretty happy after that!  Not sure if I recommend the blueberry margis but it was interesting to try.  Very nice atmosphere with all the red and velvet and dim lighting.  Sweet low key reggae playing in the background.  That place was hoppin the whole time we were there. 

I ordered the chicken and avocado enchiladas which had to be the best enchiladas I've ever had.  I don't even like enchiladas but chicken and avocado?  You can't go wrong.  I was glad I took the gamble :)  Best thing...chips and salsa waiting for us when we arrived at the table :P  I'm goin back for sure.
author: karla k.

description: damn good margarita's and fresh tortilla chips. cool atmosphere. This is the real deal bar.
author: Patrick P.

description:
I love Velvet Cantina for its overall ambiance and quality. The decor is lush and tacky.  It feels like a dive bar/restaurant redecorated by sincere but not very talented art students. I'm not giving it 4 stars for great food, but for the fact that I've had a really satisfying time every time I've been here. 

We go mainly for the bar, but always end up eating as well since we get hungry!  Its great not to have to run down the street for a burrito. The guacamole and chips are great.  The rest of the food is *fine*. Not gourmet but a big cut above the greasy taquerias. Go here for casual fun drinks with friends.  You can sit, you can stand, it isn't crowded, but it is festive.

I am always happy to go here.
author: M M.

description:
If I am in the mood for great Mexican food, this would not be my first choice.  But if I wanted a fun place to have drinks with friends that serves good mexican food, vamos a la Cantina.

Good drinks, good food and damn good service on my 1st trip here.  Carne y Queso Empanada's were good, big enough appetizer that can easily be an entree.  The Chile con Queso reminded me of my youth when after a drunken night I would end up at 7 eleven eating nachos, so of course I loved this appetizer.  The Velvet Lasagna was good, the chorizo stands out so this taste will linger with you for hours.  Never ending supply of good tortilla chips that go great with the habanero salsa.
author: Will C.

description:
Tucked on the corner of 23rd and Bartlett in the heart of the Mission, a stellar Tex-Mex infused selection of entrees, including the Bordello Burrito that's as big as your head and comes with a vegetarian option.  

A great place to gather and celebrate, the Cantina offers pitchers of Silver Tequila Margaritas in several flavors. The prices are reasonable and well worth it, meanwhile the service is star-quality. Our party of ten lavished on a homemade cake with candles--cut and served with a song, gratis. SUPERB!
author: Levi B.

description:
I've been here once or twice before and the food was ok but last night the food and service were extremely unexceptional. First of all we were seated rather fast which was nice but then we waited 15 minutes at our table with no drink menu and no acknowledgement from our server. When our server arrived he rushed us to order cause the kitchen was closing and then disappeared for another 15 minutes. So we waited no drinks or water. I could see our drinks sitting on the empty bar and multiple employs standing around dancing and screaming to each other over the loud club music totally oblivious of the customers.

When our drinks and food came everything was cold and bland. My boyfriend is a chef and the best thing he had to say about the food is that the cook has good knife skills. The veggie sopes had the exact same cold cactus potato filling as the naked relleno and the beans tasted out of a can, zero flavor. 
Also the guacamole is just plain avocado with some lime juice, no onions or cilantro or anything. The dish they served it in was severally cracked and kind of disturbing.

The service got a little more attentive towards the end of our meal but the server  walked by multiple times and never even noticed the stack of dirty plates that we had pushed to the end if the table. 

When the check came, I ended up leaving over 20% tip because I didn't have the patience to wait for our server another 15 minutes to get change. 

Right before we left the guy made a comment about things being crazy in there tonight but if you have a busy restaurant you should hire people who can handle it. This guy couldn't and the food was not worth the wait.
author: Ms. G.

description:
I went here with my friend Kimbely based on reviews she read on here and was not disappointed at all. If possible I would rate it at 4.5 stars but anyways.....

I had the nachos, which were probably the best nachos I have EVER had and let me tell you, I know Nachos!! My food receives a 5 star rating for sure. 

The wait staff was awesome at refilling drinks and keeping our margarita glasses full as well as the homemade chips which were really good! 

The margaritas could have been a little better but after a pitcher I couldn't complain!
author: Amber E.

description:
Ever hear that  voice in the Jay-z song "I just want to love U" (give it 2 me)?

Well, that is what I want to do to Velvet Cantina.  I want to love this place.  It is close to my house.  Has a distinct bar area and a restaurant. A happy hour. Jesus, what isn't to like?

You wanna know how far they gonna go? Zip-zero.

I mean it.  Aside form the chips (big whoop) everything here just inst too good.  The drinks are bland, the food all tastes like cilantro.  I mean it you can't get anything that doesn't taste like the herb.  Also, the food upset my tummy so bad last time that it ruined a show I went to afterwords.

I know.  All the hating. But I don't want this place to leave.  I see potential.  Maybe a change soon.

Go get a beer here or that sweet that nasty that gushy stuff.
author: Thadd L.

description:
This spot is the closest bar/restaurant to my new little home in this city, and I look adoringly at it every time I walk to BART - or more often when it is literally overflowing with hungry hipsters.  The bartenders here are amazing and friendly and fun, and the food is yum.  Basically every time I am hungover it is the place I crave for healing, even if those tasty cantaloupe margs are my hangover's cause.   I know those huge plates, awesome guac, and lots of chips will heal me.

UPDATE - closed indefinitely due to kitchen fire? ouch - i just died a little.
author: Natalie S.

description:
After weeks of searching yelp for the best place to throw a surprise birthday dinner for my boyfriend, I decided to go with the Cantina.

I was very nervous since I've never even seen the outside of the place and I had no idea how many people were going to show up and really the whole thing was just nerve wrecking.

My boyfriend and I arrived an hour late (thank you traffic!) and found the weird mix of people I invited happily sipping away at their third or fourth or (they lost count) pitcher of Margaritas. 

People kept joining us throughout the night and the staff happily accommodated everyone as they came with fresh pitchers of the marvelous margaritas and quickly delivered the new food orders.

I was too all over the place to really sit and enjoy the food but from the few bites I grabbed it was rather good. There was a cabbage side dish "thing" that came on everyone's plate and I swore I'd be back for more of that.

They were even so kind as to stick the cakes I brought with me in their fridge and later arrange candles on them and bring them out for us for no extra charge.

We were a crazy party and they handled us with grace. 

Birthday party recommendation!
author: Inna H.

description:
Mmmmm. . .guacamole and margaritas with the girls!  Who could ask for more?  My friend had been raving about the addictive as crack guacamole forever, so I'm glad I finally got to try it.  The nachos really hit the spot after a long day of dealing with nonsense.  And the margaritas went down nice and smooth.  

The staff here scored major points.  When they asked that we get up so they could seat a reservation, they thoughtfully bribed us with free drinks and a seat at the bar.  When these 2 biotches snagged our seats at the bar, the host dude made sure that we got a spot at the other end of the bar almost immediately.  Not what I expected from a Mexican joint in the Mission, but I liked it.

The crackamole and margaritas will definitely bring me back again.
author: Danielle B.

description:
I have often said that if I had to choose one type of cuisine to eat for the rest of my life, I would have an exceedingly difficult time picking between Italian and Mexican.  

After last night's trip to Velvet Cantina it's safe to say that serious points were scored for Mexican.  First there was this cilantro gimlet thingee (ok admittedly there was more than one...) then there was the chile con queso and the spicy tortilla soup with sour cream empanadas and then actual, real, live SOPES!  It's really hard to find sopes, much less good ones.  And these were good.  

Others at the table had enchiladas that were also good, though the cactus one was a bit weird for my tastes.  The BF was raving about the pinto beans, stating over and over "these are perfect!"  

Then of course there was the true test... the staple of all Mexican restaurants:  the chips.  These were a little thick, a little greasy and oh-so-delicious.  SCORE!  

Top the delicious, reasonably-priced food off with the fun, friendly host, uber-hot waiter, talented bar staff and the lively music playing in the background, and you have a place that I plan on going back to over and over... and over again.
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
Been here twice - Awesome margaritas .. including happy hour starting at 11pm (yes, a late night happy hour !!)

Food was really good except (as others point out) .. its too salty.  Otherwise would get 5 stars.   My favs include cornbread sopes, chicken avocado enchiladas, and the free chips and salsa.
author: chad n.

description: Great space, great drinks, great bartenders.  Now I've only eaten there once, and it was only the cesar salad, but it was still very good.  The others times I have been there have always been a blast.  It just wasn't till the last time that I realized they also served food.  So next time I decided to bar hop in the mission I will definitely start there with some food and drinks , move on to other bars and then proceed to end my night at the Velvet Cantina.  Great place.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Agree with Jason H. entirely, this place is good, not great.

However, it plugs a serious hole in the Mission dining scene: the sit-down, semi-relaxed Mexican place. The food won't be as good as as La Tacqueria or El Faralito, but it will be more leisurely, and you can have drinks. Consider this an upscale Chevy's, so to speak. 

I can speak to the margaritas--they are very good, and the nachos as a must-eat: that queso with its velveeta texture is throw-back to, well, velveeta. 

However, you might want to practice reading lips before you dine here: you won't be able to hear each other amidst all the clamor.
author: Kathleen G.

description:
The only good mexican food I had while living in San Francisco and that's from a guy who has lived in San Diego almost his whole life.

VC Tip #1:  If you order a burrito make sure to get with garbanzo beans 
                     instead of your normal pinto,black,or refried.  I admit I was 
                    skeptical at first, but once you go banzo you don't go back
author: Josh L.

description:
How did I not know about the Velvet Cantina before now? I feel betrayed, as if my friends have been holding out on me for years. 
WTF guys?

We came here in a large group for a friend's birthday. Drinks are fab, food is yum and oh... 
here comes the best part...
wait for it...
They have s'mores nachos! 
The most brilliant idea ever, BUT it gets better. They roast them at your table. It was like a drunken, Mexican camp fire and it was lovely. 
Sadly, I didn't get a chance to order the nachos. Being a birthday party and all there was pie and cupcakes going around the table and CRAP I was full by the time I saw them. 

I'll be back to get you s'mores nachos. 
If it's the last thing I do.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday.  Fantastic drinks - I had the Cilantro Gimlet, if you love cilantro, then you will love this drink.  Watermelon margaritas were spot on, they used fresh watermelon instead of a syrup based juice.

For dinner, I had the avocado cactus enchiladas and my boyfriend got the Mexican Lasagna - both delicious and unique!  For 5 people total, including 2 pitchers of margaritas, the bill came to $120 - can't beat the price!
author: Sari O.

description:
