I totally dig this place. Everyone is friendly and their food is just delicious.  The cocktails and chips are by far my favorite though.  Those chips are the best chips in the world.  I don't know if they fry them like 50 times, but I can't get enough.

I would give them 5 stars if they would change up their menu more often, but if that's my only gripe, well then, this place must rock.
author: cindy p.

description:
It is high time I gave this cantina the five stars it deserves. The house margaritas have been ranked as the finest in San Francisco by the Burnett Avenue Guild of Cave Diving Philosophers, and as a card carrying member of that storied fraternity, I raise my glass in assent.

The extra-greasy chips and salsa serve as an excellent appetizer and each menu item shines on its own. My current favorites are the Chile Verde and the delicious Mole.
author: Raoul D.

description:
I love this place. 

Margaritas by the pitcher. Delicious.
Homemade chips. Delicious.
Chicken avocado enchiladas. Delicious.
Guacamole, ceviche, cocktails, sopas, you guessed it. DELICIOUS.

I've gone here many times, small groups, big groups, boisterous drinking groups that have just finished a play over at The Dark Room and want to relax, those same groups twenty minutes before the kitchen closes on a Saturday night, and it's always the same. Awesome with great service. We like sitting in the dining room without the bar, the one closer to Valencia rather than Mission. 

Just reviewing the place is giving me a craving.
author: Rhiannon C.

description:
Velvet Cantina has solid mexican food, good cocktails, great music, comfortable booths, a long tequila list, and a cool name. The menu is more interesting than regular tex-mex so it's a good place to go when you're looking for food more interesting than your regular tacqueria. I had:

- Naked Relleno: An egg-free & unfried take on the Chilli Relleno and it was quite good. The chilli is filled with small chunks of bell pepper, chilli, potato, and an almost obscene amount of cheese (I had cheesy strings flying all over the place). I do think it would be better with some egg scrambled into the mix. It's covered with an interesting almost-mole like red sauce - I thought the flavors were more Indian than Mexican, but it was super good. The dish comes served with a heaping amount of beans (the black beans are very good and flavorful) and rice (really good mexican rice). I cleared the entire plate plus a side salad and half a basket of chips, so don't expect to share this entree with anyone. The other interesting vegetarian entree was Cactus Enchiladas which I'm excited to try at some point in the future.
- Chips & Salsa: The chips are way too greasy (like you can actually see the shinyness) but are good and salty with drinks. The salsa is amazing - super thick, super fresh, and really flavorful. 
- Ginger Ginger: A delightful tequila cocktail. Warning - do not try to eat the ginger chunks because they taste like straight alcohol...unless that's your thing, then you'll love them.

I would definitely come back to Velvet Cantina, whether for drinks & apps or dinner or for a gabfest with girlfriends or a date...it's pretty perfect for all of that.
author: Jasmine A.

description: This place has the best margarita's that will knock you off your feet!  The price is reasonable and all their rita's are made with fresh lime juice and not a mix.  The bartenders/wait staff are all about service and very entertaining.
author: Kathy J.

description:
Is "velvet cantina" a euphemism for ladybits?  

No matter, the restaurant has high-octane energy and smooth margaritas!  The food was standard, but again, smooth margaritas!
author: Marcus C.

description:
i love this random outings, so when he said he is gonna pick up and will go out for some drinks, i hurriedly put on my pants and off we go.

he knows i love mojito, but margaritas 2nd my list....esp watermelon margarita...been here before so instead of going elsewhere on that one sunny happy hour early eve, i suggested to come here, and like always he obliged....lol 

so we ate, we drank and we were very merry.. ..merry
author: Malou C.

description:
I think this place is made of solid!  It joined the neighborhood about 5 years ago or so and it is such a wonderful welcome addition to the mission.

Cute waiters, great drinks, gargantuan meals, fast service.  I really enjoy this place every time I go.
I wish I hadn't finished my meal last night because I went to a potluck dinner party afterwards and i was just too full.  okay, I ate a little more when I was ready to leave.  But that put me over my calorie limit for the day.

The watermelon margarita was so fresh and a perfect drink for our occasional hot summer days.  light on the salt thank you.

I always waiver between the chili verde, achiote tacos and the enchiladas.  I kind of get stuck in a rut when something is very good and consistent.  Last night it was the achiote chicken tacos w/o sour cream and i just love that meal.  Love the cabbage too.

No dessert for me thanks, that margarita did it for me.
author: Leslie I.

description: Went with my friend looking for a place with nice small eats and drinks. She's vegetarian--got the guacamole, queso con chile, and mushroom empanadas, and for drinks their fruit margaritas--one raspberry one pineapple. all for sharing all SO YUMMY. love the red and wonderful ambiance, had great conversation, waiter was splendid and food/drink scrumptious. miraculously free tequila shots were a plus! definitely going back.
author: Sabina M.

description: Great place for a first date! Chill enough with a nice bar but fancy enough to have delicacies like their amazing cactus enchiladas! Our server was awesome and Travis was great at the bar. Made the whole experience better. Definitely a place I'll be going back to often. I can think of this place as my friend group's hangout spot such as the guys in How I Met Your Mother have!
author: Ankit J.

description:
The two best things about this place are: (1) authentic margaritas, and (2) fresh, creative food.

Any bar that makes real margaritas (lime juice, tequila, and triple sec) ranks pretty high with me.  A margarita made with a sugary mix is not a margarita.  They have a new premium tequila each month, and it's usually well worth the extra 50 cents.

You can watch the people in the kitchen making the salsa fresh while you eat.  I've tried just about everything on the menu and it has always been very good.

The bartenders and servers are all really laid back and friendly but also very professional and prompt.  

Only draw back is that they've become so popular that it's often very hard to get a table.  But hey, all that means is that you need to drink more of their great margaritas, right?
author: B D.

description:
I have never left this establishment even remotely sober, an honor I can only bestow upon Martuni's, usually. I blame it on the fact that they seem to encourage lingering, unlike other places which place a premium on turning tables. 

They give me free guacamole when I have to wait, they accept with convincing gratitude my drunken offerings of the "Mr. Gay Latino San Francisco" trophies that I found next to the trash bin down the street. 

There's a lot of bromance going on behind the bar, which I appreciate, and this conviviality seems to spill over onto the patrons. And the food is unfailingly good. While I miss the knife fights that contributed to ye olde La Rondalla's ambiance, I'm sorry to say that the pineapple margarita here is It.
author: Melissa G.

description:
We celebrated my b-day here recently and had a fabulous time!  Since we were a party of 28, we did make reservations in advance (obviously) and decided on making it a set menu.  We started with guacamole, con queso and beef empanadas (MY FAVORITE).  Then for entrees, we had the choice of:

1) Chicken & Avacado Enchiladas - this was the hit of the night
2) Cactus & Avacado Enchiladas
3) Shrimp Diablo
4) Steak Tacos - could have used a bit more flavor

The price was right and the service was fabulous (and our 3 servers were cuties).

I will be heading back to the VC many more times!!!  Oh, and I forgot to mention the "perfect margaritas"!  They were yummy~
author: Dana D.

description:
I was excited when i first walked in.  I liked the decor and the energy that was present.  Unfortunately that was it.  The waitstaff were all too busy flirting with each other and the owner.  It took about 12 minutes to even be greeted by our waiter.  The salsa chips were good, but all the entrees were bland.  There were three of us and we all got something different, and none of them were anything exceptional.  They were so bland....no flavor what so ever.  Also there had not hot sauce on the table. For any type of mexican cuisine...how can you not have hot sauce?
To sum it up: waitstaff too worried about being pretty and flirting....bland, flavorless food.
author: D V.

description: I like this spot, but it's loud as fuck and they really try to move you in and out in a hurry on a weekend night. If you're trying to eat at a chill, relaxed pace, be warned. But most people, myself included, are just trying to get their drink on, chill with friends and eat much better than average Mexican food. Their signature dishes seem to be the Margaritas, Queso Dip and the Chicken Avocado Enchiladas. Both are stellar....my advice: go with a group, slam a few pitchers of margs, crush the queso dip and some guac and enjoy your entree. The dessert nachos look tasty as well. Bueno.
author: Matt H.

description: Such a great bar! The food was amazing, margaritas were delicious and the staff was friendly. A little dark and dungeony, but I guess that's part of the abiance. I had a great time, will definitely return.
author: Ashley B.

description: I only hung out in the bar area here, and only for about 45 minutes.  I really didn't catch any Mexican influence here besides the mediocre chips and salsa we were given.  Whatever.  The bartender was nice and funny, and the drinks came quickly.
author: Bill H.

description: 4 stars not because it's authentic (it's not), but because it's divey and weirdly satisfying even if slightly off.   The crowd when I was there seemed more like NYC.  NYC-style Mexican?  Cool dude staff guys are nice too.
author: Melanie C.

description:
Peter.....I love uuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuu friend 
And not just for your great bartending skills either ;)

Oh yeah, and I love the food here too as well as the other cool guys who work here that make this establishment fun.

The only thing that gets me is that they dont service lunch :(
Anyone else agree???

God, Im craving bad right now.  *Cries*  Sorry, but it is that good.
author: Zoe G.

description:
I was really excited when Velvet Cantina opened in the hood as I'm often in want for a sit-down, homey, enchilada plate kind of Mexi place. After noting the presence of a full bar and late hours it seemed like it would be hard for the V.C. to walk away with anything less than 4 stars. However, with a few adjustments, I think that the cantina can be vastly improved.

Grouse #1-Salsa is hurting in the spice department. I asked if they had anything spicier, nope. Then asked for some chopped jalapenos. Our waiter was compassionate in regards to our spice plight and eventually brought us a bottle of habanero hot sauce. I liked the hot sauce b/c it wasn't a vinegar based hot sauce like tapatio or tabasco, but more pureed chiles. It was also fiery hot.

Grouse numero dos-Tried the serrano infused tequila with cucumber puree drink. The cucumber elements were refreshing but I found the serrano tequila to be acrid and harsh tasting, perhaps a squeeze of lime could balance out the drink. I think I would go margarita next time. 

Grouse 3-The chicken avocado enchiladas ($10.99) have jalapeno cream sauce listed in the description. I prefer enchiladas that arrive in a pool of sauce and with just a squiggle of sauce on the top, these guys were a bit dry. Without a hearty napping of sauce, the tortillas became tough after a few minutes on the table.

Ok, grousing aside, I *loved* the chips at Velvet Cantina. If we could get a spicy salsa option, I would be there frequently for chips and drinks if not more. Warm, tender cornbread forms the base for tasty pollo asado sopes ($5.99). The white tortilla soup ($4.99) was a large enough portion to share. Shreds of chicken were hidden under the submerged sour cream empanada. My fellow eater enjoyed the soup and I was more ambivalent about it, nothing too exciting, but a decent start to a meal. After reading various reviews in the weeklies, I recalled people mentioning bland beans. As a refritos lover, I hoped that this had been improved upon. Refried pinto beans were creamy enough and went well with the freshly fried chips. 

I think that the cantina could be a successful fit to the neighborhood with a few improvements (spicier!). With a cheap late night happy hour and top notch chips, I wouldn't mind whiling away a night here. Plenty of booths to chill out in with friends too.
author: Candice L.

description:
I really liked this place when I first went, but later I realized the side dishes are basically cardboard. Margaritas are great, but the food is so-so. 

Still 3 stars for the outstanding service, and always having a blast due to the aforementioned margaritas.
author: Irene P.

description:
Better-than-average mexican food, great atmosphere, and cute, friendly waiters. 

Also, I'm lactose intolerant, and when I first looked at the menu, my queso-hating heart sunk. But they made both the sopas and the empanadas without cheese for me, without grumbling -- SWEET! 

Personally, I prefer a baked empanadas, so those were not my fave. But the sopas were excellent! 

And they have a dessert called Nacho Smores or something. We were too full to order it, but we're going to try it this weekend. Chips. Marshmallows. Chocolate. Flame. Nuff said.
author: Amy K.

description:
Great place to meet up with friends - buzzy atmosphere, reasonable priced menu, and good service.

It's a small restaurant so if you have a big party, you need to book in advance.  They were able to accommodate our party of 11 quite easily.

The ambience is great, and the margaritas are yummy.  The food is average - big portions and reasonably priced.
author: Gina C.

description:
Anytime 10 people can get seriously drunk, gorge themselves on food, and make it outta the restaurant at $35/person five stars must be awarded.  

My new favorite birthday dinner location of choice, enabling all friends to afford to fully participate in ushering in of a new year for a fellow drunken compadre.
author: Claire C.

description:
Velvet Cantina... you're like that chick in college that almost everybody avoids, purely because of the fact that they haven't spent the time to understand what is actually really compelling and cool about so-and-so...

I walk into Velvet Cantina to meet some friends for a birthday party, and I'm totally unimpressed. And in NO way am I a snob, so this isn't out of left-field... there is nothing, on the superficial surface, that draws you in. But wait until you order...

The food is fabulous. The service is top-notch, too. And the margaritas... by God, the margaritas are QUITE tasty. Between my fantastic enchilada plate, and the many glasses of margaritas, including the random shots of tequila and Fernet, this was one FUN night. And Velvet Cantina, while looked down upon by MOI upon entrance, totally delivered.

This place kicks ass. Go there. Now.
author: Drew S.

description: Thanks to Velvet Cantina, I am in a food coma as we speak! Great place to come for dinner, laid back vibe, friendly staff and oh man the food...the portions look deceivingly small but holy hell the 2 tacos and beans/rice will fill you up like no other. I had the achiote steak tacos and I almost fell asleep at the table, that is how full I was. Tasty salsa but their guacamole could use more lime and salt.
author: Marcie A.

description:
I haven't tried the food yet but the service and cocktails were great. It was a bit packed in the bar area but given the space being semi tiny it is understandable. Our bartender was very nice and offered us some chips and salsa to go with our cocktails. 

I will have to update this review after a meal.
author: Teddy d.

description:
Went here for our friends birthday recently.  My first time here.

Music is great, I loved it.  Got me in the mood to go out and party after dinner.  

The food was delicious, with very large portions!  I couldn't even finish.

Some things I didn't like...
We were a large group I feel like the staff was a tad slow with us.  They let us sit on the menus till FOREVER!  I was starving by the time he finally took everyones order.  Also I feel like the main waiter we had didn't seem very interested in making us feel welcomed.  He sort of looked blankly at us a lot, gave the impression we were annoying him.   Very competent and capable people working here, however they're lacking in the friendliness vibes for sure.
author: Mary R.

description:
Somehow the name of this place seems deceiving...but I'll admit I came here after a few drinks. My friends and I were looking to continue drinking. When we walked in we were ushered through the crowded bar and into a dining room in the back...I guess that makes sense since there were 6 of us?

From there we had to go get our own drinks from the bar and I suddenly felt like we were in a family-style Mexican food joint. And there was no velvet to be seen. But then a server offered to bring us some chips, which was really nice since we weren't on a tab or anything.

The chips and salsa were amazingly fresh and delicious so we got a couple of appetizers, chicken strips and guacamole...the awesomeness continued. After a slightly confused first impression, I was able to appreciate and admire the Velvet Cantina.
author: carrie c.

description:
Nevermind anything but the waitstaff here.  This is the most ridiculous place to have a drink.  It's great.  That's all I can say.  Especially when Darius sprays you with his water hose, or even better when Eli brings two women to the bar who he has 'had relations' with and they ditch him there!  

Yeah Eli, you're gonna pay baby :)
author: Dana M.

description:
Margaritas made from scratch, a tequila selection that rivals Tommy's (no joke), bomb food that's a great twist on regular Mexican restaurant fare . . . that's a lot of win, right there.
Doesn't hurt that the staff is incredibly rad and really friendly, too. Ask them what tequila they've got as their special for the night! It's ALWAYS something super tasty.
author: Erin P.

description:
I don't know.  I almost can't decide what I think of this place.  On one hand, I dig the atmosphere and the margaritas, but on the other hand, I feel ignored by the staff.

I've been here twice.  The first time was ok, but it took forever for our meals and drinks to come.  When our drinks did finally make it to us, they didn't make it to the table, but rather on my lap.   Honestly, not a big deal in my book, it's not easy to carry a tray of full drinks and the waitress was new.  They totally replenished the drinks and we carried on with our night.  Food was good... not great, but good.

Second visit here was a week ago with four other friends.  It took them quite a bit of time to seat us, despite all the empty seats.  The waiter was a bit out of it, but nice.  He kept forgetting to take our order and actually told us he was a bit behind and out of it.  Strange from a waiter, but whatever.

Then it took another 20 minutes for our pitcher of margaritas to get there, not because they hadn't made it, but because nobody would bring it to us.  My friend had to eventually go grab it and give the staff some shit just to get any kind of service.

Fortunately, they totally responded and paid plenty of attention to us the rest of the night.

The food was better than I remembered it from before.  

My iffiness is mostly about the service.  I actually like the place and the food is decent enough to eat there regularly, but I just feel like they need a little more practice on the customer service end of things.

I'll definitely go back and hopefully my update will have a better star rating.
author: louda l.

description:
My biggest bit of advice to you is NOT to go here.  Really.  The margaritas are too good.  The selection of tequila is great.  The food - particularly appetizers (nachos!!!) is super yummy.  Bartenders and waiters are great people and provide great service.

Please!! Don't go here.  It is getting too crowded. I personally begin withdrawals if I do not make it there every few weeks or so. Worth the trip to the Mission for me, but I really don't think you will like it.  

If you don't take my advice, however, and you really feel like you must go, you really do have to try the nachos with chorizo.  They are fantabulous! Yes, you have to have the chorizo. Trust me on that!
author: Danielle R.

description:
When looking for a place that has the room to seat 14 for a birthday party, the choices in this area are surprisingly limited... not only did the Velvet take a reservation, but the table was ready for us when we got there and already decked with chips and salsa.  Fantastic! 

I've been here a couple of times, and have always had great food, great drinks, and great times. 
Some thoughts on last night's food:
Rasberry Marguaritas - Delicious, refreshing, and 80% pure taquilla
Chili con Queso Dip - Couldn't stop eating it with the chips, amazing
Chicken Avacado Enchiladas - A little dry, but very good and properly spiced... this is my go to dish.
Tri-Tip - A little tough but very spicy and flavorful, probably not worth the $14 (most expensive item on the menu) but still really good
Chicken Mole - I love mole and this does not disappoint.  Rich creamy mole sauce with hints of cinnamon and habanero.  
Steak Tacos- I couldn't get a bite of these from my friend who ordered them because as soon as I turned around to ask how they were, they were gone... Anytime food is eaten that fast, it has to be delicious.

As it was a birthday party, they guys at Velvet brought out two plates of the S'more Nachos.  WOW.  As I said, I've been here a couple of times, but I never dared take indulgence to the level of chocolate, cinnamon, and marshmallow covered chips before.  They lit the marshmallows on top on fire and my friend got to blow them out in lieu of a candle.  Very cool of them.  After looking at them, I couldn't resist trying them... Again WOW.  Screw making s'mores on a campfire, never again.  From now on I'm making s'more nachos... truly there is no better food on earth.  Happy Birthday Jon B.  Great choice!
author: Darren R.

description:
One of my first times going to Velvet Cantina, there was some major drama involving a dumb drunk crying girl and a lost bag, blaming the bartenders. Once it was discovered that her friend picked it up, she decided best thing to do was stand behind the bar and aplogize for 20 minutes leaving all patrons unable to order a drink. Once she finally walked out the door, the host silently lined up row of tequila shots for everyone that side of the bar, the bartender, and himself. It's that kind of place. 

Even beyond that, the drinks are cheap, the food is good, and the staff is fun.
author: Cat S.

description:
Cool little spot, nice vibe.  The chips and salsa are AWEsome!  I ordered the tri-tip which disappointed.  Asked for medium rare, and this was definitely more medium-well.  Sides were not exciting.  Next time I would definitely try something else.  Also tasted my friend's shrimp diablo which were quite tasty.  At this point, the food was 3 stars for me.  Not bad, not great.

BUT, like Jason B., I have to give another star for the delicious smores nachos!  Very inventive...crunchy, gooey....awesome.  Our waiter was great (no idea what his name was) and overall, we had a fun experience.  As it often goes, the company with whom I shared this meal made it that much better.
author: Louis M.

description:
didnt even mean to come to this bar. we were gonna go the bar a block up, but glad we didnnt. actually, i didnt even know it was called Velvet Cantina until now haha. it was the many signs outside, not knowing which one was the name of the bar and just mystery of what kind of place this was just by looking at its outside appearance that drew us in. i think the sign "alluring edibles" is what did it for me.

from the outside it kind of reminded me of an old style saloon. then we walked in and were like "OH. its a cantina!" 

immediately ordered a pitcher of their Velvet Margaritas (made with avage nectar; the only way to do it). we had a good time. this dimly lit mexican restaurant/bar, playing non mexican remixed alternative/dance music is just my style. i prefer them over the "sceney" places, if u will.

we didnt order food, even though our neighbors nachos looked amazings, but they gladly gave us a complimentary bag of their wonderful tortilla chips. and no not a brown paper bag. it was like a grocery bag filled with their chips lol i guess they wanted to get rid of em. since we had no salsa, we seasoned em with their 3rd table spice (aside from salt & pepper) which our best guess was salt mixed with paprika? whatever it was it was tasty. ill call it "salprika."
author: Renalen C.

description:
Cool, kitchy, casual ambience. Cactus/avocado enchiladas were really good. Lots of tequilia options and good margaritas. Unfortunately we were too full to order to S'mores Nachos for dessert. 
Will definitely go back. 
One tip: it's a restaurant/bar environment and that combined with the music can make conversation difficult.
author: Macy M.

description:
Okay. My best friend Sara has been talking about velvet canttina literally from the first day we met...I think it was something like "yeah me and my ex went to Velvet Cantina and I got ham sauced and threw up in his car"....and from that moment on we were/are two peas in a pod. 

However tonight was my first time at Velvet. We started with the fresh fruit magaritas. They had a choice of cantaloupe and pineapple. Being the melon fanatic that I am, I went for the cantaloupe first. Ahhhhmazing. so yummy. I watched him pour and a shit load of tequila went in that bad boy...but all I could taste was the refreshing melon (no wonder she got so drunk). I then ate the whole basket of freshly fried chips and followed with the shrimp enchiladas. Sara had the grilled santa maria tri-tip...also amazing. 

all in all...great crowed, great food, sweet staff, missionish music, dim lighting, clean bathrooms and tasty offerings of food and drink. This one is a keeper.

oh only draw back is they close at 1:30 instead of 2:00 and the bar is small/wait is long...and that is the reason for the 4 stars.
author: Summer C.

description:
Delicious nachos (I'm still talking about them and thiking about them, 2 months later).

My dinner entree of the carnitas stew was also very, very delicious.  I was weary to order it because I saw a woman at the next table barely ate half of the bowl and usually, with stewed meat, unless they really know what they are doing, it comes out badly.  However, after tasting the apps, I thought the kitchen had some chops, so I went for the pork stew.  Glad I made that choice.

The wife had the enchilada - we thought it was pretty bland and dry, not the best there.

Margarita is on the sweet side, though very well made.  

Service was friendly and patient (we had a table of 10 people, ordering at different rates, people came in an hour later).

I'd highly recommend this restaurant for those of you who are skeptical of mexican food.  The price is reasonble, most of the food were on the mark, with a good vibe and staff
author: Hanson L.

description:
Talk about the biggest contradiction.  Best bar tenders, best fresh fruit margaritas, and best mexican food I have ever had--- of course, that was after 3 pitchers of margaritas.

BUT WHOA ON THE STAFF.  Our server was an absolute nightmare, including but not limited to when he literally threw the check at my girlfriend.  Prior to this point, we had to take matters up with the manager.  They were packed for dinner (which we expected) but we waited 45 minutes for our food, and when the bartenders noticed (because the waiter sure as h*ll didn't), they offered us a round of drinks on the house....

The problem was the check.  The free round we were promised actually showed up on the bill.... twice.  Everything, the food, the cocktails, the beers, all showed up twice.  (Including the vegitarian burrito we ordered for our non-meat-eating friend that actually came with chicken in it!!!)  Double-billing happens; its no big deal, so we took it up with our bartenders.  They fixed the bill, gave it to the waiter, who then delivered it with a flourish, rudely shoving the check and the plastic plate it was on *AT* my partner.  

We were all a little stunned.  We've never seen anything like it.  They're a busy restaurant, rightly popular for their amazing food and drinks.  They're also growing famous for being understaffed in the kitchen, and understaffed on the floor.  Again, no big deal.  Worth the wait, if your server isn't completely unprofessional, and bordering on the edge of an assault lawsuit. 

So we paid the bill in full.  And reported to the manager that we would not be tipping our server.  

Offensive.  Delicious.  Obscenely long waits.  Perfectly mixed margaritas by the pitcher.

When they finally catch up with their popularity, I hope its not too late.  They're upsetting a lot of folks on the way.  But goddamn, it was worth it.
author: Emmy G.

description:
SF has the best Mexican food north of the border. Even though there are countless amazing taquerias, it's tough to find a fun, reasonably priced Mexican restaurant with great food that is good for groups. That's where Velvet Cantina comes in. 

The decor is fun -- red vinyl booths (think of the booths at the old Brunos) and it's located in the heart of the Mission (the perfect pre-party destination). 

The supply of chips is endless.... And these are GOOD restaurant chips.... I've ordered the guac appetizer and I think there must have been 4 avocados in my guac! The margaritas are muy fuerte. Seriously, they are the strongest margs I have ever tried. So, be careful all you drivers, it could be pretty easy to pull a Paris Hilton after 1 margarita at Velvet Cantina. 

Of the appetizers, I like the quesadilla and the empanadas. The nachos are to-do-for, but should probably be treated as a meal and not an appetizer. 

The entrees are enormous as well because they all come with very generous portions of rice and beans. I love the steak tacos and the enchiladas. 

And for dessert, there's an incredible smores nachos. 

NY may have Rosa Mex, La Esquina,  and Dos Caminos, but SF has Velvet Cantina! More food, more character and less $!.
author: Colleen S.

description: Adorable spot in the mission.  The bar was bursting with people and it was no mystery once I tasted the margarita.  The food was very, very good.  I wouldn't describe it as authentic Mexican; it was definitely poshed up a little bit, but still tasted wonderful.  This is a great a place for a fun date or group dinner.
author: Ava R.

description:
This place is definitely unique.  The crowd leans "hipster" but there is a good mix of people.  Everyone is friendly and in a good mood.  

I was actually surprised at how good the food was since it seems more bar than restaurant.    

The only reason I only have 4 stars is that it was very loud, and I'm too old for that...
author: Keith B.

description: Minus one star for the food, it just not that good anymore. Perhaps the kitchen gets overwhelmed, but the bar doesn't seem to have a problem taking care of the crowds with their drinks. The menu is also one of the most challenging for us vegetarians, and that's normally not a problem at Mexican spots. Throw us some love will ya. Oh, and thats veg WITH CHEESE please.
author: Kylie S.

description:
The guac was guac-o-licious!  And with what seemed like homemade tortilla chips made the guac even better.  I had the chicken mole, and it was big and satisfying.  I am a fan of my meat being still on the bone.  So what if it's harder to devour, it gives way more moistness and flavor to the meat.  YUM!

The margaritas were crazy strong, I could tell even though I had one sip, and the waiters were ADORABLE!  I went out to make a phone call and one of them came out and was very sweet and asked if I wasn't freezing.  I was but I was also on the phone so couldn't respond back with words, just motions.  So they were another plus.

The downside about this place was the noise level and the darkness of the dining area.  Remember I am one of those people who cannot fully enjoy what she's eating unless she can see it!
author: Susan C.

description: Solid 4 stars for a combo of above average food (try the chile verde), AMAZING seasonal rotating fresh fruit margaritas, and divey mission ambiance. Don't go for a romantic night out, it's so loud in there, you have to yell across the table most nights. However, go there with your large group (they make reservations) or smaller - as it's a good way to get the party started. Service is solid, usually extremely friendly, accommodating and attentive. Food is quick, with delicious chips and salsa served immediately on seating, hot and consistent. The interior is dated, 70's style vinyl booths, tile topped tables and dark lighting, but charming none the less. On busy nights, expect a wait, grab a seat at the bar, or make a reservation in advance. Open late on Fridays and Saturdays with drink specials and try the flaming nacho dessert at least once.
author: Kate R.

description:
Awesome food, expensive prices, guacamole is as much as a margarita, but somehow- I love it!

Guacamole is amazing- get it! If you ask for the margaritas strong they'll make them that way. Pete the bartender is great .
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Drinks = Good!
People = Fun!
Potato Burrito = ???

The veggie burrito is made up of chickpeas, rice and a potatoe/guacamole filling.  Sure, potatoes are a root vegetable, but I was really hoping for less starchy vegetables like grilled peppers, grilled onions, pico de gallo.... oh well! 

If you like potatoes in your burrito, you might like the burritos here.
author: Heirloom Z.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants around for big group gatherings.  I like to go here with a big group and order a pitcher of margaritas and the nachos with tri-tip.  OMFG.  I'm salivating just thinking about it.  The chips are toasty and oily just how I like it and the tri-tip, oh, it's so juicy and tender.  The portions are so generous that you could easily satisfy a table of 4 or 5.  Mix in a side of chunky guacamole and perhaps the cilantro avocado chicken enchilada and you'll surely be happy and comatose from the wonderful foods.
author: Karen N.

description:
Mmmm, yes, this place has a bad taste. The dishes didn't seem to be well thought out, and the waiter warned us against the steak because it was "chewy" (oh my god it was so chewy!). I have no idea why you would go to this place seeing as Taqueria Vallarta is a short walk away. It might be a nice place to take a war veteran who had their taste buds amputated yet still craves a rich, fatty sensation in their mouth.

On the bright side, the margaritas were very delicious.
author: Devin S.

description: Okay, the food and margs are really good here, but they need to find a way of getting their reservation system under control!  They seem to privilege reservations for large groups that never show up over serving people actually at the restaurant.  This plays out in super ridiculous ways, people being asked to move tables, waiting for over an hour for a table on weekenights while multiple tables sit open for the entire hour for supposed reservations.  And at this point, I play into it by calling ahead because of this seating nightmare!
author: Gabby G.

description:
This place will get you straight fucked UP! I mean, if you want. Or if you don't want. Actually all I'm really trying to say is that if you order a pitcher of margaritas here, prepare to get in an argument with your girlfriend, yell obscenities, start dancing on the bar or do whatever tequila makes you do OKKK... 
The first time I went here was with my girlfriend and a friend and we were just planning on having a couple margaritas... Well a couple to us is two pitchers. I was hammered beyond reasonable doubt. I thought I could conquer the world. All I ended up accomplishing was being two hours late to my job.
This is the upside to this place. The margaritas. And the decor.
The first time I ate here I had the chicken tacos, which were delicious and I was thoroughly pleased.
The second time I tried the enchiladas with nopales... something texturally about that meal turned me COMPLETELY OFF to Velvet Cantina... also the large amount of pickled onion and cabbage. 

OMFG I hate that shit.

The third time I took my girlfriend's advice and got the steak tacos... they were good, but I think I was permanently scarred from our previous eating experience and needed to stick with the consistency of the margaritas and the blandness of a cheese quesadilla.

I think the next time I go, if I do, will be just for taking shots of tequila... because that had an impressive collection... and drinking pitchers, getting rowdy.
author: Liane V.

description:
I've been to the velvet cantina several times and it has to be one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city.  The atmosphere is relaxed and the staff is always friendly.

I've chosen a few things from their menu, but my absolute favorite thing to order is their burrito.  What? Chickpeas?  What are they doing in a burrito?  Yes, it isn't a common thing to put in, but after you have tried it, I think you will agree it adds just a little bit of firmness to a typically mushy meal.  It is served with a spicy relish on the side, which I also like and the burrito is presented with sauce on top with swirls of sour cream or similar.  If you put a candle in it and sang happy birthday I don't think anyone would look at you weird.

Oh, and one more word.  Tecate.
author: Joe H.

description:
If it were all about atmosphere and convenience, this place would get 4 stars.  It's nice inside - great music, flattering lighting, and real nice workers.  I'd also give the margaritas 4 stars... plenty to choose from, nice portions, and  if you don't like it for some reason, they'll gladly fix it for you.  Unfortunately, the food would get 1 star... It's hard to mess up salsa, but they find some way to do it.  

With all the wonderful Mexican food in San Francisco, I'm not sure why you'd go here... unless, of course, you're just there for the margaritas and ambiance.  If you want real food, walk down the street to a taqueria... but if you're out for drinks and fun, stop in here and check it out.
author: Genevra H.

description:
when i know we're having mexican, i'm already looking forward to the chips and salsa. if you're headed here, don't look forward to it. the chips were super thick, cold and oily. but the salsa was good. despite the chips being yuck, we still ate basket upon basket until our food came. 

oh my oh my. the food was phenomenal! i wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was since they had failed at chips making. i had the shrimp enchiladas, another friend had the tacos, and another had the chicken avocado enchiladas. all were a hit; we were just bummed we had filled up on crappy chips.

then it was someone's birthday and they brought out the s'mores nachos. you can do without those too. overly sweet and kinda meh. 

the pitcher of margarita was STRONG. if you're into that, order a pitcher. 

the service was great, it was super loud and crowded in there, but that's a friday night in the mission. just go eat the food, you'll love me for it.
author: Ren B.

description:
My new (one of them) favorite place in the Mission! I love the service and the atmosphere. Am not a big margarita fan so I can't judge, but my friends drank so many pitchers I have to think they are phenomenal. The service was really good, and the bartender ended up in half of our pictures!

I give it a solid 4 stars for a place to hang out a have a few drinks with friends . . . funky Mission vibe . .. . funky Mission people :)
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
This place has deeeelicious margaritas. I like my drinks like I like my men...STRONG (ahahaaa yes I am cheesy). Well after two margaritas I was a happy little camper. The bartender was hilarious, and had my girlfriends and I laughing until we almost peed our panties. We stumbled out of that place with huge smiles, and ready to really start our night!
OLE!
author: Anna S.

description:
The preparation for the Velvet Cantina's roasted burrito actually starts two to three months before you give your order.  Somewhere in the jungles of Columbia or Peru, farmers grow coca, which is harvested and converted into a cocaine powder.  The cocaine eventually makes its way to the United States, either via fast boats, planes, mules, or some other means.  Upon arrival in San Francisco, or somewhere before its arrival, the cocaine is converted into crack, which then makes its way into the roasted burrito.  

Or maybe not.  

I went there last week and I can't think of any other explanation for my intense craving for another one. 

The prices were reasonable.  Ambiance was nice.  I'll be back.
author: A A.

description:
Really cool vibe in this place, dark and cozy and smells awesome. Came here with Nirvanna and her man on her suggestion and was not let down!

Really good margaritas, chips and salsa. Friendly, helpful and cute waitress that took good care of us. I went with the chicken mole which was very good, great spicy kick along with the mellow sweetness but it was way too much food for me. Next time I want to try the Chicken Avocado enchiladas, Nirvanna got them and they looked faboo.

I was quite intrigued by their Mexican lasagna but not brave enough to order it, interesting idea for sure just not sure I want to eat it. I do know that I want to try their take on S'mores, *drool*
author: Christine K.

description: Damn, I ate so much here. The nacho cheese sause was kind of nasty (but what do I expect). The margaritas are bomb.
author: josh m.

description:
Great service, very friendly and a really nice vibe.  Our server was great, thanks for the tequila shot !!!
The food was very tasty, I can't remember if I thought the price was reasonable...I was a little tipsy.  
I plan on returning...soon!
author: Nilu r.

description:
Update:  This place seriously gets better every time I go!  LOVE the chicken avocado enchiladas!!!  So tasty & spicy!! The beans and rice are actually pretty good for a restaurant.  The margaritas are even better!  

Chips and service definitely bump this place up a star or two.  I haven't tasted chips like this since I went to a Superior market, and if you know what that is then you know what good chips taste like.  Salsa was tasty, but could have been a bit spicier.  The nachos were awesome and according to my friend, the best nachos she ever had.  I had the black forest quesadilla which was tasty with the gruyere, but was definitely missing something.  The margaritas were your standard house margaritas.  We went on a Thursday night and were seated immediately.  The waiter was very attentive, made sure our margarita glasses were always full (very important) and basically made sure we had everything we needed.  I will definitely  be back for the chips and appetizers.  Maybe next time I will try a main dish!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Delish drinks, tasty chips. I liked my raspberry margarita, and my girlfriend enjoyed her standard one. The tortilla chips are big, thick, and freshly fried -- a bit oily, perhaps, but that's how I like 'em. Nice salsa. The Mexican-ized Caesar was eh (too much creamy dressing), but we liked the chicken and avocado enchiladas.

Spotty service. We went here on a Sunday evening, and it took us a while to get menus, and when we ordered, the waiter acted like he was doing us a favor. Laid-back atmosphere, though, and I think this would be a good place to go with a group for a mellow meal. Wish I could give this place three and a half stars, but four will do.
author: Tara M.

description:
So after being referred to Velvet by a friend, I Yelped it to get the low down. Everything sounded so awesome, I couldn't wait to try it. I went in on a Sunday evening and the place was pretty packed. My date and I were seated right away in a cozy little booth. I will say right now that I went in with high expectations and came out disappointed. If you go in not expecting much, I think you'd come out happily surprised!

The service was the worst thing about this place. We kept joking that our waiter was either seriously hungover, hated his job or prob both. He barely even looked at us while taking our order, let alone greeted or smiled at us. We waited for what seemed like an eternity for him to bring us water..... then drinks..... then the bill......

What the service lacked, the kitchen and bar made up for. From the time we ordered - we got our food 10 or 15 minutes later - seriously fast. The drinks were fun, tasty and strong! The chips were greasy and the salsa was tasteless, but the Cactus Enchiladas were SO good. The portions are huge and the place is cheap, so that can be enticing to some. Although we weren't hungry, we were intrigued by the S'more Nachos and ordered them for dessert. Within 5 minutes a heaping plate of tortilla chips covered in melted chocolate and marsh mellows was staring right at us. They were super yummy, but I couldn't handle more than a few bites. 

If I lived near this place, I'd prob go back, but since I don't, I won't be returning. There are just too many ridiculously good places in this city for me to return to this mediocre spot.
author: Jenny S.

description:
This is my friends fave restaurant du jour.  So, he's dragged me here three times.  

He claims the margaritas to be some of the best he's had.  

He sings the virtue of the enchiladas and guacamole.

He espouses the decor and groovy clientele.  

But I know the truth behind his devotion.  The place is filled with cute gay boys.  

Other than that, the margs are decent, the food, a little better than average, and the atmospere fun and lively.  

To his credit, great arms still stand for something.
author: Shannon M.

description:
This place was complete garbage when I went. Weird menu and the food was actually disgusting. The only reason I give 2 stars is because someone I know actually liked the place so I'm compromising.
Definitely a drinks only place.
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
We looked this place up on Yelp and decided to check it out since it got good reviews.  I have been wanted to find a new favorite Mexican restaurant for the longest time and finally found it, Velvet Cantina.
Despite a pretty long wait (over 1 hour), the place was great.
Atmosphere, decor, service and food are all 5! 

After dinner, walk 1 block to 22nd street and get a drink at the Revolution Cafe.
author: Kirill E.

description:
went to velvet cantina last night for dinner. this place came highly recommended by friends.  it is a casual scene with a bar on one side and tables and then more tables in a separate room.  we were immediately sat on the bar side, so it was a bit rowdier than the restaurant-only side. we were seated immediately on a saturday night around 815, which was a pleasant surprise.  the service was good, not over the top. the food was food, too.  the best part of the meal was the tortilla soup.  drinks were good, too and 100% reasonably priced. i ordered the shrimp enchiladas and they were ok. my husband and friend we were with both ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas and they were happy with their orders.  i think i ordered wrong.  small shrimp, hardly any cheese and even though i was told the chile de arbol sauce on the enchiladas would be spicy, it was not. i really wanted the fish tacos but they could only do them fried as they are pre-battered. :(  

overall, would recommend as a place to grab a drink or two on the way out to an evening in the mission, but not sure i would recommend the food (except for the moderate prices and large portions).
author: Nicole R.

description: This place ROCKS! They've got a sweet/intimate/fun interior/seating, great margaritas and awesome staff. I love their Chile Relleno and everything else is good too. I have nothing bad to say about this well priced, good eat!
author: Caitlin F.

description:
The first time I went to this place I just got a s'mores dessert and some drinks. This place gets seven stars based on the s'mores dessert alone. The drinks are nothing to write about.

The second time I went here was for dinner. The free nachos and salsa are delicious. It's very difficult to pace yourself but save room for dinner. I ordered a steak entree. It was very good. My girlfriend got the entree with cactus in it. It is amazing. I'm inspired to buy cactus from the local markets now.

To sum up: dessert, 7; food, 5; drinks, 2
author: Robert V.

description:
White- people- friendly Mexican food. 

When I was trying to order I had a hard time choosing because I am a vegetarian and get pretty bored of the quesadilla standard. They menu is small. I can respect that though. I ended up ordering the appetizer ceviche as my entree. It turned out to be delicious. It was shrimp with coconut milk and pineapple and came with some chips. I also got a side of half beans and half rice which was enormous. 

We also got a pitcher of Margaritas that only yielded about 4 small glasses because of the massive amounts of ice the mixed with it. 

This place would probably max out at 4 stars if they had a little more of a selection, less ice in the margaritas, and less background noise. I think for me the problem is that in the Mission you can find way cheaper, and way more delicious mexican food close by.

edit*****
I am a vegetarian that sometimes eats seafood. get over it.
author: Molly G.

description:
Note: review on drinks/service only.
Came for margaritas last night with a group of 4. The fresh fruit margarita of the day had three choices: pineapple, mango, and watermelon. After checking out the glass vs pitcher prices, we chose a pitcher of the pineapple - great idea! Fresh pineapple (not just juice) was blended with tequila and tasted sooo good, not too sweet. Our one friend said it was pretty strong, but I didn't really think so? I actually seasoned mine with a little of the chile salt, which gave it some welcome heat. Towards the end, I did get some threads of pineapple at the bottom, which was a little unpleasant. After that first pitcher was drained, we decided to get one more but chose the House version instead. It was actually really good too. We did have to ask for salted rims on the glasses though (salt was also missing from round 1 - it would have been awesome had we had some of that chile salt on the rims!) which irked me a little. The other thing that was irksome was that shortly before 11, our server asked us to cash out with him because he was starting his end-of-night paperwork. All right, I guess we won't order more drinks then! There were still a few customers in addition to our table and we all hung out for at least another half hour, so it was kind of awkward to have had to pay already. He said "no rush" but come on...
Also, I basically drank a pitcher myself and was only slightly buzzed. Either that's a bad sign for me and my tolerance (!) or my friend who thought the drinks were strong is a total lightweight. I lean toward the latter ;)
Being that it's in the Mission, it's definitely out of the way for me. But I might come back to try these chicken avocado enchiladas that everyone raves about. I also want to try the Velvet Margarita with agave nectar - sounds good! We'll see...
author: Stephanie S.

description:
2 thumbs way up for the margarita pitchers!!!

2 thumbs 1/2 down for the wait at the bar....

The venue itself is a lot smaller than expected and had pretty low ceilings from what I remember. We were there for a friends birthday and the place was packed and then some!

The drinks were tasty when we were lucky enough to be served... I can't wait to go back to try the food!
author: Summer C.

description: I've been coming to this place for 7 years or so, the staff is so freaking friendly, I some times wonder how they manage to do it considering the volume of customers they handle. Food is good, drinks are great. They don't mess with the margaritas (for real!) however, they don't have "strawberry margarita" (sad face). Try the mango margarita, so freaking good! Nachos are awesome. All in all, a great place in the mission (a little bit country, a little bit rock and roll if u know what i mean). Thanks to the staff(derreck, erick, darius, travis#1, travis#2, gabe) and of course, the big honcho Matt!
author: arthur b.

description:
3 stars for the food, tortilla soup usually great was spicy as.. wow, and the pork was so overcooked. 

Atmosphere and service were excellent, maybe they were a bit busy.
author: Jay G.

description: Was not too stoked on my meal here...  The drinks were pretty good but the food was mediocre.  I ordered the steak tacos- the steak was tough/rubbery and the rice and beans were bland... I couldn't finish my plate.  The cactus enchiladas seem like the better choice but still were nothing exciting...  The nachos looked pretty good... should've ordered nachos...
author: Bobby P.

description:
Eat the queso.  Drink the margarita.  Repeat.  Had one night where the margs were a little weak, but plenty of others where they weren't.  They infuse and concoct their own juice vodka tequila action and mix it up.  I've had mango and raspberry margs that were great.

Some of the food options are not so great, but others are.  Try the sopes, the tortilla soup, and did I mention the queso?  

The staff is real, meaning they're friendly and mellow when the place is, and they have to focus and rock when it slams.  Nobody's kissing your ass and nobody's being a dickhead.  Perfect balance for me; others may want more service for their entree money.
author: Inda N.

description: Their margaritas are wonderful!  Especially the fresh fruit margarita.  I had the ceviche and it was very good.  I've had better, but definitely had much worse as well.  the staff were very welcoming and the ambiance is great for a chill night with some good friends.
author: Michael H.

description: We always have a great time here.  Margaritas are deeeelicious but can vary quite a bit depending on who is behind the bar.  Great tequila selection and super nice staff.  Chicken tacos, shrimp enchiladas, and cactus enchiladas are yummy.
author: K W.

description:
Great place to go with some friends for a bite and some drinks.  They have seasonal fruit margaritas (watermelon is the best!) and a cilantro gimlet.  They also serve free chips and salsa--not too spicy but lots of flavor.  I have had the chile queso and guacamole, both are really good but kind of expensive for the small portion.  I also like the tortilla soup with sour cream empanada.  Break up the empanada and all the sour cream mixes into the soup. (I'm drooling right now).  For dessert you have to try the s'mores nachos! Cinnamon tortilla chips with chocolate and marshmallow melted with a torch =)  

The ambiance is great too. Nice and casual and they always say hi when you walk in.  They play fun music. However, lately they have been playing too much Top 40. Put the IPOD playlist back to The Roots please! I usually eat at the bar if I'm with a friend but sometimes it gets too packed. The last time I went I sat at a table with my boyfriend and the service wasn't that great.  The waitress didn't check up on us once. It was a really busy night with lots of reservations.
author: Mel G.

description: It's really loud in here at the Velvet so I'm sorry for yelling when I say "THE CACTUS ENCHILADAS WERE GREAT!"
author: Vinit P.

description:
Velvet Cantina has a cool bar/restaurant atmosphere. The restaurant is a great restaurant for hosting large parties. Velvet Cantina is in the heart of the Mission so centrally located near many bars to visit pre or post dinner... The place is very loud so It would be awkward to go on a date. It would also be ideal for a single to belly up to the bar. ;) 
The food is okay, I think your going more for the vibe & bar scene then the food. The logo sure is catchy though: edibles & elixirs put a smile on my face before I even stepped in the door. 
The hits at the table were: Cornbread sopas w/ pollo asada, pepper jack cheeses, refried beans, salsa & sourcream. AND the Avocado cactus enchiladas. I was unimpressed with my Chimichurri Caesar salad with tri-tip but that is my own fault for ordering a salad at a Mexican restaurant... The chips and salsa were okay and the guacamole was good. I will go back just for the cool Kitchy vibe and margaritas...next time I will try the empanadas!!
author: Michele K.

description: Great food, great fresh fruit margaritas.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I wanna love this place, I've been a couple times...I'll be back, maybe. I LOVE the sultry dimmed red lights in the bar area, I LOVE the cute waiters. I really like the chips. For those I give 3 stars. 

I don't like the margaritas (is that even possible?), too limey/strong (like my throat kinda closes up after one) And after trying a mango margarita, it was too sweet. The food, meh, only ok...the refried beans tasted canned, and nothing quite delivered on the fabulous descriptions in the menu. 

Stick to chips and beer I guess.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
I wish I lived closer to go to this place more often. Everything was so San Franciscan and perfect.

I want some more flamin' s'more nachos!

Their guacamole is the best I've ever had.
author: Tomas P.

description:
I've eaten here several times, so I was bummed when I tried to take my friend here last month, only to learn that they were closed as a result of a fire.

I'm glad to see they are finally open again, and they're as good as I last remembered them.

The chips are yummy - fresh, thick and crunchy with some slightly sweet-ish chunky salsa.

I tend to get the veggie Bordello Burrito which is filled with the usual suspects (cheese, guacamole, sour cream, rice), garbanzo beans, potato, nopales and garlic, covered in a chile sauce. Yeah, at $9.99 its an expensive burrito but 'tis good to the taste buds.

Margaritas are good - just stay away from the pineapple one - I've had sleepless nights from the heartburn I got from drinking too many of those.

The atmosphere is laid back and a little on the funky side, as with the staff. Great location to have group parties.
author: Sean G.

description:
Just moved into the Mission(22nd\Capp). So this is my new hood. I decided to get in some trouble last weekend, which included getting started with some sit down Mexican food and margaritas!

I called my buddy up, picked him up...'cause he broke his neck and can't ride his bike. I figured I save him some cab fare. After fetching him, parked down the street from my crib, dropped some stuff of and we walked over. 

Even though it was like 9pm on a saturday, we were able to walk in and grab a table! That alone is worth a star! One of the things I like about the Velvet Cantina is that it's not only a restaurant, but it also has a bar with seating and so it's also a scene.

So I order avocado and nopales(cactus) enchiladas and a margarita. They had margarita specials, can't remember the name of the tequila, but it was like 6 bucks and the waiter said it was pretty decent...which it was, but it wasn't Don Julio, so the second margarita was don julio  with salt on the rocks....mmm!

I love nopales and avocado, but never thought of mixing them, let alone in an enchilada. I will definitely be experimenting with these ingredients at home! The chips were fresh and the salsa was kicking. Cause I was trying to be healthy I order black beans. The meal was real tasty.

I will be back! Especially since I can easily stumble there and back ;-)
author: isaias J.

description:
2.5 Stars. All I've heard about this place has been positive, so I went in with high expectations. Unfortunately, high expectations usually lead to disappointment. When will I learn?

The good:
-The staff were awesome. Extremely friendly and unpretentious
-The watermelon margarita was delish and a good deal at $6.50

The not-so-good
-The Mole was way too sweet. The Mole is always my benchmark of good Mexican, and this one missed
-The salsa was very fresh, but there was zero spice
-The table we were given would have comfortably sat two, but we were 4 people (including 3 boys), so it was cramp city!

I will probably give it another try in hopes of reporting back with better news.
author: Michelle D.

description: Mmmmmm, super good food.  I recommend for a group.  the atmosphere is lively and fun.  If you wanna grab a yummy late dinner before the drinking starts, this is your spot.
author: Jessica H.

description: Good service. Bland food. I had the chicken enchiladas with avocado. They were pretty flavorless and dry. Good guacamole though. The margarita had a hint of artificial flavor too.
author: Bill L.

description:
Service was horrible, food was cold (the chile con queso was brought out to our table COLD, it is supposed to be HOT, MELTED CHEESE), and the food was brought to our table within 3 minutes, which makes me think that they make everything WELL before you order it OR that the food is made with absolutely no skill.  Ironically the food was brought to our table within 3 minutes, considering that I had to beg them to take our order after waiting FOREVER for our waiter.

Too bad the food was brought to our table within 3 minutes because the food was GROSS.  I have had an ok experience here before - I thought the nachos was pretty good.  But this time, each plate had weird overly-thought out parts to it - like pickled cabbage and weird sweet potatoes with celery.  I like weird, if it is ETHNIC and/or GOURMET, but this was just annoying and bad.  The mole sauce tasted like it came out of a can.  

When you are in San Francisco, in the mission,  GO TO A TACQUERIA OR BETTER: A TACO TRUCK.  

Velvet Cantina sucks, especially compared to the awesome tacquerias and restaurants that surround it.
p.s. The salsa they offer at the table is bland.  Get a grip.
author: Priya R.

description:
Pro-: Yummy, Yummy Margarita's. - with fresh fruit blends.

 Con: Overpriced, medicore food. Fresh fruit blends for magarita's are frequently not available.

Pro: Homemade chips fresh from the frialator ( Con- the extra 5 lbs on my ass from eating said chips)

Pro: Late night happy hour, with the young neighborhood crowd

Con: During daylight drinking, or normal dining hours the place is filled with boring, sedate 9-5ers who do NOT live in the mission. It's not that fun when these types are there.

This place is hit or miss.
author: Krissy M.

description:
The atmosphere was great, the bartender was awesome, the server was great and everyone was friendly. The chips on the table were very very good.
I couldn't taste the cactus in the cactus enchiladas, but I guess I didn't really try. The margaritas were fantastic. I liked the plain one. The cilantro gimlet was not good. Actually, it was very bad. Acquired taste, said the bartender. 

The chips and entrees were enough. We were all so full--there's no way I could have dessert or apps. I definitely want to go back and get apps and margaritas. Yum.
author: Monika M.

description: Had the Avocado Cactus Enchiladas for dinner tonight and they were fantastic.  First time I ever ate cactus and now I'm a fan.  The pineapple margarita was also incredible.  Felt full and satisfied by the end of the meal.  And, after my friend and I left the waitress ran halfway down the block to return the sweater I accidentally left at the table, A+ for excellent service :-)
author: Breck B.

description: Habanero tequila shots! Great food, good ambience. Small.
author: Jamel I.

description:
Simply delicious food and a good vibe... Sure, it's in the Mission, so you might expect them to have good Mexican food. Yet, Velvet is so much more than that. The menu is both creative and offers nice twists on familiar fare. Regardless of what I've ordered, quality and freshness comes out in pretty much everything I've tried. 

I've been coming to Velvet off and on since it open, and the quality really seems to be holding... and the place seems to be getting busier and busier. Definitely worth walking a block off Mission or the Valencia corridor to try something just a step off the beaten path.
author: Aaron L.

description:
One star for atmosphere.
One star for good service.
Three stars deducted for terrible food.
author: Ben S.

description:
This place has some decent food and some alright food.

I had the "Mexican Lasagna", which was decent.  It tasted like lasagna, but umm... Mexican.  A friend of mine had the chicken mole, which was WAY too nutmegged.  My girlfriend tried the coconut-lime ceviche, which was sort of interesting but really weird with the coconut milk.

The tortilla chips were alright, the watermelon margaritas were decent, and the s'mores nachos were an interesting idea.  The rice and beans were so-so, and not really worth eating.

The prices here are pretty good, and the decor is charming.  I'd definitely come here for drinks and certain dishes.
author: Bill C.

description: I've come here several times for the margaritas which are fresh and lovely. The epic burritos that harken back to the 2-meals-for-the-price-of-one days of yore are also good. But there's always been something off here for me and it all came to fruition one day when I was with two friends in a both enjoying drinks and appetizers.  The waiter was chilly and impatient which backfired when, while focusing intently on running our credit cards, he tossed a refill of chips at us so fast and carelessly that the napkin liner landed in the candle and lit on fire. We called for help but watched as he actually seriously made the snap decision to finish running the card instead of rushing over. So we grabbed a glass of water to put it out and then all squeezed towards one side of the booth while charred water dripped on the other. He took his time getting us the rag and gave us this weird attitude like somehow we had lit tge table on fire ourselves and did so just to piss him off. Dude, you lit our table on fire! I don't mind a small table fire every once in a while- these things happen. But some basic concern and attention at that moment would have done wonders.
author: Lily S.

description:
Great margaritas and excellent chips. The salsa and queso dip were incredible. I can't really say more than that because we didn't make it past the pitcher of margaritas. Beware your friends when they tell you, "a pitcher is like 2 glasses each!" 

Super friendly staff and nice dark, cozy interior. I can't wait to go back and try the enchiladas. So many good items on the menu. I"ll be busting out my sweatpants for sure. I could eat a whole vat of queso and guac if given my druthers.
author: Corey F.

description:
After walking past this place on pretty much a daily basis, I finally decided to stop wondering what it was all about and just give it a try one night. The "edibles and exilirs" tagline on the sign outside had always sounded pretty appealing to me, ever since this place opened, but I hadn't heard anyone talking about this spot, nor had I noticed a particularly large crowd there at any time, so I never made the effort to go until last week. 

We had a few drinks at the bar, and then moved to a table to order food. A friend and I shared the ceaser salad and the prawns el diablo. Both dishes were healthy-seeming and had a home-cooked feel to them, which I liked! The food was definitely spicy, especially the salad, which is great if you like that. Otherwise, you should mention that you prefer it milder. Overall, I would say that this place works out well if you're in the mood to go out, but you don't want to deal with a lot of chaos, crowds or noise. It's more of a chill, relaxed vibe, could be romantic even, with the dim lights and velvet curtains. Good stuff.

Pretty resonable prices for what it was, and the portions were sizable. The chips and salsa are also worth mentioning-totally satisfying, and again, had that same fresh, home-y feel to them. Very excellent pico de gallo style salsa, which is my fave, you know, when the pieces of tomato and onion are actually discernable. And the chips were hot, crunchy and puffy. 

In terms of service, our server was a nice guy who was totally on top of things. Granted, there weren't a ton of other tables competing for his attention at the time, but I got the sense that they would have been attentive in any case.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Went to Velvet Cantina a couple weeks ago with a group of 6 and we all enjoyed it! 

It's got an easy going lounge feel, full bar (I felt kinda funny drinking martini's and then chomping on my enchiladas, but I got over it fast), friendly service and delicious food (their nacho dessert is awesome).

Definitely make reservations or else be prepared to wait.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
My girlfriend and I love this place.  I've eaten there three or four times now.  Standout dishes include the Steak Achiote Tacos, the Nachos, the Margaritas, and the Chocolate Empanada for dessert.

Let me reiterate -- the nachos TOTALLY KICK ASS.  They have somehow managed to bring in the tastiness of movie theater nachos, but with an accompanying sense of ingredient quality and not-using-Velveeta going on that you definitely don't want to miss.  I've tried them with beef, chicken and chorizo and I find the beef and chicken are better than the chorizo.  The chorizo is very good, but its flavor is more all-encompassing and the other nacho components seem lost to me.

More big props -- the ambiance is a rare mix of dark and casual, yet fun and clean.  The music isn't too loud, and you can actually converse with your friends.  There are comfortable booths, or a bar/lounge.  The staff have been friendly, attentive, and timely.  The food is always hot when it arrives.

The parking spot right in front of the restaurant has been available multiple times when we drove by in the 6 - 9pm timeframe.

I only wish there were more restaurants like this in San Francisco.
author: Walter K.

description:
At the last possible instant, Seana made a phone call to tack me onto the reservation. I was in the office bathroom. When I came out of the bathroom, she got me by the wrist and let me know I was coming with. I grew up in south South Texas, where the Tex/Mex is really fantastic, so usually when I'm told I'm going to a 'cantina' I am annoyed and unenthused.

Seana and I arrived and hovered near the front door, peering in through the windows. We were waiting for her boyfriend, two of our coworkers, and three of their roommates. These are incredibly punctual, reliable people; they arrived only a minute before our reservation.

Lord God Almighty. Matt said the restaurant was good, and he and Ryan pointed us to the delicious. The menu is tight and succinct, making it difficult to pick one thing. The chips and salsa are homemade; the pineapple margarita pitcher is heaven on earth. Soon enough, the conversation and laughter were flowing. We were cramped in a corner, and we did not mind. I am in love with the man who waited our table who, due to a mishap, comp'd us an entire pitcher. I was just full enough; my vegetarian cactus enchilada whatever had clearly been touched by God Himself. Keywords: jalapeno Jack cream sauce. Everyone looked pretty happy with their steak tacos, too.

I can't stop using religious language because this meal was revelatory. This is the happiest dining experience I've ever had.
author: Jenn X.

description:
Here are my new favorite things that you can indulge in while dining at Velvet Cantina and walk out a much happier person, with a fuller belly and a drunken stroll. 
Pineapple Margaritas- Does life get better than having a margarita made with fresh, in season fruit? I heard that they had blueberry margaritas on special once but my night was all about the pineapple margaritas. 
Chorizo nachos. I could eat chorizo on anything and everything but it particularly goes well on nachos. Props. 
Tequila. Tequila in any form and in a shot makes my stomach warm and me happy. 
I hosted Dining out for life here and they are some of the nicest folk I have met. It was a fun time filled with birthday parties, good food and good looking fellas!
author: Erin O.

description: I feel this place was good but not "hella good" as us nor cal-ers refer to.  I think my experience couldve been better had I chosen something else, but the chile verde was just okay.  The menu is slightly small, which might have lead me down the chile verde path, but I feel I should give this place another try because the accessories to the meal (guac, salsa) were very good.  In any case, velvet cantina wasn't bad by any stretch of the imagination, the staff is friendly and the place looks nice.  I'm merely referring to what would make it a knock out!
author: Jeff W.

description: The friendliest waitstaff and bartenders in the city! I love this place - it's dark and loud and comfortable. Delicious queso that's actually made from real cheese (ask for a dollop of guac to go in it). And the nachos are insanely enormous and delicious. They'll easily feed two people for dinner. Plus, cheap Mexican beers and tasty margaritas? Perfect.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Went here a few months back with "A team" Alisa, Ashlee, and Art (myself). 

I remember the food being really salty. Its hard to mess up Mexican food but the food was not the best. 

The restaurant was over the top loud, to the point where I couldnt hear what my friends were saying. 

I would only go back to have a drink.
author: Art A.

description:
I love Mexican food, and having moved up here from San Diego it has been harder than expected to find amazing Mexican food that didn't result in an upset stomach! 

But I finally found my place, Velvet Cantina! The service was good, everyone their seemed really nice and we got a table immediately. My bf and I ordered enchiladas, his were the chicken avocado and I had the shrimp. As we scarfed down some chips and salsa we asked the waiter if they had any "real" salsa, he said they did and returned with the Mango Habanero Salsa and IT was definitely the REAL thing. We mixed it in with some of the house salsa and delighted in the sweet burn of tastiness! The night only got better when our enchiladas came out, we both argued over who's were better (of course mine were)! Haha but all in all the message is clear, this place has been mapped on the tasty road map and I will be returning often!
author: Henriette P.

description:
Equal parts lounge and Mexican joint, the Velvet Cantina is a solid location for dinner and drinks of the margarita variety. It's a relatively small place; dark, cozy and otherwise relaxing spot. The staff here all seemed pretty down to earth and were really doing a good job to make sure we all were fat and happy. Damn fine selection of tequilas too. Not Tommy's epic mind you, but totally respectable. 
A great date spot in the Mission. I mean think, when you propose you go to a place with "Velvet" in the name, that's bound to increase your chances a little bit, right?
author: Andy A.

description: Great place.  awesome tequila cocktails!  And delicious cheese dip!
author: Eric C.

description:
food: 3/5
service: 5/5
decor/cleanliness:4/5

This is a mexican restaurant and bar. The sit down portion and bar portion are separated by a wall so you can have some quiet if you are eating in. But there is also seating for dine in on the bar side also. Came here in the middle of the week, so it wasn't too busy. Service was great. The complementary chips were not very crunchy though. I can't tell if they were stale or because they use alot of oil and they get soggy fast. They didn't have the stale taste, but it wasnt crunchy. I believe the place was a bit expensive. We had three pitchers of margaritas and two appetizers between 5 people and it came out to be about 30 per person. The margaritas were strong, so that was good. Each person got 3 drinks that night with the three pitchers. Sorry, about all the math. I just thought that was a little over priced for pitcher margaritas. I mean breaking it down, each glass comes out to be ~8 dollars each. I rather have a bartender make me 3 different drinks than to have them dump everything in a container and charge me the same price. 

Over all, the staff was very nice. Everything was very clean and it was a great talking and being loud environment. But the prices is what makes me not want to come back.
author: Cecile S.

description:
This desert nacho thing was amazing! My ginger ginger drink was also real good. They even have a sweet tequila. And I read they have a late night happy hour 11pm - 12am.

UPDATE:

The salsa! Oh my god is amazing. My cactus enchiladas were delicious as well.  A great place to eat - overall!
author: Anita C.

description: totally and completely dig Velvet Cantina.  My husband took me on our honeymoon and we had the best time.  since then, i've introduced my best friends to it and they practically live there now!  don't really like their traditional margs, but their fruity ones are to die for!
author: Kristina N.

description:
A well made margarita, a bowl-full of fresh guacamole (like, you could still hear the pitiful sigh of the avocado's dying breath), fresh, handmade tortilla chips, and chicken mole so tender it was falling off the bone.   These things cannot be questioned.  They must simply be eaten.

At the time, my margarita-clouded and delicious-oil-clogged heart ranked Velvet Cantina above the stalwarts in Mountain View (La Fiesta, Fiesta Del Mar) and Palo Alto Sol, but thinking back, I'm not so certain.

The guacamole needed a touch more salt.  The mole was a bit sweeter than I traditionally like.  The chips were very oily -- oily in that they were damn tasty while I was eating them, but an hour later... I guess the lesson is moderation, or just drink more alcohol to cut the grease.  Beans and rice were both very well made.

Oh, and happy hour every day (except saturday, maybe?) from 11-12.
author: Jay M.

description:
Get the nachos. With chicken. Oozing, dripping cheese sauce instead of grated and melted cheese. It's like movie nachos with real cheese! People don't seem to believe us when we espouse the glory that is Velvet Cantina's nachos, and, unless we're there to order it for them, don't take this advice. They should. I'm serious. Get the nachos. They also come in beef (ground, seasoned homemade taco variety - very good) and chorizo (overpowering, I do not recommend it).

Other items are also good. We've tried just about everything. Stand outs include the charred steak on achiote tacos, jalapeno cream on the avocado chicken enchiladas, cajeta empanadas overflowing with chocolate for dessert.
