This is certainly not the traditional Mexican my dad raised me on. This is new. This is dishes like Mexican lasagna and burritos with garbanzo beans. This is gooey cheese sauce instead of grains of Mexican parmesan. Did I mention you should get the chicken nachos? I may order that delicious chile con queso as a side to pour over anything else that makes it to the table, just so people will finally listen. Seriously, get the nachos. Get the damn nachos already!
author: Veronica L.

description:
I've eaten here three times and thought it was worth 4/5 stars. The margaritas are some of the best in the city made with top shelf tequila and fresh squeezed lime. The chips are homemade thick and crisp and the guacamole is pretty good. The food is decent but the main course could be a bit larger with most of the plate being beans and rice

The waitstaff is always friendly, and the service is great. I went with my wife on her birthday and they brought us a free chocolate nacho dessert. My only complaint are the benches in the booths are pretty narrow
author: Bumble B.

description:
We've waited for 45mins for our table and it was very hot, loud & packed there. Food was not impressive, my friend's nachos were very salty, but my beef tri-tip was pretty good. At least it isn't over-priced. 
They had a very busy night so I guess their service is usually better? 

Pros: Good Margarita, cute booth seating, good price

Cons: Small menu, noisy
author: Maggie C.

description:
Achiote steak tacos and the chicken avocado enchiladas are what we enjoyed on our most recent visit. The chicken in the enchiladas was very flavorful.  I had been there once before and inhaled some of their nachos (I was that hungry), but I am going to say that even on a less empty stomach the nachos are delicious.  

Prices are affordable and the wait staff are friendly though not terribly attentive.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
Velvet Cantina is awesome. It is perfect for mid size parties (6 to 8) because of the large portions and relaxed atmosphere. They also seem experienced with larger parties and have no problem accommodating. The waiters are darn cute and don't get pissy when you sit for hours and order just nachos and pitchers of margaritas.

But don't worry, it's not just the atmosphere of Velvet Cantina that's awesome. The food itself is delicious. The salsa, guac, and nachos were great. Our enchiladas and tacos were also quite satisfying. 

I definitely recommend Velvet Cantina if you're looking for a hip Mexican joint in the Mission... with less of a wait and crowd. Go here!
author: Han C.

description:
Very creative serving up the Mexican kimchi. They are teetering on the brink of a vulgar overuse of cumin in their beans, and all the dishes come very close to being spicy-with-something-to-prove, and yet...FIVE STARS! 

Bars get reviews.
author: Erin G.

description:
Went here on Saturday night for a birthday bash. 
We ordered the ceviche which was not your traditional ceviche. It tasted absolutely disgusting. Marinaded in coconut milk, and pineapple sauce. Uck whaaa is that? That is not ceviche. 
The chips thankfully were delicious with the salsa and guac. 
The margaritas were way to sweet and sour tasting. The watermelon one tasted like jolly ranchers but worse. No thank you. 
The entree I had was really by far the best thing I had there. It was the chicken avocado enchiladas. It was amazing. The cilantro sauce that they put on top of the enchilada was off da hook. I can see myself later craving those enchiladas in the future.
author: Shawn P.

description:
Was a little disappointed. Food was good, but for a place with tequila bar aspirations (or at least potential) we felt like they missed the mark. Expecting an upscale, hipper version of Tommy's, Velvet Cantina instead came across more like the pseudo-Mexican version of your average cheeseball apple martini bar. 

Why pour a high-end, top-shelf tequila into a shot glass when you know the customer is going to sip it? We stopped into Beretta for post drink drinks and they did a better job with the tequila (and mezcal, to boot!) than Velvet Cantina. 

Why are you, bartender, shooting top-shelf tequila with patrons throughout the whole night. I take issue more with the shooting than the drinking with patrons...which I actually kind of enjoy sometimes. But dude put down like 3 shots within an hour. 

Strawberry and blended margaritas with top-shelf tequila. Ack! What a waste.
author: Eric E.

description:
Okay. Nacho S'mores are NOT good for a diet.

I went here to celebrate my friend's 23rd Birthday ('cuz you only turn 23 once? haha) and we had a little group of 19. We stayed in the bar area for quite some time because it was difficult to seat 19 people in a cramped and "sexy-induced" ambiance environment. After that, I think it was all good.

I didn't know what i wanted to get, so I asked our friendly waitress what she'd recommend. She knew what she was talking about. The steak tacos were savory, tender, GOOD --- no, GREAT. The margaritas were pretty good and pretty strong, especially the mango one. The watermelon one was tasty though. mmhmmm. Then came the desert and they were NOT cheap on a group of 20 and seeing as it was FREE because it was my friend's birthday. MMMM smore nachos. MMM. I am going to celebrate my birthday here for that. 

The waiters were chill, always on top of things, and just fun. I love the vibe, i love the place. i love the smore nachos (this is why dieting is hard for me!) Definitely going to come back sometime.
author: Gabe R.

description:
I walk in to meet some friends who aren't there yet. I stand around for what seems the longest five minutes before the guy behind the bar asks me if I "need anything, dude?". No, of course not. I just happen to like standing around in restaurants. 

I get a table while I wait for my margarita which "will be right out, dude". It is, but so sour that my belly goes ouch. The other "dudes" in my group arrive, we order and the food never appears. Not to worry our server is happy to "check on it dude" and brings us more sour margaritas while we're waiting. The food arrives and it's just not all that spectacular for what I'm paying. An amble over to Farolito around the corner and down the street on Mission would have been more satisfying.

On the positive side, the salsa is very good, the margaritas are very strong and the portions are very large. Too bad I never feel motivated to finish it, I just want to get the hell out before I get called 'dude' again.
author: S K.

description:
First of all, I would like to shake the hands of every employee that had to deal with our party of 20 which cramped up the other half of the restaurant. They were all troopers and deserve plenty of gold stars. Everyone was so accommodating and the employees made sure to give us the quality service with a smile that makes this place so enjoyable. 

The establishment itself is very cozy and the decor reminds me of a little dining room in a mission. We were all promptly seated and our server did great in taking all of our orders, including serving the pineapple margaritas that were flowing throughout the evening. Three words: STIFF AS FUCK. There may have been a hint of pineapple juice in there but my mind was muddled by all the tequila that permeated my bloodstream. It's definitely a sign that you have paid your money's worth on drinks. Just get a pitcher of this stuff and you're set for the night. After the libation we all got our free chips and salsa and our orders. I had the chicken avocado enchilada which was so delicious. The portions were ample and satisfying which helped to soak up some of that margarita. Afterward we ordered the smores nachos which they served to you tableside by a blow torch to give you a good show with oohs and aahs. Also it gives it a little campfire feel. The nachos were definitely a hit and consumed in a matter of seconds. If you've got a party and need to fulfill that sweet tooth, I would advise you to get this dessert.

If you're planning on getting here by car, be aware that parking is quite a hassle and it would be advisable to take public transportation or ride your bike through. Especially after those margaritas and trips to the bar, it would be smart to not drive and enjoy yourself. I would definitely take another trip back here.
author: Leslie K.

description:
first time here tonite and it was yum!  the food was bomb (i had the chicken tacos), the margs were rockin and ALL the waiters (male only i may add) are adorable!  did you see their late nite hh? i may have to partake sometime....def worth checking out.  the music was rockin too-even go to hear some old skool newcleus  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IaNzrXAUHBk
woop woop
author: Hilary W.

description:
Randomly found this place because our parking space was nearby.  Velvet Cantina is a quaint restaurant with a fully stocked bar and a very delightful and nice bartender.  My friends and I dropped by for a quick drink on our way to downtown for NYE festivities.  We were served by the very generous and kind bartender, Travis who entertained us with conversation and delicious drinks.

Admittedly, we did not have anything to eat since the kitchen was closed, but we'll be back because service was nice and accomodating.  It is also conveniently located a block away from the 24th/Mission Bart station.
author: lasok o.

description:
I've had a good experience and a mediocre experience here, within one week.

the good:  I went on a wednesday with some serious drinking women from Texas, and we had a great time.  The restaurant was fairly empty, the margaritas were spot-on, and frequently served, and there was some sort of late-night happy hour with shots of a miraculous concoction of colorful tequila goodness given to us for free.  The best thing in addition to margaritas is their chili con queso.  It's that good hot, oily real-cheese kind of queso that I really love.  I think I had some carne asada soft tacos or something similar and it was tasty and good.

the bad:  I came back on a Saturday and it just wasn't the same.  The margaritas didn't hit the spot, and I don't even remember what I ordered for an entree.  (maybe the margaritas weren't so bad after all...) boring.  

lesson:  go mid-week.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Any place that lets my silly happy hour ass walk around the restaurant with a pitcher of their DEADLY margaritas and a straw is A-OKAY by me. And I am sure the co-workers who saw my boobs that night were also okay with the amount of tequila I was allowed to play around with. 

Seriously great service (HOTTTT waiters who are actually gracious - rare in this city), excellent chips and guacamole, and an even better buzz.
author: Miss K.

description:
Sometimes you just want to give stars because its too soon to write anything.  

Four stars.  Fun place.  But name should be velvet canteen instead.

pointless notes to self: (1) a certain soon to be ex thinks all unknown men who look at him have a crush on him, especially mexicans.  (2) don't breast feed if you like alcohol, unless its just beer.  (3) cactus enchiladas with jalapeno cream are good, but mexican cole slaw sucks. (4) putting a man's face on a shirt does not mean anyone will really care to learn who it is, but should be bearded and green regardless. (5) art is much better when made to be stolen or put up where not allowed.
author: Today Y.

description:
Service here is super friendly and very good.

The food regretfully is not.  Everything is ridiculously over seasoned.  I have tried the tortilla soup which burned my mouth - not with hotness but with the ridiculous amount of salt - and i love salt.

Also have had the Chile Verde and the Velvet Lasagna - both the same - so insanely overloaded with salt it is inedible.

Lastly tried a bite of mole.  Holy moly - that mole is you guessed it seasoned to all hell.  It was ridiculous - one bite and i was overwhelmed with salt, and cinnamon, that i couldn't eat anymore of it.

Again i am an over seasoner myself and like things very spicy, so it is not coming from point of view of food purist.

Go there for the great atmosphere, grab a drink at the bar, and get the chips and salsa.  But try and go there full, and avoid if you have high blood pressure.

Though my vegetarian friends swear by the burrito which I have not tried.
author: Greg M.

description:
I love to go out, so I was psyched when some friends suggested  the V.C. for dinner. What a disappointment. 

After asking for a server twice, it took 20 Minutes for our first drink to arrive at the table. " these are great,  but not what we ordered"

The same server came back and asked if she had taken our order....   "Yes , 20 minutes ago" ..so much for service. 

The apps came out with our dinners so we were waiting for 35 minutes with nothing, then boom so much  we cant even see our table top. so much for enjoying small tastes. 

The food was decent , not great. The empynadas , however, were excellent . 

If I were 25  and getting drunk it may have been fun, but at 35 it was just irritating. I would not go back , there are better mexican restaurants  on mission street..
author: Brad S.

description:
One star for never answering the phone (not even while they're open),  taking 24 hours to respond to voice mail, and then losing reservations once they're made.

I've been here before and I think the food is decent and the ambiance is cool. 

However, last night i planned a going away dinner for one of my closest friends and the Velvet Cantina fell through.  I spoke directly with someone  (they finally answered my voice mail), made a reservation for 6 for 915.  When 915 came, it appears that they lost my reservation and we would have to wait nearly an hour to get seated.

We ended up getting a table within 30 minutes nearby at the Last Supper Club, which, by the way, I highly recommend.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
I had some friends visit from Los Angeles and I really wanted to take them somewhere cool in the Mission area.  My co-worker suggested Velvet Cantina because it was "very LA", which I took to mean pretentious and self-involved (sorry LA people, but I lived there my whole life so I feel like I can say that!).  

Anyways, when we got there, I found that it was not LA at all.  It was a very cool and laid back kinda place.  The staff was super friendly (we arrived about 1/2 late for our reservations and they actually thanked us for calling ahead of time).  The food was mediocre for Mexican food (definitely had better from a taco truck), but it's a cool place to hang out with good friends.  The drinks were STRONG (I ordered a watermelon margarita and I swear it was all tequila!) and our waiter was super sweet!

I recently tried to visit their website and discovered that the restaurant was temporarily closed due to a fire.  Hopefully, there isn't too much damage and that they would reopen again cause I would definitely go back there for a drink.
author: Jolene W.

description:
Tasty food and drinks, a new favorite place for Mexican food.   The atmosphere is cozy and nice.  

Homemade tortilla chips:  5 stars
Salsa:  5 stars
Chicken and avocado enchiladas:  5 stars
Margaritas:  5 stars
Smores Nachos:  100 stars

Not sure that most patrons polish off the entire plate of smores nachos but it's gluttony at it's finest.
author: K V.

description:
In the mood for a little south of the border taste?
Hit up Velvet! The food here is spectacular! The bar tenders are all fun guys too! They really know how to keep a party going! The drinks flow like rivers, as does the fun and laughs. 
Be sure to tell Travis, the bar tender, Michael said hello!
Rock on guys! Keep the food fantazmic and the atmosphere warm and friendly!
author: Michael F.

description:
I am so full. So full from the baskets of chips (they don't stop coming), guacamole, and salsa. Mmmmm. 

Went here for a goodbye celebration after work; great deals on pitchers of margaritas (with good tequila). There nachos are standard but good....I like how spicy they were! I've eaten dinner here before, and although I am not a huge fan of mole sauce, I think there's is pretty darn good if you like a real chocolatey yet spicy sauce. I recommend it! A fun, laid back place to go for the standard Mexican food experience- margaritas, chips, and guac. Extra guac please.
author: Laura D.

description:
I have been here twice, each visit separated by a year. 

Two words pop into mind - Consistently Good.

The fare is Mexican, but with a modern and slightly upscale twist, but the prices remain low ($10-$16). 

On my most recent trip I had the Avocado Cactus Enchiladas and they were terrific. The ingredients are fresh and not overcooked but the star was the cilantro pesto.

A year ago I had the Grilled Santa Maria Tri Tip. This is the entree that keeps me coming back. The use of cumin creme fraiche really separates this dish from anything else on the menu. 

Oh and the margaritas - Well they speak for themselves. Nothing blended, all on the rocks. This is a great starter in the mission.
author: Kemp M.

description:
Here's what I think - It must have been an off night - So many yelpers I love and respect saying its good and I went home with a wee bit of vomit in my mouth.

The margaritas WERE from a mix - a cheap- sugary-mix that took me back to a time and place when making gallons of fake cocktails and drinking them accross the street from my highschool was a good idea.

Also, we walked in - the place was totally empty - and we still waited 10 minutes for someone to bring us menus - now that would have been understandable if no one had seen us come in but the bartender that made the offending margaritas,  told us to take a seat anywhere and that someone would be right with us, and then continued shootin the shit for ten minutes while I tried to keep my service - obsessed restaraunt manager boyfriend from dumping the table over sitcom style.

Sigh - the greasy chips are good, and they did put cheese in between the tacos which though not authentic was a pleasant surprise and you can get michelada's which I should have ordered which eeked them out that second star. 

I hope that you go and have one of these five stars I'm reading about but its a crap shoot.
author: Elektra D.

description: great spot...great food and great margaritas...maybe the best in the city...pretty close to Tommy's...not sure i would pick one over the other....but pretty reasonable for what you get...service is great and helpful....parking is tuff...but no surprise there....but probably me favorite sit done mexican in sf!!
author: Rikki Y.

description:
Special Thanks to BRITTNEY G and VALERIA R whose reviews inspired  me to check out this place.  BF and I  enjoyed it! 

Date:  June 13, 2009 @ 8:00 PM
Occasion:  Saturday Date Night with Boyfriend

Decor/Ambiance:  Divey. Saloon-style. Dark. Fun. 6 Bell Decibel-Loud.

Social Scene: Hipsters and happily inebriated group of friends.

Service:  Superb!  Down to earth. Genuinely friendly. Got our chips/salsa as soon as sat down.  Got our drinks ASAP.  Plates were cleared as soon as we were done.  Dessert came right away following dinner.

What we ordered:
Salud!:  1   Pitcher of Watermelon Margarita
               1  Glass of house red wine
Apps:
               Complimentary chips and salsa
               Beef and Chorizo Empanada over rice and beans
               Fish ceviche
Main:
              Me:  Shrimp Diablo
              BF:  Chicken Avocado Enchilada
Dessert:
              S'more Nachos
Total:  $ 108.09 (including tax and pretty generous tip for great service)

Overall:
1.  WATERMELON MARGARITA:    What was non-drinker BF thinking?!!!! Last time and only time I saw him drink was in Jan 2008 during our cruise.  He said it was cheaper to order a pitcher than 2 drinks.  Well, we paid for it!  The margarita tasted mellow and was deceptively strong. It tasted fresh, delicious and easy to drink.  I abandoned my wine (I didnt want to drink hard liquor initially but lost focus after the first sip of the watermelon margarita.) Yes, we finished the whole pitcher!!!
2. COMPLIMENTARY CHIPS/SALSA:   Thick-cut freshly fried chips. Not salty. Not greasy.  Fresh tomato salsa. Addicting.
3.  FISH CEVICHE:    Mango salsa compliments the fish. Fresh. Not fishy. Light. Healthy option. 
4.  EMPANADAS:    Yummy but the rice and beans the 2 beef/chorizo empanadas came with overpowered the real taste of the pies.
5.  SHRIMP DIABLO:   Generous portions of fresh shrimps with rice, pickled veggies and steamed beans/diced potatoes simmered in tomato salsa. Really good.
6.  CHICKEN AVOCADO ENCHILADA:   BF enjoyed it very much that he was disappointed when the plate was cleared before he finished the last bite. (My bad!) 2 fresh light enchiladas with rice and beans.
7. S' MORES:    Redundant. Fried chips with chocolate drizzle, cinnamon and marshmallows. Just okay.

***********************
We did not have "wow" moments with the dishes because the flavors were not strong but CLEAN. The dishes were light but they were delicious.  We did not feel grossly stuffed although we did eat a lot.  I will say that the food was superb in flavors in their simplicity and freshness.

The margarita at Velvet Cantina is a must-have. What was I thinking ordering a glass of wine, instead?!
**********************
9:15 PM:  BF and I got out of Velvet Cantina barely walking and staggering drunk.

9:25 PM:  Made it to the Metreon and killed time by playing at the arcade where I won 3 stuffed animals in one shot!

10:00 PM:  Saw "Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian."  Love it!

12:20 AM:  Caught the last BART train to the North Oakland while both of us were trying not to retch on the train.

1:30 AM:  In bed. The whole room would not stop spinning.  We promised: NEVER A PITCHER OF MARGARITA EVER AGAIN NO MATTER HOW GOOD!"  We learned our lesson the painful way!

10 AM:  Woke up with no hangover. Velvet Cantina must have used good tequila!
author: Leah E.

description:
Great vibe with a funky mexican feel... the food had a home made feel to it, and the prices were reasonable. Went on a Saturday, and easily slipped to the crowded bar after eating. Great vibe with good food, with awesome guacamole....

By far the best place in the Mission district to get my Guac on!!
author: Andy A.

description:
Good, but not awesome food. Bonus star for host agreeing to call us when our table was ready (so we could get coffee down the street), for the inventive menu, and for the bartender inventing a drink called the "daylight savings" in honor of it being March 11th, oh, AND for the swanky 70's lamps and mirrors in the bar.

I had the cactus and avacado enchiladas, and the dessert nachos, which come served covered in flambe marshmallows.
author: C D.

description:
Gotta give love to the Mexican food, especially in the Mission, but this one is a mixed bag. Our group banded together for Margaritas and some grub following a long workweek. We arrived with a group of 5 and grabbed some Margarita pitchers and chips (that were a bit stale and oily) and found a standing room only area big enough to accommodate. 

Upon entering this was definitely unlike any of the Mexican joints I have hit up in the Mission. The bar radiates with trendiness, from the red lights to excessive bartender attitude, to the style of the crowd...something that should be expected from a Cantina named Velvet. 

The pitchers were expertly prepared (not the tastiest, but well prepared), so the bartender's attitude was well backed. The crowd was lively and happy which made for a good social environment. Can't say much for the wait as it was well over an hour before we were seated and the guy seating could probably teach lessons in being catty and rude. 

Upon being seated at a table too small. We were set up with another round of drinks and "fresh" chips and salsa (Salsa was fairly good). My GF ordered chicken quesedillas and I went with the chile verde. One of our friends ordered a taco and enchilada. 

I was warned the Chile Verde was a bit spicy and I would have to agree. Decent...nothing to write home about. Mostly a stew of lime juice and chile powder with fresh cilantro...but no other undertones. The pork was a bit dry for a chile verde. Black beans were in the place of the refried beans I actually ordered. They had a bit of cheese for garnish but no real flavor...same can be said for the spanish rice. I'm not a big salad person so I can't speak to the rabbit food portion. 

My girlfriend only had a couple of 'dillas cause she didn't care much for them. I tried one and it was a bit underwhelming as well; lots of minced chicken, seasoned with chile powder, and cheese that could not be seen but you knew it was there as something was kinda holding the chicken to the tortilla. The grease flavor was a bit heavy considering the tortillas were very lightly browned...so again lacking rich flavor other than chile powder and oil...it had some heat though. Our friends didn't seem too impressed with their orders either. This was just a once around for us at VC but it won't be a return for food. As the food's substance seemed to match the less than jovial attitude of the staff. I would recommend trying it on a less busy day for dining and different entrees than those we had.

In the end, it was a good social environment for drinks. Mexican food left a lot to be desired when compared with some excellent choices around the area.
author: Nick V.

description:
Watermelon margaritas, chile con queso, carne y queso empanadas, velvet lasagna, and great service equals one fabulous night.  The price and food were delicious.

I can't wait to go back and try more items on their menu.
author: Christina C.

description:
Had our office holiday party here last week.  They were very accomodating of our large-ish group, although we did come at like 6:30 on a Wednesday, the place was pretty much empty, and we had a reservation.  The music they were playing was kind of annoying -- too sexpot for early on a weeknight, even for a place called Velvet Cantina.  The employees were nice enough but not doting.  They seemed somewhat annoyed that we had a kid in our group, but whatevs, that's probably standard in the Mission.

The food was okay; the guac was pretty standout, but I'd say it was the only thing that was.  The food is fine for what it is, but I probably wouldn't buy it with my own money.  (I generally have trouble paying more than like $8 for a plate of Mexican food, cause I can get better and cheaper food at lots of other places in the neighborhood.)  The margarita pitchers were quite good, but again, I probably wouldn't get them if the office wasn't picking up the tab.

Bottom line, it's a nice enough place for a get-together or a special occasion, but it's not a place I'd add to the circult of regular dinner spots.
author: Megan D.

description:
I celebrated my 25th birthday at the Velvet Cantina.  The restaurant is red-lit and sets a nice, ambient atmosphere for a night out.  They were able to take reservations for a large party and fit us nicely into the back room.  We ordered a pitcher of the blueberry margaritas (after my complimentary birthday shot!) which were absolutely amazing.  The wait staff was friendly (despite having accidentally forgotten to take the birthday girl's order).  The food came in generous portions and was reminiscent of a more authentic Tex-Mex complete with queso that fairs better than most in the city.

I like the Velvet Cantina for it's environment and because it's a nice alternative to the hustle and bustle of your typical Mission eats, and at a reasonable price.
author: Amanda C.

description:
When you come here you get what you pay for. Great atmosphere and excellent service. Start off with the queso appetizer with a plate of tasty tortilla chips and tuck into one of their entrees. 

I think the chicken mole (it's mo-lay not mole BTW) is just as good as homemade.
author: Greg P.

description:
Ahhh the Velvet.

 A long visited place, to meet with friends I ve had for years. Feels like your living room after one to many roomates and parties. 
Barstools as close as possible are an invite to interact with your neighbors who inevitably always buy a round of shots.

 Ive eaten here but only when highly intoxicated so I cant give an accurate rememberence of the food, I ate it ALL so it must have been okay. I can however tell you that Peter makes a mean margarita and has an awesome smile. ;) (cheers to my barstaff cronies)

and Ill be back a hundred times more to dance around the tables and convince ladies to meet me here on weekend kickoffs.
author: Charlie B.

description:
I've been here a few times including last night. 

Those cactus avocado enchiladas are mightily delicious as were the margaritas.  The fresh fruit ones sound delicious but have not yet in my experience matched the plain old margaritas on the rocks. 

I have also had the tacos, which were delightful. Portions are more than generous.

The service is friendly and rather hands-off. This may be, however, due to the fact that I have usually gone with a local regular.

The chips are also ridiculously good. Do not go here if you are on a diet. Do go here if you have a hankering for delicious non-Baja Mexican food.

The music was a little too loud.

I'll be back.
author: Gabrielle A.

description:
Delicious and well worth the trip from Fremont to SF --shrimp enchiladas, empanadas, chips and salsa! An extensive tequila list and a drink that's just like a mojito but better (forgot the name, but you can try to order a mojito and the server will suggest this drink). 

The restaurant is split into two sides. When we got there, one side was bright and had lots of families (and mirrors). The second side had a bar, dim lighting, and single 20-30 somethings. Felt like two different restaurants but it's cool that they appeal to a range of people.

Also a plus - even thought most of our party was almost 30 min late due to parking challenges (they were visiting from out-of-town), the server was gracious and understanding. Overall, a fun place for a small group of friends and I will be back!
author: Dee L.

description: Ay, Caramba! Chili Can Queso is excellent-e (coming from the Asian who knows no Spanish)
author: Alex H.

description: Our favorite place to hang at the bar for margaritas and a chat with the bartenders. It's a fun, funky place with a great vibe. When crowded and seated at a booth or table, dinner conversation  can be a bit difficult, but that's pretty typical of most small restaurants. Food can be a bit on the spicy side, but good and you can find a few .
author: Artina M.

description: Chicken avocado enchiladas are excellent.  Fresh and very flavorful.  Their chips are great, and I had both margaritas and white sangrias (both tasty).  The service is a bit slow.  It's a great place for a group as you can be loud and lively.  Lots of fun.
author: Kari L.

description: Four friends, two pitchers of ass kickin' margies, delicious chile verde, yummy sopes, wonderful steak tacos, spicy chile prawns, good music, tattooed waitress, wild painted walls, interesting crowd, one happy customer.
author: Kevin S.

description: I have no idea why everyone is raving about the chicken enchiladas. Mediocre and overpriced.  The chicken was bleh, and it was super dry. I've made better enchiladas myself using canned chicken.  However, the slaw, rice and beans were very good.  Our server was very wonderful and attentive, considering that he was the only person taking care of a group of 10+. The margaritas were good.
author: Mena A.

description:
Great chips & salsa. Really good (& strong!) margaritas. Very tasty food. 
Don't go if you are in a hurry, though, or if you hope to have quiet conversation over dinner.
author: Michael S.

description: I went here recently with my girlfriend and we were looking forward to some good Mexican food after reading the reviews.  The watermelon margaritas were very tasty, but we made the mistake of ordering a second one.. they are decently strong, but become too sweet.  The food wasn't bad.  The chicken avocado enchiladas was good and fresh.  The guacamole wasn't as good as we expected, especially with jalapenos in it; I was expecting a little kick, but there was nothing.  Not a bad place though.  The staff was friendly and reasonably priced.
author: Gregg K.

description:
Recently I help my daughter's 21st b/d at this restaurant.  I found it on yelp and the internet.  I could not have been more pleased that we chose
this restaurant.  The staff were WONDERFUL, the food was fabulous.  We were a group of 21 and they never made us feel unwelcomed or that they were too busy to assist.  The restaurant was crowded and yet they made our party feel very special.  I will certainly return - I live in the east bay and would welcome the drive for a very fun evening.
author: Lenora L.

description: The tacos were pretty good but not amazing.  The margaritas, however, were potent and tasty.  And the salsa was major delicious.  I think the bus boy thought I was hitting on him through...but thats irrelevant.  Fun, nice sit down mexican joint for when you are in the mood for more than a taco truck
author: Caleb R.

description:
I liked the Velvet Cantina. The service was very nice and accomodating to our large group. However when waiting on a larger group, I would to suggest to the server to actually write down the orders so that you don't have to keep checking back and you ensure that everyone gets just what they ordered.

The chips were good, the salsa bland but... order their mango habenero hot sauce YEOW! hot and tasty. the queso dip was good, i can see it being the perfect hangover food.  I didn't care for the margaritas and gave mine to a friend and opted for the $2 modelo especial...$2!! 

I hade the chili verde which i loved but lets be clear, it is very salty. i am a salt-aholic so i thought it was perfect, i would think it too salty for most. my partner had the steak and it was delicious.

i will go back probably for the chili verde and queso but all in all the food is overpriced for what you get.
author: Ashley T.

description:
3 stars for food...which is essentially higher class mexican food.  The chips are actually really good w/ the salsa.  I also had the steak tacos which I would recommend as the beef is nicely marinated but overall its what I'd expect out of a higher class mexican establishment.  

Why I really really like this place is the service they provide.  Very attentive and the wait staff are all great.  Example 1: A group of us came here for drinks several months ago and proceeded to chug their margaritas straight from the pitcher.  Instead of giving us warnings about being too loud or rowdy, they encouraged us to keep on trucking and everybody looked like they were having a great time in the bar.  (Yes, I realize this might be quite bias given my state of mind that time but regardless, it was pretty sweet).  Example 2: They not only  remembered us months later when we ate there but even seemed excited to see us and called us "the pitcher chuggers" 

That by itself, is worth an additional 1-2 stars...I think we just found our favorite place in the mission...
author: Ken S.

description:
This is my Cheers.  
The margaritas ARE the best. in. town.  Cantaloupe margs? forget about it!  
I could live off the tortilla soup alone.  I'm not exactly a "go to a restaurant and order soup" kindof girl...I really can't remember why I ordered it in the first place. But I'm glad I did because it takes me to a spicy little cloud and makes me super happy.  
When I leave San Francisco on down the line, I'll think about Velvet Cantina and shed a little tear.  But in the meantime,  you can find me at VC.  Often.  Eating queso.  and lots of soup.
author: Mary S.

description:
Tasty food (beef tacos bring it on. yum).
But my lordie it's loud. Was here on a very packed Thursday night.
Now I'm edging on the ripe old age of 28, and my delicate ears are not a chipper as they once were. My friends and I spent most of dinner screaming to compete with a blonde with killer lungs at the next table. But who am I to judge based on noise. So no stars deducted. 
It would be a little better if there were a few rugs or something to muffle the sound a bit.
Apart from that no complaints.
We had a few drinks while waiting for a table. Once we were seated and ordered the food came quickly. The staff were great, and the bill price low.  All in all good night out if you could turn down the volume a bit for us oldies.
author: MissSkip Z.

description: Hands down my favorite Mexican food in San Francisco. The vibe is hip without being pretentious and the food tastes fresh without being overly lardy. And did I mention the margaritas could knock an elephant on his ass? Good stuff, check it out!
author: tvham

description:
I was so excited that there is a hip, fund, sit-down Mexican joint near my house.  We've eaten here twice, and the nice servers and bartenders are just lovely.  BUT. I cannot in good conscience continue eating at an establishment that has RAT FECES inches from my plate.  

Please clean up the place, set some traps, and for god's sake, vacuum-up the rat turds before you open for business -- they are in the crevices of the booths.  I am so grossed out.  And sad because I really liked the tortilla soup. But now I want to hurl. : (
author: Bibi M.

description:
Everything in this place falls into two categories - Excellent and Good

What is Excellent:  margaritas, chips, guacamole, velvet nachos, chicken mole, bordello burrito, naked relleno, atmosphere (fun décor and people watching), music and service (wait and bar staff).

What is Good: salsa.  It has its tasty some days and its bland some days.  But the chips are so good that on the bland salsa days they are tasty enough to just eat naked.  Or to save and eat with your meal. 

If you are looking for a super authentic Mexican food experience this might not be it.  If you want a quiet dining experience this might not be the place either.
author: Kristin S.

description: FYI.. they no longer have happy hour (late night) and the kitchen closes @ 10:30.. awesome margaritas and nachos!
author: Samantha S.

description: Excellent margaritas!  The food was good too, but the margs rocked.
author: Cathy M.

description: Great Mexican food and very laidback environment. Also, very accommodating of vegans.
author: Sarah B.

description: Awesome Margaritas. Good food, great service and overall a great spot to unwind after work.
author: crystal e.

description: went here on a whim with a buddy of mine who lives in the mission. he'd gone here a few times prior and said they served strong drinks with a good atmosphere. it's dimly lit, bartenders are super social, and i give it a 5 out of 5 for getting me absolutely wasted on just a couple cheap margaritas. cheers!
author: Brandon F.

description:
I always make quick judgments about mexican restaurants based on their chips and salsa, which I loved! The rest didn't disappoint either! 
The quesadilla was great, right amount of cheese. 
Margaritas were just fabuous. 
Portion sizes were huge

Fun vibe here, especially for a weeknight, and am looking forward to going back!
author: Janice J.

description: The first time I went my friend recommended the nachos and I forgot to order them.  My bad.  The other night I went, and we split the nachos.  And now Velvet Cantina has one more star from me.  So what they do is just give you a plate of house made chips, top it with your typical nacho suspects...but here's what makes it special: queso dip.  Mmmm mmm mmm.  Yummy, creamy chile cheese dip all over those nachos.  I actually wanted to lick the plate.
author: Emily T.

description:
I went here back in 2007 and everyone in my group got violently ill immediately afterwards.  A week later a few people from my office went and THEY all got sick.  Then Velvet Cantina had the fire and i figured, well, maybe that sanitized the place.  So i tried it again two weeks ago and myself and my date both got violently ill.

moral of the story: stay for the tequila, leave before the food comes.
author: Zachary L.

description:
I've been here four times now and most recently, the owner himself brought us our food. He was super nice and sat down for a bit to shoot the breeze (it was a slow Sunday night). The appetizer nachos are bigenough to eat as a meal, shared with a friend. Everything on the menu is fabulous and you have to top it off with the smore nachos. The waiters and bartenders are so nice. Definitely get margs with dinner - they have different flavors so always ask what's hot for the night.
For those of you that drive, parking has never been a problem!
author: MK J.

description:
I started this vegan cleanse on Saturday-no alcohol, caffeine, animal products, sugar, and gluten (I know, I'm dying, and it's only been 4 days). So, Friday night I needed something bad to send me out. Enter Velvet Cantina. 
I hadn't been in over a year and remembered really liking it my first visit, and I had a hankering for queso. 
I definitely needed to start with something alcoholic since I already hadn't had a drink in a week, and I wasn't going to be able to drink for another 2 weeks. I had the margarita with fresh fruit (pineapple and watermelon were the choices that night). It was good, though I didn't pick up a lot of pineapple in it, and it was served in a DOF (I like my margaritas in a pint glass). We ordered the queso and chips to start, and I got the chicken burrito for my meal. The queso was lukewarm (I still forced it down, it was going to be my last dairy for 2 weeks!) and the burrito was on the dry side, despite the guac and sour cream it came with. I only ate 1/2 the burrito, gave the remaining to my friend since I wouldn't be able to consume the leftovers. 
Overall everything was just fine (except the chips, those are bomb). Probably will not return, especially for a last meal. Kind of wish I had gone to El Farolito instead and spent half the money!
author: Sarah M.

description:
This is tough, but I have to give the place 3 stars despite great/friendly service, cool ambiance and pretty good food (if you're not vegetarian).

If they change their margarita recipe (no mas mix!!) then I'll revise to 4 stars.
My recommendation: equal parts, fresh squeezed lime juice, cointreau, 100% agave tequila (no, not cheap, but people will drink 2x as many and visit 3x as often)   Go learn from the guru, Julio at Tommy's or his new place, tres agaves.

Chips/Salsa were outstanding.
author: jeff k.

description:
I heart this place. I can't give it a full five stars because I have yet to get a full entree (why must my love for globs of cheese mixed chicken and salsa wrapped in corn tortillas conflict with my desire to not be a lard ass?) 

Nevertheless, I must give this place mad props. I went for one of my really good friend's birthday.. we had a party of 10-15 people and our waiter was so attentive! You wouldn't have thought that it was a Friday night and they were so packed that there was literally steam on the windows. 

My one critique is that I wish the lighting were a little better. I mean, I get the whole candlelight "romantic" theme.. but if there is some hair in my food I want to see it! I don't like feeling like I am eating blindly, but then again, that's just anal me. 

Regarding food, all I can vouch for are the frijoles y arroz. Loved it. Although I think it was a bit pricey (6 dollars for beans and rice?) But well worth paying abit more for the overall positive experience. 

Would I go back? Absolutely. Matter of fact, maybe I'll go tomorrow. 

hmm...
author: Brielle H.

description:
Okay I am going to get straight to point!
The Best Nachos Ever, Best Flavor and Season,The Best Margarita's From the Watermelon to the Perfect Margarita,The Best Bartender's,Great Prices.
Atmosphere is great  and chill with a great mix of people. 
Would suggest riding along with a friend since parking is hard to find in the area, or take the public transportation. We almost gave up to go to Chevy's since parking was difficult but the parking gods came our way.  Also, I went the next day in the afternoon for the Nachos, they  were that good, but they were closed.  See you there tonight!!!

Summerbreezeof thebay
peaceluvandsunshine!
author: Staci C.

description:
Velvet Cantina is my go-to spot for margaritas and sit down Mexican. I have been there countless times and find it to be reliably delicious and the staff always amiable. I love their margaritas and have tried the blueberry, mango, watermelon, and traditional. The flavored margaritas rotate on a daily basis, but I would suggest the traditional margarita or the mango if you are feeling the need for fruity drinks. 

Food-wise the chips, salsa, and nachos are all great. Their pinto bean side has great flavor and are not too salty. Minus one star because I am continually bouncing around the menu without falling in love with anything in particular (besides the chips and salsa).

I continually return because the food and drinks are reliably tasty. Also, the staff always makes us feel welcome and never rushes us as we sit forever chatting over pitchers of margaritas.
author: Abigail R.

description: I moved into the hood about a year ago and stumbled along this place.  I dig the vibe, margaritas, food and staff.  My favorites are the Nachos and the Bordello Burrito.  The margaritas are stiff and they have different flavors to choose from.  If you are into tequila they have a variety to choose from.  I've gone here with small groups or even solo and the staff is always chatty and friendly.
author: Juan L.

description:
Cool Mission atmosphere and quirky decor. Attentive waitstaff, a tequila list to keep any tequila snob happy and, for the most part, yummy food.

Salsa - so, so.
Guacamole - yum!
Entrees - both great although guys, what's with the rice? How is it possible to make your rice taste like sawdust?????

Also, the place is loud (well the groups next to us were because you do need to shout when in the Mission yah?) plus take an iPhone to light up the menu. Ambience is lovely, not being able to read the menu due to the color choice of the design less so.

However, we'd go back.
author: D M.

description:
came here for a friend's birthday dinner on a saturday night and was impressed they were able to accommodate a table of 14 for us. 

first off, chips/salsa get 2 very big thumbs up.  coordinating with large groups is hard.  hence the 45 minutes spent nibbling on chips before enough people showed up so that we could start ordering the real food.  on the one hand, not a big deal since we had good company and many a margarita pitcher.  on the other hand.  we were pretty much full by the time the appetizers got there, but we tried our best to power through.  

apps: guacamole - good, but it was really cold when it came out, it kind of surprised me.  guess they have it waiting in the fridge.  ceviche - eh, good, but not terribly inspired, not something i'd order again.  nachos w/ chicken - mmmm.  too bad we didn't have more of those instead of the ceviche.  

for the entrees since we were such a large group we were told we could only choose from 4 options (chicken enchilada, steak taco, burrito, or shrimp diablo).  a good mix for a limited selection.  I opted for the enchiladas.  I was a little surprised when they came out...i was expecting a pool of cheesy sauce, but these enchiladas were dry, save the garnish of cilantro pesto.  I could've used more sauce, but the enchiladas were stuffed and the pesto was divine, so I can't complain too much, I guess.  Rice, beans, and something else on the side.  

all in all a pretty good smattering of food and margaritas.  and the bill was surprisingly low per person given all the appetizers and margaritas.  heck, i think i'd go back for their chips alone.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
The steak tacos were overpriced and not that great. 

The margaritas and atmosphere are nice though.  A much better place for drinks than food (except the chips and salsa).
author: Anthony E.

description:
Contemplated not reviewing because this is (THANK WHOEVER) one of those few places left in the Mission where it is still possible to walk in, without a reservation and get a table on a Saturday night . . . (NOTE: do not be a dumbass and show up with 8 people and think that rule still applies, unless its after 10 because then it might)

Now, unlike most places where such a thing is possible, the food is good, the Margaritas are better and the scene is pretty damn cool. 

Great for a) pre-dinner apps and Margaritas b) dinner and MARGARITAS c) low-key pre-midnight apps and, you guessed it, MARGARITAS!

UPDATE 4.25.07: Yeah, so much for that "walk in w/o reservations thing." You can still get a table on a weekend night but you'll be eating at 9:30 or 10 and have to wait 20-30.  So, make reservations. But honestly, this place is a MUCH BETTER CALL during the week. The B-day party crowds seem to have swarmed on weekends. Still great food, great margaritas, fun staff.
author: Jen A.

description:
This place rules!! Best Mexican food in the Mission, interesting fact only one of the 3 owners is actually Mexican.

What the VC does really well is take great ingredients and adjust the Mexican classics slightly and come up with really good solid food. The chicken avocado enchiladas are the best, the chili verde is awesome, the burrito is from another planet where Mexican gourmets live (beware though it is huge!!!) The only thing that was disappointing was the relleno but heh I can live with that.

The drinks are awesome and here is a hint, they make their own flavored vodkas and tequilas including cucumber jalapeno - which is great in a oh that is cool now it is hot kinda way.
author: Alex H.

description:
A group of us went there for my birthday on Friday - I was blown away by the delicious food, the fantastic drinks and the exceptional service.  We had reservations for 8pm and it took about 10 minutes for us to be seated (not bad right?  it was Friday night and we were a large group... I was not at all upset by a 10 minute wait).  The waiter apologized for the wait and sent out a giant plate of nachos - on the house - to make up for it.  Totaly unexpected, unnecesary and SO NICE!  These nachos are TO DIE FOR.  If you don't believe me, keep reading -- everyone is raving about these nachos.  You might think - nachos?  Chips and cheese?  How good can they really be?  Trust me, these are the best damn nachos I've ever had.

We ordered up a few pitchers of margaritas - pineapple (on the rocks, no salt - YUM) and regular.  Their margaritas are DELICIOUS and strong :)  They have a few different fruit margaritas and you don't have to get them blended which is genius.

Most of us went with the chicken and avocado enchiladas... great choice!  The chicken is so tender and flavorful (with a serious kick) and the enchilada is actually kinda dry - not a soggy, wet cheesy mess like you get at other places.  All dishes come with beans and rice and this spicy pepper relish stuff.  YUM!  Someone else ordered a giant wet burrito bigger than his head, someone got some shrimp that looked pretty good, I saw some steak tacos that didn't stay on the plate for long.  All in all, everyone was HAPPY with their dinner.  

The service was amazing - our waiter was, not only hot, but the happiest waiter I've ever seen at a busy restaurant in the Mission on a Friday night.  He was super attentive (margaritas were flowing and waters were constantly refilled) and just made for an overall great experience.

My friends ordered the flaming smores nachos for my birthday - wow!  Cinnamon tortialls chips doused in chocolate sauce and covered with flaming marshmallows- ok... sign me up :)

Amazing restaurant, great vibe, phenomenal food... highly highly recommended!
author: kyle e.

description: Wow -- fantastic customer service.  Came here on a busy night (what night isn't?) and got a little screwed up by some staff confusion.  The staff made it up to us and then some, and took very good care to make sure we had a good night.  Fantastic margaritas, and the agua frescas were pretty great too.
author: Adam G.

description: Loved the chicken avocado enchiladas! The chips & salsa were memorable. The chips are fresh & crispy, not oily. Our waitress could have been a bit more attentive. The restaurant is small but has a cool SF vibe!
author: Tiffany N.

description: I went for the first time this past Sunday and was very impressed. The service was fast, friendly and attentive. I ordered the Azteca Cake (tomatillo chicken between layers of corn tortilla with pepper jack cheese) which came with beans and rice. Additionally, the Salsa and Chips were addictive and my Cranberry Margarita was well worth it. One of the people in my party was unsure about the Mole sauce for the Mole Chicken. Our server brought over a small tasting bowl of the sauce so we could judge for ourselves prior to ordering. Nice, thoughtful touch; she rocks! I will definitely come back here again.
author: Shivaun O.

description: The food was decent and affordable, and the pitchers of margaritas were delish - we tried the mango and watermelon varieties, both were great.  Didn't love the tiny, cramped booths, and super-loud music (never would have expected rock/pop music at a Mexican place), so it's not really great for chatting and catching up with friends, which was sort of the reason my friends and I were there.  Next time we might skip the meal and go straight to the drinks after dinner elsewhere.
author: Kristen K.

description: Thanks to Velvet Cantina Cinco De Mayo is one of my new favorite holidays.... shared the nachos + margarita pitcher---yum! Didn't have to wait long to order and got our drinks instantly. Service was friendly despite that this place was beyond packed for the night. But they even managed to find me in the crowd and bring back forks.....I'll definitely be back for the full menu and possibly a table...We forgot to get the smores nachos...gotta. get. that.
author: Kelley N.

description:
be prepared to wait abt 45 minutes... at least if you're there on a friday night.  usually i am the least patient person ever, but it was no prob once we got our pitcher of margaritas from the bar (beware, this takes a lnnngggg time too, especially if that brown-haired-girl is there again smashing in front of you, rude, i hated her...).
the chips are amazing, best chips i've ever had.  as for the food, GET THE MOLE!!! you may think you aren't a huge mole fan, but trust me, if you do not order it you will regret it (i speak from experience).  it's perfect.

margaritas, chips, mole.  remember this combo and you'll be fine.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
The food was mediocre. I would not go back here by choice. I came here on a Friday night and it was pretty poppin. For appetizers we ordered Empanadas, but they were simply not good. They sounded amazing in the description, but were not enjoyable to eat. The "spicy cheese blend" was not spicy at all. For my entree, I had steak tacos which were better than the Empanadas, but no were close to being great. The steak was a bit chewy and they just tasted average. 

On the plus side, I loved the upbeat, semi-loud ambiance and the Mango Margaritas were pretty freaking tasty, yet not watered-down
author: Sati K.

description:
This was a great restaurant, good food, good portions. The service was great, though it may have helped that my friend seemed to know the wait staff. The host was friendly, attentive and funny. 

They lose one star for their canteloupe margarita. Not two flavors that should be combined.
author: Kris B.

description:
I've been to Velvet Cantina twice now, once for margaritas and socializing, once for a full dinner and a date. It is a great atmosphere for whatever your mood is.

The food is out of control good. I had The Chicken Avocado Enchiladas last night, which were phenomenal. I finished up my friend's burrito, also excellent.

The margaritas are tasty too, and the servers are friendly and fun.
author: David S.

description: Girls' Weekend began at this great spot in the Mission in San Francisico! BEST queso I have ever eaten, and I live in TX!!  Cozy, fun, great food and wonderful service. Lethal margaritas too! A must!
author: Liz B.

description: I came here on a Friday night with a large group of 19, and had to wait at least 15-20 min after our reservation to get all seated. I loved the dark sultry environment with the dim lights and attractive waiters/waitresses. The whole restaurant and bar had a very chill laid back mysterious vibe to it. The margaritas got me dancing with my chips and my chicken avocado enchiladas. From what I recall, it was pretty good but a little dry and needed some more flavor and seasoning. I must come back here sober and try more of their food for a fairer review! Who wants to come?
author: Alexa M.

description: A big step up from the taqueria highway of Mission Street is just a half block off hat over beaten path. And with a full bar to boot there's no question that Velvet Cantina should be top of your list for sit-down quality Mexican in the Mission. Pitchers of margaritas are convenient, but I prefer sipping something neat from the top shelf. The only problem is the fresh made in house tortila chips are so delicious you always run the risk if filling up on them before you get the main course. Ah well, first world problems. Did I mention the s'mores-y dessert nachos? I'll just let you find out or yourself.
author: Mikl e.

description:
it's a cozy restaurant/bar situated in the mission.  an alternative to mom and pop taquerias when you're jonesing for a nicer ambiance while chowing down on mexican food.  with the ambiance comes with the price, of course.  the food was decent, but nothing memorable.  the guys working the joint were friendly and attentive.

for my taco plate, his ceviche, 2 drinks and guacamole the price was $40.  i've heard so many great raves of this place, but myself and the mister both agreed we wouldn't be back.  it's more of a  trendy scene restaurant in my books.  i'll stick with my low key taquerias for a fraction of the price.
author: Sheri N.

description: This place is horrible! First off there's no ambience--it's just dark. So dark you can't even see what's in your plate. The salsa is unimaginably disgusting. It really was water with a hint of salt and a few chunks of tomato slush. I ordered chille rellenos. Man was that bad. I'm not even Latino and I know when I've been served bad Mexican food. The worst part of the whole experience was that my friend and I got sick after dinner. Don't even attempt the ceviche. My friend and I were the only ones to eat that crap and so we were the only ones who got sick. Nauseuous and puked the whole night. I'd give it zero star but the server who helped us was nice and attentive. We just didn't have the heart to tell him that the food sucked every time he came over and asked if everything was good.
author: Andre J.

description: THIS SPOT IS AMAZING! Jonathan and Darius are two of the most friendly dudes ever!  Ive never been let down with any of my meals here, the atmosphere is killer the drinks and great the tequila selection is fantastic.............  GO!
author: David R.

description:
2.5 stars.  given the amount of margaritas tonight...i'm not sure how viable my review is...only that we had our team dinner here (hey, it is in the face of economic headwinds...)

the margaritas go down easy.  the deep fried chips and salsa are bottomless.  they get 3 stars for that.  the service? super friendly and accomodating...they get another star.

the food?  well, could be better so they lost a bit there.  the chicken mole was rich and tasty and the empanadas were quite filling with the cheese and rice and beans.  
add lots of hot sauce and i was good.  not great but ok.

the chile queso was a little watery but tasty.  i like mine so thick that you can use a fork.

the kitchen offered us a super hot version where i turned a color of red not found in pantone and teared up.  somehow my table found that quite amusing.

but it was fun for a rowdy group.  a rival table sent us a pitcher of shirley temple...so we retaliated and sent back a pitcher of beans with 2 letters written in sour cream.  

it was a real blast.
author: Anh V.

description: Noisy and crowded, but offering up a solid mole sauce, fresh chips and strong drinks. The overworked servers still made us feel completely nestled in. A fantastic place.
author: Ben G.

description: My brother lives in San Fran and we went there with him. We're from Texas so we LOVE Mexican food and while this place was small in size compared to what we're used to - the food did not disappoint. The salsa is fresh and tasty and the guacamole and queso were excellent. I ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas and LOVED them...plus I liked their rice and beans too and frankly that's something I normally ignore at Mexican food eateries. Margaritas were strong and good and I would definitely return to eat there and my brother and his friends are regulars. Love it!
author: Amanda P.

description: Cute spot that I'd come back to. I prefer the back room to the bar area - has a different more chill vibe to it. The food was pretty good - portions are ridiculously large. Service could've been a little more on top of things. And one bathroom for the ladies - that always gets a minus 1 star from me.
author: Aim E.

description:
my new favorite mexican restaurant in the city! and it's only three blocks from my house. yay! i feel blessed. truly blessed.

good mexican food is paramount to my happiness cuz i'm really like mexican in heart. if you don't believe me, i can prove it to you. just meet me at velvet cantina and i can show you all my team mexico world cup jerseys. 

te amo mexico! viva mexico!

ok, getting back to the review. when i'm grumpy or down, velvet cantina is my prozac.

let's start with the chips and salsa. oh they are so effing phenomenal! the chips are puffy and crispy, like the ones you'd find in mexico. the salsa is complex and simply mouthwatering with the burst of flavors. this addictive combination radiates through my heart and uplifts my spirit in the most amazing way. honestly, i can jaunt over to velvet cantina and just binge on their chips and salsa and call it a day. but then i would be missing out on the food.

velvet cantina combines the best of mexican food with a creative, modern touch to create some bold and dazzling dishes. my favorite is the velvet cantina nachos. this isn't your ordinary nachos, ladies and gentlemen. it is a beautiful dish with that elusive smokey aroma and full of zest. it should dazzle even the non-mexican foodies. now combine that with gracious service and somewhat ethnic, sexy and intimate decor, velvet cantina is a remarkable experience. i'm a big fan! five stars!


* oh i almost forgot about the margaritas. they are potent. they will instantly put you in that special mood for whatever you desire... ok, that was corny. um, yeah, so for your other drinking pleasures, velvet cantina has a full bar to satisfy all your deep down body thirsts. yup, corny again. kids, that's what margaritas will do for you - corny, silly and horny...
author: frisco j.

description: If I ever need comfort food that is close, this is where I go.  Seriously, a bad day at work or after a good cry, I am craving the Chile con Queso dip with chips and some potent margaritas. Some of the food is hit or miss, but the Enchiladas are good( Chicken or Cactus) and I really enjoyed the Cornbread Sopes.  This place has a chill and sexy atmosphere and could easily become a neighborhood favorite.
author: Stacy R.

description: Came here the other night to celebrate my BFF's birthday! When we first got there, there weren't a lot of people. We were seated immediately and as we sit down, there are chips and salsa waiting for us at the table! The place is smaller than I expected but I suppose it gives things a cozy feeling. So, okay, lets talk about the food--I ordered the Chicken avocado enchiladas! Soooo good! It was creamy and rich in flavor! I loved it! I ate slow so that I could savor each bite. We shared nachos and that was good, too! For dessert, we shared the nacho smores. It was sweet and reminded us of Cinnamon toast crunch cereal.  Gooey and fun. After awhile it got way too busy so definitely make a reservation if you can. You will definitely have a good time here!!! :)
author: Mel P.

description:
I went on an impromptu date here last night.  It was okay I guess; he's been wanting to come here for a while and I'm sure he thought I had a great time.  I think he busted me texting one of my friends for a "rescue call" when he came back from the bathroom.
It was really loud, mostly from the one waiter/bartender that did not have an inside voice and kept shouting to the other across the restaurant and swearing like a sailor.  He was professional.  At least he offered up something for us to talk about as we struggled to make small talk.
The fresh watermelon margarita was yummy, but the margarita flavor overwhelmed the watermelon flavor.  I tried a sip of the date's ginger drink and it was definitely gingery!  Spicy on the tongue, ginger on the palate - not my cup of tea but he liked it.
The coconut-lime ceviche was very sweet and I'm going to have to refer to it as pina colada shrimp since that's seriously what it tasted like with the coconut milk and the pineapple.  It came almost as soup, in a bowl full of "broth" with a spoon.  I liked it best when I got some cilantro too, otherwise it tasted like a crustacean dessert.
The chili con queso was good; they seem to use actual cheese as opposed to Velveeta or that other nacho melty cheese.  The guy asked if I wanted to get this and I said "No," so he got it anyway.  Wtf?  I've recently discovered that melty cheese and chips make me violently ill, most likely due to the fact that I have no "off" switch when mowing through these and I end up eating enough to satisfy an entire ballpark full of nacho fans.
I hear the food is divine, so I'll definitely try this spot out again, especially since s'mores nachos sound like potentially the best idea ever.  Next time I'll go with someone else though, I am never calling this guy again, despite the 13 texts and messages he's already left for me.  STALKER.  What was I thinking?  Well, at least he paid.
author: Jennifer D.

description: After 11 pitchers of margaritas they still didn't kick us out. Either we tipped really well or they enjoyed our tomfoolery. Regardless, we wouldn't have stayed for 11 pitchers if they were bad. Get my meaning hombre?
author: Tal K.

description:
first off this place was generous enough to participate in "Dining out for Life" - thank you guys so much - it was a wonderful time! 
also: the hype about the 'ritas is totally warranted - they are really quite good (i particularly like the pineapple one, but as i was informed by the super friendly staff, the margarita menu changes with the season so ensure we get the freshest fruit in our drinks!) 
oh yeah - the food and the decor are also pretty fabulous so you kind of can't go wrong - unless you try and go on a weekend without reservations in which case you have to wait...at the bar... so yeah, pretty much a sweet spot.
author: Sole A.

description: As I was perusing my recent conquests in the city, I couldn't believe that I hadn't yet written a review for this DELICIOUS, TRENDY-MEXICAN place with EXCEPTIONALLY CUTE STAFF and a FUN ATMOSPHERE. As everyone else has said, the Chicken Mole is absolutely amazing, and big enough to feed a small army. After eating the chips and salsa and a few margaritas (there are many flavors to choose from), you need to split an entree. And no matter what you do, *save room* for the Nacho S'mores: Cinnamon-sugar chips, chocolate sauce, and marshmallows (e.g. heaven on a plate.)
author: Matthew S.

description: I've been there twice. I have to say that the menu looks more appetizing then the actual food tasted. I mean it was decent but not as good as I was hoping. At the end of dinner we were very full and were looking forward to having coffee for a little jolt.. They said they didn't server coffee. First time I've ever been to a restaurant that didn't offer coffee. I mean what if you ordered dessert? no coffee with it?
author: Caroliina F.

description: I came here for my birthday last weekend-- along with about 20 of my friends-- and had one of the best birthday dinners I ever had. All of the staff members-- from the host to the bartender to the waiters-- were SO nice. They let us choose how to arrange our tables, made us strong drinks upon request, gave me a free birthday shot, and even let us pick whatever music we wanted to hear and have a little dance party in the back! Not to mention, our food was delicious! My favorite was the chicken mole... YUM. I'm usually just "eh" about mole, but this really hit the spot. Several others agreed. The chicken avocado enchiladas were great too. I highly recommend this place for birthday/big groups dinners (just be sure to reserve in advance!), for the great staff, and for the yummy mole and margaritas! Thanks, Velvet Cantina, for a great birthday dinner! You guys are so awesome.
author: Phil S.

description: Velvet Cantina is super yummy. You HAVE TO order the chile con queso. It is to die for. The place is dark so it sets the perfect mood for first dates, night out with the girls and bday parties. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because of the music. I am all for music while I am eating but does it have to be so loud?
author: Ursula R.

description: I fucking love this place. I'm sitting here eating my leftover Mexican lasagna from dinner here and it's even better that it was when I drunkenly wolfed it down last night. The drinks are fabulous and the tarbenders are great. Try the vodka infused with cucumber and Serrano peppers, it's a pretty much a perfect cocktail. I need to come back again and again because everything on the menu looks wonderful. I wish I was a regular here.
author: margot b.

description: This place is amazing!  The chips actually taste like corn, The pitchers of Margaritas are strong and tasty (two managed to get seven of us very intoxicated...) The food is great - I'm a veg and the cactus and avacado enchiladas are wonderful and the chili rellenos are as big as your head.  If I remember correctly they have a late night margarita happy hour not to be missed - but SHHHH don't tell too many people about this great neighborhood place.
author: amy b.

description:
i don't know anything about the food, but i know that if you roll into the bar on a foggy sunday evening and order a pitcher of margaritas, you might as well call in sick for monday morning right then and there, cuz they don't stop pouring the tequila until you say when. and then they might not stop.

i just wanted to get a quick drink, but when we were greeted with a drunken cheer by the other patrons when we walked in the door, i knew it was gonna be that kind of party.

the margaritas were spectacular and the ambience was rambunctious.  the bar tenders were super friendly (maybe too friendly) and everyone in the place was having a deliriously good time.

it's probably a bad thing that my friend took us to this place, cuz now i'll be ducking in there for margaritas way too often, although i suspect on a friday or saturday night it's a bit too crowded and noisy for my taste.  i'll probably stick to the sunday afternoon crowd.

best quote heard while there:
"oh, you don't go out with him anymore?"
"no.  it's amazing what whiskey can do to a relationship."
author: amy l.

description: The Velvet Nachos and a pitcher of 'perfect' margaritas kicked off our night. The bartender was great. For dinner we split the cactus avocado and chicken avocado enchiladas. It was all really tasty and we had great service. All in all would definitely go back. The only downside is that it is a bit small and crowded on a Saturday night so getting room at the bar and a table later took some time.
author: Jeanne M.

description: I frequent this place. There are three things (well, more than three, but these are the main points) I love about Velvet Cantina. The margaritas are yummy, and pretty potent as far as I can tell, the chicken and avocado enchiladas with the spicy cabbage (I get them every time), and the mellow but helpful vibe of the staff. And one time, I made a reservation for a friends 30th birthday. It was for 12 of us. Some of us were 20 minutes late, and some of us were almost an hour late. We deserved to be kicked out on our bottoms, but they were gracious and accommodating, and didn't even start to harass us about leaving until way after the allotted two hours was up.
author: Natalie D.

description:
after my first pineapple margarita, i wanted to put on a sombrero and sing show tunes to the entire restaurant.  thankfully, i managed to restrain myself...there were no sombreros around anyway.  a pitcher of fruit margaritas costs $23, which is twice as much as la rondalla....BUT you only need one or two glasses to get the job done!

to compliment the deliciousness in my margarita glass, i stuffed myself silly with homemade, fresh and warm tortilla chips.  they were crispy, oily, and incredibly addictive (as was the salsa).  each bite was probably 100 calories, but no matter...i had pineapple margaritas to help me forget all about that stupid diet!
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Fun place, an interesting menu and the food was good.  For calling their Margarita "perfect" on the menu, they're not anything close to Julio's at Tommy's or Tres Agaves, but they're okay.  The service staff seemed to be strained a bit too, perhaps they were short on servers on the recent night I visited, but this is a pretty small place.
author: P H I L H.

description:
now that i live in the mission, i have a sneaking suspicion i will have a truckload of mexican reviews in the near future.. at least i had the pleasure of experiencing the velvet cantina before i became a jaded reviewer of the cuisine.

i was taken here during an evening of celebrating some work successes, so the fact we got to expense some things made the experience nicer. there were four of us and one of our crew (not me, of course) suggests the watermelon margarita. not that it was gross or anything, but it just wasn't me. i'm definitely a traditional margarita type of guy. salted rim. on the rocks. no fruit flavorings. keep it simple.

the burrito i had was pretty damn good. no sort of dish you'd be able to take away from the table. very fulfilling. everyone else's food looked pretty good, too.

the place is pretty subdued and wanted to kick us out around 1215, which makes perfect sense. it was time to move on to another bar anyway..

oh! great chips and salsa here!
author: Jeremiah W.

description:
Always pass by here and there's always a crowd on weekends, so I thought "Birthday!"

You'd think it'd be dead on a weeknight, but there was a still a wait, so good thing I made reservations anyway. A few of us ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas (a fave on yelp), and I went with the cactus enchiladas. I love meat and usually don't order vegetarian entrees but it was a pretty damn tasty choice. Even the cilantro sauce was good and I'm not a big fan of cilantro! I also enjoyed the mango margarita pitcher which magically made me remember and recite toy commercial songs from the 90s. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food, and afterwards, we shared a round of the traditional nachos and s'mores nachos back to back because we're fatties like that. I was hoping the s'mores nachos (which tasted something like churros or cinnamon toast crunch) would be more flamey (just so I could blow it out for fun, in lieu of candles) but by the time the plate hit the table, all the sparks were gone. 

The service was spotty at times but it didn't ruin the night. I'd come back again but more likely for celebrations rather than a quiet dinner out. I ate so much for one night, I think I'm all Mexican-fooded out for 2008.
author: Zell C.

description: What a great place to go with a large group. not only do they take reservations but there are a ton of bars in very close proximity to grab a drink while you wait for your table. They were about 45 mins late on getting us to our table but when they did sit us they gave us a few free apps to tide us over which was really cool. The bar is not that big and if it's crowded it's rough to navigate. The food is good and the margs will do the trick. what more do you want from your mexican restaurant?
author: Stephen K.

description: House margarita + queso dip + and cactus enchilada = perfect meal
author: Melissa B.

description:
waiters are friendly, it has a nice ambiance.
the food was good. the chips and salsa were yummy
would def. recommend it / go again
author: Yas G.

description:
oh, velvet how i love thee!
i've been here about a dozen times and have never had a bad experience. great food, great prices, fun atmosphere, and fantastic margs. 
good for dates, great for groups.
author: Amanda B.

description: Phenomenal margaritas!  It's impossible not to order a second ...or third ...or.....another pitcher.  Nice atmosphere (dark, narrow space illuminated by red lights) but this place isn't pretentious. I found the wait staff to be very helpful and we got seated right away with reservations. Great place to start a Saturday night!
author: Megan C.

description:
i have to chime in on velvet cantina while my visit is still fresh in my mind.  first off, i don't know what some people here are talking about this place lacking ambiance!!???  if it has anything, it is ambiance.  it reminds me of those classic family-style mexican food restaurants i always went to as a kid.  you know the kind, with the very lardy beans with the cheese melted on top.  yum.  and the booths are great; and they make the space feel really cozy.  

the crowd was cool and chilled out (it might have helped that we brought our own).  i agree that the salsa could be spicier, but that isn't to say it isn't tasty.  maybe they could offer a spicy alternative, too?  our whole party (there were 10 of us, and we showed up at 8 and got a table - though you probably couldn't do that on a weekend) enjoyed their food.  it is a bit on the steep side, but there are plenty of things for you if you're on a budget.  i highly recommend the snack-type things.  the nachos are some of the best i've had, and definitely big enough for a meal.  the tortilla soup and the sopes were super tasty as well.  the entire staff there is awesome, too.  really friendly and very hardworking - the place was jumping on a tuesday night. 

what is the deal with peter (who i kept calling patrick, sorry!) the bartender??  it seems as though everyone has a big crush on him, including a member of our group who shall remain nameless.  he is very sweet, though.  

fun neighborhoody place to meet friends during the week.
author: Cami B.

description: Tuesday night, lots of empty tables...was not happily greeted by the bartender, asked to sign in, waited 10 minutes before one of 3 staff acknowledge our presence, then was told it would be "a few minutes".  Waited 15 more and then left for a place around the corner.  It's been 4 years since I've been here, I will not venture here ever again.  Bummer!
author: John F.
