description: When I come here, I don't even look at the menu anymore. I simply order a pitcher of margharita, an order of nachos, and chicken avocado enchilada. That's way more food than you need but it's all so tasty that you can't walk in and not order these 3 things.
author: Patty G.

description: Really great restaurant.  Came with a large group and our we were double booked.  They were very gracious - put some tables outside and gave us free nachos and margaritas. The food was very good - some dishes were very authentic others not so much.  I had the shrimp enchiladas - pretty good, not a lot of sauce on the enchiladas - they were really small with a little sauce drizzled over the top.  BF had the Chile Verde and it was soooooooo good! Also tried my friend's mole which I give an A- - they serve it over chicken drum sticks which is pretty close to the more authentic turkey leg.  Friends also enjoyed the tacos (I didn't taste).  This place is very loud though - don't recommend for a date.  As the night went on the music got louder and it was even harder to have a conversation.  Fun atmosphere for a night out partying.
author: Kristina R.

description: This is place is heaven on earth.  One word...actually two words CHICKEN MOLE.  Good golly its like you've died & gone to heaven.  Sauce is spicy & rich & the chicken literally falls off the bones.  This dish is a must if you come here.  Appetizers that we ordered were so yummy....sopes, empandas, & ceviche were all winners.  Oh yea and their S'More Nachos....HELLO LOVER!!  And their margarita's will put you on your ass.  Strong but tasty.  They have excellent service, food & the waiters are nice to look at....HOLLA!
author: Natacha M.

description: Great hot queso for making your poo lite and almost as yellow as its original form!  Decent margaritas and sopas too.  I was in Tal K's group downing the 11 pitchers of margs and let me tell you.....our group after 11 pitchers is a less than desirable configuration for wait staff.  Whoever we had were very patient and loving people.  They'll make wonderful fathers one day.
author: Chard M.

description: I went here with a large group and we had a great time. The food was fantastic - extra points for having agave on the menu!! - and the cocktails were delish.
author: Jennifer P.

description: I want to go back right now! Get a pitcher of margaritas while you wait for a table especially if your in a large party. its best of both worlds because you've got a little bit of the bar crowd and mellow dinner goers. Great food and fun atmosphere! It's a definite dinner spot to stop at if your in the mission.
author: Rita R.

description: New restaurant that opened up in the mission where El Zarape used to be.  I think this place will be great once more people know about it.  The food is not your typical mexican dishes and still not trying to be high end, the prices were fair.  I really enjoyed the mango & orange infused tequila, but what really hit the mark and why I have to go back is the chocolate tamale, WOW....  take a chance and check it out, I'll definetly be back.  Really chill laid back atmosphere.
author: gabriel d.

description: This place is awesome! The food is great the service is decent and the margaritas are strong. This is a great date spot if you go on an off night. The place has low lighting so its a nice spot to cozy up with a girl in a booth. The queso is some of the best queso I have ever had. I literally ate two baskets of chips just so I could eat it all.
author: Michael K.

description: So, here's the thing.  This place opened, and my husband and I started going there...  a lot.  I mean, enough that everyone knows us by name, and when we haven't been there in a while, they ask where we've been.  It's like home, just 4 blocks from home, but at this home they serve yummy margaritas, chips & salsa to die for, addictive nachos (I'm serious, what do they put in there), crazy-good refried beans, succulent chicken enchiladas, and c'mon, s'more nachos for dessert!  What else do tequila-lovin' foodies need?  And now they've dropped the idea that they need to be closed one day a week, and they're open every day!  No more Monday "let's go to the Velvet, oh right, it's closed."  Yea!  Not to mention, as mentioned by other yelpers, the occasional free tequila shots.  Come hungry, leave tipsy - it's all good!
author: Julie L.

description: We went to velvet cantina for dining for life and had a big party (11 people).  5 of us were late and they didn't stress us about taking up the table.  The service is great!  The margaritas were fantastic, although I had a little hangover the next day after 3 Ritas.  The food was a good deal, but only mediocre.  American Mex in the Mission.  Fun atmosphere and decor
author: J J.

description: The guacamole is amazing and it isn't $10. The drinks are pretty stiff so it was hard to tell how good the food was, but I thought it tasted pretty good and it didn't break the bank. The crowd is very mission hipster, so my V-neck cashmere sweater definitely gave away my 94109 area code. The service staff is super cool and attentive which is a plus. Five stars would have been in order if parking was better, but hey, it is the mission, take a goddamn cab.
author: Miles T.

description:
this place was fantastic...and after reading a few yelp reviews prior to going, i felt that i was very accurately briefed for such a place!

its a totally fantastic, fun, lively atmosphere, with super HOT waiters, all of which were very kind and eager to tend to our margarita-needs.

all in all...it was an excellent experience.  and---i have to say it---the margaritas here give the margs at tommy's (in the richmond) a run for the money!  they were great!  i now have 2 favorite margarita spots in the city!  (not to mention, the chicken-avocado enchiladas were incredible.)
author: Melody H.

description: I've had drinks here before but went for dinner last night for the 1st time.  I thought it was pretty darn good.  We ordered a pitcher of good top shelf margaritas (tasty) and the Chicken Tortilla Soup was a great appetizer (in fact the bowl was huge and is almost a meal all by itself).  The steak tacos were great too.... I was impressed with the tastiness of the beans and rice (sometimes nothing but plate garnish in some joints).... Prices weren't too bad and our server was a super pleasant fellow.  I'd definitely go back and try some of the other menu options.
author: Mike S.

description: yes yes yes....nachos and avocado enchiladas delishhhhh
author: Rob C.

description: Thank you Yelpers! I decided to try this place out because I had read all the fantastic reviews. The watermelon margaritas are sooo yummy! The wait staff was really nice and I definitely stumbled out a happy customer!
author: Rae H.

description:
Great staff, good food, stiff drinks.

The place has a great atmosphere, featuring two... interestingly.... decorated rooms. Our server was charismatic, prompt, and fun to talk to. The chicken avocado enchilada was excellent. My only complaint is that the margaritas may have been a bit *too* strong...
author: John Eric H.

description: Shrimp Diablo is muy  hot and the drinks are cold! Get the Mango Margarittas and forget the raspberry one! The chips are most likely made with lard b/c it so damn good. Crowded and loud so good for hanging out with loud drunk people, but forget it if you are trying to talk to someone. Thanks, Carlos for the "1000th" date and another Mexican adventure!
author: karina x.

description: The food here is good.  No complaints.  But the best thing is that the guacamole is fantastic.  And the chips are fresh and awesome.  AND they make some fabulous drinks.  It's a good place to go when you want some good mexican food and you want something a step above taquerias, get some drinks, but you want to stay on the authentic side of things.
author: Sarah R.

description: So so so much food, ridiculously delicious, fantastic service, and never ending complementary chips - always a win!
author: Josh L.

description: Great neighborhood bar! The staff is fun and welcoming, the vibe is chill, and the food and drinks are yummy! Can't go wrong with a pitcher of margaritas and the velvet chicken nachos...it's supposed to be an appetizer, but it easily feeds three people.
author: Danielle N.

description: Last night was our first visit to this crimson-y and cozy cantina, and it was numma numma.  The service was just so-so. I've had better.  I will admit, when we first reviewed the menu we were slightly disappointed in the lack of appealing options.  For some reason, everything felt like a slightly off kilter version of something I would maybe like to order.  However, the chile relleno I ordered proved to be an excellent choice--healthy, wholesome, veggie goodness.  The beans and rice were just ok.  The prices were more than reasonable and I liked the comfy booth.  I will return, but next time with a reservation.  Plus, I really want to try the fiery smores nachos.  Word.
author: Lacy T.

description: Good bloody hot spicy food that burns your lips, tongue, and throat (I had Avocado Cactus Enchiladas)!! The dessert S' Mores Nachos was definitely a sig dish! Ambiance was dark, lively, crowded as the seats were quite close to each other, which created a friendly and hip space to be at.
author: T L.

description: I'm vegetarian (I occasionally eat fish) and the menu here is basically all meat. So why the four stars? Because Velvet Cantina has a wonderful staff, a great atmosphere, and the best chili relleno in the Mission. Not at all soggy and not 90% cheese. It comes with a great spicy sauce on top. I also recommend the signature salads. Didn't get to try out the bar but I will be going back!
author: Regina S.

description:
The sole reason I dragged Lo and Mo to the Velvet Cantina is because I'd read about the peanut butter chocolate dessert tamale. Sadly, after 2 pitchers of margaritas, steak tacos and the best goddamn free tortilla chips I've ever consumed, that tamale would have to wait for another time. A couple of words to the wise:
~If you're like us and showed up on a Friday expecting to get a table immediately, forget it. They looked at us like we were hobos wandering in off the street, our lack of reservation was so offensive.
~Don't get anything to go. While waiting for our table, because you know, we didn't have a reservation, we chatted with two women waiting for take out. It was delivered to them by a very cute and of course, very stupid guy who handed them their containers sideways, obviously creating some kind of stew with what was once, no doubt, gorgeous and seperate food. 
~Don't walk in through the door on the corner. Apparently, this is not cool. Walk in through the door on 23rd. Way cooler. 
Otherwise, it was awesome, laid back, inexpensive and spectacular. The crowd was cool but not too cool, the staff was laid back, if a little bit too much so, and the food was fantastic. 
Just, uh, make a reservation...
author: Beth S.

description:
Reading all the great reviews here, me, my wife and my friends all thought that this place was gonna be a shoe-in for a great meal.  First let's start on the food.  I started out w/ the ceviche which was adequate but nothing like the ceviche I had in Costa Rica.  I then had the tri-tip and it was very good but not crazy good like everyone is making it out to be.  I didn't have the drinks, but everyone else at the table said that the margaritas were fantastic

Now let's get into why I gave this restaurant 2 stars.  My friend had gotten the organic chicken enchiladas WITHOUT avocados because is incredibly allergic to it.  He mentioned this (allergy, effects, et al.) to the waitress 3 times as we ordered.  After we got our main course, about 10 minutes into eating it, my friend finds not just one piece of avocado, but avocado all over the inside of his enchilada.  We flagged down the nearest waiter to let them know of the faulty order.  He then flagged down our waitress who in turn just made a ton of excuses as to why it came out the way it did.  So she asked if he wanted another dish to which he said yes cuz he should try to eat to see if he can subside the side effects of his allergic reaction.  She kept on coming back making excuses about how this happened and didn't apologize once.  The initial waiter on the other hand kept on coming back to check on my friend and kept on apologizing.  After my friend got his meal, he couldn't even touch it and we pretty much ended our meal shortly after that.  He ended up sending the meal back eventually too.  When we got the check we noticed that they had comp'd his initial meal but charged us for the second plate that he had ordered.  We pinged the waitress and she was like of course we're gonna charge you for a meal.  And at that point that's when all of us went into an uproar.  How can a restaurant that knows they did something wrong have the audacity to charge for a meal that they knowingly messed up!  She was all flustered that she had to call her manager and was visibly annoyed by all of this.  Needless to say when she came back the manager had comp'd the entire meal and we left no tip.  We did however give a tip to the one waiter guy who did check in on my friend.  The only reason why this place got 2 stars was due to that one waiter.  The waitress though can go to obedience school w/ some chihuahuas.
author: Swarup B.

description:
i pass by this place on the way to work and always wanted to check it out. i am now very glad that i did. i had the chili verde, which was incredibly tender pork in a spicy broth, with tortillas, a tasty cabbage slaw and a really surprisingly good beans and rice. i mean, it's rare that one is taken aback by the deliciousness of the ubiquitous beans and rice combo, so points for that. points also for booths, free chips and awesome salsa, and a really nice and funny waiter. 

can't comment on the drinks, since i went almost immediately after recovering from a vicious and horrific post-New-Year's eve hangover of death upon which i vowed to detox and quit drinking for at least a week.  

now it's january 2nd. i'm going for drinks tonight. margaritas, here i come??
author: Mei L.

description:
i'd like to see velvet cantina get off its feet a bit more, so people should definitely start checking the place out. i live right across the street, so we've gone about five or six times now, sometimes for dinner, sometimes for drinks. 

food isn't too cheap, and with so many mexican options where you can get dinner for less than five bucks right around the corner, vc might seem a bit out of touch, BUT they create their own little niche. they definitely try to put some pizazz in the menu.... especially with the desserts, which include smores nachos (haven't tried yet, but can't wait) and peanut butter-chocolate tamales (kinda weird...).  the nachos are amazing, and the chips they give you with whatever you order are fresh out of the oven, making them nice and greasy, fo sho.  

drinks also have a little bit of added spunk... they have this one vodka drink that has cucumber puree and some sort of chili pepper in it, and i definitely think it should be tested by someone in one's group of patrons, as it's definitely a love-hate type drink.  and now they're starting a 11pm-midnight happy hour, with 3dollar shots of frenet and margaritas, and that rocks. also, 3 of the 5 times i've been, we've gotten free drinks! 

velvet cantina definitely hits a nice little spot for a chill night with a mexican flair.  great for dinner and drinks with a small group of friends.

UPDATE:  Befriending the bartenders here is DANGEROUS. nuff said... love them though!
author: lauren a.

description: THis place is disgusting. I went here because of the reviews on Yelp. This convinced me that Yelp cannot be trusted because so many of the reviews are given for completely arbitrary reasons. Yeah, the place looks really hipster but it's a restaurant and the food is gross. I went here with 4 people and all of our dishes were gross--do not order anything with shrimp in it. I'm from Texas so I know what a margarita should taste like and this place is not serving it. I have no idea why it has gotten 4 stars and so many other, better restaurants get 3 stars.
author: mazzy s.

description: I just was introduced to this little gem.  Excellent!  Great ambiance, really good food, and the margs are off the hook.  I'll be going again very soon.
author: Rose D.

description: The bff was craving some non-taqueria mexican food, so I suggested Velvet Cantina after coming here for another friend's birthday a while ago. It was packed on a Saturday night, but we were told the wait will be about 10 mins. That estimate was pretty off since we ended up waiting for about 30 mins instead. We got some seats at the bar right after we walked in, so the extended wait was a non-issue for us. The Palomas were good, but I do miss the toronja Fresca in my Palomas when I'm in Mexico. Once we were seated, we ordered the empandas and the chicken avocado enchildas to share. I thought the empandas were ok, but the bff liked them a lot. And she also really liked the enchiladas (which is a big deal because she is the pickiest eater I know) and said it really reminded her of her mom's cooking. I though the enchiladas were great too. Ordered the mango margaritas to wash dinner down and you can definitely taste the fresh fruits in the drinks. Will definitely come back when the hankering for some good mexican food kicks in.
author: Janny N.

description: Yum, the guacamole is fresh and delish with chopped cilantro on top. Had the naked Relleno, original, tasty and almost felt good for me!
author: Cindy L.

description: Had a great time for a friends Bday dinner.  There was a steady flow of margaritas and deep fried chips.  What more could anyone really ask for??!
author: Susan K.

description:
i just discovered this place, 2 blocks from my house.  SO GOOD! so nice to have a mexican restaurant - as opposed to a taqueria - so close by.  it reminds me of the old style mexican places i grew up with in L.A. - El Cholo, El Coyote, Gardens of Taxco, etc. Old school.  dark, booths.  love the bordello decor.  and a good dinner soundtrack!  fun waiters who promise not to piss in your next drink when they overhear you complaining that the margarita was made with a mix rather than fresh lime juice (ala Tommy's on Geary) - then he brought me one with made w/lime - and no discernable pee!

Everyone's right - the chips are yummy.  Salsa is good too, blended texture, not chunky, but with good flavor.  coulda used a bit more heat, for my taste.  We had the coconut shrimp ceviche to start.  A bit too sweet for us - a bit like dessert - again, coulda used some heat - but we still ate every bite.  with the yummy chips.  my sister had the marinated steak (which wasn't on the online menu), totally tender, juicy, perfectly pink, served with a jalapeno cream sauce, sauteed potatoes and nopalitos, a wonderfully crunchy and tart pickled cabbage thing, and rice.  The rice:  i judge Mexican restaurants by their rice, having grown up in So.Cal. (glad that's over) and attending many a quinceanera in my day, and thereby having tasted a lot of authentic, homemade mexican rice.  it should be firm, with separate grains, not mushy, the taste should smack of cloves, and a hint of garlic, it should have almost a slightly smokey flavor.  and it should be a robust orangy color, flecked with specks of tomato paste.  the individual grains should be flexed, not straight, so that they almost look like little jumping jack men.  i'm serious - i've had lots of good rice!

well, Velvet Cantina's wasn't that, but it wasn't bad. and it grew on us the more we ate it, especially when mixed with the black beans i was given by a pleasant mistake (i'd asked for refried).  they were DELICIOUS, more like cuban black beans.  my entree was the nopalitos, potato and pepper jack cheese enchiladas, also with the jalapeno cream sauce.  YUM.  gooey but not overly saucy, the tortillas had obviously just been fried so they were not too greasy and not hard, just perfectly al dente.  i usually order a meat entree of some sort, but since my sister was having the steak, i tried this.  and i'm not a fan of chicken (dirty bird!)  that said, we had a friend join us late and we ordered the chicken enchiladas for her.  i had a bite - the chicken was nicely spiced, not like so many other chicken enchiladas where the bird is just boiled and tasteless.

I was sad they were out of the serrano chile/cucumber elixer, but our friend had some kind of cilantro tequila thing that was very refreshing.

i'm definitely going back, and with so many other ridiculously good restaurants in this City still to try, that's saying a lot.
author: maria a.

description: Place to go for great margaritas and food...I tried to watch what I ate because a girl has to maintain her figure, right?  But I couldn't resist here!  Pineapple and watermelon margaritas were fabulous.  I couldn't get enough of the chips and salsa.  The ceviche was good, reminded me of Thai flavors because of the hint of lime and coconut.  Because I loaded up on all this  fabu food, I ended up ordering a Ensalada de Manzana...also quite satisfying for a plate full of greens!
author: Christina T.

description: Superb place, friendly staff who're actually engaging, the food is simple and very filling, naturally not the best place if you plan a night out dancing, but if you're wanting time with friends, talking and laughing while enjoying good food, then this is a good option. Wonderful.
author: Adam B.

description:
Wow - I can only blame myself for trying this place for the 6th time and it still sux miserably.

Waiter did not even approach the table for at least 5 minutes - to put that into perspective, me and my friend had eaten an entire basket of their disgusting grease-soaked chips, accompanied by warm water without ice, before someone even stopped by to get our drink order.  Simply amazing!

About the drinks - if you order a margarita, you probably should spring for the $10 version with regular tequila.  I don't know what is in the $7 version but it tastes like it could take the paint off of a car.

We ordered some nachos.  Sparse toppings and not even in the same league as anything you could get at just about any taqueria in the Mission.  Dry.  Tasteless.  Awful.  Especially so when you consider they are ~$10 (taqueria nachos are $6-7).  We downed our drinks and got out of there as fast as possible.  I still gave the waiter 15% - I couldn't blame all of the shortcomings on him and, having been in the service industry, it is really difficult for me to stiff someone.

Crappy service, crappy food, crappy drinks.  Every time I go there I get the impression that the restaurant is being run by a bunch of young stoners.   I've given Velvet Cantina more than enough chances.  Won't be back for the seventh time.  Consider yourself warned.
author: David M.

description: Sometimes, I find the strangest places sexy and romantic...Velvet Cantina is one of those places. Low lighting, La Pinta Pomegranate Infused Tequila on the rocks, diverse crowd. No pretension. Great salsa, down to earth staff, great food. This place has flavor.
author: Sandy C.

description: love me some velvet cantina. awesome service, GREAT margaritas, good atmosphere. Went last nite with 8 friends and got seated right away. The ceviche is different but yummy, its sweet-made with coconut milk. i had the avocado cactus enchiladas. to die for. everyone was pleased. bill wasnt to bad either. will return again, real soon.
author: cristina s.

description: Velvet Cantina takes the sort of walk-in Mission taqueria and turns it into a comfortable, if a bit loud / busy, sit-down restaurant.  The food retains an authentic feel, though the restaurant, bar, waitstaff, and soundtrack are hipster central.  The nachos are excellent.  The mole's perhaps a bit too rich.  I'm not a tequila fan, so I have no comment.  It's an enjoyable place to dine with friends, but I wouldn't expect to be blown away.
author: Jason H.

description: The homemade chips and salsa are really good, I'll give them that but the food is whatever and so are the drinks, but the male waiters are hot and that kind of makes up for the food ;)
author: T C.

description: Huge portions for reasonable prices.  The food was on the good side of OK.  Nice big table in the center of the restaurant for large parties.  They played increasingly strange, but really awesome music during the dinner.  The pitcher of margaritas was great and the chips and salsa kept flowing.
author: Octous O.

description:
i enjoy the velvet cantina alot!!! this is one of my local favorite in the mission...the food is xxxcellent & very good!!!! the servers are always on top of things, esp. darrius, johnny, & jason....always on top of things....

on saturday nights, b4 going 2 the local club, my gurlfrendz & i get a few drinks.  the filipino bartender, i believe he goes by "d"....he is always full of jokes-look out single ladies, "d" is a charmer!!! d, u rock!!!!  this bartender will make anyone's frown into a smile!!!! i hope he stays at the cantina 4 a long time.  as long as he's around, my crew will be going 2 the cantina!!!  single ladies u have 2 see what i'm talking about!!!
author: D.c.g G.

description: Alls I has to say is the Nachos ROCK!!!! SO YUMMY!! Oh LOVE the Tequila wall too!!!
author: Rob L.

description: Nice place, but I went there because it had such good ratings on yelp. C'mon. 5 stars??? The food isn't even in the same breath as Limon or other top notch restaurants. Had the steak tacos. Ok, definitely not great.
author: eric a.

description: I like taquerias just as much as any other white chick from the midwest, but sometimes I want a mexican restaurant (and I don't mean Chevys).  Like one where you sit down and have a conversation in between shoveling awesome combinations of rice, beans, and cheese into your mouth. Velvet cantina BRINGS IT, and then some. My irresponsible friends and I showed up a 1/2 hour late for our res on a saturday night. The adorable owner got us a table in 5 min. The restaurant feels like an old sf establishment-the place has soul. It's great for groups. The dishes are creative and inexpensive. The watermelon margaritas will certainly soon be a staple in my weekly cocktail outings. Yay.
author: Laura H.

description: I love this place! It's not that the food is so fantastic, but it's tasty and the portions are incredibly generous. The chips are greasy, but they're homemade, thin and crisp and that makes me happy. It's just a fun, casual spot to meet up with friends and share strong pitchers of margaritas (often a few too many).
author: Crissy G.

description: I went here a few months ago, I'd say it's some of the cleanest most flavorful mexican food I've had. By that I mean they don't serve greasy slopped piles of rice and beans with every dish, it seemed very fresh and lighter on the sides. The margaritas were fantastic. Make a reservation though, even with one for our group we had to wait a little over an hour in a packed shoulder to shoulder bar area, worth the wait, just do a few patron shots and you'll be good to go!
author: Ryan M.

description: this place is excellent. The margs are strong and tasty. My favorite thing to eat is the jalepeno infused broth tortilla soup with the cheesy wonderfulness .I dare you to hate it
author: Lauren V.

description:
panchita's cooler, swaggering cousin. this is mexican with a modern and hip twist. this was a welcome addition to a neighborhood that already has way more mexican joints than we could possibly use. friendly bartenders in the east room pour stiff concoctions. surprisingly good menu with some goofy surprises... for one, i swear they have some of the best chicken fingers i've ever had (tortilla encrusted!). 

thank god they added their fantastic chicken mole to the permanent menu. that's a winner.
author: Brady W.

description: Came here on a Friday night with friends to get drinks.  The bartenders were pretty cool but the drinks not as stiff as other places but they are cheaper than the other places.  Place is a little small but that makes it more intimate.  We had a pitcher of margarita which I would say was okay but then again I'm not a tequila drinker.  I would definitely come back if I'm in the Mission, this place is a good starter place.
author: Paul C.

description: Got a last minute reservation here on a Friday night for a big group - really convenient.  The food isn't amazing but it's good.  The margaritas are great!  Good for large groups.  Oh and definitely love the endless chips and salsa.
author: Sandhya R.

description: Service - 5, Food - 2. I went this weekend and I got a table for 2 at 8 pm. walking in. how novel in Sf. that said, the food was just ok (i ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas - maybe that was my fault for going with something so standard, my compadre ordered the achiote tacos, again, minimal meat, the rice and beans overflowed though...the house margarita was good, dont bother ordering the special one...smaller glass and too limey. the ceviche was mediocre at best...the service though was friendly and attentive except for forgetting our appetizers of the unremarkable ceviche (which he gave us on the house)...overall, neighborhood bar/stop by but not a destination place...
author: Hilary H.

description: Note to vegetarians:  They have non-listed options that they will make for you (ask for the nachos with grilled veggies instead of chorizo).  The nachos are some of the best I've ever had, all the meat is high quality, they serve much later than most of the restaurants around, and they have a happy hour that starts at 11pm!  The margeritas are delicous, the bar has great unique and refreshing cocktails, and the staff is really friendly.  So far - it's not too crowded, but I expect that to change.  And the cactus enchilada is great!
author: Arshad T.

description: The good:  Great margaritas. Friendly staff.  Funky design.   The bad: the food is pretty awful (we wanted this place to be good - tried it three times now, just can't recommend eating here).
author: babsie g.

description:
a solid place to get some grub and a few [pitchers of] margaritas.

i settled on 3 stars, but its worth making special mention of the tortilla soup, which deserves 5.

it has the kind of kick that might make some [not me!] come up for air. luckily, theres a sour cream empanada life jacket floating in the bowl to cut through some [but not too much] of the spice and add just the right amount of creaminess to keep the meek treading water.

i normally dislike sour cream pretty intensely but find this delightful, so im apt to think theres some kind of pick-me-up afoot. thats fine...i can think of worse ways to get addicted to crack.
author: Jon W.

description:
Hipster Mexican food, San Fransisco style.

Fun, casual place with good drinks.  Friendly staff.  Tasty food.  Good vegetarian options.  Great place to go with friends.  They take reservations.

However, this is not authentic Mexican food by a long shot.  Thus, the three star rating.  If you don't care about authenticity, then I would give it four stars.

I had the tacos Valentina - tasty chicken tacos with salsa and avocado, rice and whole pinto beans.  The pinto beans had lots of cumin.  Rice was flavorful, not greasy.  The vegetarian burrito was generous, with a good amount of spice.  The staff went out of their way to seat us without a reservation.

Loud enough to be kid friendly if you go to the restaurant early.
author: Mel D.

description: I heard good things about this place and so went there for a friend's birthday. The food was good and the margaritas were good but the service was disappointing. It may have been because it was busy and they were understaffed but the waiter was unfriendly.  My friend had to send her food back twice for being the wrong order and then being cold and the waiter failed to apologize. Perhaps it was an off night - I would be willing to go back and give it another try.
author: Catie S.

description:
Really just not that impressed.  Went here on Friday night date(reservations were ready on time, which is nice) and ordered two margarita, one pineapple, one regular.....sadly we could not tell the difference and they were both bad.  Instead we opted for beers.  The food was mediocre, at best.  Our plates were both pretty full by the end of the meal, and neither of us wanted to take it home.  The service was pretty good though, so I can compliment that.

There are SO many other friendly margarita, party-time Mexican places in SF, I suggest you visit those first,

(The whole night would have been a bust if not for the awesome company I had).
author: Lara F.

description: Decent food, good margaritas and cheap prices. Good place to get together with a larger group of friends. I wasn't blown away by anything I ordered, but nothing tasted bad either... just keep sipping on the margaritas, you're bound to leave in a good mood.
author: shadi m.

description: 3.5 stars. Went out with my girls last night and started with a late dinner here. Decor is cozy, and the chips that were served while we perused the menu totally hit the spot. I was into it. We had a pitcher of margaritas and shared some guac to start. I ordered the chicken enchiladas and my friends had the shrimp enchiladas and the steak tacos. The margartas were strong and a good value (we each probably got 2.5 glasses, so 7.5 glasses for $28 bucks). We had ordered the mango flavored margarita, but I detected no fruit flavor--oh well, I can't drink too much sweet stuff anyway. The food was merely okay--not bad, but, like, we're in the mission eating Mexican food--if it was really bad, this place would have been shut down a long time ago. We were among one of the last tables left as the restaurant cleared out, but we weren't rushed to leave. I liked that. Service was friendly, and the food came out fast. I have no honest complaints, but I also don't know if I was really wowed by anything.
author: Nora G.

description:
free shots.  too many....as a result, 

 i puked on the sidewalk the next day while walking the dog.  

cheese dip/chips will stop all bar conversation as you consumer the liquid crack.

bar tender and host are the nicest in town
author: Olis L.

description:
1. S'MORES NACHOS

I could almost stop there. The S'mores Nachos are not corn chips, as far as I could tell, but some kind of hard flour chip (almost like a pita chip) covered in sugar & cinnamon, then doused in chocolate, and covered with mini marshmallows. Which are then SET ON FIRE next to your table. Then you eat them and freak out.

2. Strong Margaritas.
Pitchers of the house margaritas are reasonably priced (can't remember the actual number) to split between some people. And they are strong. (Not something good to wash down the nachos with, because a big gulp left me reeling. But very good for drinking on its own.)

3. Good food. 
I had dinner there about 2 months before the S'MORES NACHOS evening, and all I remember about it was that it was delicious. I'm sure other people can tell you about the food.

4. Great service.
When the 10 of us rolled in at 10:15pm, the server was nice and let me know that the kitchen was closing in 15 minutes. So we got our order in quickly, had lots and lots of drinks, and had a great time. The busser was also really fun and seemed to enjoy that we were having a good time.
author: Lillie C.

description: A fun, lively "dive-bar" with hot staff and decent enchiladas and "too hot" mole chicken. Our group of 9 enjoyed good service but the chairs were not comfortable. The adult beverages were OK- but I just expect more from the place- especially reading all the yelp-hype!
author: Darrin D.

description: I'm dumb - I always thought this was just a bar even though their sign clearly says 'Edibles & Elixirs'.  But the other night after an event at the Makeout Room, a bunch of us were searching for some late dinner, ended up here, and were pleasantly surprised. I had some delicious sopes as my meal and N got an amazing bowl of chile verde. I want to go back to try some other interesting things on their menu - nopales and avocado enchiladas, achiote steak tacos (I'm a big fan of achiote), and chicken mole (um, I'm also a big fan of mole -- ok, so I'm a big fan of lots of things).
author: Angi C.

description: I have too many stories that end, "And the last thing I remember is ordering $3 margaritas at Velvet Cantina."  But they are all good stories...
author: Tessa M.

description: Took my cousins here when they came to visit from NY.  Quiet enough to chat with friends at a table, but enough noise and energy in the room to keep the night going.  Great margaritas and I highly recommend the chicken and avocado enchilada.
author: Lillian B.

description: So, I really can't speak to much at this place, seeing as I only ever get one thing. BUT, it may be the most disgustingly delicious desert ever made: 'Smore Nachos. Yes, you heard correct. Its everything you can imagine in your head, except probably a little better, a little sweeter, and more tasty. In fact, I would do it no justice to explain it, just go, now. And by now I meant 5 minutes ago so you're already lagging...
author: sholeh m.

description: I'm not a huge Mexican fan, so I think I tend to rate Mexican food a lot harder. My friend and I shared two entrees: steak tacos and shrimp diablo. The steak tacos were pretty good. It came with two soft tacos filled with stripes of steak, guacamole, cheese and sour cream. The shrimp diablo was very tasty, but I thought the shrimps could have been a little bigger. Both entrees came with rice and beans. We were served baskets and baskets of chips and salsa. I think we devoured almost 3 baskets! We were so full that we didn't have room for dessert, but the smores nachos looked delicious!!! Graham crackers piled high with chocolate and marshmallows then flamed with a torch and presented to you!! It smelled just like the real thing from camping! If anything, I'd go back just to try this special dessert.
author: Denise L.

description: This place was just made for groups of 6, it really was! Nice booth action in both rooms, attentive and friendly service and excellent, if maybe not very authentic cuisine. Yes, this is more cuisine than taqueria fare.  The chips are thick & taste house made, the salsa is a nice compliment to the chips, could be spicier in my opinion. Empanadas are delicious as hell, they even come atop rice & beans, so it's a substantial starter. They make an interesting ceviche, little shrimp in a sweet pineapple coconut sauce, really tasty. They also have s'more empanadas with 'flaming marshmallows"! The margaritas are fairly good too.
author: Colleen B.

description:
ala justin...i'm lovin' it. 

the food just about rocked my face off. the decor was as delicious as the comida. the margaritas left me shakin' my moracca all over the mission.

only draw back. kinda took a while to be seated. And my lover complained about his dish. if you don't like it spicey, don't go here.
author: Kaleb L.

description: I stayed away from this place for soooo long because I couldn't get over the horrible, baggy stenciled gold awnings.  But, it's 2 blocks from my house so finally I broke down.  Turns out, I shouldn't have been such a snob because it's awesome there and I've been probably 10+ times over the past few years and even had a small group birthday there.  The food is great (huge portions though), the margaritas are strong (except go for the more citrusy flavors versus the cantaloupe or something) and the beer is cheap (if you like Tecate, Modelo).  I love the copper flecked mirrored panels behind the bar. If I knew where to buy those, I'd have them in my house. So, if you like that kind of vibe, you might like the Cantina. Don't get the vegetable relleno though.  Stick to the enchiladas, chile verde and tacos.
author: Kari J.

description: Great tasting and creative food.  Bartenders are great.  I've been here twice and had a great time both times.  Once was cinco de mayo and 2 crazy guys were there all dressed up!  It was funny.
author: John B.

description: I had dinner here recently with friends.  I thought the food was good but the service was kind of lacking.  Despite other reviews I read below, I found that the margaritas were great,  but admittedly, i really needed a drink by the time I got there so maybe I was a push over that night when in came to cocktails.
author: Brooke Z.

description:
i love this place!  the "pot o' queso" is like a crack pot!  one dip and you are addicted!!!  gabe totally rocks!  actually , every person that works here is totally awesome!  the chicken enchiladas are DELICIOUS and so are the steak tacos!  you cannnot go wrong here!  dine in at the booths in the front of the restaurant or sit at the bar like we love to do, you will walk away giving 2 thumbs up to this mission establishment!  i loooooove everything and everyone about it!    mmmmmmmmmmm VELVET CANTINA, i loooooove you!!!!  go here for CINCO DE MAYO! or any other day for that  matter!
xoxoxo
author: dawn m.

description: This place is great if you're looking for traditional-ish, sit down Mexican food. I say "traditional-ish" because it isn't as greasy or heavy as some of the other places in the neighborhood. Love the drinks, the chips, and the vegetarian refried beans. I had the shrimp diablo, which was plenty spicy- and delicious. My date loved his steak tacos. I'm thrilled I live within walking distance of this place!
author: Ann F.

description: This is my new favorite mexican spot! First off the space was great - very cozy, vintage and kitschy. The booths are roomy if you are a party of 2-3...but more than 3 can get crowded. Drinks - I tried both the blueberry margarita and a regular margarita...major yum and major potent.  Chips and salsa were excellent. We had a coconut ceviche for  our appetizer - it was delish, but the consistency was too soupy. I would have liked more seafood and less soupy sauce. I LOVED my entree - chicken and avocado enchiladas with refried bean. My first reaction was awesome the portions are not intimidating. I was able to clean my plate. The pesto enchilada sauce was a nice added touch! I can't wait to go back here. I'll definitely want to stay for dessert and  another margarita.
author: Samira S.

description: I have been looking high and low for a place to replace the not-so-great Puerto Allegre and I've found it.This place is everything you want in a fun, festive experience. I looovvve the host for squeezing me and 11 of my friends in on a very busy Saturday night. The margaritas were great and and from 11pm-12am they had happy hour! 3 bucks a pop! The food all tasted really fresh and the portions were generous. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful, even when we got drunk and slightly unruly. It's nothings fancy but it sure bets the hell out of your other sit-down Mexican restaurants, i.e. Puerto Allegre and La Rondalla(yuck!).
author: Kathy K.

description:
people say, 'dont go for the food--- go for the drinks!' 

 i gotta say VC's FOOD DESERVES MORE CLOUT. we had the chicken enchiladas, new shrimp enchiladas, nachos, and chile con queso. all the dishes were yummy. it would be great to have a plate of one shrimp/one chix enchilada because both are so nice. one with a creamy red sauce and the other with a green. i was happy my friend was willing to go halfsies. 
the mango margaritas were good, but somewhat filling & too thick. basically like a meal in a glass. i'll stick to original next time and save my appetite for the food.
author: SF U.

description: Wow - talk about serendipity. We were headed for one restaurant that was supposed to be on 24th Street which apparently is no longer there. So, since we had a parking space, we yelped Mexican Restaurants around our location (between 23rd and 24th on Mission) and saw that the Velvet Cantina was on 23rd. Off we went, found it and laughed at it's "interesting" decor - red velvet curtains, red lights draped across wooden beams, red booths and chairs - very bordello (in a fun way). Anyhow, to the point - the food was fantastic! The BEST chicken mole I've ever had, the best restaurant salsa I've ever had and great service. And OK, the margaritas were fantastic too. I can't wait to go back - it's my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco! (and apparently a well kept LGBT hangout secret!)
author: Maureen M.

description: At this point Velvet Cantina is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. It's the kind of place that I'm always in the mood for because the servers and bartenders rule and the food is consistently great. I still get the same thing every single time - avocado cactus enchiladas - because I insist it's one of the best things I've ever eaten. Recently I've become a huge fan of the cabbage they serve everything with. Some variety of spicy, probably pickled cabbage. I've tried the chile con queson and the nachos as well. They're also fantastic. Pair them with a pitcher of margaritas and you're set.
author: C P.

description:
uh-huh... i've dined, drank, tossed my cookies and panties at this place.  it's wonderful, i keep going back and learning something new about myself,  like three shots of tequila in half an hour and i'm LIT gets me an escort home with a tuck in.

dont' get me wrong its not ALL about the drinks, the food is AWESOME here....el pastor, nachos (with chorizo) and steak tacos  totally deliver in that way only mexican food can....by sedating you and then carrying you into a coma....

the bartenders are all FUN, nice and cute, this really makes the place fun every time.
author: erica u.

description: I absolutely love this place.  I kept thinking to myself that I would love to throw a big birthday party here.  The food is awesome, the staff is fun and super cool. Looking forward to coming again.
author: Juan J.

description: Cozy, delicious, reasonably priced, and dripping with atmosphere. A bunch of us went over there recently and ate family style, washing everything down with a pitcher of frozen watermelon margaritas. The Bordello Burrito and Chicken Mole were both wonderful, but what really blew my mind was their Avocado Cactus Enchiladas. Hoo wee! I will definitely be coming back for a plate of those.
author: Mer Y.

description:
This IS a great place.  Though it's new, I hope it sticks around.  

Even though it is hard to spend more than six bucks on a burrito in the Mission, this place is still worth a look, because it has good food, a full bar with bartenders who make good margaritas, and pretty good service when they're not too busy.  

Obviously, you can find cheaper Mexican food in the Mission.  You can find cheaper, really good food in the Mission.  But usually the atmosphere is spartan, or downright scary (think El Farolito at 3am), with nothing stronger than a Dos Equis in sight.  That may be good value, but it can also be depressing.
author: Dave N.

description: I came here last night and was impressed with their 'elixirs' that they make with their own infused vodkas and tequilas.  And the decor is really pimped-out (hence the 'velvet' in their name).
author: Rego S.

description: Came here for a friend's good-bye party and would definitely recommend it for big parties. The place is loud and friendly. The food and margaritas are very flavorful. I ordered the chicken avocado enchiladas and was very satisfied since the portions were HUGE. Of course the food cannot be compared to the authentic, home-made-Mexican-food-sold-on-the-street that I'm used to, but the restaurant certainly does dress up their dishes. Plus, you can't really have horrible Mexican food in the Mission, right?
author: Natalie T.

description: Classy in a seedy kind of way.  Great chips.  Met my chica here before a night out on the town.  I didn't have time for dinner, but I'll be back next time I'm in the Ciudad.
author: Joe B.

description: I always expect to leave here sober. It never happens. Watermelon margaritas. Please and Thank You.
author: Madalyn F.

description: Great restaurant!  Everyone's right about the portion sizes though!  Huge!  The restaurant itself is much smaller than I imagined it to be.  We did have a couple different people waiting on us, so I was kind of confused as to who our server was but nonetheless, service was very attentive.  The food was fantastic.  I had the avocado chicken enchiladas, yum!  We also shared the cornbread sopes, excellent...I just wish they gave you more!  All four of us indulged in the smores nachos at the end.  All I can say is- be prepared to share!  So much sweetness, so rich!  But oh so good.  The only reason for the four star rating (rather than a five) is the location.  Nothing against them but I'm sorry, just not a fan of that area and therefore don't know if/ when I'll be back but please don't let that discourage you from giving it a try!
author: Kelly H.

description:
I'd been here twice, and they've only been open for a couple months.  I'll begin my saying...thank la virgen de guadalupe for another margarita pitcher-serving restaurant that serves chips and salsa without charging.  I love it already.  Not only that, their pitchers are damn tasty.  i'd venture to say better than puerto alegre AND la rondalla.  Thier food is a bit pricey, but you can tell they pay special attention to the food.  Their achiote asada tacos are a killer with jack cheese in between the tortillas.  The ceviche is a small portion, but very delicious.  Their salsa is also fresh.  I did try their chile verde and it tasted a little bland.  Their staff is really cool and we've never had to wait.  I give it a few months before folks start learning of the margaritas.  Then i'll review again.  Popularity always changes the food, drink and service.  I really hope Velvet Cantina doesn't.  Lastly, the restaurant is divided into two spaces.  I love the bar room with the wooden moldings and cool vibe.  Can't wait to have my pitcher again!

Updated Review 6/1/06...
OK, Chile Verde this time was much much better.  Margaritas are still very tasty.  For being a thursday night, no wait.  I've come to appriate it more now.  Not too crowded, but enough people for a lil bit of eye candy. I was here on Friday about a month ago and the wait was too long.  Our server wasn't as friendly, but standardly attentive.  Maybe was having a bad day.
author: Adrian N.

description: I really wanted to like this place, but the only reason I am giving more than one star is for the great service. The drinks were bad, the food was bad, even the music was out of place.
author: Justine K.

description: This place was as expected: loud, fun and delicious. Try the steak tacos and be sure to have a margarita.
author: A T.

description: Cool little Mexican place which accommodated a party of eight on a same day reservation in the city. I kept hearing about how impossible it would be to find a place for a large party on a Saturday night. Though the place was packed, they were able to get us a table in a very short time.  They were soo sweet and gave us comp drinks cuz it took 'em a little awhile to get the table ready. I do have to say, margaritas were very good and this coming from a girl who's not a big fan of margaritas. The food was good with interesting combos... Had cactus avocado enchiladas that were very delicious. And the salsa n chips before entree was yummy too. Only negative to this experience... Our appetizers never came through. They were really sorry about that and took it off of our bill but it was a bit funny to have the entree come out first n they were trying to figure out what happened to the starters. But overall, it's a good place and I'm hoping to go back next time i'm up there.
author: Sue T.

description: Went on a quiet Sunday and loved the decor immediately (someone mentioned a rec room, and they got it right). My first margarita came with some added protein in the form of a fly (there's a reason that tequila bottles come with corks rather than spouts), so my second and third were free, top-shelf, and very good. Props to the bartender and his witty sidekick for handling the situation with grace and good service. For apps, the gaucamole was rich and spicy, with a perfect amount of cilantro, and the nachos were addictive (I don't know what they put in their black beans, but man, is it good. I could have eaten them with a spoon.). I've heard from foodie friends that the entrees are disappointing, so we didn't try any. Overall, I'd say the place has the right components, but hasn't quite gotten it together yet.
author: Kimberly O.

description: This is my new favorite restaurant!!!  Okay okay, it could very well be because I have a huge crush on the bartender, or it could be the shots I had after dinner.  To be honest, I really don't remember much of the food but I think it was pretty good.  I did really like the redecoration job, and the staff was so wonderful to us - they accommodated a group of 12+ with no reservation for an impromptu birthday dinner at 9:30.  They were great and I have every intention of going back soon so I can try more of the food.  And flirt with Peter of course!
author: kerry l.

description: Spent more on booze than on the food - always a good sign!  The perfect margarita, bold statement that I had to confirm or deny, was pretty good, although not perfect.  The ceviche was pineappley, but I thought it was delicious and a nice twist on a traditional treat.  The steak tacos and the chili verde were both great - and the rice and beans were perfect.  Yummy!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
If you are going here for chips and salsa (free with drinks!), a pitcher of margaritas, a side of black beans and guacamole while sitting at the bar, this place rules.  But as you probably noticed, we're giving this place only three stars, not the the 5 stars appropriate for a place that rules.  Here's why: bad music, the nouveau mexican is not that good and it's a bit on the expensive side.  Now, nouveau mexican doesn't mean bad, but if that's what you are going for, you better be kick ass at it or else you get the obvious "this isn't authentic!" criticism from the white people you are trying to cater to.  Oh and fat bitches like to order plates of nachos as a side and eat the entire thing like they was starving in Somalia (also known as SOMA for us in the know,  you know, us really sympathetic it girls who adopt starving babies).  This is probably the perfect spot for you Marina folks to come get "scummy" in the Mish.  In that case I recommend the sushi a la carne asada al pomodoro fresco authentico.
j/k marina folks.  stay home, there's no beer pong here.  
Right, so salsa, chips, beans, guacamole + margaritas = muy bueno! ha ha
oh la rondalla, why won't you open again?!
author: Katherine K.

description: Margaritas are created from scratch at the Cantina - try the Watermelon Margarita - it is Oh so Good! I really liked the chicken and avocado enchiladas - it has this really good - cilantro/pesto sauce on the enchilada. My wifes chicken tacos were as she said a tad  dry. Fun Ambiance - nice and dark inside - with electronic music in the background. 4 stars for moi
author: Christian S.

description: admittedly, i didn't try the margarita, but i did have the chicken avocado enchildadas, which the waiter recommended over the chilaquiles. very unimpressive. mediocre at best. pineapple agua fresca was ok but stringy with tons of ice. the chips and salsa were the highlight of the experience. i won't go back here again unless it's to try the margarita.
author: Bella S.

description: I love this place. I really do. Delicious foods. Only problem is that both times I've been here with a big group, and HAD A RESERVATION, we didn't get seated until at least one hour post-reservation time. I mean, an entire hour? The first time it happens, you assume its a fluke. You give the benefit of the doubt. Things happen. People post up at their table and what can you do. But twice? Really? The point of a reservation is to not wait an hour for your table.
author: J J.

description: Best place in town. Great staff, great food, great drinks, great bartenders, great location. A must go in the Mission!
author: That G.

description: The food was great, but the service was pretty poor.  The servers were all very nice, but it took about 20 minutes just for me to get a drink.  Plus, the bar screwed up my margarita.  So, if you don't mind slow service, this is a pretty decent place.
author: Eileen C.

description: Pretty good, but not great. The pitcher of mango margarita was very strong. Entrees: cactus avocado enchilada (tasty enough), flanked by pickled cabbage and the usual duo of rice and black beans (heaping, but nothing special). The cilantro pesto is pretty awesome though.
author: Maximillian M.

description: This is a special little place tucked away... I love going there for the margaritas and chile con queso... probably the best I have ever had.  They are super nice and I am happy everytime I go there.  Like most restaurants in the Mission, if you go there past 7, especially on a weekend, be prepared to wait.  Tho there is a crowded bar where you can drink margz while you wait, ain't nothing wrong with that.
author: Diosa L.

description:
This place has got some cool, funky ambiance and the food's not bad.  Their chicken mole is actually darn tasty, if you like that chocolate plus chicken combo.  And if you're looking for a strong margarita, this is your place.  

However, I have one gripe about Velvet Cantina (a gripe large enough for me to feel compelled to create a yelp account and make my gripe public!).  When I called to make resies for my large party, I was told that I could only have the table for 2 hours since it was a Saturday night.  Check, understood.  Well turns out our food took forever to come out since the kitchen was busy cooking for the wedding reception in the other room.  Our waiter was cool and apologetic -- no problemo we said, we were in no rush.  But then once the food came out, another waitress totally hurried us along, grabbing our plates before we even had a chance to put our forks down, throwing to-go boxes on our table along with the check...without even asking if we wanted dessert!  NOT cool, especially since it was their fault we were lagging.
author: Lilo F.

description: Best spot to go. I love to food people are great. local spot to check out drinks are good and not to much money either
author: Jorge B.

description: Ok, this place gets two stars...and that's only cuz they make a tasty cheap margaritas! The food on the hand was pretty poor, the chile verde tasted like a boiled old shoe, and not even a spicy one!!
author: Matthew R.

description: Definitely check this place out.  The atmosphere was fun, the drinks were strong, the staff was very generous (a round of shots for everyone in the dining area and business cards to come back for a complimentary margarita) and the food was-- mostly good.  My meat was way too tough, which is -1 star in my book, but I promise to go back and give it another go.  I'll let you know if it bumps up to 4+...
author: Mara H.

description:
Picture the Reagle Beagle with a Tex-Mex flair. And if you're too young to understand what the Reagle Beagle is... please don't ask me as I go drown myself in mango margaritas. 

I really liked this place... it fills a hole in the Mission. If you hate waiting forever at Puerto Allegre or can't quite enjoy the food at La Rondalla, this is that nice in between place that serves decent food, reasonable prices (not taqueria prices, but restaurant prices), and a full bar! 

All the appetizers and salads were $5-6 (I think) and the entrees were at max $14... but I think most were closer to $10 or $11. 

I liked the free chips -- they appear to be homemade chips -- thick and substantial. Ahem. And my friend and I split a Citrus Salad which was good - not AMAZING, but tasty. We also got Cornbread Sopes, now those were yummy and I haven't seen those anywhere else. We also split the Chicken Avo enchiladas -- a seemingly popular item for the Yelp set. I thought they were pretty decent too -- the rice was really flavorful. 

They make different fruity margaritas, and boy do they have a heavy pour. They also sell by the pitcher -- definitely a plus in my eyes. 

I agree with whomever said that this is a good, chill birthday party spot for a big group. Not too pricey, cozy/divey atmosphere, and good margaritas.
author: J K.

description: We went here by default for my friend's birthday.  The appetizers were delicious and the salsa was addictive.  I don't remember the margaritas...they were probably that good but the reason I'll go back is the food.  Being of Mexican decent and having been born in the Mission, there isn't much in terms of Mexican fare that impresses me.  I've had the "best" tacos burritos, churros, tamales, etc. this side of Operation Gatekeeper.  Yuppified Mexican food is not my bag.  Great hole in the walls abound.  But to find a creative yet traditional restaurant in the Mission that doesn't take itself too seriously gets massive brownie points in my book.  I had the quesadilla tacos.  The meat was moist and flavorful and to add cheese oozing out of the tortillas the held it all together was all I needed to become a fan.
author: Captain Happy Pants H.

description:
After reading the 96 Hours review, I had to see for myself...
I took three total foodies.  We've each been in SF over 12 years so many many nights over the early years at puerto allegra, la rondalla...tastes, incomes and budgets have afforded us upward into other levels of dining hence but that being said, Velvet Cantina brings back the fun WITH QUALITY and awesome prices.  BRING IT ON!!  

Upon entering the bar teeming with a great diverse crowd, we ordered house margaritas while waiting for our reservation.  This set the mood perfectly.  it was a balanced drink, not too sweet, perfect strength.  For starters, we got the Cornbread Sopes, very good, I thought it was pork but the menu does state it's chicken...either I even ate the garnish, every last bite.  Three entrees we get total thumbs up are the Achiote Steak Tacos, Chicken Avocado Enchiladas and the Tri Tip. All perfected prepared, well portioned, even for guys and really tasty. We were torn on the Lasagna.  The description sounds awesome but my friend who ordered it thought it was too runny.  The flavors are there, distinct and tasty but the texture and consistency didn't work for her.  I liked it but it didn't work for her.  This is a place where I could have literally been content with margaritas, chips, salsa and guac. (a must) but very glad to have discovered a place with awesome food.  I will be back many many times for sure.  Oh, the service is good and staff is consistent, friendly.

Travis and Pete are magicians with concoctions...inviting styles and Pete is an A's fan too- NICE!   The house margaritas (rocks no salt for me) ROCK ROCK ROCK and again the chicken avocado enchiladas were consistently fantastic.  However, last night's chili verde was not a favorite.  The broth is well spiced with excellent flavor, but a little too watery and the downer was that the pork was overcooked and tough... I will continue to eat here though because, overall, it's the most fun thing in SF right now.

OK (after many visits later), I am officially a regular now...Gabe is da bomb and has an awesome crew, Justin, Darrius, Jamie, John ;-)  ...all will treat you right.  Last night we again had the chicken avocado enchiladas (terrific) and the chicken mole. The mole is rich, heavy and perfect. It has a little more chocolate than other moles' I have had but it's really really good~~
author: Brian G.

description: Gal pals Amy, Tracy, and I dropped in on this little dig in the Mission one Saturday night. We found seats right away at around 6:30 pm (it gets a bit crowded around 7pm). Our chips and salsa were good.... the tortilla chips were crunchy and light--- we could have eaten more. My dish was good--- achiote tacos (steak on a soft taco w/ sour cream and guacamole) lots of Spanish rice and beans too. My friends had the chicken enchiladas, chicken strips, and salad...... ay caramba it was nice and filling. We were on the verge of food coma but not to the point where we couldn't partake of the crazy tasty smores nachos. (Think cinnamon churros with chocolate and marshmallows). They are best when warm. Staff were nice and hunky and the atmosphere is cozy but too dark for my taste.
author: Patricia M.

description:
wow, BIG disappointment.  i was SO excited to try this place, i'd been talking about it for weeks.  i even said so to our server who sat us.  unfortunately we didn't see her again for 30 minutes later.  30 minutes of chips and salsa without even the promise of water???  i wanted to leave.  

we should have.  the whole experience was probably the worst service i've had in san francisco.  i think the problem was that it was one server for the whole section.  so maybe it was an off night.  that might inspire me to come back, but the food wasnt even that great.  i'd MUCH rather go to puerto allegre if i'm looking for a sit down place.
author: Natalie H.

description:
cantaloupe, blueberry, watermelon margaritas +

nachos on the house+

decent food+

tequila shots on the house+

flaming smores desert on the house+

= 10 drunk, full, happy people celebrating a friend's birthday.

oh, and did I mention everyone paid $30?
author: Lauren V.

description:
good, strong margaritas. 

nice ambiance.

friendly and attentive staff.

good food. QUESO - where else can you get that in SF? although it's not the best queso and definitely nothing like the stuff in texas.

had the cactus enchiladas - mmm. can't wait to go back.
author: michella s.

description: Pretty good food although the bordello theme is nothing short of retarded. Had the chile verde, was pleasantly surprised that it didn't suck when given the location and the emphasis on margaritas I expected oversalty overspicy and instead got a pretty tender braise. Totally cheap prices, though they are a sit-down competing with any of the zillion burrito shops within earshot of the place.
author: David Y.

description:
a solid 4 stars.

the service was of quality and very attentive. just try them out for a tequila recommendation. who can decide with 25+ types of silky smooth goodness?

order the queso, try spreading it around on your entree. then hit the gym twice the next day.

if you blink your drinks, appetizers and entrees may magically appear as soon as they're ordered. a shock and appreciated.

order the chicken taco's, deeeelish and juicy.

chips and smores? cactus enchiladas? where's the velvet (update...found it)? 

finally...bring friends, lots of friends...do shots, lots of shots.
author: Bruce A.

description: Last night I took my visiting parents and sister to the Velvet Cantina where we had impeccably friendly service, brilliant food and potent margaritas. My already outgoing and eccentric mother has a condition that makes her very forgetful and mood sensitive. Our waiter and buss boy last night were so incredibly sweet to her, receiving her hugs and flirtations with smiles and open arms. It made our night! We had a sensational time and will remember the evening for many years to come. Heartfelt thanks to the Velvet Cantina:)
author: tiffany s.

description:
Absolutely love everything about it.  Ok wait, not exactly true - the big ass burrito they serve isn't much to get excited about.  It seems more like a menu filler for the generic American clientele but other than that...   I really look forward to the hot wait staff and then of course the chicken mole, the guacamole, and the chips...  mmmm...  

I haven't found better Mexican anywhere else yet!  Just find something better than that burrito.
author: David A.

description: I recently came her with a group for dinner. The food was pretty good. I ordered the chicken mole which I enjoyed. Definitely make reservations because this place gets packed especially on Friday and Saturday nights. The prices are also pretty reasonable as well, so I would recommend trying it out.
author: Eva C.

description: very cool and casual mexican restaurant. large portions, reasonable prices and good service make this restaurant a great place to eat.
author: Alon G.

description: The chicken enchiladas w/ jalapeno cream sauce is TO DIE FOR!!!  Not to mention the nice eye-candy, I mean waitstaff & bartenders!  This is a great place to start a nite out with friends... Grab a pitcher of the many flavors of margaritas and get ready for some fiesty flirtation, a la Peter the magnificent bartender and his saucy comrades!  The ambiance varies depending on the time and day but usually becomes a boisterous crowd of shot-guzzling fun times!  You won't be sorry you stopped by!
author: Sandy M.

description:
come here for the margaritas, especially the fruity ones. come here for the nachos that are big enough to feed 2 people dinner, with creamy cheese that i've heard is store bought... but who cares when it  makes my mouth water at the thought of it.   do not come here for a nice dinner.  the rest of the food is mediocre at best.  come for the decor that is like a retro mexican restaurant. come for the  service that is friendly and attentive 

the music tends to be played way too loud. when the place is packed full of people all yelling over each other, conversation is next to impossible. but then again it may not matter after a few margaritas.  so come early and the generally bad food (except for the nachos) and noise level might not bother you by the time the delicious margaritas have done their magic
author: Lisa T.

description: Their margaritas are lethal and oh soo delicious! Food is good but not amazing. All i can say is that I will hands down choose going here over Puerto Allegre any day!
author: ingrid H.

description: Great margaritas.  Good food.  Nice atmosphere.  Hot bartender.
author: Chris C.

description: This place has great ambiance and super, SUPER fast service, but when it comes down to it, the food is under-seasoned and just not that inspired. I came here once with boyfriend and a friend and I had the nopales enchiladas, which were pretty good, but I came here this evening with my boyfriend and we split the chimichurri caesar salad and the veggie burrito, and both were worse than I could have made at home. The caesar was fresh, but it was just romaine, a spicy dressing, fake parmesan and tortilla strips. And it was small. The veggie burrito was completely boring. It was huge so I thought, "Yay, this will be satisfying!" No. It was mostly rice, with some pinto beans, some guacamole, unseasoned boiled potatoes, cactus bits and some cheese. First of all, potatoes in a burrito are filler. Secondly, they weren't even seasoned, just boiled!!! You get my point. Everything was so blah. And it was way too expensive for what we got. Not going back.
author: Laura M.

description: I am at the velvet cantina right now the service was great the food was awesome. However, after I paid my waiter and tipped him 20% he  informed me that he needed to accommodate a party of 10 and if I could leave the table to make room for them. Really? I can't believe he told me this I wish he could've told me my party would get kicked out of the table if a bigger party arrived!
author: Rose B.

description:
seems like a decent place to go with a group to eat and get some drinks.

Try the michelito - Sol with lime juice, hot sauce and a rim of salt. Sound bad and I've never been able to properly replicate, but is absolute heaven if you're in the mood.
author: blimp w.

description:
so, everyone knows that san francisco has been in dire need of a good place to have margarita's and mexican food, just look at tres agaves!

velvet cantina has good margaritas and the guacamole was good too! but the food stunk, we barely ate it and only paid for a portion of it. watery beans! chewy grisly steak tacos...stale tortilla's, what the hell!
author: Kai H.

description: I've never had the displeasure of having a meal at this joint, but my co-worker just finished describing her and her hubbie's fun-filled weekend of battling respective cases of food poisoning stemming from the consumption of beef at Velvet Cantina.  Prospective customers--BEWARE, FAITES ATTENTION, ACHTUNG, @#$%%   (oops, I guess I forgot to install the japanese character code on my computer).
author: Momo R.

description: With somewhat limited choices for vegetarians, this little Mexican joint with the highly erotic name was probably much more fun for the girl in our party who drank all the margaritas.  But, my burrito was decent, despite the price.  The decor is original.  I might come back and try again another day.
author: Apollo L.

description: I'm not sure if this place has authentic mexican food, but its good.  A friend told me its more of mexican/american fusion.  The menu is a bit limited, only has a few items, but most items are really good.  They have killer Margaretas.
author: Dishar R.

description:
this place is great!  

i didn't have a margarita, but reports are favorable.  they have a nice wine and beer list for those of us who can't handle their tequila.

the food was very tasty.  we had read about the avocado/nopales enchilada and it did not disappoint.  delicious guacamole and VERY YUMMY homemade chips -- perhaps my current fave.

the main room was a little loud -- music plus general hub-bub -- but we sat in the extra room off the kitchen and it was nice and quiet and breezy.  the wait staff was very friendly, very mission "hip", and totally not latin.  not a big deal, but my accent (which is pretty bad) was way better than their's.  :)

the main reason for only 4 stars = the price.  a little on the high side, given the food, location, etc.  but i will give them this: the portions were quite big.
author: hillary h.

description: The fresh fruit margs are great, last time we had pineapple and save room for dessert, Smore Nachos.......
author: Adrienne G.

description:
First and foremost, the margaritas were to die for. Absolutely to die for. This is probably the most redeeming quality of this place. Yep, it was definitely the margaritas. 

Got there on Friday night around 8:30 and the place was absolutely packed. We didn't have a reservation so we ended up waiting for about an hour for a table. I took this lovely opportunity to watch the clientele and observed a fair amount of douchiness. Didn't really appreciate the crowds of alpha males donned in white button down shirts sporting a serious coke vibe. Dunno, maybe it's just me. 

So after an hour wait, I expected the food to be spectacular.... and it just wasn't. My friend and I split a huge plate of nachos drizzled with guacamole, some sort of cheese sauce, and a sporadic black bean or two. The tortilla chips were delicious. The rest was underwhelming. Nachos are supposed to have refried beans dammit! 

I guess that's what you get when you go to a new-age gourmet Mexican restaurant. I'll definitely come back for the drinks, but not for the food.
author: A K.

description:
Last time I was in town they had just closed because of their kitchen fire.  I can't wait to get back, although I'm mourning the removal of the peanut butter tamales from their menu.  

The prices are great, the food takes a nice departure from the typical cheese laden (not that I have a problem with this) boring beans and rice Mexican joint.

Yum.
author: Teresa I.

description: The Velvet Cantina is a wonderful little lively spot for some good food and excellent drinks.  With a nice selection of Tequila here, it's hard not too pass up a margarita or even a shot or two of the stuff.  You will find no Jose Cuervo here (thank goodness!), but you will find some Chamuco, yumm!  The staff is wonderful, greeting you with a warm smile and friendly hello.  To the bartenders, thank you for the tasty drinks and the laughs.  You guys are awesome!
author: Cynthia C.

description: food and ratings are all relative to what people like and who they are. that being said I have been here a handful of times and I keep coming back; always good margaritas, great chile con  queso, smokin' mole chicken and did I mention the margaritas - we usually get hammered on 3, stuffed on the food and waddle home. The food is always fresh and creative, service is sometimes good and sometimes slow - depends on what waiter you get. and yes the bar portion is filled with hipsters, but what place in SF isn't these days - that's another story.
author: Michael E.

description: stepped into the low-lit, sexy red bar side room around 9:30pm on a wednesday and seemed to be accepted by the mission peeps which was totally unexpected.  i ordered a corona which was a fail on my part since everyone else was sharing a pitcher of watermelon margaritas which were so frigging delicious that i promised myself i'd be back again some day.  it was like a chilled agua fresca watermelon drink mixed with tequila over ice. get on down here to try one. arriba arriba!
author: Holly B.

description: I went here last night with my boyfriend and his mom and we all loved it.  It definitely feels more like a bar like some other people have mentioned but it didn't affect our experience at all.  It was pretty busy in there for a Tuesday night and there was a short wait for a table but we ordered some drinks and hung out until a booth opened up.  The margaritas were good.. if you were to ask my boyfriend's mom she would say that they were too strong but I thought they were just right :) Anyway, the food was great.  Even the chips, salsa and guacamole were good.  I ordered the avocado cactus enchiladas and they were so tasty.  I only had a few bites left but I still took it to-go so I could enjoy the leftovers haha.  My boyfriend got the bordello burrito which I didn't try but he said was really good.  His mom got the naked relleno which was really tasty as well. If I were to go back I would probably get that.  This is a really cool place to go to and the service is good too.  I definitely want to go back with my girlfriends because I feel like it's the perfect place to go to for a great meal and some drinks!
author: Kristin P.

description: Walked in and it was packed, good music playing and dive bar like setting. The boy friend and I had to walk around a bit in order to find the host. During our wait we had a round of drinks, the cilantro tequila gimlet was delish! Nice and fresh, and the margaritas were strong too! We were sat in a nice booth and both ordered an entree, and both of us were pleased. I wouldn't say the food was miraculous, but it was good, pretty yummy.  However it took near 25 minutes for us to get our second round of drinks, and our waiter, as was most of the staff, was goofing around and not paying attention to any of us customers. Towards the end of our meal, the table right next to us turned into a fraternity house in the sense that all the wait staff were taking big ass shots of tequila with some guests. I wouldn't really care if they didn't let the alcohol get in the way of serving us but it did. It felt as if my boyfriend and I were interrupting their night out, definitely awkward. Our check was then thrown on our table, even though we planned on ordering dessert, but I guess they could care less.
