I might come back here for a drink or something but with all the other great restaurants in that area its on to the next one.
author: Tabitha H.

description: While the hot waiter nearly tipped the scales to a 5-star review, I don't want to give him a big ego so I kept it at 4. This place is great! My date and I went here on a Saturday night and the place was packed. We started with some guacamole which was delicious, unfortunately, we filled up a little too much on this to fully enjoy our entrees. I ordered the chicken/avocado enchilada and he got the mole. Both were delicious with really good flavors. The portions are HUGE, so we could have done with sharing an entree, but lesson learned to lay off the guacamole next time. Sadly, I was playing the part of sober sister, so I wasn't able to try any of what looked to be amazing cocktails, but now I have something to look forward to for next time!
author: Liz Y.

description: I made a reservation at this place based upon the reviews I read on yelp and boy am I glad i did!!!  This place was awesome!  The ambience is incredible and really fun!  We ordered a pitcher of margaritas and it kicked our butts!  So good!!  We ordered the ceviche as an appetizer and my only complaint about this was that they brought it out with the rest of the main meals, which I always hate when a restaurant does that, however, it was tasty.  They have a very unique menu.  I ordered the avocado cactus enchiladas and they were incredible!!  Tangy and spicy, very interesting flavor!  The black beans were awesome as well.  My boyfriend ordered the chile verde and loved it!  It was his birthday and our waiter surprised him with an order of ridiculously delicious mexican nachos, which are sugar/cinnamon tortilla chips with chocolate and marshmellow, which the waiter proceeds to torch.  So GOOD!!!!  Speaking of our waiter, he was amazing. He was right on top of everything and had a good sense of humor.  I loved this place and can't wait to go back when I'm in San Fran!!  Go here, you won't regret it!!
author: Steph H.

description: Had a great time here during a bachelorette partY (Hey I am a gay guy, I am allowed).  Our hot server, took off his shirt and let the bride to be take a body shot off his chest... He was almost as tasty as the food ;)
author: Gerald L.

description: Sexy, sultry, and smooth-food, drink and service. EVERYONE was super nice. Peter-the barkeep-made us the best margs! Food was awesome. Really, a good review is short and sweet, so here ya go VC. Loved it!!
author: Virginia D.

description: I luuurrrrrrrve this resto. Velvet nachso are amazingly creamy cheezy good, chips n' salsa are great, comfy atmosphere, and always good times to be had.
author: Cody E.

description: Maybe I was too excited to check this place out?  The exterior (cute name), the atmoshphere (super chill swanky bar, dimly lit) and the menu (not your typical taqueria - some interesting sounding dishes) promises to be something good.  Well, sadly, not so much.  The main courses were week, in fact one of our group sent there dish back.  However, the appetizers were tasty, the drinks (infused tequilas) were good and the chips rocked.  So all in all, I am going to give it another shot (why not...it is blocks from my house)...but maybe next time just for some tasty drinks and appetizers....
author: Michelle G.

description: As soon as I walked in I knew I found my new happy hour spot.  It felt like I was at my uncle's funky basement with all that dark wood and formica but with that unique twist where I actually wouldn't be embarrassed to bring my friends.  The menu was tempting and very satisfying with the shrimp diablo reminding me of Mexico.  Great wine, staff, and vibe!
author: michelle s.

description: I thought this place was so cute.  My friend and I were driving around the Mission on a Monday night in the pouring rain looking for a place to eat.  I noticed their huge sign in lights and had to try it out.  We even got movie star parking which I was so excited about.  I ordered the Apricot Fizz for my beverage and it was delicious.  My friend ordered the Ginger Tequila drink and it was stiff and tasty.  It was perfect because both of us were in a funk and after our first round we were back to our normal selves.  The food was okay.  I had the tri-tip which was fair and my friend had the tortilla soup which was delicious.  I like the atmosphere a lot because of the booths and I thought the employees were super cool.
author: Toni C.

description: I can see their sign from my living room window, I really want to love this place for the convenience alone.  The food has always been good enough, and the margaritas excellent, but oh my belly.  Not in the good way, in the very, very bad way.  Every time I've eaten there.  I'm not sure if I'll give the food another try, for now I'll stick to just having cocktails here.
author: Jen S.

description: Stick to the taquerias.  Besides the margaritas you can get the same and better food at local mission taquerias.  The staff was nice and the bar seemed like it could be lively and fun, but I went for the food and I was disappointed.
author: Bhavesh M.

description:
Good drinks. I had the chicken-avocado enchiladas with jalpeno cream sauce. Very good, and just the right portion size.

My only problem with them was that they did not have any specials the night I went. Nonetheless, it was a good sitdown experience in the Mission. 

Oh, and their salsa was not up to snuff. There was too much oregeno in it. It was as if they used seasoned tomatoes out of a can, where that sort of seasoning can be an issue. So, I am giving this place 4* because I lack the mechanism on this site to give it 3.5*. It was a fun evening so it get the benefit of the doubt.  :)
author: Rahul T.

description:
3.5 starts - because everything was pretty darn good, but the ceviche was just nasty. my friend ordered it as her meal - it looked like a cup of soup - totally unexpected.  tasted like something from a thai restaurant, not very good.  the chili con queso was great - but how can melted cheese be bad? the guac was the freshest i have had in a while. 

the empanadas were good too but a little to heavy on the fried side. the smores nachos were DELICIOUS!  watermelon margies were great, a bit on the sweet side -  to have more than one would be a headache in a glass, so switch to regular. 

all in all - fun atmosphere - good vibe, fun waiters, and good/standard food.  nothing that will blow your mind, but definitely a good thing to have right down the street! reasonably priced for groups too!
author: B H.

description: I was here last week, and OMG yum.  everything on the menu is great... go with friends so you can order one of everything.  And their house margarita washes it all down perfectly.  I went with two other people and we had leftovers and drank a pitcher for less than $20 each.
author: Simmi M.

description:
Came with a large group and was seated promptly while they served an endless supply of margarita pitchers.

I love the cactus entrees to be ordered, and any place that uses cheese whiz on their nachos is aces in my scorecard.
author: Kaveh A.

description: The cantaloupe margaritas are awesome! I am a margarita purist but always order the cantaloupe. As a Texas girl, its great to get chips, salsa, and queso. The cactus and avocado enchiladas are unique and tasty. The caeser salad has just a kick of spice. The chicken tortilla soup has a sour cream empenada in it. I love the soup, it's a miracle soup!
author: Melissa A.

description: I like the decor. the food was solid when i ate here. i got really drunk and stayed awhile.
author: Sprout S.

description: This place is like Cheers for 2008 and sever Mexican (or whatever lol).  The food is good and the enviroment is always relaxed with its dim lighting and warm colored paint.  It feels like you stepped inside of a real central american cantina but its right off of mission and its not ghetto in here at all.  While there are definately regulars this isnt the kind of place where you feel uncomfortable if  your a new face.  Try one of the house specialty margaritas.  They also have more unique tequilas then any other place Ive been.
author: Raymond P.

description: OK, so the website makes it seem like it is a bit 'more hip' than it might actually be.  But this turns out to be a good thing in this case, cause this place backs it sh** up with delicious food and yummy margaritas! Seems to be a great place for groups since there were many large reserved tables set aside, but still room for cozy 2 or 4 tops.  I have no complaints... Great food, Great service (actually very cute service!), and excellent margaritas by the pitcher!  Cheers to Velvet Cantina!
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is pretty cool.  Haven't eaten here, just drinks at the bar.  Prefer midweek visits, as it gets a little crowded and hip otherwise.  Bartender remembered my name when I walked in my second visit.  Interesting drinks, a serrano infused vodka with cucumber juice was really good.  So was the cilantro tequila drink, though I'm not a huge tequila fan.  Decent margaritas, judging from the sips I stole from the girls.  Good free chips and salsa.  The place is fairly small but reminds me of a cheesy nightclub, so I don't go too often, but I live right around the corner and it's a nice change sometimes.  Want to try the sangria but they're always out.
author: Jett S.

description: Great Mexican Food and even better margaritas (probably the best in the Mission) - we went there on my birthday and they gave us a free order of marshmellow chocolate nachos!
author: Steve J.

description: I can't give lot's of stars on this one b/c I was there only for drinks. Said drinks were awesome though. I also enjoyed the bartender's craic. It was a good time. I would like to go back and give the food a try.
author: shannon t.

description: So I write this review a bit reluctantly. I hate to share this place!! I know, that isn't neighborly of me. So I am going to share. This place is my favorite place to hang out in the city...period. The staff are excellent. Peter and the bar gang kick @#$!. Really. And the owner....the bomb. The margaritas are by far the best - the food is consistent and always enjoyable. They remember your name! Really I love this place - so much so that I put up with the insane crowd it drew for cinco de mayo. And that was only because I wanted to be loyal. I wasn't disappointed.
author: Tom R.

description:
Funny how you can spend so much time in an area and never know of little places like this.
The service was fairly attentive, pretty good. The drinks were hit or miss, I had the Cilantro gimlet which was an interesting concoction. It was pretty tasty, but one you take slowly since it had a veggie taste to it and was only slightly sweet. It was a hit with the table. However, my friend's margerita tasted like they used lime juice from the plastic "lime"...a miss in my opinion. My other friend and my 8 year old girl got virgin margeritas with seasonal fruit, which was fresh watermelon, and all I can say is HOLY CRAP, YUM! It was an amazing drink! Sweet and fresh..I almost stole it from my daughter, but that would be wrong :)
The food was so good, fresh ingredients and interesting combinations. Wonderful beans, which I didn't know were veggie until reading the other reviews. Great spanish rice. Super steak tacos.
Only lame part was that it took forever to get our entrees, forever.
Prices were not too shabby.
I will definitely be going back frequently. Hopefully the owners read the reviews and improve the delivery time of entrees.
author: Charlie C.

description: My boyfriend and I just happened to walk past this place the other night.  He'd noticed it before but I hadn't.  We decided to give it a shot and what an amazing find!!  The food was fantastic and the service great.  I had the chicken avocado enchiladas and he had the cactus avocado enchiladas and both were wonderful.  We didn't drink but their drink menu looked quite tasty.  We'll definitely be coming back to this spot.  My only suggestions would be to add some vegan items to the menu and some heat to the salsa.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Visited on 7/23/07
A chance to use another Cozmo card and close to the Marsh were the primary motivations to go here. We didn't sit in the inner sanctum where the action is, but took up one end of the (I assumed) communal table. Service was quick, good chips and salsa, Tecate for two bucks (they give you lime if you for "limon", so just say "lemon"). We started with Guacamole ($5.99), which was pretty good but small portion wise. The cornbread sopes ($6.49) were great - if you can, make sure every one in your party gets a whole one (there's two per order). Chiles Rellenos ($9.99), Chile Verde ($10.99) and Chicken and Avocado Enchiladas ($10.99) all come with your choice of beans. My cohorts were pleased with their selections. I liked my enchiladas well enough, but I miss the old days when the tortillas were dipped in hot lard just long enough to soften them up. I asked for no rice, so they my doubled my refried beans, a bit of overload. The prices here are just high enough to probably keep out most of La Raza, like over at Roosevelt Tamale Parlor, but I may just come back for one the specialty drinks so I can check out The Young and The Entitled in the other room!
author: Chili Bill E.

description:
I always think eating here is a great idea until I go again and hm, not as good as I was hoping.  I like the booths, the location, the decor that is nostalgic of my childhood, the cheesey name and the watermelon margaritas.  I am a sucker for a girly fruity drink on occasion and melons are a specific weakness.  I really do not like the chips, I don't care that they fry them in-house, I think they're too greasy and unevenly salted.  And the salsa is just weak!!!  Mild tomato water.  Blech.  I can't even remember what I ate last weekend, it was so boring.

Anyway, I'm sure I'll be here again, sometime when I'm walking by and get sucked in yet again.  I'll keep hoping for the food to improve.
author: Jessica T.

description: Velvet is one of my favorite places in the mission to hang.  Recently i learned that they had a fire.  My heart goes out to them and there families.  Can't wait till they get up and running again.  I need a good shot and margarita.
author: Drew S.

description: I really enjoy the margaritas here.  Flavor is great.  The atmosphere is great.  Make reservations if you go on a Thursday or Friday.  The food is good.  Must try the enchiladas with the cactus.  Must say this was very good and the flavor was almost home made (my dad makes this cactus dish).  Not bad for a night of fun, good food and lots of margaritas!
author: lori c.

description: We had a good time and the Mole was great.  Waiter didn't offer dessert and service was slow, considering he only has a couple of tables to work with.  Maybe just an off night but after reading the reviews on Yelp I was really looking forward to our experience.  Slightly disapointed.
author: Michele G.

description: I love this place! Most Mexican food places are pretty conventional, you know what's on the menu and you go in knowing what you want already. Or, at least, I do! This place, on the other hand, was quite a pleasant surprise, adding a few new twists on classic Mexican dishes. And, I would reccommend that everyone try at least two things. 1) Guacamole. It was to die for. Not that watered down crap you get a lot of places, this was thick and oh so tasty. 2) S'More Nachos. The creative new dessert was incredible and had me leaving my New Years Resolution at the door. Great place - everyone should go and bring your friends for a round of great margaritas, mellow fun environment, awesome food, and a wonderful serving crew.
author: Kat G.

description: Ok, nevermind the food and and drinks and atmosphere (which are all great)...what's really great about the Velvet Cantina are the bartenders. So nice and friendly and the last time I went, I ended up sharing a plate of the tortilla s'mores (weird as hell but good) with the bartender - for free. I always sit at the bar and end up talking to interesting people. They have good drinks, too. But go for the company. Really.
author: G O.

description: Okay, so the meat may not be all natural or free-range, the veggies not organic the tortillas may not be made from hand-ground maiz, but damn I love this place!  The food is tasty, filling and affordable.  The staff has always been very cool.  On many occasions not all of my party arrives at the same time and they never hassle us about it.  The margaritas are tart and boozy and the atmosphere is festive.  I go there at LEAST once every two months and never leave unsatisfied.  It's a great place to go with a group and just relax, stuff yourself and get a nice buzz going.  Highlights: Achiote Steak Tacos (my personal fav), Chili con Queso, Chicken Enchiladas and the ENORMOUS Roasted Burrito.  The only thing I have been unimpressed by are the desserts.  Luckily, I don't have much of a sweet tooth, so I won't even take away the fifth star...
author: Anthony C.

description: The salsa and chips were out of this world.  The mixed drinks were, as my dining companions reported, excellent.  However, the steak tacos were so tough and used such terrible cuts of meat they are almost to hard to chew.  I would go back there, but maybe try a different meal.  Or maybe just eat a ton of chips and salsa.  Seriously, that salsa was sooooo yummy.
author: Sofia M.

description: This place is everything a good mexican food restaurant should be.  It gets packed on weeknights and sometimes a wait, but we just hop over to Laszlo or Medjool for a drink while we wait.  The Velvet Nachos are SO wonderful and really should be considered an entree because the portion is freaking huge! They have good margarita specials as well.  Had a lovely pineapple margarita with their top shelf tequila.  Always friendly staff and food comes quickly.
author: Knitgirl P.

description: I have three words for you " Chili Con Queso" AKA cheese crack,lol. This is the best queso cheese ive ever had in my life, no lie. The margaritas were woooooooooooo my goodness, and very strong . Ive tried plenty of entrees and appetizers and all of them were so damm good. There velvet lasagna yummm. There Teri tip melted in my mouth. Oh and the tortilla chicken strips are great if your not that hungry and just wanna drink. This place is a cozy romantic lively spot. My girlfriend found it and we've returned at least 1-2 times a month. Definitely a fave.
author: Michelle F.

description: I really like Velvet Cantina.  Good food, good vibe, the service is fast and friendly.  Great vegetarian options.
author: J. M.

description:
Four of us out for a nice dinner in the Mission and what did we pick? Well, unfortunately a bar, nothing less and definitely nothing more.  Go only to have a Margarita.  

Appetizers, ah yes, (or would that be Aaaarggghhh!!)...Chips and salsa - canned stewed tomatoes. Guacamole - flavorless mush.  Chili con queso - less flavor than Velveeta and stewed tomatoes diluted to avoid any hint of flavor and/or staying on the greasy chips, then slightly heated.   I have never had to go into a Mexican restaurant and ask for bottled sauce to add flavor to salsa, guacamole and chile con queso, but here it is absolutely necessary.  But then again, the appetizers were the highlight of the meal.

Slow, sloppy, inattentive service.  Entre orders wrong.  Four entrées, but delivered over a 5-10 minute span while the waiter did what? Who knows?  Perhaps out of sympathy for other diners, pushed more Margaritas.  

One of our party thought that their burrito was great. It was big.  

Shrimp Diablo was a few shrimp swamped in thick stew of tomatoes, onion and peppers. The requested tortillas were slung, by someone flashing by the table, 20 minutes after the last entre arrived.  

The Chicken in Mole, tepidly warm lower legs drowned in a sauce of Hersey's syrup, Schilling's chili powder and enough sugar to make a week's supply of cotton candy at a good sized carnival. Hardly touched, (and that's a good thing!).Asked for beans no rice. Waiter kindly offered to replace the rice with a salad - great.  What did we get?  Lots of rice, no beans, and under the few chopped lettuce leaves, what, more rice!  

Naked Chile Relleno, well hardly exposed to peering eyes, perhaps there was a chile under the nopales/papas but hard to tell. Could have looked, but why bother?

Nuevo Mexican food, hardly.  No Way Yo  food is a far more accurate description. Avoid.
author: Geary L.

description: Food was very good. Found the House Margarita a disappointment. Too watery and without much taste. If I'm in the area I would stop in too eat but pass on their Margarita, I'd go for a Mexican beer instead. .
author: Bubba J.

description: Great Margaritas, great food, great salsa,  and even great music. This place is awesome.
author: Marina B.

description: I recommend coming here if you have a big group of people. They are very accommodating for large parties. Also it is very LOUD in here so it seems more party appropriate than date appropriate (more of a casual date place).  The margaritas here are off the chain good. I love their endless chips & salsa too. They keep them coming which is nice. I enjoy their Chimichurri Caesar salad, it is an interesting approach on a caesar as it has a spicier dressing topped with cotija cheese. My favorite dish here is the Chili Verde. It is a nice tender pork doused in the tomatillo sauce with fresh corn tortillas and sides of beans and rice. Their beans aren't stellar, kind of bland and undesirable. I love the velvet nachos. They are huge and can easily be shared. They are also only $7.99. I like to add chicken on them and they are perfectly filling and can soak up all the margaritas you order. I'd recommend coming here to start off your night for happy hour, then heading somewhere else.
author: Kristy H.

description: Mmm Hmm Good.  I felt like I was invited over to a friends house for a special dinner.  And the best thing was that they took a pretty traditional menu and enhanced items with fun seasonings.  The Ceviche was great.  The host and staff are very friendly.  I even enjoyed a "healthy" drink at the bar before devouring my flavorful Mexican dinner.  There's nothing wrong with a little spice with your evening. And you'll find it at Velvet Cantina Edibles & Elixirs!
author: Keith T.

description: Quite possibly a new favorite among the Ammo staff. Aside from a few crushes we've had on the bartender, resulting from several shots after dinner, the food there is quite enjoyable.  Definitely bring an appetite and try the grilled tri-tips, avocado cactus enchiladas, guacamole & chips, ceviche salsa...and of course, a margarita!
author: Ammo Marketing ..

description: Three pretty words: Chile. Con. Queso.
author: Conor C.

description: This place never fails to disappoint me. I love this place. Everything from the enchiladas, to the quesadillas to the tacos and the WATERMELON margaritas. Those are the best. I love the coziness of the restarant and the waiters/waitresses are always nice. And the prices are good too!
author: Darlene R.

description: I love the Velvet, almost everything about it.  From the owners of Blue in the Castro comes this yummy in the tummy Mexican restaurant.  It might take awhile to get a seat, but it is totally worth it.  The drinks are to die for and the bartender knows how to make your wait less daunting.  Order the cilantro gimlet for all things holy before you delve into the flavored margaritas.  Everything on the menu is fantastic but if you need a recommendation start with the corn bread sopes and for a main entree either the steak tips or chicken mole (falls off the bone!).  Keep an eye out for dancing Gabe, great host.  Save room for the s'more nachos.  This place still gets five stars, but it is very loud and can get a little toasty in there.  Suck it up and have another gimlet.
author: Thomas C.

description: So, so, so happy to see that the Velvet Cantina is open after it's fire before the holidays!  My friends and I have been dieing for the great margaritas, the great chips (made on the premises) and salsa, and the great bartenders-each and every one of them is friendly.  They all know how to get a party going and keep it that way.
author: MARGARITA V.

description: I love this place! Great Food, Great drinks, and   Peter, the bartender rocks! gotta stop by..
author: joann l.

description: I just moved to the Mission, I had heard great things about this place but was disappointed.  Got there and it was a zoo.  No room to walk and there was a line to put your name on the list for a table.  The food was ok but nothing special and definitely not the LA style mexican that I was craving.  The only good part of the dinner was the chili con queso which is very hard to find in California.  It was creamy and had a slight onion-like taste. My quest continues....
author: melissa o.

description:
best mexican food ever. 

oh, also best margaritas. 

it is a place i enjoy hanging out in, can bring my local friends, my out of town friends (and here's what makes it really great) MY PARENTS. 

not sure what to say that hasn't already been said.  a little hipster mexican joint with cool dive-y decor and great service.  the margs are amazing (and strong).  everything that i've ever eaten here has been top notch.  i definitely recommend that you start with the empenadas.  there may be crack (just kidding!) in their queso.  my boyfriend and i also generally get the chicken and avocado enchilladas, which are sick good.
author: gracie m.

description:
I only went to Velvet Cantina for cocktails. But, if I recall correctly, they pour a mean stiff drink...  The margaritas were tasty... and moderately priced... We came towards the end of the night but, the space was still inviting for those who were there solely for the bar... 

The Interior is small and not trendy (in a good way)... My friends and I didn't eat there... however, the aroma from the dining area smelled fantastic... The way grandma used to make it... 

I will definitely go back... 
I would
author: smartie p.

description:
This place is great. Actually... it's better than great. 

I've been three  times, twice in big groups - which is great because I've been able to have a taste of about 75% of the menu. 

My two favs: Chicken Avocado Enchiladas and the Chile Verde.
author: K. K.

description: I've hung out a lot in this area, but never tried this restaurant until 10/24. The food was amazing, I'd never eaten cactus in such a tasty and creative way before. If you're going there for drinks, I would suggest the large margarita pitchers- overall drinks are amazing, and they have fun margarita flavors like watermelon and mango...
author: Maquina N.

description: After months of grilling from a pal.  We finally tried "The Best Mexican Place in SF".  I must say we were not disappointed. Margaritas that in a pinch could fuel your car are always a good start!  Relaxed retro vibe with good food, friendly service, and reasonable prices.  Thanks T.R.
author: Z. G.

description: Showed up early to meet friends.  Drinks at bar.  Margaritas good and strong.  Spicy cucumber cocktail not tasty. Had a reservation but table wasn't availabe for another half hour.  Host apologized and brought us free nachos and we hadn't even complained - nice. Great nachos. Service good and very fast.  Restaurant got really loud and busy (Fri night) - fun. Ordered the shrimp, burrito, chicken avocado enchiladas, and steak tacos.  All but the tacos were way too spicy - weird (off night?). Good prices and good times.  I'd go back to give the food a second chance.
author: Big Al S.

description: Fun atmosphere, provided you sit on the bar side. The waitstaff is terrific, friendly and honest. The nachos used to be amazing, but the last few times I've been there, they have been a little sub-par. The chicken avocado enchilda is always very good. The prices are decent. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Michelle B.

description: Velvet Cantina is like a suburban Americanized strip mall Mexican restaurant that's been "San-Francisco-ized."  Dark, cozy, and laden with those tacky red candle lamps, I half-expected curvy middle-aged Latina waitresses with embroidered fluffy-armed white blouses to be serving cheese-doused enchiladas.  To the contrary, it's dim interior plays host to loud hungry Mission-ites looking for a slight twist on the aforementioned cuisine.  Their well-stocked bar serves pitchers of Margaritas which expertly quench the heat of the homemade salsa.  The chips are light and seem very freshly made.  I had cornbread sopes.  They were the right combo of juicy and crispy and accompanied by a sweet and bitter red cabbage slaw that I enjoyed.  The crowd was a loud Caucasian one, but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.  The servers were attentive but not annoying, and the prices were fair for what you get.  If you want to go up one notch from the cheap, brightly-lit taqueria scene, and sip from a full bar this is the place to do just that.
author: Eric S.

description:
When I first ate at this restaurant  their completely backwards fusion (between what and what I am not sure, perhaps other Mission hipster restaurants, and Tex-Mex) Mexican food was kind of endearing. But as their prices rise, and they no longer care what their serve you this place becomes offensive. 

We used to say, "They have $4.50 margaritas, and they are good!" Now we say, "the margaritas are $6.00 and they taste like syrup!".

 home made tortilla chips are great but salsa with green onions, really, what is that all about? Green onions are for salad, scrambled eggs, and soup,but not salsa.

And the interior decoration here is absurd, It reminds me of a basement , or of Mexican Brothel themed haunted house at Halloween. Perhaps Velour Cantina is a better name.
author: Anthony M.

description: this place is awesome, hands down. I've organized countless birthday parties here and have left thoroughly drunk, happy and full everytime. the margaritas are strong but have excellent flavor, not the sugary cheap gross mix like chevys. the seasonal ones are awesome, i've had mango and watermelon. The food is also delicious, especially the tortilla soup. i've had the entrees and am still the most satisfied with the soup-it's huge, but the avocado pesto chicken enchiladas are good too.  the chips and salsa are great and the waiter refills them as often as you want. the prices aren't the best but i'd call them reasonable.  the waiters are super friendly and even turned down the lights when we went to surprise our friend with a birthday cake!
author: melsa m.

description: My friends and I planned a graduation party here for about 30 people, and it was fabulous. The food and service were great! I changed the number of people a few times and they were very accommodating. They gave us most of our own room and never rushed us or made us feel like we had to move along the party, even though we were there for about 5 hours. I would highly recommend having dinner here or a party. The waiter was very nice and gave out party of 30 lots of service even though he had other tables to attend to.
author: elisa s.

description: This restaurant was a solid 4 in my book... tasty mexican food that is a little more interesting and upscale than usual, located in the heart of the mission.  The chips and salsa for your table are great - really flaky and salty.  I had a cantelope margarita with sugar around the rim (a little watery, but still good) and a chicken avacado enchilada for dinner.  You can choose between pinto, refried, or black beans, which makes the serving sizes nice and big.  The enchiladas were juicy and a little spicy, yum!  I was eating dinner with friends, and we had a lot to catch up on, but we were yelling over the noise once the place got packed.  Apparently that is typical for a Friday night at this place.  After we had paid the bill they asked if we would move to the bar to give up our table.  Service was good, and I would come back again, but maybe for something a little rowdier like a birthday or bachelorette party.
author: Laura W.

description: We ate here last night. Were told it was a 25 min wait but it ended up being about 15, which was great. I got the cactus avocado enchiladas. They were delicious but I found the rice and beans way too salty (I'm not sure if the culprit was the rice or the beans as I mixed them all up together before I starting eating--I suspect the rice). When will restaurants stop salting so much? It's just not needed....otherwise, all was great!
author: Julia B.

description: excellent margaritas! the menu doesn't offer many selections but the ones they do offer are pretty strong. great chips and salsa as well. i would also recommend making reservations if you are coming on the weekend. i never have but i have been told that the table was reserved an hour or so after i sat down so I had to pay attention to the clock while dining. either way the wait isn't bad and you can enjoy a great margarita while you wait. the avocado cactus enchiladas are great for vegetarians and aren't too cheesy and you get different bean options.
author: Leuwam T.

description: I refuse to believe that any of you people who gave this place 4 or 5 stars are telling the truth, and if you are, it damn well isn't because of the food.  The food is so incredibly sub par compared to literally any other mexican place in this city.  HOW can this place be so highly rated?  Are you people on crack!?  I wouldn't go back to this place if you paid me.
author: Gregorio S.

description: Poor quality food at a moderate a price, that tasted awful. I guess they recently updated their decor with some tacky mural; all I can say I would have hated to imagine what it used to look like. The margaritas were some of the worst I have ever had, like they were made from some cheap & unpleasant tasting lemon lime mixer
author: Bill K.

description: i had a big birthday party of 25 and only had reservations for 20, they were super accomidating and the staff was awesome. the food was amazing. we woke up and couldnt stop thinking about the chicken Mole and were tempted to go back! I love this place and recommend it for anyone! Especially the watermelon margarita!
author: Sharon C.

description: just hung at the bar saturday night. hella fun. good drinks. great bartender. delicious food,
author: Wayne T.

description: So so happy I found this place.  It's been hard for me to find a good sit down mexican restaurant in the taqueria haven that is the Mission.  Here it is.  Great margaritas, completely affordable food, fresh innovative ingredients.  The decor is very warm and inviting.  The servers/ bartender were very cute. This place is great.
author: Samantha B.

description: I have never gotten anything less than completely annihilated at this bar.  With such a friendly bar staff, I don't feel like the blame falls entirely on me.  The food looks tasty but I've never partaken as I am more likely to crawl out of the bar and go with a foil wrapped burrito from a taqueria as opposed to the sit down plate.  It might have been a 5 star review but the bar ran out of guiness after my friend and I took repeated car bombs, so we were forced to substitute negro modelo and while we were deviating decided to swap the shot of baileys and jameson with a shot of tequilla and kahlua.  We called this drink a mexican knife stabbing and it was not as good as it sounds.  still, you can't go wrong with their margaritas.
author: Mike T.

description: Quite a contrast to my review of Kan Zaman, THIS is a place that knows customer service. They are always jam-packed, and they never fail to deliver great food (heart the chicken avocado enchiladas), strong yummy margaritas, and outstanding service. The last time I went there was a perfect example. We had 6 people, and admittedly we got a bit carried away with our margaritas and stayed for some time after paying the bill. We had probably been there a full 2 hours on a Friday night, and of course they needed the table. Instead of asking us to leave, the waiter explained that they had another party they needed to seat, BUT as a consolation they sent us over to the bar where all 6 of us were presented with double shots of Patron, on the house. Clearly, they knew the way to our hearts. I already loved Velvet Cantina before that experience, but it placed them solidly on my list of absolute favorite restaurants in the city. I will for sure keep coming back!
author: Kristen B.

description: the food here is surprisingly good given that it's really more of a party place than a food place.  but the party is still the reason to good.  good margaritas by the pitcher, really nice staff that doesn't rush you and is surprisingly good-natured given the sh*tshow inside.  the people watching is pretty incredible.  i have never seen so many terrible, terrible dresses in my entire life.  it's like all the girls lost 75% of their clothes on the taxi ride from the marina.
author: James R.

description: I picked this place for a send-off dinner for a girlfriend going on a trip solely based on the reviews I read here, and I was not disappointed!    We started with margaritas which were well-made, tasty and strong.  They offered us a sample of the raspberry marg which was also pretty good - but I like my margs simple.  The bartender was very attentive and friendly.  When our whole party arrived they'd already prepared a table for us on the restaurant side so we moved over there, where our waitress was also friendly and attentive - I think it helped that the place was not full,  towards the end of a Wednesday night.  Our party split a plate of nachos and a quesadilla - the nachos were outstanding and everyone in our group loved them.  We all ordered entrees but after another pitcher of margs and all those appetizers, we had a hard time finishing the generous portions, even though they were all very tasty.  Our leftovers were promptly wrapped up to go, and though we were full, we figured a group could still demolish a dessert, so we had the smores nachos (I saw no listing of the peanut butter nachos other reviews have mentioned, but it was dark and I was drunk...). They were brought to our table in flames and were also delicious.   Total for a table of 5, including two Patron margs, a raspberry marg, a pitcher of house margs, two appetizers, five entrees, and dessert, was about $30pp not including tip.  I wouldn't call it cheap but it was definitely reasonable.  Food, drinks, and service were all very good.  My boyfriend tasted my leftovers and cursed himself for not having come along.  We'll be back!  Note: I don't know if they're actually open until 2am every night - it appeared we closed the place down, as they were shutting down after we left around 10pm.
author: Eclipse T.

description: christmas eve dinner here was perfect.  it was hard finding something open later and walah!  got those chicken enchildas once again and DAMn!  they are good.  also ordered a side of veggies which included potato and cactus-yum.  again, pitcher of 'ritas split between 2 people and we were perfectly happy :-)  it's such a cozy place and i liked the service.  nice guys here.
author: Keri K.

description:
food was excellent, service was pretty solid considering how busy they were at peak friday night, music was impressive, and the environment made for a great dinner.  overall, it beat out my expectations and was just shy of five stars.

i went back again... drinks were not bad and food was not as memorable as my first visit.  five stars is a must go-back, four stars i would definitely recommend... so ratcheting own to three stars since it now falls into that middle zone.
author: Victory V.

description: i'm on an endless search of good places to go with a big group that a) are not too expensive, b) don't require a reservation more than a few days in advance, c) have a good atmosphere and d) that i know will be a good time. velvet cantina is one of the places on my limited list that fulfills all those pre-requisites. sure, it's a little hectic in there at peak times, but despite that, i've never had a disappointing experience. and they keep the beers and margs coming, which, let's be honest - is really what makes it so great to come here.
author: Kate M.

description:
i love the vc....the staff is HOT, fun, attentive and totally unpretentious. the drinks are stiff, the food delicious, the atmosphere raucous and fun. 

avocado chicken enchiladas with refried beans...yum! 
sopas...super yum! 
pete, jayson, darius, gabe, johnny....super duper yum!
author: sheila s.

description: very very good food, try the chili verde, fresh guacamole, coconut-lime ceviche, chicken-avocado enchilada, and the margarita. both the food and the people are nice-looking. they also have a full bar. probably my favorite mexican restaurant in world.
author: Josie K.

description: The chips and salsa are superb, lots of black pepper in the salsa. The margaritas are really good too. The food is weird. The flavors don't really work together for me. I have gone twice for dinner and both times it didn't seem hot enough either. Go for the margaritas and chips and salsa.
author: Sara T.

description: okay, wow. i understand that part of the reason i am giving this place such a rave review is because my husband and i had just finished a long day out on the bay sailing and were craving a margarita...but honestly, this place is the best! we went for dinner on a saturday night and the place was hopping, the bartender was nice, the lighting was perfectly cozy and the margaritas were certainly up to par. dinner was just as good. my husband got the cactus enchiladas, which i had to try because how often do you get those? they were delicious and so was my chicken avocado enchiladas. a friend of ours got the mole chicken which also looked wonderful--highly recommended. and the reasonable pricing is the cherry on top.
author: Denise D.

description: This is an excellent place!  The food is delicious - I had the chicken avocado enchiladas and washed it down with a watermelon margarita.  The owner is a true gourmet and gentleman who knows how to treat his customers.  I have recommended this place to friends and hope you all get a chance to experience this establishment.
author: Steven K.

description: Was not a big fan!!! We started with chips and salsa which was super watered down and had NO flavor. We also ordered the ceviche which was actually pretty good. It all went down hill from there. I ordered the steak taco's, YUCK!!! I took one bite of my taco and lost my appetite. I didn't touch my plate after that so it was obvious something was wrong. About 5 waiters walked by me and saw the obvious (apparently not). As our waiter picked up my plate and did not ask or say how the food was, I quickly asked him if the meat always had no taste. The sad part he said YES, I was surprised he answered the truth. I am not one to ask for a refund or ask for another plate, its part of trying new places. BUT what I was actually more surprised about is that he did not offer me a different plate or something to make up for it. I would NOT have left this wonderful review if that would have been done. I would NOT recommend this place!!!
author: Oscar U.

description: if i could be anywhere right now, it would be here. i love the warm atmosphere, the flavorful food, the funny bartenders. the place is generally packed, and with good reason. the velvet cantina makes me start humming silly pop songs, like "i think i'm in loooooove, again". for some reason, and i'm not sure how, i consider that a good thing. like junior mints. hearts!
author: julia r.

description: We went for a drink here last night while we were waiting for our table at Beretta. It's definitely small, so don't expect to meet 15 of your friends here for drinks. But the feel of the place is great - the music is loud but not too loud, it's dark but not too dark, and the crowd all seems cool and friendly. The food smelled amazing and I definitely want to come back here some night for dinner. The flaming smore nachos looked fun too - this place would be perfect for doing someone's birthday dinner. I think it's pretty easy to get a reservation and there was a group of maybe 7 people there celebrating something - I definitely have to keep that in mind next time we're trying to come up with somewhere fun to go for something. Anyway, it took a while to get a drink, but once we did it paid off. The margs were fantastic! Order 4 and you get a pitcher that serves about 6. Strong, tart and really refreshing since we have actually had some warm days. Highly recommended for drinks!!! Would be a fun spot to kick off a girls' night out in the Mission. I can't wait to go back for dinner.
author: Sarah R.

description: Food was good, margarita was great, ambiance was very lacking. This place had cool art / murals on the walls but the tables reminded me of a suburban-Mexican-Pizza Hut.  I recommend the chicken/avo enchilada. And I loved the warm chips, but wouldn't go back soon.
author: Cbr A.

description: I love this place. A bit crowded but the waiters more than try to accomodated our one last addition. The margs were fabulous and strong!  We even got a free pitcher for getting up and not dawdling so they could seat another party
author: Nancy G.

description: great ambience.  food is okay, Excellent smore tortillas desert, must try!
author: Sydney L.

description: Came here for the second time about a month ago with some friends. I dunno - I was the one who recommended the restaurant, but I found my second experience was not nearly as good as the first time - I guess their margaritas are THAT good that I forgot about the food? I found the appetizers were much better than the entree. Which, being that we had nachos and the quesadilla - which are practically bulletproof/can't really mess them up/everyone loves 'em- style dishes, says a lot about the mediocrity of the entrees. I had the Naked Relleno which was pretty unremarkable other than remarking that I ate it. My friend had the Chicken Mole which was swimming in sauce - didn't look too appetizing, but she seemed to enjoy it. Margaritas were great though - fresh, authentic and tasty; no BS sour mix. Service was OK - I was disappointed that even with having a reservation, they put 4 average-to-tall adults at a TINY booth table (more suitable for 2 people having drinks) which was very cramped with hardly room on the table to fit our drinks and dishes of food. But we had no choice in the matter, as the place was very full, even for a Wed. night. All in all, a so-so meal. I could see myself trying a 3rd time; maybe with a different entree choice it would be better. A note for first-timers: there are 2 different dining areas with two separate entrances (one on the corner, one by the bar). They connect at the back of the bar, but just something to be aware of in case you wander in by the bar and don't see your peeps or vice versa.
author: Barbara K.

description: i have enjoyed food and margaritas here on weekends and weeknights. the kitchen closed at 1030 on a recent weeknight, so don't expect to be getting a late dinner on a thursday.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: the whitest mexican place in the hood, dude. food ok. staff super nice. ambiance. eh.
author: a w.

description: dark and cozy is how i like my mexican restaurants.  most of the food was really tasty--sope, cheese dip, salsa, and the desserty nacho thingies.  cheap pitchers of margs.  i wasn't too crazy about the mole i tasted--too sweet AND too spicy.  but i'll definitely be coming back here.
author: tara w.

description: Oh boy, how I love the Velvet Cantina.  Cheap tasty ungreasy mexican food.  Don't get me wrong, I do love a greasy burrito or enchilada plate every now and then, but this is just way tastier.  The tortilla soup is great, with lots of yummy cheese hidden inside.  The cactus-avocado enchiladas are my favorite - soooooo good.  And the chile verde?  Yes please.  Really, everything here is good.  Fantastic margaritas as well.  You can't go wrong.
author: Kris W.

description: fantastic mex food with fun, kitchy atmosphere.  the velvet nachos are to die for, margaritas right on the mark.  also had the chicken avocado enchiladas, a great pick.  i only wish i came here more often.
author: e w.

description: Food was decent to good.  The portions are large so go hungry or split something.  The drinks are what make the experience though.  Good, strong margaritas will get your night started off right.  Friendly service too.  Ambiance is kind of dark, so if you require actually being able to see details about the food you're eating, this might not be the best place to dine for you.
author: A K.

description: velvet cantina is my new favorite sunday spot.  we came here last sunday and ate at the bar - it was awesome.  the chips and salsa are the bomb.  the main course portions are huge, so its good to share, especially so you have room for the fabulous magaritas - both traditional and fruit-flavored.  the guys who work behind the bar are both fun and cute, which makes the experience all the better.  they also hooked us up with some ridiculously tasty shots on the house - i'll be back for those alone.  it was also quite hoppin' for a sunday.  although i do love taquerias, don't get me wrong, its nice to have a good sit-down option for mexican food as well.
author: Erin C.

description: I love this place. GREAT food and decent margaritas. Try the chili verdes and don't miss the guacamole...they are both amazing.
author: K D.

description: if you're craving mexican food but want a little more atmosphere than your garden-variety taqueria, then this is a fun place to be. the chips and salsa and margaritas are great to get you started, and you can't go wrong with the chile verde or the tri-tip. good for dates or groups, small or big.
author: Ray O.

description: Great food (had the enchiladas twice now), awesome drinks (margarita on the rocks, hmm hmm, more than twice now), and excellent service sum up this Mexican joint. After several long months of living on the east coast (where Mexican food isn't really Mexican food, its Mexican-food-ish), I was pleasantly surprised with the genuine Mexican cuisine. Highly recommend!!!
author: Raul Z.

description: One of the friendliest places in SF! And, yes, the margaritas are really good.
author: paul k.

description: I don't understand why this place gets such great reviews - maybe my friends and I just ordered the wrong things. I got the "velvet lasagna" which I only ate three bites of and then couldn't stomach anymore. I have an iron stomach and it was actually really gross. My friend got the ceviche which was totally nasty - it wasn't what we expected. The drinks are really delicious though - fresh fruit margaritas. Those along with the ambiance made my dining experience enjoyable!
author: foodbot c.

description: This place is pretty much awesome. Guac, good and reasonably priced. Get the chicken mole - you will not be disappointed. The margaritas? So tasty. And the service was incredible - attentive without being constantly present, very nice, made great recommendations. Definitely a place worth visiting!
author: i p.

description: so many great things to say about this place ...  i guess i'll start at the start and cut to the most important part - the margs.  they were great and the pitchers seemed to fill 6 glasses very well, which is a good thing when you are out with a group of five (extra glass goes to the birthday girl of course).  secondly, the ambiance is perfect, just sort of small and fun and friendly.  thirdly, the food was excellent, i had the naked relleno, which is a chile relleno without the breading, my only complaint would be the potatoes, the filling definitely didn't need it and then it made me too full for the chips ... which brings me to my fourth point, the chips - clearly freshly fried and so delicious.  after we had devoured our first basket and it wasn't refilled, we felt anxious and sad until one of our friends finally requested a refill.  of course, by the time we had eaten our dinner, the refilled basket proved to be unnecessary and went largely untouched - dang it they are so smart at velvet cantina.
author: ali l.
